gt:
In a medium bowl, beat cream cheese, lemon juice, Italian seasoning, and garlic with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth and combined.
Spread the cream cheese mixture in the bottom of a 9-inch deep pie pan or shallow serving dish.
Evenly spread the prepared hummus on top of the cream cheese.
Top the hummus with the cucumbers, tomatoes (make sure to get rid of the extra juice from the tomatoes), olives, feta, and green onions, in that order.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours but no more than 24 hours.
Serve with pita chips.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, lemon juice, and Italian seasoning. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the minced garlic, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the prepared hummus, mixing until smooth.
5. Stir in the chopped cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, Kalamata olives, and feta cheese.
6. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and spread it evenly.
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly, and the cheese is melted and baked through.
9. Serve the Layered Greek Dip with pita chips on the side.

The essential ingredients for preparing Layered Greek Dip include 8 ounces of cream cheese, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 1 teaspoon of dried Italian seasoning, 3 cloves of minced garlic, 1-1/2 cups of prepared hummus, 1 cup of chopped cucumbers, 1 cup of chopped cherry tomatoes, 1/2 cups of Kalamata olives, 1/2 cups of feta cheese, 13 cups of sliced green onions, and 1 package of pita chips for serving.

gt:
To make Crust: Combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, and salt in bowl.
Rub margarine into flour mixture with fingers until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle in vanilla, and stir.
Add 1 to 2 Tbs.
cold water until dough clumps together loosely.
Press dough into pie dish or tart pan until sides and bottom are covered.
Chill in freezer 30 minutes.
To make Filling: Preheat oven to 375F.
Spread nuts on baking sheet, and bake 10 to 12 minutes, until lightly browned.
Melt margarine and chocolate in saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth.
Sprinkle in flour and salt, and stir until smooth.
Stir in maple syrup and vanilla.
Stir in nuts.
Spread nut mixture in piecrust.
Bake 25 minutes, or until crust is golden and filling is firm.
Cool on wire rack at least 20 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pastry flour, cornmeal, sugar, and salt.
3. Add the vegan margarine and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients, and mix until the dough comes together.
4. Press the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. In a small bowl, combine the chopped nuts, vegan margarine, and maple syrup.
6. Roll out the chilled dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan or a similar pan with a removable bottom.
8. Spread the nut mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch (2.5 cm) border around the edges.
9. Bake the tart for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is set.
10. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes.
11. Carefully remove the springform pan or the tart from the pan, and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
12. Once the tart is completely cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into wedges.
13. Serve the Triple Nut Chocolate Tart as a delicious dessert or treat.

[/INST]

gt:
Stir together the marinade ingredients until the cornstarch is dissolved.
Stir the beef in the marinade until coated and let stand for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile prepare the sauce.
Stir together the stock, oyster sauce, rice wine, and soy sauce together in a bowl.
Cook the broccoli in a small pot of boiling water about 2 -3 minutes.
Drain thoroughly.
Heat a wok over high and add the oil, swirling to coat the sides of the wok.
Add beef and cook until no longer pink, about 1 1/2 - 2 minutes.
Add the sauce and broccoli and bring to a boil.
Pou in the dissolved cornstarch and cook until the sauce boils and thickens, about 1 minute.
Serve.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the minced ginger and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
2. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until they are tender but still crisp.
3. Add the chicken stock, oyster sauce, soy sauce, cornstarch mixture, and rice wine or sherry. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Add the flank steak to the skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until it is cooked through and reaches your desired level of doneness.
5. Serve the Broccoli Beef over a bed of cooked rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

gt:
Put mango cubes and sliced strawberries in a large pitcher.
Cut the passion fruit in half and scoop the seeds into the pitcher.
Add wine, pineapple juice, rum and sugar.
Stir gently to combine and taste.
Adjust sugar as needed.
Cover and put in the refrigerator overnight.
To serve, fill glasses with ice.
Pour in sangria with a little fruit.
Top each with a splash of sparkling water and garnish with strawberries and a sprig of mint.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the peeled and pitted mango cubes, sliced strawberries, and chopped passionfruit.
2. Add the Sauvignon Blanc and Pineapple Juice to the bowl, stirring to combine.
3. Add the white rum, superfine sugar, and ice to the bowl, stirring until the sugar is fully dissolved.
4. Allow the mixture to chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve, discarding the solids.
6. Stir in the sparkling water and pour the mixture into glasses.
7. Garnish each glass with a sprig of mint and a slice of passionfruit for added flavor and visual appeal.

Enjoy your refreshing and delicious Tropical Sangria with Passionfruit!

gt:
In a large bowl, mix together the butter, Cheddar cheese, pecans, cayenne pepper and salt until well blended.
Gradually mix in flour, using your hands to work in the last bit.
The result will be a stiff dough much like shortbread.
Form the dough into logs about 1 inch thick, and 10 inches long.
Wrap each log in waxed paper, and refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Unwrap the chilled logs of dough, and slice into 1/4 inch thick rounds using a sharp knife.
Place slices about 1 inch apart onto cookie sheets lined with parchment paper.
Bake for exactly 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm and slightly browned at the edges.
Allow wafers to cool for 1 minute before removing from the pan.
pred:
To make a delicious Cheddar Pecan Wafers dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and shredded Cheddar cheese until smooth.
2. Add the toasted pecans, cayenne pepper, and salt, and mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the all-purpose flour, mixing until the dough comes together.
4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
6. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the wafer shapes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the wafers for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
9. Allow the wafers to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Cheddar Pecan Wafers dish!

gt:
Peel and slice apples.
Toss with lemon juice so they don't turn brown.
Beat eggs and sugar; add oil and beat till smooth.
Add dry ingredients and mix well.
Spray a 9" x 13" pan, and pour in 1/2 the batter.
Top with apples and cinnamon.
Pour remaining batter on top; spread it with a fork.
Bake at 350-375F for 45 minutes, till light brown on top.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
3. In a large bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, oil, and baking powder.
4. Add the flour, salt, and cinnamon, mixing well.
5. Stir in the sliced apples.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat and coat with cooking spray.
Add the celery and onion.
Cook and stir until tender.
Reduce the heat to medium and mix in the cream-style corn, water and salt.
Remove from the heat and stir in the eggs and bread cubes.
Form into balls about the size of baseballs, and place them on a cookie sheet.
Brush melted butter onto the balls.
Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until heated through and the outside is lightly toasted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped celery, onion, and cream-style corn.
3. Add water or chicken broth, salt, and beaten eggs. Mix well.
4. Gradually add the soft bread cubes to the mixture, stirring to combine.
5. In a separate bowl, melt the butter.
6. Pour the melted butter over the bread mixture, stirring to coat the bread evenly.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the mixture is cooked through.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Corn Balls!

gt:
Slice the white part of the leek into very fine strips (this is called "white-hair leek"), then soak in water.
If the kimchi cabbage pieces are large, cut into easy to eat pieces.
Boil the ramen, following the instruction on the packet.
When the noodles have been in the hot water for 2 minutes, add a lightly beaten egg and simmer for a minute.
Turn off the heat, let the soup dissolve and then transfer to a serving bowl.
Top the noodles with the drained leek slices and kimchi, sprinkle sesame that came with the packet of noodles, and it's done.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the Instant ramen noodles, egg, and 1/2 cup of water. Mix well until the noodles are evenly coated.
3. In a separate bowl, chop the leek into thin strips.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the kimchi over medium heat until it becomes soft and slightly melted.
5. Add the softened kimchi to the noodle mixture and mix well.
6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Transfer the noodle mixture to the prepared baking sheet and press it down firmly to form a flat, even layer.
8. Bake the ramen mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked through and the egg is set.
9. Remove the ramen mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into desired shapes.
10. Serve the cooked ramen mixture on a plate and enjoy your delicious Salty Ramen with Leek and Kimchi dish!

gt:
Put onion, potatoes, hamburger, and water into crock pot and cook on low heat for 4-5 hours, or until potatoes are tender.
Then add in the rest of ingredients and let cook for another 2 hours, or until you are ready to eat.
Use salt and pepper at the table for taste.
pred:
[INSTR]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or crock pot, combine the diced potatoes, onion, and water. Cook on low heat for about 8 hours or until the potatoes are tender.
3. Add the hamburger, drained, and cook for an additional 30 minutes or until the meat is fully cooked.
4. Remove the meat from the pot and set aside.
5. In a small saucepan, heat the evaporated milk and whipping cream over low heat until the mixture is smooth and heated through.
6. Add the Velveeta cheese, onion salt, paprika, salt, and pepper to the pot with the cooked meat. Stir to combine.
7. Pour the heated milk and cream mixture over the meat and potatoes.
8. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for an additional 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.
9. Serve the Cheesy Hamburger Potato Soup hot.

[/INSTR]

[/SYS]

gt:
Cut the pork tenderloin into 3/4 inch slices.
Pound the slices until each is about 1/4 inch thick.
Place the cracker meal in a dish (aluminum pie pans work great).
In a second dish, pour in the water and stir in the bouillon.
Dip each slice in the bouillon water and then in the cracker meal.
Coat well.
Deep fry in a fry daddy or deep fryer at 375F until golden brown.
(Pan frying works equally well).
Drain.
Serve on a hamburger bun with your choice of condiments.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the bouillon, water, and saltine crackers until the crackers are well-coated.
3. Place the pork tenderloin slices in a baking dish, and pour the mixture over the top.
4. Bake the pork tenderloin in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
5. Remove the pork tenderloin from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
6. Toast the saltine crackers in a dry skillet or oven until they are golden brown.
7. Assemble the sandwiches by placing a slice of cooked pork tenderloin on a toasted saltine cracker, and top it with a slice of cheese (optional).
8. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Place the sandwiches in the skillet, and cook until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 2-3 minutes per side.
9. Place the cooked sandwiches on a plate, and serve immediately.

Enjoy your Fried Pork Tenderloin Sandwich dish!

gt:
Spray grill with nonstick spray or brush with vegie oil to prevent sticking.
Preheat on high for about 10 minutes.
Mix first six ingredients in a blender.
Puree into a smooth sauce.
When ready to cook, brush both sides of fillets with sauce.
Place fillets on grill and cook, turning once or twice.
Brush more sauce as needed.
Fish is done when it flakes easily (about 5 minutes).
Serve with lemon wedges.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the melted butter, extra virgin olive oil, and fresh garlic cloves.
2. Add the cilantro or parsley, cajun seafood seasoning, and lemon juice to the bowl. Mix well.
3. Place the wahoo fillets in the marinade and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.
4. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
5. Remove the wahoo fillets from the marinade and place them on the grill or grill pan. Cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Garnish the cooked wahoo with a lemon wedge.
7. Serve the Lainie's Wahoo Marinade with the cooked wahoo.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

gt:
Combine first 5 ingredients in 13x9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray; top with cheese.
Whisk remaining ingredients until blended; pour over hash brown mixture.
Refrigerate overnight.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake casserole, uncovered, 55 min.
to 1 hour or until knife inserted in centre comes out clean.
Let stand 5 min.
before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the frozen hash browns, corn, black beans, red pepper, and onion.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and cilantro.
4. Pour the egg mixture over the hash brown mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Sprinkle the shredded habanero cheese evenly over the top.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wobbly.
8. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Mexican Brunch Bake!

gt:
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
Place alternate layers of sweet potatoes and apples in baking dish, ending with apples.
Pour orange juice and zest over mixture and sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake, covered with foil, in preheated 375 degree oven for 40 minutes.
Remove foil, top with crushed cereal or bread crumbs, and spray with non-stick cooking spray.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes more until brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the apple slices, sweet potato slices, orange juice, grated orange zest, and cinnamon. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the crushed corn flakes or breadcrumbs with nonstick cooking spray.
4. Pour the apple mixture into a baking dish, and then evenly sprinkle the crushed corn flakes or breadcrumbs mixture over the top.
5. Drizzle the remaining orange juice over the top of the mixture.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the crumb topping is golden brown.
7. Serve the Apple Sweet Potato Scallop hot, and enjoy!

gt:
For sponge: dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup lukewarm water in large bowl and let stand 5 minutes to proof.
Add starter, dry milk and remaining warm water and blend well.
Add wheat flour, all-purpose flour and wheat germ and beat 4 to 5 minutes.
Cover with plastic and let stand in warm draft-free area until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
Add molasses, margarine, salt, baking soda and 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour and beat until dough is stiff, adding remaining 1/2 cup all-purpose flour as necessary.
Turn dough out onto very lightly floured surface and knead 10 to 15 minutes.
Transfer to bowl.
Cover and let stand in warm draft-free area until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Grease 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Punch dough down and shape into loaf.
Transfer to pan.
Cover and let stand in warm draft-free area about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Bake until loaf is nicely browned, about 35 minutes.
pred:
To craft the perfect Best Sourdough Whole Wheat Bread, follow these steps:

1. Combine the active dry yeast, water, and sourdough starter in a large mixing bowl. Allow the mixture to sit for 10-15 minutes or until the yeast is fully activated.

2. Add the milk, skim powder, and non-fat powder to the bowl, and mix until well combined.

3. Gradually add the lukewarm water, whole wheat flour, wheat germ, molasses, and margarine polyunsaturated. Mix until a smooth dough forms.

4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 10-15 minutes.

5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.

6. Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C).

7. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.

8. Shape the dough into a loaf by pressing it down and then folding it in half. Place the loaf on a lightly greased baking sheet.

9. Allow the loaf to rise for another 30-60 minutes or until it has doubled in size.

10. Bake the loaf in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.

11. Remove the loaf from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Best Sourdough Whole Wheat Bread!

gt:
In a large pan over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef with the chili powder, cayenne pepper, Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper to taste.
Adjust the spices to suit your taste (add red pepper flakes to make it spicy!).
Cook through to form a bit of crust on the meat.
Set aside.
In a large pot, heat oil over medium-high heat and saute onions, garlic, and carrots until soft.
Add the cooked ground beef, lentils, broth, sage, thyme, pepper and salt.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until lentils are just barely tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in kale.
Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer another 10 minutes until the lentils are cooked through.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Add the chopped onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.
5. Add the lean ground beef and cook until it is browned and cooked through, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
6. Add the chili powder, cayenne pepper, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper to the pot. Stir to combine.
7. Add the rinsed and drained lentils, chicken broth, sage, thyme, and additional water if needed to reach the desired consistency.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
9. Add the chopped kale to the pot and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the kale is tender and the flavors have melded together.
10. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
11. Serve the Hearty Lentil Stew hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper and a drizzle of olive oil, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In large skillet, combine sausage, onion, garlic and bell pepper.
Cook until sausage is browned and vegetables are tender.
Put into large soup pot and add remaining ingredients except pasta, beans and zucchini.
Bring to a boil and simmer 30 minutes.
Add pasta, beans and zucchini and simmer another 20-25 minutes or until pasta is tender.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the chopped bell pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes, until softened.
5. Add the diced tomatoes with their juice, tomato sauce, or tomato puree, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
6. Add the beef broth or beef stock, and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Add the cooked sausage, uncooked pasta, and diced zucchini. Stir to combine.
8. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the soup is heated through.
9. Serve the Sausage, Pasta & Bean Soup hot, garnished with fresh parsley, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Grill salmon.
Quantity depends on people served & one's preference.
Set aside.
Wash 1 Japanese cucumber.
Cut both ends.
Divide into 3 portions & cut in elongated form.
Set aside.
For every 1 teaspoon soybean paste, add half a teaspoon water.
Quantity of soybean paste depends on salmon & cucumber's quantity.
Set aside.
In a semi-bowl, put salmon & Japanese cucumber together.
Shower with soybean paste solution & top with okaka.
Ready to serve.
pred:
1. Wash the Japanese cucumber thoroughly and cut it into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a small bowl, mix the Okaka and Soy bean paste together.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the water with the Soy bean paste mixture.
4. Dip the Japanese cucumber pieces into the water mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
5. Allow the cucumber pieces to sit in the mixture for a few minutes, then remove them and pat them dry with a paper towel.
6. Serve the Belle Japanese Holiday Snack on a plate or in a bowl.

[/INST]

This step-by-step procedure will help you create a delicious and visually appealing Belle Japanese Holiday Snack using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Heat butter and oil in large pot until butter begins to foam.
Add onion and garlic, and cook for 2 minutes.
Add cayenne, curry powder, and ginger.
Stir for 1 minute.
Add parsnips, apple, and honey.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in the stock.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes.
Let it cool.
Strain out all chunks and puree in blender.
Add puree back to liquid, whisk together.
Reheat to serve.
pred:
To make a delicious Spicy Apple Parsnip Soup, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, melt 3 tablespoons of unsalted butter over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and cook the chopped onions until soft and translucent.
2. Add the chopped garlic and cook for an additional minute.
3. Add the ground cayenne pepper and curry powder, stirring to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
4. Add the chopped parsnips and apples, stirring to combine. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the honey, stirring to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the honey has melted and the vegetables are coated with a sweet glaze.
6. Add the vegetable stock, stirring to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
7. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
8. Serve the Spicy Apple Parsnip Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg, if desired.

This delicious Spicy Apple Parsnip Soup is a hearty and flavorful dish that combines the sweetness of the apples and parsnips with the spiciness of the cayenne pepper and curry powder. The honey adds a touch of sweetness, while the vegetable stock provides a rich and nourishing base. This soup is perfect for a cozy meal during colder months or as a comforting side dish.

gt: Mix all ingredients together well.
pred:
To make a delicious Moroccan Chicken Salad dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the diced chicken breast, cucumber, orange, and onion.
3. In a small bowl, mix the mild Heinz chili sauce, fat-free yogurt, and mayonnaise.
4. Add the chili sauce mixture to the chicken mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
5. In a small bowl, mix the fresh lemon juice, cumin seed, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper.
6. Add the lemon juice mixture to the chicken mixture, and toss to combine.
7. Optionally, add a dash of cayenne pepper for extra heat, if desired.
8. Serve the Moroccan Chicken Salad immediately, or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

The ingredients used in this dish include chicken breast, cucumber, orange, onion, mild Heinz chili sauce, fat-free yogurt, mayonnaise, fresh lemon juice, cumin seed, cinnamon, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper (optional). The combination of these ingredients creates a flavorful and refreshing salad that is both delicious and visually appealing.

gt:
Mix cream of chicken and cream of broccoli in crock pot
Add I can full of water to soup mixture
Then add and mix light brown sugar
Add chicken cook on low for 4 to 5 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours
Towards the end of your cooking time prepare rice as desired
Serve creamy broccoli chicken over rice and enjoy
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
To create a delicious and savory Creamy Broccoli n Chicken over Rice dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the chicken until it is fully cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the canned cream of broccoli and the canned cream of chicken. Stir to combine and cook until the cream of chicken is fully heated.
4. Add the light brown sugar to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the sugar has melted and the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. In a separate pot, cook the desired amount of rice according to the package instructions.
6. To assemble the dish, place the cooked chicken on top of the rice in a large bowl. Pour the creamy broccoli and chicken sauce over the chicken and rice.
7. Serve the Creamy Broccoli n Chicken over Rice dish immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Drain excess fluid from cottage cheese.
(If you decide to put in on bread, you may want to drain in a strainer.
).
Gently fold together shredded carrot, green pepper, onions, tomato and cottage cheese.
Place in serving dish, and refrigerate until ready to serve.
pred:
1. Begin by preparing the ingredients: wash and peel the carrot, shred it, and set it aside. Wash and chop the green pepper, and set it aside. Wash and de-seed the tomatoes, and chop them into smaller pieces.

2. In a large bowl, mix the cottage cheese with the shredded carrot, chopped green pepper, and chopped green onions.

3. Add the chopped tomatoes to the bowl, and mix everything together.

4. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.

5. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

This delicious Summertime Cottage Cheese Salad dish is a refreshing and healthy option for a light meal or a side dish. The combination of cottage cheese, carrot, green pepper, green onions, and tomatoes creates a vibrant and flavorful salad that is perfect for enjoying during the warmer months.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Over medium-low heat, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil into a large cast iron skillet.
Once hot, add in diced sweet potato, black beans, minced garlic and jalapeno.
Stir and let cook for about 1 minute, then add in honey, salt, pepper and vegetable broth.
Cover and cook until the potatoes are soft and the liquid is mostly absorbed, about 8 minutes.
Once cooked, remove from heat and set aside.
Meanwhile, in a separate skillet, add remaining tablespoon of olive oil and once hot, saute peppers and onions for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they become soft.
Set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, cheddar and fresh cilantro.
Add some salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Once sweet potato mixture is cooked, add sauteed peppers and onions to the potato skillet and mix together.
Over low heat, add egg mixture to the vegetables and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring only once at the beginning to evenly disperse ingredients.
Transfer skillet to preheated oven and cook until middle is set solid, about 20 minutes.
Serve warm and garnish with avocados, salsa, or any fun ingredient you can think of!
Recipe adapted from The Faux Marthas Mexican Frittata.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced sweet potato and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the black beans, minced garlic, and sliced jalapeno pepper. Cook until the beans are heated through and the garlic is fragrant, about 5 minutes.
4. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vegetable broth, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Add the cooked sweet potato and black bean mixture to the egg mixture, stirring to combine.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
7. Sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the frittata.
8. Bake the frittata in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is fully cooked.
9. Remove from the oven, let it rest for a few minutes, then slice it into wedges and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Jalapeno, Black Bean and Sweet Potato Frittata!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 325F (160C).
Sprinkle turkey inside and out with salt and pepper.
Tuck wings under turkey.
Place turkey in an oven roasting bag.
Scatter onions, carrots, celery, turnip and garlic over and around turkey.
Fold the top of the bag over and place turkey, breast up in a small roasting pan.
Add 1 inch water.
Roast turkey 3 to 3 1/2 hours, or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the leg (but not touching the bone) reaches 165 to 170.
Carefully tear open and remove the bag.
Increase the oven temperature to 450.
Roast 30 minutes longer, or until the thermometer registers 180, basting with the pan juices every 5 minutes.
Turkey should be golden brown.
Remove the roasting pan from the oven and carefully transfer turkey to a platter, letting the juices run back into the pan; reserve the juices for gravy.
Cover the bird with foil and let stand for 20 minutes before carving.
(In the meantime, make gravy.)
Makes about 16 servings.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Rinse the turkey and pat it dry with paper towels.
3. Place the turkey in a large roasting pan.
4. Season the turkey with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
5. Place the chopped onions, carrots, celery, and turnips around the turkey in the roasting pan.
6. Pour in the chicken broth or water to cover the turkey and vegetables.
7. Roast the turkey in the preheated oven for about 3-4 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the turkey from the oven and let it rest for about 20-30 minutes before carving.

The essential ingredients for preparing Super-Moist Roast Turkey include thawed turkey, salt, black pepper, onions, carrots, celery, turnips, garlic, and chicken broth or water. These ingredients work together to create a delicious and moist turkey dish.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place 2 cups of the mushrooms in a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Dip chicken breasts into beaten eggs, then roll in breadcrumbs to coat.
Heat butter or olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet.
Brown chicken (approximately 2 minutes per side) in skillet.
Place browned chicken in baking dish, on top of mushrooms.
Sprinkle remaining mushrooms on top of chicken, then top evenly with mozzarella.
Pour broth in pan around chicken.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until chicken juices run clear.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the beaten eggs and seasoned bread crumbs.
3. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any additional desired herbs or spices.
4. Dip the chicken breasts into the egg mixture, then coat them with the bread crumb mixture.
5. Heat the butter or olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken breasts until they are golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 3-4 minutes.
8. Add the chicken broth or vegetable broth to the skillet, and bring to a simmer.
9. Add the shredded mozzarella cheese to the skillet and stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
10. Return the cooked chicken breasts to the skillet and stir to combine the chicken and sauce.
11. Cook the dish in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
12. Serve the Mozzarella Chicken and Mushrooms dish hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a small bowl, whisk all dressing ingredients together; cover and chill until ready to use.
To prepare salad, bring water to boil in medium saucepan; stir in quinoa and simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand until all liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff with a fork then stir in raisins; let cool.
Transfer to a large bowl; add celery, onion, thyme and dressing.
Toss to coat well.
Cover and chill for at least 1 hour or salad may be prepared to this point and held for 24 hours in refrigerator.
To serve, add walnuts to salad and stir well.
Remove thick slice from tops of the tomatoes and scoop out seeds with a small spoon (or melon baller).
Arrange on individual salad plates and fill with salad, spooning any extra onto plate around tomatoes.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, raisins, and water. Allow the mixture to sit for about 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is cooked through.
3. In a small bowl, mix the sugar, lemon juice, and salt.
4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced red onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the diced celery and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until softened.
6. Add the cooked quinoa mixture to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the chopped fresh thyme, minced red onion, and walnuts to the skillet. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the ingredients are heated through.
8. Remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool slightly.
9. Slice the ripe tomatoes into halves or quarters, depending on your preference.
10. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa mixture, sliced tomatoes, and chopped fresh thyme.
11. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Serve the Quinoa and Raisin Salad Stuffed Tomatoes immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

This cooking procedure involves a combination of cooking, mixing, and assembling various ingredients to create a delicious and nutritious Quinoa and Raisin Salad Stuffed Tomatoes. The ingredients are carefully selected and combined to create a well-balanced and flavorful dish. The oven-roasted quinoa provides a nutty and slightly chewy texture, while the raisins add a sweet and slightly tangy taste. The sliced tomatoes add a burst of freshness and juiciness, and the chopped fresh thyme adds a subtle herbal flavor. The toasted walnuts add a crunchy texture and a nutty, slightly earthy taste, while the

gt:
Cook onions in dressing in large skillet on medium heat 5 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally.
Add tomatoes, peppers and olives; mix lightly.
Top with fish; cover.
Simmer on medium heat 8 to 10 min.
or until fish flakes easily with fork.
Serve fish topped with sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the chopped red onions and cook until they are softened and slightly caramelized, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the KRAFT Sun Dried Tomato Vinaigrette Dressing to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Add the stewed tomatoes, green pepper, and black olives to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the thawed haddock fillets to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Season the fish and vegetables with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
8. Serve the Super-Easy Fish Skillet hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This recipe is a delicious and easy way to prepare a hearty fish dish using a variety of ingredients that are readily available in most kitchens. The combination of the tender vegetables, flavorful vinaigrette, and flaky haddock fillets creates a satisfying and comforting meal that can be enjoyed by the whole family.

gt:
In heavy 8-inch saucepan, quickly saute garlic in oil over medium heat.
Add shrimp and tarragon.
Cook, covered, 4-5 minutes, tossing once.
Add wine; cook, uncovered, a few seconds before adding olives, lemon juice, and tomatoes.
Cook a few minutes more to soften tomatoes, and mix in cheese and pepper.
Spoon onto 4 warmed ramekins.
Sprinkle with scallionsand serve with brown rice or sourdough bread.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the garlic, olive oil, and shrimp. Allow the shrimp to marinate in the mixture for 15-20 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the dried tarragon or sweet basil leaves with the dried white wine. Allow the mixture to sit for 10-15 minutes.
4. In a large, oven-safe skillet or pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the marinated shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the marinated shrimp to the bowl with the marinade, and mix well.
6. Add the cooked shrimp to the skillet or pot with the marinade mixture, and stir to combine.
7. Add the tomato, scallions, and lemon juice to the skillet or pot. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. Season the shrimp and sauce with black pepper, to taste.
9. Transfer the shrimp and sauce to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the shrimp is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
10. Serve the cooked Greek Shrimp over a bed of rice or pasta, and garnish with a dollop of feta cheese.

Enjoy your delicious Greek Shrimp!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with about 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Mix tomato, onion, garlic, and parsley in a bowl.
Place a layer of potato slices in the bottom of the prepared baking dish; sprinkle with about 1/4 the tomato mixture, salt, pepper, and all the rice.
Continue layering with potatoes, zucchini, tomato mixture, salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil, ending with a layer of potatoes.
Pour in just enough vegetable broth to cover the rice.
Sprinkle bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese over top potato layer.
Cover dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Remove aluminum foil and bake until top is golden and crusty, about 10 more minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, chopped onion, and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Add the sliced potatoes, rice, and diced tomato to the bowl. Toss to combine.
4. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish, spreading it evenly.
5. Drizzle the top with a little more olive oil, and sprinkle with the chopped parsley.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the rice is cooked through.
7. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
8. In the meantime, prepare the bread crumbs and grated Parmesan cheese.
9. Sprinkle the bread crumbs and cheese over the top of the dish, and return it to the oven for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the Potato, Rice, and Zucchini Bake immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Prepare cake and bake according to package directions in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
With a fork, poke holes all over top of cake.
Combine 1 cup hot water and 1 cup cold water with one package of lemon gelatin.
Stir until gelatin is dissolved, and pour mixture over cake.
Chill in refrigerator until cool.
In large bowl stir together milk, vanilla pudding mix and remaining package of lemon gelatin until powders are dissolved.
Fold in whipped topping and spread mixture over cake.
Refrigerate until serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the lemon cake mix, hot water, and cold water. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the lemon flavored Jell-O mix, milk, and instant vanilla pudding mix. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cake is completely cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into 12 equal pieces.
8. In a large mixing bowl, combine the frozen whipped topping and thawed. Mix until well combined.
9. Spread a layer of whipped topping over each piece of cake.
10. Refrigerate the cake for at least 30 minutes to allow the whipped topping to set.

[/INST]
