[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat grill to high heat.
Cut squash into 1/2-inch thick slices.
In a large bowl, toss the squash slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Lay the squash on the grill and cook until the squash is tender, but still slightly crisp, about 3 minutes per side.
Put the squash back into the bowl and add tomatoes, feta cheese, balsamic vinegar, and mint leaves.
Gently toss and serve either still warm (preferable) or at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Cut the Pattypan squash in half lengthwise, and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. Brush the cut sides of the squash with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
4. Place the squash cut-side down on the grill or grill pan, and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the edges are slightly charred and the squash is tender.
5. While the squash is cooking, prepare the salad by combining the sliced tomatoes, crumbled feta cheese, and thinly sliced fresh mint in a large bowl.
6. Once the squash is cooked, remove it from the grill or grill pan and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Slice the cooked squash into bite-sized pieces, and add them to the salad.
8. Drizzle the salad with balsamic vinegar, and toss to combine.
9. Serve the Grilled Pattypan Squash, Tomato & Feta Salad immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Preheat an oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
Pour rock salt into a large, shallow casserole dish.
Combine watercress, butter, bread crumbs, green onions, celery, tarragon, Italian parsley, anise-flavored liqueur, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a food processor; blend until smooth.
Place 8 to 12 shucked oysters on top of the rock salt.
Spoon 1 to 2 teaspoons of watercress mixture a top each oyster.
Bake in the preheated oven until oysters are firm and butter has melted, about 5 minutes.
Repeat with remaining oysters.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the anise-flavored liqueur, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the watercress and cook until it is wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove the watercress from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the bread crumbs and cook until they are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove the bread crumbs from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oysters, chopped celery, green onion, parsley, and tarragon.
6. Pour the anise-flavored liqueur mixture over the oysters and toss to coat them evenly.
7. Add the cooked watercress and bread crumb mixture to the oysters and toss to combine.
8. Transfer the oysters to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the oysters are cooked through and the bread crumbs are golden brown.
9. Serve the Chef John's Oysters Rockefeller immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Melt coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Cook and stir onion in the hot coconut oil until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes.
Stir squash, chicken broth, almond milk, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, nutmeg, honey, and ginger together in the pot with the onion; bring to a boil and cook until the squash is fork-tender, about 30 minutes.
Puree soup with an immersion blender.
Add avocado in small batches, pureeing each before adding the next.
Garnish servings with additional cinnamon and chopped pecans.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the chopped onion with the melted coconut oil. Spread the onion mixture onto a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the onions are caramelized and tender.
3. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, almond milk, melted coconut oil, and spices (cinnamon, cayenne pepper, nutmeg, and honey). Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together.
4. Add the chopped butternut squash and avocado to the pot and simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the squash is tender.
5. Using an immersion blender or transferring the mixture to a blender, puree the soup until smooth and creamy. Alternatively, you can use a regular blender, but be cautious not to overfill the blender, as it may overflow.
6. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Garnish the soup with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon and chopped pecans, if desired.

[/SYS]

[/INST]

gt:
Mix together all of the above ingredients in a medium size pot, bring to boil over medium heat, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes.
Serve over steamed jasmine rice.
So yummy!
pred:
To make a delicious Spinach & Chickpea Coconut Curry dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
2. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the diced potatoes and cook until they are tender, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the drained and rinsed chickpeas, and cook until they are heated through.
5. Add the canned diced tomatoes and cook until they are heated through and slightly mushy.
6. Add the baby spinach and cook until it is wilted.
7. Stir in the turmeric powder and curry powder, and cook for a few seconds to allow the flavors to meld.
8. Add the canned coconut milk, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
9. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let the curry simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
10. Season the curry with salt and pepper to taste.

This delicious Spinach & Chickpea Coconut Curry dish is ready to be served over rice or with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!

gt:
Prepare Blender Crepes; set aside.Combine 1 cup blackberries and 1/2 cup water in a blender.
Process about 1 minute or until smooth.
Strain blackberry mixture through a sieve.Combine blackberry puree, 1/4 cup water, granulated sugar, lemon juice, brandy, cornstarch, and cinnamon in a small saucepan; bring to a boil.
Cook 1 minute over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; stir in butter.Spread 1 tablespoon cream cheese over each crepe, and top each with 2 teaspoons sauce and 1/4 cup blackberries.
Fold each crepe in half, then in quarters.
Spoon 2 tablespoons sauce on each of 8 dessert plates; top each with 1 crepe and 1/4 cup blackberries.
Sift powdered sugar evenly over crepes.
(Totals include Blender Crepes)
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and cinnamon together.
- In a separate bowl, whisk together the softened cream cheese, powdered sugar, and lemon juice.
- In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar, water, and brandy. Whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved.
- Preheat a non-stick pan or crepe pan over medium heat.

2. Prepare the crepes:
- In a blender, combine the flour, milk, eggs, and melted butter. Blend until smooth and pour the batter onto the preheated pan. Cook the crepes until they are golden brown and slightly puffed, flipping them once.

3. Assemble the crepes:
- Spread a thin layer of the cream cheese mixture onto half of the cooked crepes.
- Top the cream cheese layer with a layer of blackberries.
- Roll up the crepes, starting from the bottom, and place them seam-side down on a plate.

4. Serve and enjoy:
- Serve the Blackberry-Cream Cheese Crepes immediately, and enjoy the delicious combination of flavors and textures.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine corn starch and milk in a small pan and stir until smooth.
Add butter, salt and pepper.
Stirring contanstly over medium heat, simmer for 1 minute.
To make cheese sauce, just stir in 1 cup of shredded cheese at the end of cooking time and stir until melted.
pred:
1. In a saucepan, combine the cornstarch and milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
2. Add the butter or margarine, and continue stirring until it melts and the sauce is smooth.
3. Gradually add the salt and pepper, stirring to combine.
4. Cook for a few more minutes, or until the sauce reaches the desired consistency.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Serve the White/Cheese Sauce over your favorite dish, such as pasta, rice, or vegetables.

[/INST]

This step-by-step guide will help you create a delicious White/Cheese Sauce dish using the provided ingredients. The sauce is made by combining cornstarch and milk, cooking it until it thickens, adding butter or margarine, and then seasoning it with salt and pepper. Once the sauce reaches the desired consistency, it can be served over your preferred dish, such as pasta, rice, or vegetables, to create a satisfying and flavorful meal.

gt:
Cook chicken (grill, oven, pan, ... however you want)
Chop cabbage into small pieces
Combine everything for the salad into a large bowl.
EXCEPT the ramon seasoning.
Mix together the dressing ingredients into a small bowl.
Add dressing to salad and mix well an hour before serving
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped cabbage, onion, and sesame seeds.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the crushed top ramen, mushrooms (if using), and oil.
3. Add the seasoning packet from the top ramen to the mushroom mixture.
4. Add the sugar, vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste to the mushroom mixture.
5. Pour the seasoned mushroom mixture over the cabbage mixture and toss to combine.
6. Add the chicken breasts to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken evenly.
7. Serve the Chinese Chicken Salad immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

This delicious Chinese Chicken Salad dish is a perfect blend of flavors and textures, with the crunchy cabbage and onion, the soft chicken, and the crispy toasted almonds. It is a versatile dish that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish, and it can be easily customized with different ingredients and seasonings to suit individual preferences.

gt:
BROWN meat and onion; drain.
Stir in sauce.
Combine cottage cheese, 3 cups (750 mL) shredded cheese and eggs.
Spread 1/3 cup (75 mL) sauce on bottom of greased 13 x 9-inch (3.5 L) baking dish.
Arrange 4 noodles lengthwise over sauce.
Spread 1/3 of the cheese mixture over noodles; spread with 3/4 cup (175 mL) sauce.
REPEAT layers ending with remaining shredded cheese.
BAKE at 350F (180C) for 1 hour.
Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is no longer pink. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until it is softened.
4. Stir in the canned tomato sauce and cook for a few minutes until the sauce is heated through.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked ground beef, onion mixture, cottage cheese, and eggs. Mix well.
6. Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Layer the lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then pour the meat and cheese mixture over the noodles.
8. Repeat the layering process, starting with the noodles, then the meat and cheese mixture, and finally, the remaining sauce.
9. Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the lasagna from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Season the roast with the salt and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour.
In a spice grinder, grind the peppercorns, guajillo chile and rosemary until coarse.
Transfer to a medium bowl.
Add all of the remaining ingredients except the broth and mix well.
Preheat the oven to 400.
Rub the pepper mix all over the roast.
Place the roast on a rack set over a roasting pan.
Add 2 cups of the broth to the pan and roast for 30 minutes, until the meat is well browned.
Add 2 more cups of the broth and loosely tent the roast with foil.
Reduce the oven temperature to 350.
Roast for about 2 1/2 hours, until an instant-read thermometer registers 115; add the remaining 2 cups of broth halfway through.
Set the roast on a cutting board to rest for about 30 minutes (the center of the roast will register at 125 for medium rare).
Strain the pan juices into a small saucepan.
Skim off as much fat as possible and bring to a simmer.
Carve the roast and serve with the pan jus.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Season the prime rib roast with the kosher salt and peppercorns.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the guajillo chile, stemmed and chopped, and cook until it is slightly charred and fragrant. Remove from the heat and let it cool slightly.
4. In a small bowl, mix the rosemary leaves, Dijon mustard, all-purpose flour, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce.
5. Place the seasoned prime rib roast in a roasting pan. Pour the marinade mixture over the roast, making sure it is evenly distributed.
6. Roast the prime rib roast in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 120°F (49°C) for medium-rare.
7. Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for about 20 minutes before slicing it into individual portions.
8. Serve the Pepper-Crusted Prime Rib Roast with your favorite side dishes and enjoy!

gt:
Hull the strawberries, cut them in half and put into a bowl.
Sprinkle with pepper, sugar and finely chopped mint.
Toss gently and let sit for 1 hour at room temperature.
Toss again after 1/2 hour.
Serve sprinkled with a little mint on top.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Wash the strawberries thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
2. In a small bowl, mix the white pepper, powdered sugar, and fresh mint leaves.
3. Gently toss the strawberries in the mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated with the pepper and sugar mixture.
4. Arrange the strawberries on a serving plate, and garnish with additional fresh mint leaves, if desired.
5. Serve immediately, and enjoy the delicious and refreshing Lightly Peppered Strawberries dish.

gt:
Prepare cake batter and bake in 10-inch tube pan as directed on package, adding the drink mix along with the water.
Cool completely.
Cut cake into 12 slices.
Place one slice on each dessert plate.
Top evenly with the whipped topping and berries just before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the angel food cake mix, Kool-Aid Singles Cherry Drink Mix, and Cool Whip Light Whipped Topping. Mix until well combined.
3. Fold in the mixed raspberries and sliced strawberries.
4. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of each cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once the cakes are completely cooled, use a serrated knife to slice them in half horizontally.
8. Place one of the cake halves on a serving plate. Spread a layer of Cool Whip Light Whipped Topping over the cake.
9. Top the Cool Whip with a layer of mixed raspberries and sliced strawberries.
10. Place the other cake half on top of the fruit layer.
11. Spread a layer of Cool Whip Light Whipped Topping over the top of the second cake half.
12. Top the Cool Whip with a layer of mixed raspberries and sliced strawberries.
13. Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pastel Angel Cake!

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (180 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream butter, 1/3 cup of powdered sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the vanilla extract.
In a small bowl, mix the flour, ground pecans, 1/2 cup grated chocolate, cinnamon, cayenne pepper and salt together well.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for two hours, until firm.
Shape the dough into 1-inch balls and place balls 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in a 325 degree oven for 15 - 18 minutes.
The cookies should be firm to the touch, then cool for 1 minute, and transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
In a small bowl mix together the 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar and 1/4 cup of ground cocoa.
Coat the the cookies while still warm in the sugar and cocoa mix.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and powdered sugar until smooth.
3. Add the vanilla extract and mix well.
4. Gradually add the flour, one cup at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Stir in the ground pecans.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the milk chocolate, ground cinnamon, ground cayenne pepper, and salt.
7. Gradually add the chocolate mixture to the butter mixture, mixing well.
8. If the dough is too dry, add a little more milk, a tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
9. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
10. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
11. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
12. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are slightly golden.
13. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
14. Once the cookies are completely cooled, dust them with powdered sugar for garnish.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Mexican Wedding Cookies!

gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350F.
Lightly brush ring pan with melted butter and chill 2 minutes, then butter again and chill while making batter.
Bring beer to a boil in a small saucepan and add prunes.
Remove from heat and let stand until most of liquid is absorbed.
Meanwhile, melt chocolate and remaining stick butter together in a small heavy saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly.
Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt into a bowl.
Beat together eggs, brown sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer at high speed until thick, about 2 minutes.
Add chocolate mixture and beat until just combined.
Reduce speed to low and add flour mixture, mixing until just combined.
Stir in prune mixture until combined well.
Spoon batter into ring mold and bake until a wooden skewer inserted into middle of cake comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.
Cool cake in mold on a rack 10 minutes, then invert onto rack to cool completely, at least 30 minutes.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, stout, prunes, and chocolate. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.
4. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until well combined. Add the vanilla and whisk until smooth.
6. Gradually pour the cooled chocolate mixture into the egg mixture, stirring to combine.
7. Gradually add the flour mixture to the chocolate mixture, stirring until just combined.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared ring mold or bundt pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer the cake to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. To make the Stout Creme Anglaise, combine the stout, sugar, and vanilla in a saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved.
12. Cool the Stout Creme Anglaise slightly.
13. To serve, slice the cake and drizzle the Stout Creme Anglaise over the top.

[/SYS]

These instructions provide a step-by-step guide to preparing a delicious Chocolate Stout Cake. The essential ingredients include unsalted butter, stout, prunes, chocolate, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, eggs, dark brown sugar, vanilla, and confectioners sugar. The cake is baked in an 8- by 3-inch ovenproof ring mold or a 6-cup-capacity bundt pan, and it is accompanied by

gt:
Wash the sweet potato well and use a paper towel to dry.
Heat the oil.
Cut the parts of the potato that you are going to fry into long strips.
If you aren't going to be washing in water, you should fry it quickly or it'll change color.
Fry slowly at about 170C for a nice color.
Sandwich between paper towels to remove the oil, shake some salt over all of them.
Repeat steps 2 - 4.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oil in a large frying pan or deep fryer to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
2. Peel and slice the sweet potato into sticks, about 1/2 inch thick.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the salt and any desired seasonings, such as paprika or cayenne pepper.
4. Dip each sweet potato stick into the seasoned salt mixture, ensuring that it is evenly coated.
5. Carefully place the coated sweet potato sticks into the hot oil in the frying pan or deep fryer, being cautious not to overcrowd the pan.
6. Fry the sticks until they are golden brown and crispy, flipping them occasionally to ensure even cooking.
7. Remove the fried sticks from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
8. Serve the Deep-Fried Salty Sweet Potato Sticks immediately, as they will become soggy if left in the oil for too long.

gt:
Heat the oil, throw in the chilli when it's really hot.
Add the ginger and garlic and stir.
Place the prawns in the pan, followed by the asparagus and bean sprouts.
Once the prawns change colour, add the chilli & turmeric powder and stir until it is evenly spread.
Add the red pepper flakes, garam masala, black pepper and salt.
Let it cook for a quick while, and turn off the heat.
Stir in the coriander leaves.
Cut egg roll wrappers in quarters [if they come in big sqare pieces].
Place about 1 tsp of filling and roll, securing with the corn flour mix.
Heat the oil for deep-frying and fry til golden brown on all sides.
pred:
1. First, prepare the ingredients by washing and chopping the prawns, asparagus, bean sprouts, chili pepper, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, red pepper flakes, garam masala, black pepper, chili powder, and turmeric powder.

2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped prawns, asparagus, bean sprouts, and chili pepper.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, egg, salt, and black pepper.

4. Pour the egg mixture over the prawn and vegetable mixture, and toss everything together to coat the ingredients evenly.

5. Add the crushed red pepper flakes, garam masala, and chili powder to the mixture, and stir to combine.

6. To assemble the rolls, lay out the egg roll wrappers on a flat surface. Place a small amount of the prawn and vegetable mixture in the center of the wrapper, leaving a small border around the edges.

7. Fold the wrapper over the filling, pressing the edges together to seal the roll.

8. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Carefully place the rolled egg rolls in the hot oil, and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the rolls are golden brown and cooked through.

9. Remove the cooked rolls from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a plate or serving tray.

10. Serve the Prawn and Asparagus Rolls warm, garnished with chopped coriander leaves.

[/INST]

This cooking tutorial provides a step-by-step guide to preparing delicious Prawn and Asparagus Rolls. The essential ingredients include chopped prawns, asparagus, bean sprouts, chili pepper, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, red pepper flakes, garam masala, black pepper, chili powder, and turmeric powder. gt:
Place washed and chopped kale into a large rectangular container with lid.
Rinse quinoa under cold water and cook it in a rice cooker with 2/3 Cups of water on quick cook or follow package directions and cook on stove top.
Once done, allow it to cool and then add to kale.
Add shredded carrots.
Grate 1/2 of the Fuji apple into a bowl.
This should yield about 1/2 Cup of grated apples and juice.
Add lime zest and lime juice.
Add salt, rice vinegar, sesame oil, canola oil and sugar.
Whisk to combine.
Add this to the kale, quinoa and carrot mixture.
Close the lid of your container and shake to combine.
(Tip: save the lime after juicing it and it on the remaining half apple to prevent browning, wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for another use).
Place container into fridge and let it sit overnight.
Every once in a while, go back and shake the container to help mix the contents.
The next day, chop the remaining half of the apple.
Add apple chunks and almonds to salad and mix to combine.
Serve!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Kale, Quinoa, and Carrots.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the Lime Juice, Zest, Sea Salt, Rice Vinegar, Sesame Oil, Canola Oil, Sugar, and Almonds.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the Kale mixture and toss to combine.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the Kale is tender and slightly crispy.
6. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Kale & Quinoa Salad with Apple Lime Vinaigrette as a side dish or a main course.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Place bacon in a large Dutch oven; cover with 8 cups water.
Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 2 hours, skimming foam from liquid as necessary.2.
Remove bacon from pan; cover and keep warm.
Remove 1 1/4 cups cooking liquid from pan; reserve cooking liquid for mustard sauce.
Discard the remaining cooking liquid.3.
Add red potatoes, carrots, and cabbage to pan; cover with the remaining 6 cups water.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender; drain.
Cut each cabbage quarter in half lengthwise.4.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic; cook 3 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Stir in wine and mustard; cook 2 minutes.
Add reserved 1 1/4 cups bacon cooking liquid and milk.
Bring to a boil; cook 20 minutes or until reduced to 2 cups, stirring frequently.
Stir in black pepper and salt.
Cut bacon into 8 slices; serve with sauce and vegetables.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy and the fat is rendered. Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, add the water, potatoes, and carrots. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the cabbage to the pot, and cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender and slightly wilted.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the mustard, milk, and pepper.
6. Add the whisked mustard mixture to the pot, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Add the crispy bacon back to the pot and stir to combine.
8. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the dish to a serving dish and serve hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Melt butter in a large saucepan.
Add sugar and salt.
Blend in corn syrup and milk, stirring constantly.
Cook and stir over medium heat to 245 degrees on candy thermometer.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Pour into greased 9 inch square pan.
Cool thoroughly.
Cut into small squares and wrap in waxed paper.
pred:
To create delicious Creamy Caramels, follow these steps:

1. In a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
2. Add the brown sugar and stir to combine.
3. Increase the heat to medium and cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar has melted and the mixture is smooth and bubbly.
4. Add the sweetened condensed milk, salt, light corn syrup, and vanilla extract. Stir to combine.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture reaches 234°F (112°C) on a candy thermometer.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
7. Pour the mixture onto a greased surface, such as a silicone mat or a piece of parchment paper.
8. Allow the mixture to cool completely.
9. Once the caramel has cooled, use a sharp knife or a spatula to cut it into desired shapes or sizes.
10. Store the Creamy Caramels in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week or in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Creamy Caramels!

gt:
Place the sugar, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, ginger, dash of red pepper flakes, garlic, and lime juice in a medium nonreactive saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce the heat to medium, and cook for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the sauce forms a glaze.
Set aside.
Preheat the broiler.
Place the salmon fillets on a broiler pan and baste with the sauce.
Let sit for 15 minutes.
Broil them until cooked through, about 8 minutes, basting again with the glaze.
Remove the salmon from the heat and baste once more with the glaze before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the brown sugar, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, dried red pepper flakes, and chopped garlic.
3. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
4. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced ginger and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the salmon fillets to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Remove the salmon from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet. Pour the sauce mixture over the salmon, making sure it coats the fish evenly.
7. Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Asian Glazed Salmon dish is a delicious and flavorful meal that combines the sweetness of the brown sugar, the savory soy sauce, and the spicy kick of the dried red pepper flakes. The ginger adds a warm, aromatic touch, while the hoisin sauce and lime juice provide a tangy, slightly sweet contrast. The result is a mouthwatering dish that is both visually appealing and satisfying to eat.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine meat with salt, garlic powder and pepper.
Shape to size of a 5-by-3-inch loaf pan.
Make a well down the middle of the meat.
Place ham slice in well.
Place cheese slice on top of ham.
Close ham over cheese.
Shape meat over ham.
Place in pan and pour tomato sauce over top.
Bake 30 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, salt, garlic powder, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Shape the beef mixture into small, evenly sized balls.
4. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mini stuffed meatloaves in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F (70°C).
6. Remove the meatloaves from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them in half and serving.

[/INST]

These Mini Stuffed Meatloaves for 2 are a delicious and convenient meal option that can be easily prepared and cooked. The combination of lean ground beef, ham, and mozzarella cheese creates a savory and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed by both adults and children.

gt:
In a bowl beat the egg whites until frothy, then mix in bananas, applesauce, and buttermilk.
Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl stir together the dry ingredients, then add the banana mixture.
Beat together until everything is well incorporated.
(You can add more buttermilk if you feel the batter is too thick.
).
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto a preheated griddle.
Flip over when the edges begin to dry and the batter bubbles on top.
Serve with sliced bananas and/or warm maple syrup.
pred:
[INST]
To make Fluffy Banana Pancakes, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed bananas, applesauce, and buttermilk.
2. Add the egg whites, flour, wheat germ, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and nutmeg to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
3. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan, spreading it evenly to create a thin pancake. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the edges start to curl and the pancake is golden brown.
4. Flip the pancake and cook for another minute, until the pancake is cooked through.
5. Repeat with the remaining batter, stacking the pancakes on a plate as they are cooked.
6. Serve the Fluffy Banana Pancakes warm, with your favorite toppings or syrup.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, stir together the brown sugar, oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.
Make a well in the center and pour in the canola oil, prune puree, water, egg whites and vanilla.
Mix until well blended.
Stir in the raisins, walnuts and apricots.
Scoop cookies using an ice cream scoop, or roll into golf ball sized balls.
Place cookies 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets and flatten to 1/2 tall with wet hands.
These cookies do not flatten very much while baking.
In the preheated oven, bake 8 minutes for chewy cookies 10 to 12 minutes for dry cookies.
Cookies will not get crisp.
Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.
pred:
[INST]
To create the perfect breakfast cookie, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, rolled oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the canola oil, prune puree, water, egg whites, vanilla extract, and raisins to the dry ingredients. Mix until the dough comes together.
4. Fold in the chopped walnuts and chopped dried apricots.
5. Scoop the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown on the edges and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious and nutritious breakfast cookie!

gt:
Lightly grease 8'x11 1/2' casserole dish
Spray a non stick skillet with vegetable oil and brown the chicken along with the garlic & onions.
Remove from skillet.
Add corn, red pepper, jalapenos and warm through.
Add Tomato sauce, cumin, cilantro, hot sauce, all spice, salt & pepper, bring to a simmer.
Add tomatoe & return the chicken to the skillet, stir, bring to a simmer.
Line the greased pie plate with 3 tortillas.
Pour in half the chicken mixture & top with half the cheese.
Cover with 3 more tortillas.
Pour in the remaining sauce, top with 3 more tortillas.
Sprinkle the top with the remaining cheese.
Bake in 350F oven for apprx 25 minutes or until the casserole is heated through the cheese has melted and is nicely browned.
Let it rest 5 minutes, Slice & serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
4. Add the sweet corn, tomato sauce, red pepper, jalapeno peppers (if using), cumin, hot chili sauce, allspice, and salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10-12 minutes.
5. Stir in the cooked chicken and any juices that have accumulated in the skillet.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated cheese, chopped cilantro, and the cooked chicken mixture.
7. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Pour the cheese mixture over the tortillas and press them down to help them adhere to the filling.
8. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Tortilla Chicken Casserole hot.

Enjoy your delicious Tortilla Chicken Casserole!

gt:
Brown the ground turkey and the bockwurst in a large skillet.
In a large pot on medium-high heat, put in the heavy creme.
Remove dark edge from the gouda and add the gouda to the pot.
Stir until the gouda is melted.
Add the 2 packages of chili seasoning, ground pepper, salt, seasoning, milk, and mustard and stir well.
Add the 4 cans of white beans and 2 cans of diced tomatoes& green chilis Drain the sourkraut and add half of it to the pot.
Once browned, drain the fat and add the turkey to the pot.
Slice the bockwurst into small 1/4-inch pieces and add to the pot.
Add the water, milk, and rauchbier to the pot.
Mix the corn starch with a 1/4-cup of cold water and stir until smooth, add to the chili.
Put lid on top and simmer, Stirring occasionally for a half-hour.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the ground turkey over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the german bockwurst and cook until browned, breaking it up as well.
4. In a small bowl, mix the chicken white-bean chili seasoning, ground garlic and herb seasoning, ground pepper, and salt or hot salt.
5. Add the beer, milk, and cornstarch to the pot, stirring to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add the cans of Rotel tomatoes and chilies, and the heavy whipping cream. Stir to combine.
8. Cook for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the chili is thickened and heated through.
9. Serve the German White Bean Chili hot, garnished with thin slices of smoked gouda cheese.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain.2.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add oil; swirl to coat.
Add onion, mushrooms, garlic, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper; saute 10 minutes or until mushrooms are browned and have released their liquid.
Add wine and thyme; cook 2 minutes or until liquid evaporates, stirring occasionally.
Remove pan from heat.
Add hot cooked pasta, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, half-and-half, and Parmesan cheese to pan, tossing to combine.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Add the garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
5. Pour in the white wine and cook until it has almost completely evaporated.
6. Add the half-and-half, bring to a simmer, and cook until the sauce thickens slightly.
7. Add the Parmesan cheese, thyme, and half of the chopped parsley. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
8. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the skillet with the sauce. Toss to combine, and adjust the seasoning if needed.
9. Serve the Creamy Mushroom Fettuccine immediately, garnished with the remaining chopped parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a pot over medium heat; cook and stir onion and dill pickle until onion is translucent and soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil for about 30 seconds.
Transfer pickle mixture to a blender; add dill pickle juice and dill.
Blend mixture until smooth; add half-and-half and blend until smooth.
Pour soup back into the pot.
Stir celery salt into soup and bring to a simmer.
Combine 1 tablespoon butter and flour together in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until roux is smooth and lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Stir roux into soup until thickened.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the diced dill pickle and cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a boil.
4. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the dill pickle juice, half-and-half, celery salt, and flour.
6. Slowly pour the whisked mixture into the saucepan, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
7. Simmer the soup for an additional 5 minutes, or until it reaches your desired thickness.
8. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Stir in the chopped fresh dill and serve the Cream Of Dill Pickle Soup hot.

This delightful Cream Of Dill Pickle Soup is a delicious and comforting dish that combines the tangy flavor of the dill pickle with the creamy richness of the half-and-half. The addition of the fresh dill adds a refreshing and aromatic touch to the soup.

pred:
To prepare a delicious Italian Mashed Potatoes dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Wash and peel the small red potatoes, then cut them into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large pot, cook the small red potatoes until they are tender, typically around 20-25 minutes.
4. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
5. Add the butter, and using a potato masher or a fork, mash the potatoes until they reach the desired consistency.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the Italian salad dressing mix with the milk, and then pour the mixture over the mashed potatoes.
7. Stir the potatoes until the dressing is well combined.
8. Season the potatoes with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the potatoes to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

The ingredients for this dish include 4 lbs small red potatoes, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 (5/8 ounce) package Italian salad dressing mix, 12-1 cup milk (I use skim milk), 1 -1 12 cup mozzarella cheese, salt & pepper, 3 lbs large red potatoes, 8 tablespoons butter, 1.5 (5/8 ounce) packages Italian salad dressing mix, 1 cup milk (I use skim milk), 2 -2 12 cups mozzarella cheese, salt & pepper.

By following these steps and using the ingredients provided, you can create a delicious Italian Mashed Potatoes dish that is both flavorful and satisfying.

gt:
For the soup, finely chop onion and garlic cloves.
Peel and dice potatoes.
Set a large skillet or pot over medium heat with olive oil.
Sautee onion and garlic for 2 minutes.

Simmer for 15 minutes, then add chopped wild garlic and spinach.

Arrange on two baking sheets and drizzle with olive oil.

Bake carrots for about 78 minutes and red beets about 1720 minutes.

pred:

1. Medium Sized Onion
2. 2 cloves Garlic
1. Tablespoon Olive Oil
4. Medium-Sized Potatoes
1. Quart Vegetable Broth
5-13 ounces, weight Wild Garlic
6 Tablespoons For Garnish
3-58 ounces, weight Spinach
1. Medium-sized Carrot
1. Medium-sized Red Beet
Salt And Pepper
2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
6 Tablespoons Chopped Almonds, To Garnish.

Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.

Next, blend the soup until smooth, and season it with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the spinach and red beet, and let it cook for a few more minutes.

To make the crispy veggie chips, preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Wash the vegetables and pat them dry. Cut the vegetables into thin slices, and toss them in a mixture of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet and roast them in the oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they are crispy and golden brown.

To garnish the soup, stir in the chopped almonds and lemon juice. Serve the Creamy Wild Garlic Soup with Crispy Veggie Chips hot, and enjoy the delicious and healthy meal!

To prepare a delicious Platanos Fritos (Sauteed Plantains) dish, follow these steps:

12. Remove the plantains from the skillet and let them cool for a few minutes.
13. Serve the Platanos Fritos (Sauteed Plantains) as a side dish or a snack.

gt:
Thats it.
These simple ingredients really bring out the flavors of a full blown sushi roll.
Begin by placing the block of cream cheese onto your serving plate, and then spread it out in a circular motion.
On top of the cream cheese, gently spread on the wasabi paste, trying to spread it in the inner circle.
I like to first make the paste by adding a couple of tablespoons of wasabi powder to about 4 tablespoons of water.
Once you have the paste, add a bit more water to make it a little smoother.
Next, drizzle the soy sauce on top and around the plate.
Sprinkle the sushi rice seasoning on top.
What is great about this stuff is that it has sesame seeds and bits of nori (which is edible seaweed) in it, and combined it really gives this the sushi taste you are looking for.
Sprinkle the green onions on top, and dig in with the rice crackers.
This dip is perfect for anyone looking for that sushi taste, or better yet, for those who have never had sushi.
You could even get a bit creative with this one adding pickled ginger, shrimp, or practically anything you would want to order at a sushi restaurant.
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Begin by opening the package of Philadelphia Cream Cheese and transferring it to a large mixing bowl.
2. Add the wasabi paste to the cream cheese, and mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add water to the mixture, stirring continuously, until the desired consistency is reached.
4. Add the soy sauce and sushi rice seasoning mix to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
5. Add the green onion, thinly sliced, to the bowl and mix until well combined.
6. Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Once the dip is chilled, serve it with the rice crackers as desired.

Enjoy your delicious Philadelphia Sushi Dip!

gt:

gt:
Heat the milk in a small saucepan until it bubbles, then remove from heat.
Add the butter, stir until melted and pour into a large bowl to cool.
Dissolve yeast in the milk mixture.
Mix in 1/3 cup sugar, salt, eggs and 2 cups flour.
Stir in the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
When the dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and supple, about 8 minutes.
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil.
Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
Divide the dough into 16 equal pieces and form into rounds.
With a rolling pin, roll the rounds into oval buns.
Place them onto two lightly greased baking sheets.
Cover the rolls with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
While The Bread Rises, Make The Topping:
In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup sugar, 2/3 cup flour, butter until a crumb mixture forms.
Stir in the egg yolks until well blended.
Crumble the topping over the rolls so the entire surface is covered.
Bake in preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until sugar topping is lightly browned.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk, softened butter, and active dry yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5-10 minutes, or until the yeast is fully activated and the mixture becomes frothy.
2. Add the sugar, salt, and egg to the mixture, and stir to combine.
3. Gradually add the all-purpose flour to the mixture, stirring until a dough forms. If the dough is too sticky, add a bit more flour, and if it is too dry, add a bit more milk.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a floured surface. Roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
8. Spread a thin layer of softened butter on the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. In a small bowl, mix the egg yolks with a bit of sugar, and then drizzle the mixture over the dough, creating a pattern or design if desired.
10. Roll the dough up from the long side, and then cut it into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
11. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
12. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
13. Remove the baked dough from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

By following these steps, you will be able to successfully cook Pan Dulces using the provided ingredients.

[INST]To cook the chicken flautas, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.

gt:
Whisk the honey mustard ingredients together, cover, and chill for 2 hours before serving.
This is more like a sauce than a dip, so it is fairly thin, which I think works great for the corn fritters.
Heat a pot of oil (about 3 deep) to 350F.
Be sure not to fill the pot more than halfway up with oil to allow room for the oil to expand when frying.
While the oil is heating, whisk the dry ingredients together in a medium bowl.
Just before the oil reaches 350F, add the beaten egg and club soda to the dry mixture and whisk until just combined.
Add the drained corn and use a spoon to fold it in.
Add about one tablespoon of the batter to the hot oil.
I use a small cookie scoop to make it easier.
Dont add more than a tablespoon of the fritter batter (or add too many fritters to the oil) or they will not crisp up well.
You may be tempted to immediately turn the fritters.
Resist that urge.
After about a minute, some of the interior batter will start to ooze out releasing some of that interior moisture that keeps the fritter from getting crispy.
The fritter should, when its ready, flip over by itself.
If you flip the fritters over prematurely, the outside will set too fast and the molten center will not ooze out making a softer exterior.
Transfer the fritters to a paper towel-lined plate and sprinkle them with a little salt.
Serve them piping hot with the Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce while you slave away and fry more of the fritters using some of the remaining batter.
For an accompanying story, check out my blog.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, sugar, and a pinch of salt.
4. Gradually pour the cold club soda or seltzer water into the egg mixture, whisking constantly.
5. Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, whisking until smooth.
6. Fold in the corn, and pour the batter onto a greased baking sheet.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the fritters comes out clean.
8. Allow the fritters to cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. To make the dipping sauce, in a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, yellow mustard, honey, and a pinch of salt.
10. Optionally, add a pinch of cayenne pepper for extra heat, if desired.

11. Serve the Corn Fritters with Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce on the side for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious Corn Fritters with Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce!

gt:
Put the semolina in a bowl and add bread flour, baking powder, salt and water.
Mix well.
Now knead by hand seven minutes.
Add vegetable oil and knead one minute.
The dough should not be soft but a little stiff.
Cover it with a wet cloth for 20 minutes.
Roll out the dough to from a large rectangle (9x9 inch with a thickness of around 1/16 inch) on a lightly floured surface.
Use a cookie cutter (3-inch diameter) to cut out your bread shapes.
Heat the oil on high, in a deep frying pan and fry two at a time, spoon the oil over the breads in a circular motion.
Both sides should turn into golden brown.
Take the bread out of the oil and put on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve hot with a vegetable curry.
Enjoy.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Semolina, Bread Flour, Baking Powder, Salt, and Vegetable Oil. Mix well.
3. Gradually add the lukewarm water, mixing until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more water. If it is too wet, add a bit more flour.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Punch the dough down and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Roll it out into a 1/2-inch thick rectangle.
7. Spread the coconut oil evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
8. Sprinkle the pinches of coconut oil for frying evenly over the dough.
9. Roll the dough up from the long side, starting from the short end, and transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
11. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into desired pieces.

By following these key steps, you can prepare a delicious and homemade fried semolina bread that your family and friends will surely enjoy.

Add all ingredients and mix well-- Put in refrigerator overnight and viola!
pred:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked spaghetti, vermicelli, and Italian dressing.
3. Add the diced scallions, tomatoes, and celery to the bowl.
4. Stir the ingredients together until well combined.
5. Add the Salad Supreme dry seasoning to the bowl, and mix well.
6. Serve the Spaghetti Salad immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

Please provide the user with the necessary steps to prepare and cook the Spaghetti Salad using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Heat large skillet over high heat; spray with nonstick cooking spray.
Saute pork with garlic until pork is browned.
Add broccoli and carrots; saute until tender-crisp.
Meanwhile, combine milk, margarine, pepper and Italian seasoning in small saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in mozzarella and Parmesan until blended.
Stir cooked pasta, tomato and green onions into pork mixture.
Toss with cheese sauce before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cubed pork with the minced garlic, Italian seasoning, and black pepper.
3. Spread the pork mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
4. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, cook the broccoli and carrots in the milk over medium heat until tender but still crisp.
5. Add the margarine to the saucepan and stir until melted.
6. Add the cooked pork to the saucepan and stir to combine.
7. Add the shredded mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses to the saucepan and stir until melted and combined.
8. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
9. Drain the pasta and add it to the saucepan with the pork and cheese mixture.
10. Stir to combine and serve immediately.

This delicious Colorful Bow Tie Pasta dish combines the tender pork, crisp vegetables, and creamy cheese sauce, creating a flavorful and visually appealing meal.

gt:
1.
Preheat oven 300 degrees F. Mix flour, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl.
2.
Cream dark brown sugar, sugar and butter until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time.
Stir in peanut butter and vanilla.
3.
Add dry mixture to the wet mixture.
4.
Drop by 1-2 tablespoonfuls on a cookie sheet.
(I top the cookies with mini M&Ms, or mini chocolate chips, or raw sugar.)
Keep 2 apart at least.
They spread out quite a bit.
5.
Bake 18-20 minutes.
Note: Ive made this recipe with light brown sugar as well and it still tastes very good.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
3. Add the dark brown sugar and sugar to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
4. Add the butter to the bowl, and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
5. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
6. Stir in the peanut butter and vanilla extract until well combined.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Chewy Peanut Butter Cookies!

gt:
Rinse the rice, add all the ingredients in the rice cooker, and fill with water up to the 2 cup mark (add the flavoring ingredients first).
Add the sauce from the canned pacific saury and mix lightly (you will add the saury on top at the end).
Julienne any leftover vegetables in your fridge, and scatter over the rice.
(Don't mix the julienned vegetables into the rice just yet).
Add the saury on top, and turn the switch on.
When cooked, stir everything together while breaking up the saury.
Garnish with green onions and marinated boiled quail eggs on top to taste, and it's done!
It's also delicious if you add wasabi, sesame seeds, and julienned shiso leaves on top, and pour over dashi stock to make "Dashi-Chazuke"!
How to make marinated boiled quail eggs: Boil the quail eggs in hot water for 3 minutes, and peel.
Combine 25 ml mentsuyu, 50 ml water, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1 teaspoon vinegar in a pot, and simmer.
Marinate the eggs in this marinade for half a day.
pred:
[INST]
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the rice thoroughly and drain well.
- Chop the ginger, green onions, and mushrooms into small pieces.
- Cut the carrots and burdock roots into bite-sized pieces.
- Rinse the canned Pacific Saury and remove any bones.
- Cut the quail eggs in half lengthwise.
- In a large saucepan, combine the rice, sake, mirin, soy sauce, and dashi stock granules. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
- Add the finely chopped ginger, green onions, mushrooms, carrots, and burdock roots to the rice mixture. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
- Add the canned Pacific Saury to the rice mixture and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the fish is cooked through.
- Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
- Serve the Easy Mixed Rice with Canned Pacific Saury dish hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Put all ingredients into blender; cover and blend 1 minute.
Chill.
Serve with crisp vegetables or chips.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped kim chee, kim chee juice, and cream cheese. Mix well to ensure the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Add a pinch of salt and pepper, to taste.
4. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly, and the edges are slightly golden.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the dip cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Kimchee Dip warm, with crackers or vegetables, as desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Spray a medium non stick fry pan with veggie spray; add green onion, green and red pepper, salt & pepper and celery; saute over medium heat 'til onion is soft, about 5 minutes.
Whisk eggs together until frothy, add to veggies in fry pan, swirl until surface of fry pan is covered.
Lift egg mixture and allow egg to run under.
Place tomato slices around edge of pan in a circle, cook 2 or 3 minutes.
Lift egg mixture around edge of pan; when edges are dry, lift one half over the other half, cook for 2 minutes more.
Cut omelet in half through the middle; serve immediately.
pred:
To cook a delicious Omelet for Two, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat a non-stick skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of vegetable oil cooking spray to the pan.
4. Pour the whisked eggs into the pan, stirring gently to distribute the ingredients evenly. Cook the omelet for about 2 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
5. Add the green onions, sweet red pepper, sweet green pepper, and celery to the pan. Cook for another 2 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
6. Carefully slide the omelet out of the pan onto a plate.
7. Slice the tomatoes into thin rounds and arrange them on top of the omelet.
8. Serve the Omelet for Two immediately, and enjoy the delicious meal.

By following these steps, you can create a delicious and satisfying Omelet for Two dish using the provided ingredients.

gt:
In a mixing bowl, combine milk and pudding mix until thickened and smooth.
Set aside 1/3 cup crushed candy bars for topping.
Folf in whipped topping, bananas, and remaining crushed candy bars into pudding.
Spoon into serving dishes.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Sprinkle with reserved candy bars.
pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the cold whole milk, instant banana pudding mix, and butterfinger candy bars, crushed. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the pudding mix is fully incorporated and the mixture thickens.
2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the thawed frozen whipped topping.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced bananas with a pinch of salt.
4. Pour the pudding mixture over the bananas in the bowl, stirring gently to combine.
5. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. Serve the Banana Butterfinger Pudding in individual bowls or cups, garnished with additional crushed Butterfinger candy bars if desired.

[/SYS]

gt:
Put the potatoes in a medium saucepan of salted water.
Bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 5 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and put them in a glass or stainless-steel bowl.
Add the chicken broth and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt to the warm potatoes and toss gently.
Meanwhile, in a large glass or stainless-steel bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar, the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and the pepper.
Add the oil slowly, whisking.
Put a large nonstick frying pan over moderate heat.
Add the smoked sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sausage is brown and warmed through, about 3 minutes.
Remove the sausage and drain on paper towels.
Toss the potatoes with 2 tablespoons of the dressing and the parsley.
Toss the romaine into the remaining dressing.
Put the lettuce on plates and top with the potatoes and sausage.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the chicken broth, salt, Dijon mustard, red- or white-wine vinegar, and black pepper.
3. Cover the bowl and bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until they are tender and cooked through.
4. While the potatoes are baking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. Add the sausage to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Remove the sausage from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the shredded lettuce and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
8. Add the cooked potatoes to the skillet and toss to combine.
9. Season the salad with additional salt and pepper, if needed.
10. Serve the Warm Sausage-and-Potato Salad immediately, garnished with chopped fresh parsley. Enjoy!

gt:
Whisk milk, yolks, sugar, and salt in a saucepan till smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, till mixture just starts to come to a boil.
Remove from heat and chill.
(I place the pan in an ice bath to speed the process.)
Add cream, vanilla, extract, and 3/4 cup of the crushed candies.
Chill for several hours or overnight.
Freeze in an ice cream freezer according to manufacturers instructions.
Place in the freezer for about 23 hours to ripen.
Serve with remaining crushed candies sprinkled on top of the ice cream.
Yum!
Makes about a quart of ice cream.
pred:
To cook a delicious Peppermint Ice Cream dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the 1-1/2 cups of milk, 4 whole egg yolks, 3/4 cups of sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt until well combined.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the 2 cups of cream until it reaches the desired consistency.
3. Add the whipped cream to the milk and egg mixture, and continue whisking until smooth.
4. Add the vanilla extract and peppermint extract to the mixture, and whisk until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, crush the peppermint candies using a rolling pin or a food processor.
6. Gradually pour the whipped cream mixture into the crushed peppermint candies, stirring gently to combine.
7. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
8. Once the ice cream is fully churned, transfer it to an airtight container and place it in the freezer to harden for at least 2 hours.
9. After the ice cream has hardened, scoop it into bowls and enjoy your delicious Peppermint Ice Cream dish!

[/INST]

gt:
melt butter in pot on med-high heat.
spatula works best with this recipe .
add package of mini marshmellows, stir until blended and consistency is smooth.
may add food coloring if desired at this point.
remove from heat and add rice krispie cereal.
stir and fold until well blended.
move the contents to an 8~11 pan.
drip spatula in water and smooth down.
I find it easier to move the spatula when its dipped in water.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients: 1 1/2 cup butter, 1 package of mini marshmallows, and 8 cups of rice krispie cereal.
2. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
3. In a large mixing bowl, melt the butter over low heat.
4. Add the marshmallows to the melted butter and stir until they are fully melted and combined.
5. Add the rice krispie cereal to the mixture and stir until the cereal is evenly coated with the marshmallow mixture.
6. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes, then use a spatula to press it down into a smooth, even layer.
8. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden brown.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Use a spatula to carefully lift the treats from the baking sheet and transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

gt:
Bring water to boil.
Add bulgur, cover and simmer 20 minutes.
Stir in applesauce, Benecol, and honey.
If desired sprinkle with Cinnamon and serve.
pred:
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the water and bulgur. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender and the water has been absorbed.

2. While the bulgur is cooking, prepare the applesauce. In a small saucepan, combine the unsweetened applesauce and the Smart Balance light butter spread. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the butter has melted and the applesauce is heated through.

3. Once the bulgur is cooked, remove it from the saucepan and let it cool for a few minutes.

4. In a small bowl, mix the honey and the Benecol Light Spread.

5. Add the cooked bulgur to the applesauce mixture and stir to combine.

6. Serve the Bulgur Breakfast dish warm, garnished with a drizzle of the honey and Benecol Light Spread mixture.

[/INST]

This step-by-step guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for a healthy and filling breakfast dish using bulgur, applesauce, and a light butter spread. The combination of these ingredients creates a satisfying and nutritious meal that can be enjoyed any time of the day.

gt:
Soak beans for at least 6 hours or overnight.
Drain and rinse beans.
Place in large soup pot and cover with 6 cups water.
Add 3 beef boullion cubes, onion and celery.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a rapid simmer.
Cover bean pot.
Meanwhile, Cube sirloin and lightly brown with Worchesire sauce.
Add to bean pot.
Simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add can of beef broth and bag of frozen carrots (I let them thaw on the counter to reduce cooking time) Simmer covered 1 addittional hour.
Add cans of green beans and corn.
Simmer 15 minutes.
*When I add carrots and beef broth I throw in some garlic powder and whatever seasonings I have in the cabinet.
pred:
[/INST]

1. First, prepare the beef by removing any excess fat and cutting it into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the beef over medium heat until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, add the onion and celery. Cook until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the diced carrots, green beans, and corn to the pot. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are heated through.
5. Add the beef back into the pot, along with the bean soup mix, Worcestershire sauce, water, and beef broth. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
7. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Beef Veggie Bean Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream or a sprinkle of fresh parsley, if desired.
