gt:
Combine the barbecue sauce with the tablespoon oil, rub lightly over the fish fillets, and leave in a non-reactive dish at room temperature while you prepare the rest of the dish.
Mango sauce: Heat the oil in a pan and add the onion, cover and cook 5 minutes, then add the mango, orange juice, hot pepper and honey, and stir well.
Simmer, uncovered, for about 7 minutes.
Puree the mixture in a blender, season with salt, put in a bowl, cover, and keep in a warm oven.
Corn relish: Combine all the ingredients (corn kernels down to the oil).
Season to taste.
Put in a bowl, cover and put in warm oven with the mango sauce.
Also put 4 - 6 plates in sam oven to warm up.
In a pan (can use same one you used to make the mango sauce) heat some oil until hot.
Fry the fish fillets for about 2 minutes per side, until JUST cooked through.
To serve: Spoon some mango sauce in the centre of each plate.
Set a fish fillet on top, and spoon some corn relish over the fillet.
Serve immediately.
Nice with simple boiled potatoes or baby potatoes, and a mixed green salad.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the fish fillets with the barbecue sauce, oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and bell peppers, and cook until they are soft and slightly browned.
4. Add the mango, orange juice, hot pepper, honey, and rice vinegar to the skillet. Cook until the sauce thickens and the flavors meld together.
5. Transfer the fish mixture to the skillet with the sauce, and cook for about 10-15 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Serve the Chilean Fish With Honey-Mango Sauce over rice or noodles, garnished with cilantro and a squeeze of lime.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt; set aside.
In a medium bowl, cream butter with 1/4 cup white sugar and brown sugar.
Mix in egg and vanilla.
Add the sifted dry ingredients, and mix until well blended.
Divide dough into 3 equal portions.
Roll into logs 2 inches in diameter, wrap, and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours.
These logs can be frozen for up to 6 weeks.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon on a flat plate or a piece of wax paper.
Unwrap dough logs, and roll in the cinnamon mixture.
Cut into 1/4 inch slices, and place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven.
Remove from baking sheets to cool on wire racks.
Baked cookies can be kept in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
pred:
To create delicious Cinnamon Sugar Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. Fold in the ground cinnamon.
7. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
8. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Scoop the dough into balls, and roll them in granulated sugar, cinnamon, or a mixture of both.
10. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
11. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Cinnamon Sugar Cookies!

gt:
Cut bacon in half.
Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet, and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate.
Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 30 second intervals, stirring after each melting, for 1 to 3 minutes (depending on your microwave).
Do not overheat or chocolate will scorch.
Dip all but the last inch of each strip of bacon in the melted chocolate.
Place bacon on waxed paper and allow to cool and harden before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium-sized bowl, mix the 8 slices of bacon, milk chocolate chips, and 1/2 cup of melted butter.
3. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Spread the mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
5. Bake the bacon and chips mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the chips are melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Using a spatula, carefully transfer the mixture to a serving dish.
8. Serve the Hogs and Kisses immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Boil the edamame.
I recommend using Tanaka-san's "Easy!
Delicious!
How to Boil Edamame"They have a slight sweetness and taste delicious.
Remove the boiled edamame from the shells and if you have time, also remove the thin inner skin.
Combine the ingredients and add to a plastic bag.
Add the edamame from Step 2 and shake shake shake.
Heat a small amount of oil (not listed in ingredients) on medium heat.
Add the edamame from Step 3 and cook for about 30 seconds.
Remove from the pan and drain the oil.
Sprinkle with a bit of salt to finish.
pred:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
2. Add the curry powder and cook for a few seconds until fragrant.
3. Add the white flour, stirring constantly, and cook for a minute or two until it becomes a light golden color.
4. Add the edamame, stirring to coat them evenly with the curry mixture.
5. Season with salt to taste.
6. Cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, until the edamame are cooked through and the curry flavors have melded together.
7. Serve the Goes Great with Beer Curry Flavored Fried Edamame immediately.

This recipe combines the flavors of a classic curry with the crunchy texture of fried edamame. The white flour adds a delicate, slightly nutty taste to the dish, while the curry powder provides a rich, spicy kick. The salt balances the flavors, and the beer enhances the overall taste profile. This dish is perfect for those who enjoy a combination of flavors and textures in their meals.

gt:
Heat canola oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ginger, lemongrass, and garlic; saute 1 minute or just until mixture begins to brown.
Add chicken; saute 2 minutes.
Add edamame and stir-fry mix; saute 3 minutes.
Combine soy sauce, mirin, sesame oil, and cornstarch, stirring with a whisk.
Add to pan; cook 1 minute.
Remove from heat.
Stir in onions, sesame seeds, and salt.
Serve over rice.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the canola oil, minced ginger, minced lemongrass, garlic, and minced onion.
2. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken evenly with the marinade.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
5. Add the marinated chicken to the skillet and cook until it is cooked through and no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. In the same skillet, add the edamame and bell peppers. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
8. Add the stir-fry mix and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 3-5 minutes.
9. Add the soy sauce, mirin, dark sesame oil, and cornstarch. Stir to combine and cook until the sauce thickens slightly, about 2-3 minutes.
10. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
11. Serve the Sesame Chicken Edamame Bowl over a bed of cooked brown rice.

[/INST]

gt:
If using cleaned and deveined shrimp please skip to step 4 --
Cut shrimp shell with scissors starting at the seperation between the head and body.
Use knife to cut a shallow slice down back of shrimp and devein.
Make a 'boat' with several layers of foil to hold shrimp and juices.
Place shrimp in boat and season with salt, pepper garlic and cayenne making as hot as you want.
Cut butter into pieces and place on top of shrimp.
Place boat on grill and cook just until shrimp curls.
Garnish if desired.
You can skewer these too but they are more moist done this way.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix the shrimp, minced garlic, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Toss the shrimp in the mixture until they are evenly coated.
3. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add a splash of lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Cook the shrimp in the lemon juice mixture until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 1-2 minutes.
6. Serve the shrimp over a bed of linguine or your preferred pasta. If desired, garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley and a squeeze of lemon wedge.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Grilled Shrimp Scampi!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375*.
If you are making a 'crustless' quiche, spray a 9" deep-dish pie plate well with cooking spray.
Set aside.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium/high heat.
Add mushrooms and onions.
Cook until mushrooms are soft.
Stir in seasonings and set aside to cool slightly.
Whisk eggs and cream until well combined.
Stir in the mushroom mixture, cheeses and parsley.
Pour into the pie shell or prepared pie plate.
Bake for approximately 20 - 25 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
pred:
To cook a delicious Herb and Mushroom Quiche, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mushrooms, onion, dried chives, onion powder, thyme, salt, cayenne pepper, and black pepper. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and cream until well combined.
4. Add the egg mixture to the mushroom mixture and stir to combine.
5. If using a pie shell, roll it out on a floured surface to fit the pie dish. Place the pie shell in the pie dish and press the edges to form a crust.
6. Pour the mushroom and egg mixture into the pie shell.
7. If using a pie shell, bake the quiche for 35-40 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are golden brown.
8. If not using a pie shell, bake the quiche for 25-30 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are golden brown.
9. Remove the quiche from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Prepare jelly as directed on the pack.
Pour it in a glass bowl (till an inch).
Pour rest of the jelly in tray or cut it into different shapes for topping.
Layer some crackers over jelly.
Prepare custard let it cool for sometime then pour over the cracker's layer.
Boil noodles according to the directions n lay them over on custard when custard is set.
Layer cream and pineapple on top of it.
Add jelly shapes to top it off.
And put it in the refrigerator for two hours.
Serve cold.
You can either serve it as it is or mix it all up so that everyone gets a taste of everything in it (but this may get a little mushy and colourful and sometimes out of place too.
I prefer serving it as it is set or I just give it a few folds.
I don't mix all of it throughly).
Up to you :-)
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the two packages of different flavored jelly and mix well.
2. Add the custard and cream to the bowl, and mix until smooth.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs until they are light and fluffy.
4. Gradually pour the whisked eggs into the jelly mixture, stirring constantly.
5. Add the 3/4 cup of Egg noodles to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and smooth the top.
7. Bake the custard n creme in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 45 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly golden.
8. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the custard n creme warm, garnished with chopped pineapples or fruit cocktail, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Place the potatoes and onion in a slow cooker.
Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the beef and garlic together in the melted butter until the beef is browned on all sides.
Transfer the beef and garlic to the slow cooker while keeping the beef drippings in the skillet.
Return the skillet to the medium-high heat.
Stir the coconut milk, peanut butter, and curry powder into the reserved beef drippings; cook and stir until the peanut butter melts.
Pour the coconut milk mixture into the slow cooker.
Turn the slow cooker on to Low; stir the fish sauce, brown sugar, and beef broth into the slow cooker.
Cook on Low until the beef is fork-tender, 4 to 6 hours.
Stir the peanuts into the curry about 30 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, onion, and butter. Toss to coat the vegetables evenly with the butter.
3. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a slow cooker.
4. Add the beef chuck, garlic, coconut milk, peanut butter, curry powder, fish sauce, brown sugar, and beef broth to the slow cooker. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Cook the curry on low heat for 8-10 hours or on high heat for 4-5 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
6. Stir in the unsalted, dry-roasted peanuts.
7. Serve the Slow Cooker Mussaman Curry over rice or with your preferred side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Put teriyaki sauce in skillet, place on medium heat.
Add garlic powder.
Place chicken breasts in skillet.
Top with red peppers on each breast.
Turn heat to med-high and bring to a boil.
Lower heat and simmer and cover for 20 minute.
Flip chicken breasts about every 5 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with garlic powder and red pepper flakes, ensuring even coverage.
3. In a large bowl, mix the teriyaki sauce, cornstarch, and water.
4. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish, and pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over them.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
7. Serve the Teriyaki Chicken with rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal.

gt:
Blend peanut butter and honey in small bowl.
Spread about 1 tablespoon peanut butter mixture on each of 10 grahams; top with banana slices and remaining grahams.
Freeze for at least 1 hour.
Individually wrap and store in freezer for up to 1 week.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread the creamy peanut butter evenly on one side of each graham cracker square.
3. Place the banana slices on top of the peanut butter-covered graham crackers.
4. Drizzle honey over the banana slices.
5. Place the sandwiches in a baking dish or on a baking sheet.
6. Bake the sandwiches in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy and the peanut butter is melted.
7. Remove the sandwiches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious and easy-to-make dish is perfect for a quick snack or a fun treat for children. The combination of creamy peanut butter, honey, and graham crackers creates a satisfying and satisfying taste experience.

gt:
For the pecans: In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, water, vanilla, and paprika and set aside.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, toast pecans about 3 minutes or until they give off a nutty aroma.
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Pour the sugar mixture over the pecans, stirring constantly for about 15 seconds, until the pecans are thoroughly coated.
Immediately remove from the heat and spread on wax paper to cool.
Once cooled, you can break the nuts apart, if needed.
The pecans will be slightly sticky at first, but the coating hardens further within a few hours.
You may use immediately or prepare in advance.
For the dip: In a medium saucepan over medium-high eat, combine all the ingredients for the dip except for 1/2 the lime zest and the cream cheese.
Bring to a boil then simmer about 15 minutes or until the sauce has thickened, stirring often.
To assemble, spread the cream cheese evenly on a serving dish, top with warm cranberry sauce.
Chop the pecans and sprinkle over the dip and garnish with the remaining lime zest.
Serve with crackers.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the 1-1/2 tablespoons of packed brown sugar, 1-1/2 teaspoons of water, and 18 teaspoons of vanilla. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved.
3. In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth.
4. Add the dissolved sugar mixture to the cream cheese, and mix until well combined.
5. Add the zest of the lime, divided, and mix well.
6. Add the cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and water. Mix until well combined.
7. Add the fresh or frozen cranberries and chopped serrano peppers. Mix until well combined.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are bubbly and the center is set.
9. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. While the dip is cooling, prepare the candied pecans by combining the 1 cup of pecan halves, 1/4 cup of sugar, and 1/4 cup of water in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the pecans are coated.
11. Allow the candied pecans to cool completely.
12. Once the dip is cool, stir in the candied pecans.

[/INST]

This Cranberry Sauce Cream Cheese Dip with Candied Pecans is a delicious and easy-to-prepare appetizer or snack. The combination of tangy cranberries, sweet cream cheese, and the crunchy candied pecans creates a delightful contrast of flavors and textures. The ingredients are readily available, making it a perfect choice for a gathering or a simple treat for yourself.

gt:
In a large shallow dish, combine 1 cup white wine, Worcestershire sauce and Dijon mustard.
Add flank, and turn to coat evenly.
Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours.
After meat has marinated, slice thinly across the grain, and return to marinade.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat.
Saute onion until soft and translucent.
Stir in mushrooms and garlic.
Pour in beef stock.
Simmer until sauce is reduced by 1/3, about 10 minutes.
Remove beef from marinade, and stir into skillet.
Pour in 1 cup wine, and season with Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.
Simmer for 10 minutes, or until the beef is fully cooked, then add tomatoes, and cook until heated through but still firm, about 5 minutes.
Place pasta into a large serving bowl, and top with sauce and grated Asiago cheese.
pred:
1. In a large skillet or pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the beef flank steak and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
2. In the same skillet or pot, add the onion and mushrooms. Cook until the onion is softened and the mushrooms are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, Italian-style seasoning, salt, and pepper to the skillet or pot. Stir to combine.
4. Add the beef stock, white wine, and tomatoes to the skillet or pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the beef is tender.
5. Return the beef to the skillet or pot and stir to combine.
6. Cook the linguine according to package instructions, then drain and add it to the skillet or pot with the beef and sauce. Stir to combine and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
You have successfully created a mouthwatering Straccetti dish using the provided ingredients. Enjoy your delicious meal!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Cook penne noodles until they're done to your liking.
When noodles are almost done, mix heavy whipping cream and pesto in a bowl until well blended together.
When noodles are done, drain them and then put them back into the pot.
Then pour creamy pesto sauce on noodles and stir together
Add as much shredded Parmesan cheese as you'd like into your own bowl of pasta and mix around.
Enjoy!
And as a side note, I have tried to use another brand of pesto for this recipe and it wasn't very good so if you want to be on the safe side, Buitoni brand is your best bet.
pred:
1. First, gather the necessary ingredients: 11 oz Buitoni pesto with basil, 1 lb box of penne noodles, and 1/2 pints heavy whipping cream.
2. Begin by cooking the pasta according to the package instructions. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the pesto sauce by combining the Buitoni pesto with basil, heavy whipping cream, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and return it to the pot. Add the pesto sauce and stir to combine.
4. If the sauce is too thick, you can add a bit more heavy whipping cream to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Serve the Easy Creamy Pesto Pasta immediately, garnished with fresh basil leaves if desired. Enjoy your delicious and creamy pasta dish!

gt:
Cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs and crushed bananas.
Combine well.
Sift together flour, soda and salt.
Add to creamed mixture.
Add vanilla.
Pour into greased and floured loaf pan.
Bake at 350 F, 60 minutes.
Keeps well, refrigerated.
Yield 1 Loaf.
My notes: I made muffins, so changed title to include that.
VERY moist and flavorful.
Sticky.
Big hit.
We added pecans.
In other bakings, I've added walnuts.
Both are fantastic.
Bake muffins 16-19 minutes.
Additional notes: I've made this using frozen and thawed bananas and it was perfect.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking soda, and vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the banana mixture, and mix until just combined.
6. Fold in the pecans or walnuts.
7. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups or a loaf pan.
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes for muffins or 45-50 minutes for a loaf, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean or a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins or loaf to cool in the pan for 5-10 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade banana bread or muffins!

gt:
Pre heat oven to 375F degrees.
Sprinkle salt and pepper all over roast, place fat side up in dutch oven or roaster; bake uncovered for 1 hour at 375f degrees.
Reduce heat to 325f degrees, sprinkle roast with desired seasoning; add 1/2 cup water or broth to roaster, cover and bake for 1 hour.
Remove the roaster from the oven; add 3/4 cup water or broth to roaster, add the potatoes carrots, onions and mushrooms, sprinkle them with salt and pepper; cover and roast for another hour or until veggies are tender.
Remove roast to platter and slice; surround with veggies, cover with foil and keep warm.
Add cornstarch to cold water, whisk and add to roaster, whisk while bringing to boil, simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened; ladel over roast and veggies; serve and enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the beef roast with salt and pepper.
3. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the beef roast and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the roast from the pot and set aside.
4. In the same pot, add the onions and carrots, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their juices, about 5 minutes.
6. Pour in the water or beef broth, and bring to a boil.
7. Add the beef roast back to the pot, and cook for about 1 hour or until the meat is tender and falling apart.
8. Add the cornstarch mixture to the pot, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
9. Cook for an additional 15-20 minutes or until the sauce has thickened and coated the meat.
10. Remove the roast from the pot and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all ingredients in order.
Use a tablespoon to make large scoops.
Flatten to 3/4 of an inch.
Bake until done (recipe doesn't say how long!).
Do not overbake.
These freeze well for a quick breakfast or snack.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, butter, brown sugar, honey, baking soda, and peanut butter. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the oatmeal, vanilla, powdered milk, golden raisins, dates, and chopped dried mixed fruit. Mix until well combined.
4. Chop the chocolate chips (if using) and add them to the mixture.
5. Gradually mix in the flour until a dough forms.
6. Roll the dough into small balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Breakfast Monster Cookies!

gt:
Make the fruit salad: Combine the fresh fruits in a bowl with the sugar, lemon juice, lemon verbena and lemon balm.
Cover and refrigerate.
Make the Vanilla Pudding Custard, about 1 hour before serving: In a microwave safe 2-quart bowl, whisk together the pudding mix, milk, brandy, vanilla extract and scraped vanilla bean and seeds.
Cook in the microwave on high heat for 6-8 minutes, whisking every two minutes, until thickened.
Make the Whipped Cream: Whip the cream until soft peaks form; add the vanilla extract and sugar.
Whip until stiff peaks form.
Assemble the parfaits: Place a mini shortcake in the bottom of each individual dessert or parfait glass (I used mini trifle glasses).
Ladle the warm vanilla pudding custard over the shortcakes.
Spoon the fruit salad over, and top with whipped cream.
Garnish tops of parfaits with fresh sprigs of lemon verbena, lemon balm, or fresh fruit.
pred:
To cook a delicious Fresh Fruit and Warm Vanilla Pudding Custard Parfaits dish, follow these steps:

1. In a medium saucepan, combine the 3 cups of sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon finely minced fresh lemon verbena leaf and fresh lemon balm leaves. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture reaches 234°F (112°C) on a candy thermometer.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.

3. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, heat the 14 cups of sugar, 1 tablespoon finely minced fresh lemon verbena leaf, and fresh lemon balm leaves over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture reaches 234°F (112°C).

4. Carefully pour the hot sugar mixture into the cooled syrup in the first saucepan, stirring constantly to avoid splatters.

5. Return the mixture to the heat and cook, stirring constantly, until it reaches 234°F (112°C) on a candy thermometer.

6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.

7. Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl, combine the 1 (8 ounce) package vanilla pudding mix, 3 12 cups whole milk, and 1 vanilla bean, split and scraped. Whisk until smooth.

8. Add the 3 tablespoons brandy (or cognac) and whisk until combined.

9. Pour the pudding mixture into the cooled syrup in the first saucepan. Stir to combine.

10. Return the mixture to the heat and cook, stirring constantly, until it reaches 234°F (112°C) on a candy thermometer.

11. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.

12. Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl, combine the 1

gt:
Mix all ingredients and allow to sit so the chia seeds gel up.
Top with fruits or nuts of your choosing.
I topped mine with chopped candied ginger.
* Sweeten to your taste, this recipe will make a dark chocolate taste.
Add more sweetener to cut the bitterness cocoa powder if you prefer it sweeter.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Chia Chocolate Pudding (Vegan), follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix the chia seeds with the agave nectar. Allow the mixture to sit for a few minutes to allow the chia seeds to absorb the liquid.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the chocolate almond milk, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract until smooth.
3. Combine the chia seed mixture and the chocolate almond milk mixture in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the mixture into a glass or a small dish, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. Serve the Chia Chocolate Pudding (Vegan) in a bowl, garnished with a drizzle of chocolate sauce, if desired.

This tasty Chia Chocolate Pudding (Vegan) dish is a delicious and nutritious dessert option that is both vegan and gluten-free. The chia seeds provide a healthy dose of fiber and omega-3 fatty acids, while the chocolate almond milk and cocoa powder add a rich, indulgent flavor. The combination of these ingredients results in a creamy, smooth, and satisfying dessert that is perfect for sharing with friends or family.

gt: Blend the basil, pecans, garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, salt, and pepper together in a food processor until the mixture becomes a slightly chunky paste.
pred:
1. First, gather all the ingredients, including 3 cups fresh basil leaves, 1 1/2 cups pecans, 4 cloves garlic, 1/2 cup shredded Parmesan cheese, 3/4 cup olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1 pinch ground black pepper to taste.

2. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

3. In a large bowl, combine the basil leaves, pecans, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

4. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

5. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nuts are fragrant and the basil is slightly wilted.

6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.

7. Once cooled, transfer the mixture to a food processor or blender. Add the olive oil in a steady stream while the food processor is running, until the desired consistency is reached.

8. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.

9. Use the pesto immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

10. To use the pesto, simply add a small amount to your favorite dishes, such as pasta, pizza, or salads, for a delicious and healthy touch.

gt:
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Heat the oil in a pan, and fry the sausage until browned.
Sprinkle on a generous amount of cracked black pepper.
The sausages are done when they are close to becoming burnt.
If you have the time, top them with a sunny-side-up egg.
The creaminess of the egg yolk is divine.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a bowl, mix the fish sausages with the pepper.
3. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
4. Add the fish sausages to the pan and cook until they are golden brown on all sides.
5. Remove the fish sausages from the pan and place them on a baking sheet.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and cook for about 10-12 minutes, or until the fish sausages are cooked through and the breading is crispy.
7. Serve the cooked fish sausages on a plate, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/SYS]

gt:
Place all ingredients together and mix well.
Coat Meat with mixture and rub well into meat.
Let sit for a couple of hours.
The longer it sits the more flavours go through the meat.
Cook meat as desired.
pred:
1. Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
2. Mix well to ensure even distribution of the spices and herbs.
3. Store the mixture in an airtight container or jar for up to 6 months.
4. To use, simply sprinkle a small amount of the dry rub onto the meat or poultry before grilling, roasting, or baking.
5. You can also use the dry rub to marinate the meat or poultry for at least 30 minutes before cooking.
6. Enjoy your delicious Dry Jerk Rub-infused dish!

gt:
Crush eight biscuits finely set aside.
Layer the other biscuits on the bottom and side of a square dish.
Mix condense milk and coffee creamer together.
Add lemon juice slowly, mix until the mixture thickens.
Pour over the layer of biscuits.
Sprinkle crushed biscuits on top, put into the refrigerator.
Serve the following day.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Velvet Coffee Creamer Tart, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Crush the coconut biscuits into fine crumbs using a rolling pin or a food processor.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed biscuits, condensed milk, lemon juice, and powdered coffee creamer. Mix well to ensure the biscuits are evenly coated with the mixture.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased and floured tart pan, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.
5. Bake the tart in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Pour the milk over the cooled tart, spreading it evenly to create a smooth, velvety texture.
8. Allow the tart to cool completely before serving.

This Velvet Coffee Creamer Tart is a delightful dessert that combines the rich flavors of coconut biscuits, condensed milk, and coffee creamer, creating a velvety texture that is both indulgent and satisfying.

gt:
1.
Heat the olive oil over medium heat and 1/2 teaspoon of curry powder in a skillet and add chicken.
Cook thoroughly it will probably take at least 5 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the chicken.
Just make sure the juices run clear.
2.
Chop celery and combine with grapes (either halved or whole) and nuts in a bowl.
Cube the cooked chicken and add to mixture.
3.
In a separate bowl, stir the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of curry powder and the lemon/lime juice into the Greek yogurt.
4.
Pour the yogurt mixture over the other ingredients and mix until throughly coated.
Serve plain or on whole wheat bread or pita.
Note: I refrained from the nuts after considering the amount of protein already in the Greek yogurt.
This chicken salad isnt a normal chicken salad, so you may have to play around with the recipe until the taste is satisfactory to you.
But it IS healthier!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken breast, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until it is cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside to cool.
5. In the same skillet, add the celery and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the grapes, walnuts or pecans, and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
7. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, lemon or lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked chicken to the skillet and mix everything together.
9. Serve the curry chicken salad on a bed of mixed greens, if desired.

This Healthy (Non-Mayo) Curry Chicken Salad is a delicious and nutritious meal option that combines the flavors of curry, grapes, and walnuts or pecans. The chicken provides a lean protein source, while the celery and grapes add a touch of natural sweetness and crunch. The yogurt and lemon or lime juice help to balance the flavors and create a refreshing taste. This salad can be enjoyed as a main course or as a side dish, making it a versatile and satisfying meal option.

gt:
Place frosting ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Mix on medium speed until well blended.
Ice cake when cake is completely cool.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, reduced-fat cream cheese, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the imitation maple flavor and Splenda granular to the mixture, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the powdered sugar, mixing until the desired consistency is reached.
5. If the frosting is too thick, add a bit more Splenda granular or powdered sugar to achieve the desired consistency.
6. Pour the frosting onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the frosting is set and slightly golden.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring the frosting to a piping bag or a container for storage.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
This step-by-step procedure outlines the process of making Splenda Cream Cheese Frosting using the provided ingredients. The frosting is made by combining the softened butter, reduced-fat cream cheese, vanilla extract, imitation maple flavor, Splenda granular, and powdered sugar. The frosting is then poured onto a baking sheet and baked in the oven until set and slightly golden. Once baked, the frosting is removed from the oven, allowed to cool for a few minutes, and then transferred to a piping bag or a container for storage.
<</SYS>>

gt:
In a medium nonstick skillet, sprinkle garlic salt and red pepper flakes over ground pork and saute until slightly pink.
Add slivered onion, ginger, and lemongrass; saute until onion is translucent.
Add fish sauce, chili sauce, sesame oil, and honey; saute for 1-2 minutes.
Add dry sherry and simmer for about 2-3 minutes.
Add roasted peanuts.
Serve in cabbage leaves (or lettuce leaves) as an appetizer, garnished with green onion tops and cilantro leaves.
Four appetizer servings.
Serve as a meal for by adding steamed rice, sugar snap peas, and sliced carrots.
Garnish with green onion tops, and cilantro leaves.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large bowl, mix the ground pork, garlic salt, red pepper flakes, onion, ginger, lemongrass, fish sauce, sweet chili sauce, sesame oil, honey, and dry sherry.
2. Cover the mixture and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
3. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Shape the pork mixture into small meatballs.
6. Place the meatballs on the prepared baking sheet, and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
7. While the meatballs are baking, prepare the cabbage and green onion tops.
8. In a large bowl, toss the cabbage with a little bit of oil, salt, and pepper.
9. In a small bowl, mix the green onion tops with a little bit of oil, salt, and pepper.
10. Once the meatballs are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
11. Serve the meatballs on a bed of cabbage, garnished with the green onion tops and cilantro leaves.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Cook spaghetti according to package directions and drain.
In a large bowl, mix cooked spaghetti, drained tuna, mushrooms, pepper, olives, onion, artichoke hearts and ground pepper, and 1 1/2 cups of cheese.
Stir together mushroom soup, chicken broth and wine or sherry; pour over spaghetti mixture and stir to blend evenly.
Pour mixture into lightly greased 13-inch x 9-inch baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining 1 cup of cheese over the top.
Bake at 350 degrees F until bubbly and lightly browned, about 45 minutes.
Serve immediately with salad and warm crusty slices garlic bread.
pred:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the onions, mushrooms, bell peppers, and olives. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
3. Add the drained canned tuna, black pepper, and cooked spaghetti to the skillet. Stir to combine.
4. In a small bowl, mix the cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, and white wine or dry sherry. Pour the mixture over the tuna and vegetable mixture.
5. Cook the mixture over low heat until it is heated through and the cheese is melted.
6. Serve the Tuna Tetrazzini immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
mix oil, vinegar, salt and pepper together.
add grapes, pear and red onion and let marinade while chopping chicken.
combine cooked and cooled chicken in chunks with lettuce and pour grape mixture on top.
pred:
1. Wash and clean the chicken breasts thoroughly.
2. Cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces.
3. Wash and cut the grapes in half.
4. Wash and cut the red onions into thin slices.
5. Wash and cut the pear into cubes.
6. Wash and cut the lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
7. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, grapes, red onions, pear, and lettuce.
8. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, sugar-free rice wine, salt, and pepper.
9. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
10. Serve the Healthy Chicken Salad immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cover baking sheet with foil; spray with cooking spray.
Combine first 5 ingredients in pie plate.
Pour dressing into separate pie plate.
Dip chicken in dressing, then in coating mixture, turning to evenly coat both sides of each breast with each.
Place on prepared baking sheet.
Bake 25 min.
or until chicken is done (165 degrees F).
About 5 min.
before chicken is done, add broccoli to saucepan of boiling water; cook 4 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Drain broccoli.
Serve with chicken.
pred:
To cook a delightful Baked Chimichurri Chicken with Broccoli dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a small bowl, mix the SHAKE 'N BAKE Chicken Coating Mix with 1/4 cup of water. Set aside.

3. In a large bowl, combine the chopped fresh cilantro, parsley, minced garlic, lime zest, and KRAFT Zesty Lime Vinaigrette Dressing. Mix well.

4. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then coat them evenly with the cilantro-parsley mixture.

5. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

6. Bake the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

7. While the chicken is baking, steam the broccoli florets until they are tender but still crisp.

8. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.

9. To assemble the dish, place the cooked chicken breasts on a serving platter.

10. Pour the remaining vinaigrette mixture over the chicken, and garnish with additional chopped cilantro and parsley.

This delicious Baked Chimichurri Chicken with Broccoli dish is a perfect combination of flavors and textures, with the tender chicken, crisp broccoli, and tangy vinaigrette creating a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Fry bacon until crisp, reserving 4 tablespoons of grease.
Saute potatoes and onions in the reserved bacon grease in a Dutch oven for about 15 minutes.
Add butter, corn, cream, seasoning and Tabasco.
Crumble bacon and add to the chowder.
Cook on low heat until potatoes are tender, approximately 20-30 minutes.
Add crawfish tails and simmer for 15 minutes more minutes (since the tails are pre-cooked, you dont want them to get too tough).
If you dont have crawfish available, you can always use shrimp instead.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the diced onions and bacon over medium heat until the onions are translucent and the bacon is crispy.
3. Add the precooked crawfish tails and cook for a few minutes until they are heated through.
4. Add the diced potatoes, corn, and half-and-half to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
5. Season the chowder with Tony Chacheres or your favorite Cajun seasoning, and add the Tabasco sauce if desired.
6. Serve the Crawfish and Corn Chowder hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Crawfish and Corn Chowder!

gt:
Place eggplant in a colander; sprinkle with 3/4 teaspoon salt.
Toss gently to coat.
Cover and let stand 30 minutes.
Rinse eggplant with cold water, and drain well.Prepare grill.Place eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper on grill rack coated with cooking spray.
Grill 10 minutes, turning once.
Add tomatoes and onions; cook 5 minutes, turning often.
Remove the vegetables from grill; cut all into 1-inch pieces except tomato.
Cut tomato halves in half lengthwise.Combine 1/4 teaspoon salt, oil, rind, and basil in a large bowl.
Add vegetable mixture, pasta, and cheese; toss well.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant, zucchini, and red bell pepper with the salt. Allow the vegetables to sit for 15-20 minutes to release excess water and allow the salt to draw out moisture.
3. Spray the vegetables with cooking spray and place them on the grill or grill pan. Cook for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
4. While the vegetables are cooking, prepare the pasta according to the package instructions.
5. In a large bowl, combine the sliced green onions, olive oil, lemon rind, and fresh basil.
6. When the vegetables are cooked, remove them from the grill or grill pan and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Add the cooked vegetables to the bowl with the green onion mixture and toss to combine.
8. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, then drain and add it to the vegetable mixture.
9. Add the grated Parmesan cheese to the mixture and toss to combine.
10. Serve the Grilled Italian Vegetables with Pasta immediately, as it is a delicious and healthy meal option.

gt:
Place chicken pieces in crock pot, top with sauce and sprinkle with cheese.
Cover and cook on high 4-6 hours or on low 8-10 hours.
Remove chicken to a serving dish, for a thicker sauce stir in tomato paste and spoon over pasta.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, ragu pasta sauce, and 1 cup of water. Mix well, then cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the grated parmesan cheese and tomato paste (if using).
4. After the chicken has marinated, remove it from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.
5. Place the chicken in a large, oven-safe casserole dish or a slow cooker. Pour the marinated chicken mixture over the chicken.
6. Sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese mixture evenly over the chicken and sauce.
7. Cover the casserole dish or slow cooker with a lid or aluminum foil.
8. Cook the chicken and sauce in the preheated oven for 1-1.5 hours, or in a slow cooker on low for 6-8 hours.
9. Once the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and hot, remove the casserole dish or slow cooker from the oven or slow cooker and let it rest for a few minutes.
10. Serve the Busy Day Italian Crock Pot over your favorite pasta. Enjoy!

gt:
Rinse and drain chicken wings.
Combine remaining ingredients to make glaze.
Add chicken wings and stir gently to coat.
Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and arrange wings on pan.
Bake for 25 minutes, turn wings and bake for another 25 minutes until golden brown.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chicken wings, ketchup, brown sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and minced garlic.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Remove the chicken wings from the marinade and shake off any excess marinade.
6. Place the chicken wings on the prepared baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the glaze is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the chicken wings from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet & Sour Glaze Chicken Wings!

gt:
Place quinoa in a fine-mesh strainer and run under cold running water.
Rinse well.
Add quinoa and water to a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cover.
Cook for 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Turn on heat and set aside.
Meanwhile, prepare vinaigrette.
In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice, mustard, fig jam, and honey.
Slowly, while continuing to whisk, add olive oil until vinaigrette is emulsified.
Add arugula, quinoa, and cherries to bowl.
Gently toss and serve immediately.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
To prepare the Wild Arugula-Quinoa Salad With Cherries, follow these steps:
1. Rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh strainer and drain well.
2. In a medium saucepan, bring the quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the quinoa rest, covered, for about 5 minutes.
4. Fluff the cooked quinoa with a fork.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherries, baby arugula, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, fig jam, honey, and extra-virgin olive oil.
6. Toss the salad gently to combine the ingredients.
7. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Wild Arugula-Quinoa Salad With Cherries immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/SYS]

[/INST]

gt:
Break the stick kanten into 2-3 portions and soak in water for 10-15 minutes.
Squeeze out the water and shred finely.
Stir into 300 ml of boiling water and dissolve.
You can get rid of lumps if you pass it through a strainer.
Warm the milk until it's nearly boiling, and dissolve the sugar.
Add Step 2 and a generous amount of almond essence.
Mix well.
Transfer into a large container and set aside to cool.
Chill and harden in the fridge.
Mix all of the ingredients for the syrup.
When the jello (from Step 3) is chilled and hardened, pour the syrup over the jelly.
Cut into cubes, top with fruit and serve.
Here's the stick kanten.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, mix the Kanten, water, and milk until well combined.
2. Add the sugar and almond essence, and mix until the sugar is fully dissolved.
3. Pour the mixture into a saucepan and heat it over medium heat, stirring continuously.
4. Once the mixture reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Pour the mixture through a sieve to remove any lumps.
7. Place the saucepan back on the heat and add the fruits for decoration.
8. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the fruits are tender and the sauce has thickened.
9. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Pour the sauce into a serving dish and let it cool completely.

[/INST]

1. To cook the Simple Almond Tofu, follow these steps:
- In a large bowl, mix the tofu with a pinch of salt and pepper.
- Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
- Add the tofu mixture to the pan and cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is golden brown and slightly crispy.
- Remove the tofu from the pan and let it cool for a few minutes.
- Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces.

[/INST]

1. To prepare the fruit in syrup, follow these steps:
- In a saucepan, combine the water and sugar.
- Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
- Add the fruits for decoration and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the fruits are tender and the syrup has thickened.
- Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
- Serve the fruit in syrup alongside the Simple Almond Tofu.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Toss shrimp with kosher salt and 3/4 teaspoon coarsely ground pepper.
Heat butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until foam subsides, then saute shrimp, turning, until pink and just cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes.
Reduce heat and add tequila, then increase heat to medium-high.
Tilt skillet over gas burner to ignite tequila (or ignite with a long match; use caution, as flames may shoot up high).
Cook, shaking skillet gently once or twice, until flames subside.
Remove from heat and stir in crema.
Serve sprinkled with scallion.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the shrimp with the kosher salt, ensuring they are evenly coated.
3. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the tequila and crema or sour cream. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 2 to 3 minutes.
6. Add the shrimp back to the skillet and toss to coat them with the sauce.
7. Serve the Tequila Shrimp over a bed of rice, garnished with the sliced scallion.

[/INST]

gt:
Chop the chicken into bite-sized pieces, then season with sake and salt (not included in ingredients).
Roughly chop the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Soak the burdock and lotus root in vinegar water.
Slice the konnyaku into 5-6 mm thick slabs.
In the center of each slab, cut a slit lengthwise about 1/4 the konnyaku length and thread the ends through the slit to make "rein knots."
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan, then saute the chicken.
Transfer to a plate once they are evenly browned.
Add more oil, then saute the rest of the ingredients, then transfer to a separate dish.
Wipe the pan with a paper towel to clean, then return the sauteed vegetables to the pan.
Add the dashi stock and seasonings, bring to a boil, reduce to low heat, then cover with a lid.
Frequently toss the ingredients in the pan while stewing to cook evenly.
When the ingredients become tender, remove the lid, set over high heat, then saute until the ingredients are glazed.
It's ready to serve once the liquid boils out.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken thighs, carrot, shiitake mushrooms, Konnyaku, and dashi stock.
3. Cover the bowl and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until it is browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside.
8. Add the bamboo shoot, ginger, and thinly sliced onions to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 3-5 minutes.
9. Add the soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
10. Add the burdock root and lotus root to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
11. Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to combine with the vegetables.
12. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
13. Serve the stewed chicken with root vegetables over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix cocoa, sugar, and pecans.
Stir in egg whites and vanilla, and mix until blended, but do not whip.
Chill for half an hour.
Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet lined with parchment.
Bake at 350 for 14-16 minutes.
Remove to rack to cool.
Pour a glass of milk and eat half of them yourself.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the confectioners' sugar, cocoa powder, and salt until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until they form soft peaks.
4. Gently fold the egg whites into the cocoa mixture until well combined.
5. Fold in the chopped pecans.
6. Drop the batter by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Mix first 5 ingredients in large bowl.
Whisk eggs, milk and oil until well blended.
Add to flour mixture; stir just unti moistened.
(Batter will be lumpy.)
Stir in apples.
Spoon into 12 muffin cups sprayed with cooking spray.
Mix remaining ingredients; spoon over batter.
Press lightly into batter.
Bake 20 to 25 min.
or until golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, brown sugar blend, salt, and baking powder.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, skim milk, canola oil, and granulated sugar replacement.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the grated Granny Smith apple and quick-cooking oats.
6. Fold in the peanut butter until just combined.
7. Scoop the batter into muffin cups, filling them about 3/4 full.
8. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes in the pan, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Apple Crumble Muffins!

gt:
Wash and pad dry chicken
Cut tenderloins in half and pound with mallet between to pieces of plastic wrap until 1/4 in thick
Preheat large saute pan with the oil
Start cooking pasta in pot of boiling water.
Dredge chicken in flour and seared in batches in preheated pan removing chicken from pan after searing both sides
To make sauce mix can of broccoli cheese sauce, stock, parmessan, broccoli and bring to a simmer.
Add salt and pepper chicken and finish with butter and fresh parsley.
You can either mix with cooked pasta or pour it over a bed of cook linguini
Garnishing tips: you can add chopped scallions or more fresh parsley for presentation.
Drissle with evoo for a fresher taste or just enjoy with parmessan cheese or crushed red pepper flakes for a little kick
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken tenderloins, broccoli, and chicken stock or water. Season the mixture with salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
4. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually add the chicken stock or water, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
6. Add the Parmesan cheese, stirring until melted and smooth.
7. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
8. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Add the cooked linguini to the skillet and toss to combine.
10. Season the pasta with salt and pepper.
11. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large serving bowl.
12. Pour the chicken and broccoli sauce over the pasta.
13. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Chicken with broccoli and cheese linguini.

gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, 1 cup white flour, brown sugar, baking powder and salt.
Using a pastry blender, or two knives scissors-fashion, cut butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Add nuts or wheat berries.
Stir in the maple syrup and egg and just enough milk so that dough leaves side of bowl and forms a ball.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; gently roll in flour to coat.
Knead lightly; if dough is very soft, roll in flour again.
Transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
Pat or roll into an 8-inch disk; cut into 8 wedges, but do not separate.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Immediately remove from baking sheet, and carefully separate.
Serve warm.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, white flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Cut the chilled butter into small pieces and add it to the flour mixture. Use a pastry cutter or your hands to mix the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the chopped toasted walnuts or cooked wheat berries, and mix until the nuts or berries are evenly distributed throughout the mixture.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and milk together.
6. Pour the egg-milk mixture into the flour mixture, and stir until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more milk, a tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
7. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently until it becomes smooth and elastic.
8. Pat the dough into a 1-inch thick disk, and cut it into 8 equal pieces.
9. Place the scones on a greased baking sheet, and brush the tops with the maple syrup.
10. Bake the scones in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
11. Remove the scones from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Maple Scones dish!

gt:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add a dash of salt and the pasta and cook until al dente (according to package instructions for al dente).
Then drain it and place pasta in a large serving bowl.
In a small pot over medium low heat, combine a splash of water, chopped ginger, garlic, tamari/soy sauce, honey, tomato paste, vinegar, sesame oil and hot sauce.
Whisk until smooth and heated.
Pour sauce over noodles and keep warm.
Get all of the remaining ingredients ready for a quick stir-fry.
In an over-sized skillet over medium heat, saute the mushrooms in the butter.
Once most of the water has cooked out of the mushrooms, remove them from the pan leaving the remaining juices behind.
Add the oil and heat over high heat.
Add the chicken cubes and stir-fry until browned, about 3 minutes.
Add the coleslaw mix, carrots and bell pepper and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Then add the scallions and continue to saute and toss for 1 minute.
Add the mushrooms back in, stir and empty the skillet contents over the noodles.
Top with sesame seeds.
Enjoy!
pred:
To prepare a delicious Korean-Style Chicken Noodle Bowls dish, follow these steps:

1. Cook the ramen noodles according to the package instructions, usually by boiling them in a pot of water for a few minutes.

2. While the noodles are cooking, chop the ginger, garlic, and red pepper.

3. In a large skillet or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.

4. Add the chopped ginger, garlic, and red pepper to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.

5. Add the sliced carrots to the skillet and cook until they are tender.

6. In a small bowl, whisk together the tamari, honey, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil.

7. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until it is fully cooked through.

8. Add the cooked noodles to the skillet and toss everything together.

9. If desired, add more Sriracha hot sauce to taste.

10. Serve the dish in a bowl, garnished with toasted sesame seeds.

This Korean-Style Chicken Noodle Bowls dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of the ramen noodles, chicken, vegetables, and a touch of spiciness from the Sriracha hot sauce.

gt:
In a large picture add all of your ingredients and give it a mix.
Add some ice cubes if you like.
Place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before drinking.
Discard the water after 24 hours if you dont drink it all.
Recipe slightly modified from Skinny Mommy.
pred:
1. Fill a large pitcher or container with 1/2 gallons of purified water.
2. Slice the lemons, limes, and grapefruits into quarters and add them to the pitcher.
3. Slice the cucumber and add it to the pitcher.
4. Peel and slice the fresh ginger and add it to the pitcher.
5. Remove the leaves from the peppermint plant and add them to the pitcher.
6. Stir the ingredients together to ensure they are evenly distributed.
7. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 30 minutes before drinking.

This Detox Water recipe is packed with essential vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that can help support a healthy lifestyle. The lemons, limes, and grapefruits provide a boost of vitamin C, which is crucial for a strong immune system and collagen production. The cucumber is rich in vitamins A and K, as well as potassium, which can help regulate blood pressure and support overall health. The ginger has anti-inflammatory properties and can aid in digestion. Finally, the peppermint leaves provide a refreshing and invigorating sensation, which can help improve mood and mental clarity.

By incorporating this Detox Water recipe into your daily routine, you can enjoy the benefits of these nutrient-rich ingredients while also staying hydrated and promoting overall wellness.

gt:
Heat the butter and oil in a deep frying pan and add the beef strips and onions
Lightly fry off to soften but don't colour the onions, around 2 minutes.
Add the cornstarch and mix into the meat juices
Add the mushrooms and fry a further 3 minutes
In a jug, mix together the stock, sour cream, mustard, tomato puree, Worcestershire, paprika and cayenne
Pour into the pan and bring to the boil then let simmer for 5 minutes
Stir in the parsley, adjust the seasonings to taste and serve over mashed potato, steamed greens, pasta or rice
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Vickys Beef Stroganoff, Gluten, Dairy, Egg & Soy-Free, follow these steps:
1. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. Add 1 tbsp sunflower spread/butter and cook until melted and fragrant.
3. Add 450 grams sliced beef and cook until browned on all sides.
4. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside.
5. In the same pan, add 1 large onion and cook until softened.
6. Add 1 tbsp cornstarch and cook until the onion is caramelized.
7. Add 300 grams button mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid.
8. Add 200 ml Vickys Sour Cream recipe or coconut cream mixed with a tbsp lemon juice, 100 ml beef or mushroom stock, and stir to combine.
9. Add 1 tbsp mustard powder, 1 tbsp tomato puree/paste, 1/2 tbsp Vickys GF Worcestershire Sauce recipe, and 1 tsp sweet paprika.
10. Stir to combine and cook until the sauce thickens slightly.
11. Add 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper and 1 tbsp chopped parsley.
12. Return the cooked beef to the pan and stir to combine.
13. Cook for a few minutes until the beef is heated through.
14. Serve the Vickys Beef Stroganoff over cooked noodles or rice.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Chop apple and one onion into large chunks.
Stuff into cavity of chicken along with the garlic (peeled).
Save any apple chunks that won't fit.
Spray 9x13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Place chicken back-up into baking dish.
Baste chicken liberally with olive oil, then sprinkle with dried seasoning of your choice.
Chop the carrots into 1-1.5" pieces.
Chop the potatoes and remaining onion into similar-sized pieces and place into baking dish around the chicken.
Add any leftover apple.
Pour half of the can of chicken broth over vegetables in the dish.
Season vegetables with sea salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
Bake in preheated oven for 60-80 minutes, or 20 minutes per pound of chicken.
Halfway through baking, add the remaining half can of chicken broth to the pan.
Cool for 5 minutes, covered with aluminum foil, before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Remove the chickens from their packaging and rinse them under cold water. Pat them dry with paper towels.
3. In a large bowl, mix the chicken broth, poultry seasoning, salt, and pepper.
4. Place the chickens in a large roasting pan or a large baking dish.
5. Using a nonstick cooking spray, lightly coat the chickens with oil.
6. Place the potatoes, carrots, onions, and apple around the chickens in the pan.
7. Roast the chickens in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chickens from the oven and let them rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.
9. While the chickens are resting, use a fork to pull the vegetables from the pan and place them on a serving platter.
10. Carve the chickens into serving pieces and serve alongside the vegetables.

Enjoy your delicious Whole Roasted Chicken with a side of vegetables!

gt:
Put buttermilk and cheese in a large pan and cook over low heat the cheese has melted.
Stir, don't worry if mixture appears curdled.
Cool to room temperature.
In a large bowl, disolve sugar and yeast in warm water.
Add the buttermilk mixture, egg, salt and 1 1/2 cups flour.
Beat until smooth, then stir in remaining flour until it forms a soft dough.
Turn onto a floured boad, knead for 8 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Please in a greased bowl, turn once to grease top.
Cover and let rise for an hour in a warm place until it has doubled in size.
Punch down the dough on floured board and divide the dough in half and roll each peice into an 9 x 6 inch rectangle.
Spray one half of the dough with cooking spray.
Top with the cheddar and red pepper flakes then top with the remaining peice of dough.
Cut the prepared dough into 6 (1 1/2 inch strips)
Cut each strip in half and twist.
Place about 1 inch apart on greased and foiled cookie sheet and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.
Bake at 375 degrees for 15 - 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
Put on wire rack to cool, serve warm.
Refrigerate any leftovers.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the buttermilk, sugar, and yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5-10 minutes, or until the yeast is foamy.
3. Add the warm water, egg, salt, and flour to the bowl, and mix until a dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick.
8. Spread the shredded cheese evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
9. Roll the dough up like a jelly roll, starting with a long side, and then seal the edges by pressing them together.
10. Place the rolled dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the dough from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into 12 equal pieces.
13. Serve the Cheesy Bread Twists warm.

Enjoy your delicious Cheesy Bread Twists!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Brown turkey in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drain fat.
Place halved zucchini slices in a baking dish.
Pour the ground turkey, spaghetti sauce, and corn on top.
Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in preheated oven until zucchini are tender, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Uncover, and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake, uncovered, about 5 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground turkey, 3 cups of spaghetti sauce, and the drained corn. Season with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer. Mix well to combine.
3. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
4. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the shredded Mexican cheese blend, and a pinch of salt.
5. Spread half of the meat mixture evenly in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
6. Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the meat mixture.
7. Top with the remaining meat mixture.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Easy, Cheesy Zucchini Bake!

gt:
Pour out half of the beer, cut open the top of the beer can.
pour all of the ingredients into the beer.
set whole chicken on top of the beer can.
get your smoker set at 300-350 deg.
set chicken and beer can on smoker and smoke for 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
I always smoke two and make the 2nd one into chicken salad.
Hint: They make a stand that you can out your can in and then put your chicken over the stand.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the beer, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, black pepper, and cajun seasoning.
3. Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken evenly with the marinade.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
5. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
6. Spread the chicken pieces out on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
7. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
9. Serve the Beer Butt Chicken with your choice of side dishes, such as rice, potatoes, or a salad.

Enjoy your delicious Beer Butt Chicken dish!

gt:
In a small saucepan, combine vinegar, water, onion and garlic; simmer until onion is tender (about 5 minutes).
Add in sugar and simmer until dissolved.
Cool to room temperature.
Stir in mayonnaise, sour cream, salt and pepper.
Refrigerate dressing for 2 hours or more.
Delicious!
pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, water, and minced onions.
2. Add the minced garlic and continue to whisk until the garlic is fragrant and the mixture is smooth.
3. Slowly drizzle in the sugar, whisking continuously to ensure the sugar is fully incorporated.
4. Add the mayonnaise to the bowl, and whisk until the dressing is smooth and creamy.
5. Gradually add the sour cream, continuing to whisk until the desired consistency is reached.
6. Season the dressing with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
7. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dressing for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
8. Serve the Creamy Garlic Dressing over your favorite salad or as a dip for vegetables.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Creamy Garlic Dressing!

gt:
Heat oven to 350F Line a 13x9x2 inch baking pan with foil, grease foil.
Set aside.
Melt butter and chocolate in a large saucepan over LOW heat till smooth.
Do NOT COOK, you are only melting the chocolate and butter together, this is very very important.
Remove from heat.
Stir in eggs, granulated sugar, and vanilla.
Stir in flour and the 3/4 cup cocoa powder.
Spread batter in prepared pan.
Bake for 22 to 25 minutes or till a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack.
Lift brownies from pan with foil.
Cut into bars, wiping knife between cuts.
Roll in powdered sugar or, in a mixture of equal parts powdered sugar and cocoa powder.
I usually serve them plain, and I think they are just fine, but my husband like them rolled in the cocoa sugar the best.
Makes 64.
To store: Place in layers separated by waxed paper in an airtight container; cover.
Store at room temperature up to 3 days or freeze up to 3 months.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the vanilla extract, and mix until just combined.
4. Spread the dough evenly onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the dough comes out clean.
5. Allow the brownies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
6. Once the brownies are completely cooled, use a sharp knife or a cookie cutter to cut them into finger-sized pieces.
7. Dust the cut edges with powdered sugar, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Brownie Fingers!

gt:
Combine the first five ingredients; cover and let stand for 15 mins to and hour; then drain.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Combine the chili garlic sauce and 1 1/2 teaspoons of sugar; stir well.
Place pork on the rack of a small roasting pan or broiling pan coated with cooking spray.
Spread 2 tablespoons of the chili garlic mixture evenly over pork; sprinkle the pork with 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Bake at 400F for 20 minutes or until a thermometer registers at 155F (slightly pink) Cool; cover, and refrigerate.
Combine mayo and the remaining chili garlic mixture; cover and refrigerate.
Cut each baguette horizontally.
Cutting into but not completely through.
Spread mayo garlic mixture evenly on cut sides.
Thinly slice the pork; divide evenly between baguettes.
Top evenly with carrot mixture, arrange 8 cucumber slices and 8 cilantro sprigs on each baguette.
Top evenly with the green onions and jalapeno.
Press gently to close; Cut each baguette in to four servings.
pred:

1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded carrot, daikon radish, and sugar.

4. Spray the pork with cooking spray and season with salt and pepper.

8. In a small bowl, mix the chili-garlic sauce and sugar.
9. Spread the pork slices on the bottom half of the baguettes.

11. Add the sliced cucumber, fresh cilantro stems, and green onions to the top half of the baguettes.

gt:
Combine all ingredients except crushed chips.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Top with crushed chips just before serving.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cooked long-grain white rice, black beans, frozen corn, red pepper, green onions, and lightly crushed tortilla chips.

The lightly crushed tortilla chips add a crunchy texture to the dish, while the green onions provide a pop of freshness. gt:
First, prepare the vinaigrette by whisking together the oil, honey, lemon juice and zest, salt and pepper.
Gently stir in the fresh mint; set viniagrette aside while preparing other ingredients.
Cut the peach in half and remove the pit, then thinly slice.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F; grease bottom of loaf pan.
Mix all ingredients, except topping, in a large bowl.
Pour into loaf pan.
Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top.
Bake 55-65 minutes, until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean cool 10 minutes; remove to wire rack to cool completely, 1 hour.
pred:

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and ground cardamom.
3. Add the chopped unpeeled pears, vegetable oil, and milk to the bowl.
4. Whisk the eggs and add them to the mixture.
5. Gradually combine the wet and dry ingredients, ensuring that the batter is smooth and free of lumps.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and moist Pear Cardamom Bread that everyone will enjoy.

gt:
Spread cream cheese spread on crackers.
Top with a dollop of jelly and sprinkle with chopped almonds.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread, hot pepper jelly, and chopped PLANTERS FLAVOR GROVE Skinless Almonds.
3. Place the RITZ Crackers on a baking sheet, and spoon the cream cheese mixture evenly over the crackers.
