gt:
For the filling, place husks in a large bowl.
Add water to cover, and set aside to soften.
In a large saucepan, combine the tomatillos, jalapeno peppers and chicken broth.
Bring to a boil, and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a blender, and add salt, garlic, onion and cumin.
Blend until pureed.
Return the mixture to the pot, and place over medium heat.
Add the lard, cook for 5 to 7 minutes until fully melted, then remove from heat and set aside.
For the masa, combine the masa mix with the melted lard, baking powder, salt and chicken broth in a large bowl.
Knead dough until soft, 10 to 20 minutes.
To finish and steam: Fill the bottom of a steamer with about 2 inches of water.
Line the bottom of the insert with a layer of corn husks.
In a corn husk, place about a handful of masa.
Spread with 3 tablespoons of the sauce and some shredded chicken.
Fold in the sides of each husk, and fold the pointed side up, leaving one end open.
Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Stand the filled husks in the steamer with the open ends up.
Cover the tops with a layer of additional corn husks, and cover the pot tightly with foil and a lid.
Steam until the tamales release easily from the husks, 45 minutes to 1 hour; add water to the bottom of the pan as necessary so it doesnt run dry, and be careful not to overcook.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, tomatillos, jalapeno peppers, garlic, onion, and cumin seeds. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, Maseca tamale mix, lard, baking powder, salt, and 1 cup of the chicken broth. Mix well.
4. Fill the corn husks with the chicken and tamale mixture, leaving a small opening at one end for steam to escape.
5. Place the filled husks on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until the tamales are cooked through and the husks are slightly crispy.
6. Serve the Tamales Verdes hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

gt:
Mix dressing and mayo in medium bowl.
Add chicken; stir to evenly coat.
Refrigerate 20 min.
to marinate.
Heat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade.
Thread chicken and onions alternately onto 8 skewers.
Grill 8 to 10 min.
or until chicken is done, turning occasionally.
Meanwhile, place lemon, cut sides down, on grill grate next to kabobs; grill until heated through.
Place kabobs on plate.
Squeeze lemon halves over kabobs.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the KRAFT Greek Vinaigrette Dressing, KRAFT Real Mayo Mayonnaise, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt and pepper to taste.
3. Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. While the chicken is marinating, prepare the skewers by threading the chicken pieces and red onion slices onto the skewers, alternating between chicken and onion.
5. Once the chicken is marinated, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes.
6. Preheat your grill or grill pan.
7. Grill the kabobs for about 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the onions are tender.
8. Serve the Grilled Greek Chicken Kabobs warm, with the remaining marinade on the side for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Greek Chicken Kabobs!

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine all ingredients except toffee bits in large bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until well mixed.
Stir in toffee bits.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls.
Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 8- 11 minutes or until edges are very lightly browned.
Sprinkle warm cookies with sugar, if desired.
Variation:
Chocolate Chip Sugar Cookies: Substitute 1 cup mini real semi-sweet chocolate chips for toffee bits.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and beat until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and vanilla.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a dough forms.
6. Fold in the almond toffee bits.
7. If desired, sprinkle a bit of sugar on top of the dough before baking.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Almond Brickle Sugar Cookies!

gt:
butter bread all side then put cheddar cheese on bread
layer peach then chesse again then bread
grill till cheese melt and cut into shape
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread a layer of butter on one side of each slice of bread.
3. Place the peach slices on the buttered side of one slice of bread, and the cheddar slices on the buttered side of the other slice of bread.
4. Place the two slices of bread with the peach and cheddar slices between them in the oven.
5. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into halves or quarters.
7. Serve the Peach And Cheese Sandwich warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
dredge toast in beaten egg and milk.
fry on a griddle until browned on both sides.
meanwhile, fry bacon.
make a patty out of sausage and fry as well
lay both pieces of browned toast on an ovenproof plate.
place a slice of each cheese on each piece of toast.
place in oven to melt cheese.
layer sausage then turkey.
add a slice of cranberry sauce.
then bacon and then ham.
place other toast on top.
place back in oven for a couple minutes to reheat.
garnish with cinnamon and powdered sugar.
if desired serve with strawberry jam on the side.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the beaten egg and milk.
3. Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter.
4. Place the buttered side of the bread down on a clean surface.
5. Add a layer of the whisked egg mixture to one slice of bread, followed by a layer of American cheese, Swiss cheese, breakfast sausage, bacon, deli smoked turkey, deli honey ham, and jellied cranberry sauce.
6. Top the layered bread with the remaining slice of bread, buttered side up.
7. Place the sandwich in a baking dish and bake for 10-15 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and the filling is hot and melted.
8. Remove the sandwich from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. While the sandwich is cooling, prepare the garnish by mixing the powdered sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
10. Once the sandwich is cool enough to handle, cut it into halves or quarters.
11. Drizzle the garnish mixture over the top of the sandwich and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Monte Cristo style breakfast sandwich!

gt:
Use a medium saucepan to boil noodles just until they are done, 3 to 5 minutes; stir to prevent sticking.
Drain noodles and rinse with cold water to cool down; return to pot and toss with sesame oil.
and set aside.
In a shallow bowl, combine chicken, ginger, 1 teaspoon rice wine, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper.
In a separate small bowl, combine 1 tablespoon rice wine and 1 tablespoon soy sauce; set aside.
Heat a wok over high heat, add 1 tablespoon oil and stir fry pepper flakes for 10 seconds; add chicken and let sear 1 minute, then stir fry 2 to 3 minutes until done, then place in a bowl.
Add cabbage and mushrooms to wok and stir fry 1 minute to wilt; add to bowl with chicken.
Add 1 tablespoon oil to wok and stir fry noodles for 30 seconds; stir in soy sauce/wine mixture.
Return chicken and vegetables to wok, along with green onions; season with 3/4 teaspoon salt, stir to heat through.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large saucepan or wok, heat the peanut oil or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
2. In the same pan, add the toasted sesame oil and cook until fragrant. Add the ginger, garlic, and mushrooms, and cook until the mushrooms are tender and the aroma is released.
3. Add the chicken back to the pan, along with the rice wine or dry sherry, cornstarch, soy sauce, kosher salt, and white pepper. Stir to combine.
4. Add the noodles to the pan and stir to combine. Cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the noodles are heated through and the sauce is well-coated.
5. Serve the Longevity Noodles With Chicken, Ginger, and Mushrooms immediately. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Trim the yellow colored fat from the chicken thigh, then chop into several pieces across the fiber.
Season with salt and pepper, then fry both sides to a golden crisp on medium heat.
Add the sake, cover with a lid, then reduce heat to steam cook until thoroughly cooked through.
Remove any excess fat from the pan.
Remove the chicken from Step 2, add the ingredients and blend with the tasty bits and juices left in the pan, then lightly simmer while stirring.
Pour the sauce from Step 3 onto the cut pieces of chicken thigh, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper on both sides.
3. In a small bowl, mix the Sake, heavy cream, and whole grain mustard.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and then place the chicken fillets in the pan. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
5. Remove the chicken from the pan and place it on a plate.
6. Pour the cream mixture over the chicken, and let it cook for a few more minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Serve the Chicken Sauteed with Cream and Mustard over a bed of rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
In large pan, bring rhubarb and water to boil.
Drain and reserve liquid.
Combine sugar, gelatin and boiling water in a large bowl.
Once sugar and gelatin are all dissolved add pineapple and lemon juices, mix well.
Stir in rhubarb juice and refrigerate.
Add ginger ale just before serving.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the 8 cups of fresh or frozen chopped rhubarb, 8 cups of water, and 2 tablespoons of strawberry gelatin. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rhubarb is tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.

2. While the rhubarb mixture is cooking, prepare the pineapple juice by combining 2 cups of pineapple juice with 14 cups of water in a separate pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pineapple juice has been reduced by half.

3. In a large bowl, combine the 2 cups of lemon juice with 6 cups of ginger ale. Stir the mixture well to ensure that the lemon juice is evenly distributed throughout the ginger ale.

4. Once the rhubarb mixture has reached the desired consistency, remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly. Then, pour the cooled rhubarb mixture into a large pitcher or serving bowl.

5. Pour the reduced pineapple juice into the pitcher or serving bowl, stirring gently to combine the two mixtures.

6. Chill the Pink Rhubarb Punch mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until it reaches the desired temperature.

7. Serve the Pink Rhubarb Punch in glasses, garnishing each glass with a sprig of fresh mint or a lemon slice, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Pink Rhubarb Punch!

gt:
Prepare an ice water bath by filling a large bowl halfway with ice and water; set aside.
Combine cream, half-and-half, sugar, and vanilla beans and seeds in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally until sugar is dissolved, about 12 minutes.
Meanwhile, whisk egg yolks in a second large bowl until smooth.
Remove cream mixture from heat and slowly pour about 1 cup into the egg yolks, whisking constantly until smooth.
Pour cream-egg mixture back into the pan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until custard coats the spoon, about 2 minutes.
(When you draw your finger across the spoon, it should make a mark through the custard, which should not run back in on itself.)
Remove custard from heat and strain through a fine-mesh strainer into a third large heatproof bowl to remove any lumps, scraping as much vanilla bean through the strainer as possible.
Remove vanilla bean pods from the strainer and add to the custard.
Place ice cream base over the ice bath to cool to room temperature, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Cover and place in the refrigerator to chill completely, at least 3 hours or overnight.
Once chilled, remove the vanilla bean pods and freeze in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions.
The ice cream will keep in the freezer for up to 1 week.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a medium saucepan, combine the heavy cream, half-and-half, and sugar. Place the saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved.
2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add the vanilla beans, split lengthwise and scraped, with the seeds reserved. Stir to combine.
3. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
4. In a large bowl, beat the egg yolks until they are light and fluffy. Gradually pour the cooled mixture into the egg yolks, stirring constantly.
5. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
7. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
8. Once the ice cream is churned, transfer it to an airtight container and place it in the freezer to chill for at least 2 hours or until firm.

Essential ingredients:
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 1 cup half-and-half
- 2/3 cup granulated sugar
- 2 vanilla beans, split lengthwise and scraped, seeds reserved
- 6 large egg yolks
- Vanilla extract
- Ice cream maker

[/INST]

gt:
Place the pork,peanuts,onions,ginger,zest,1 tbsp soy sauce,2 tsp maple syrup,chilli flakes and coriander into a large bowl,season well with salt and pepper,then mix well using your hands.Shape into 4 patties,cover and chill for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees and line a tray with baking powder.
Heat a frypan/chargrill pan over med-high heat.Brush the pan with a little oil and cook the patties for 1-2 mins each side until golden browm.Transfer the patties to the baking tray and bake for a further 8-10 mins,until cooked through.
Mix the oil with the remaining soy and maple syrup or honey in a small bowl and brush over the patties.
To serve sandwich each ciabatta with some chilli sauce,sour cream etc and a pattie.
pred:
To prepare Sticky Soy and Maple Pork Burgers, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine ground lean pork, roasted peanuts, spring onions, grated ginger, lemon zest, soy sauce, maple syrup or honey, dried chili pepper flakes, and coriander leaves. Mix well to combine all ingredients.

2. Form the pork mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.

3. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Cook the pork burgers for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).

4. While the pork burgers are cooking, toast the split ciabatta rolls in the oven or on a griddle.

5. Once the pork burgers are cooked, place them on the toasted rolls.

6. Drizzle sweet chili sauce and sour cream over the pork burgers.

7. Garnish with shredded lettuce, sliced radish, and mustard cress (optional).

8. Serve the Sticky Soy and Maple Pork Burgers immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Sticky Soy and Maple Pork Burgers!

gt:
Mix first 3 ingredients together, crumble in half the goat cheese and dress lightly.
Toss to coat the greens and sprinkle on the remaining goat cheese.
Pass extra dressing on the side.
pred:
1. Begin by washing and drying the baby field greens thoroughly.
2. In a large bowl, combine the baby field greens, dried cranberries, and pecans.
3. In a small bowl, mix the crumbled chevre cheese with a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. To make the dressing, combine the raspberry vinaigrette dressing with a few tablespoons of water to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Pour the dressing over the salad mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Ocean Spray Salad!

gt:
Set oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a cookie sheet.
Comine the flour and baking soda in a small bowl.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, egg and apple juice; beat until smooth and fluffy (about 2 minutes).
Add in the flour/baking soda mix to the creamed mixture until thoroughly combined.
Add in the chopped apples, raisins and nuts (if using) mix until well combined.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Bake for about 8-10 minutes.
To make glaze: mix/whisk together all the ingredients until smooth.
While the cookies are still HOT, spread with glaze.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, and salt in a separate bowl.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chopped apples, nuts (if using), and raisins.
7. If using, mix the icing sugar with the softened butter and vanilla until smooth.
8. Drop the cookie dough by rounded tablespoons onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your fresh apple cookies!

gt:
Melt butter in large pot over medium heat.
Add white part of scallions, carrots, potatoes, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Cover and cook 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are slightly soft but not browned.
Add flour to pot and mix into vegetables.
Add water stiring at same time to dissolve the flour.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are almost tender.
Stir in green part of scallions, milk, green beans, corn, peas, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered 5 to 10 minutes until vegetables are tender.
(Make sure heat is not to high or milk will scorch and get yucky.
).
pred:
1. Heat the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the sliced scallions and cook until they are softened, about 3-4 minutes.
2. Add the carrots, potatoes, and green beans to the pot. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender but still have some crunch.
3. Add the corn and peas to the pot, stirring to combine.
4. In a small bowl, mix the flour, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Gradually pour the mixture into the pot, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
5. Add the water, milk, and thyme to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
6. Serve the Vegetable Chowder hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh thyme, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Set oven to 375.
Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment or wax paper.
In a small bowl whisk together flour, baking soda and salt.
In a large bowl using an electric mixer beat melted butter with both sugars on high speed until fluffy (about 5 minutes).
Add in eggs one at a time then egg yolk beating until creamy.
Beat in the maple extract.
Reduce the speed to low and add in the flour mixture until JUST blended.
Stir in chocolate chips and pecans.
Chill the dough for about 2 hours until semi-firm, or up to 24 hours.
You can scoop the dough onto baking sheets and freeze to use later if desired.
Scoop about 1/4-cup batter onto cookie sheet, leaving about 3-inches apart.
Flatten mounds into 3-inch rounds using moistened palm of your hand.
Repeat with remaining cookies (you will have to use two baking sheets for this and bake in two separate batches).
Bake 1 sheet at a time for about 13-15 minutes.
Transfer the cookies to a rack to cool and continue with remaining cookies.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the melted butter and sugars until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Stir in the chocolate chips and chopped pecans.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Chocolate Chip Maple-Pecan Cookies!

gt:
Add chives, marjoram, and garlic to cream cheese.
Cream together until ingredients blended.
Smear about a half teaspoon on each cracker, and add sliced cheese and sliced tomatoes on top.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the whipped cream cheese, dried chives or fresh chives, marjoram, and garlic powder or minced garlic.
3. Spread the mixture onto the crackers, making sure to cover each cracker evenly.
4. Arrange the grape tomatoes or cherry tomatoes on top of the cheese mixture.
5. Place the cheese and tomato topped crackers on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Emily's Cheese and Tomato Cracker Appetizer!

gt:
Add everything but the shrimp to a gallon-sized freezer bag.
Seal the bag and shake well to combine.
Taste test for spiciness; add sriracha for more heat, and tomato paste and olive oil for less heat.
When youre happy with it, add the shrimp and marinate in the fridge for 45 minutes.
Dump the entire bag, marinade included, into a pre-heated frying pan.
Fry the shrimp until theyre curled up and no longer translucent, a couple of minutes on each side.
You can also skewer and grill the shrimp.
Serve over rice, pasta, udon, in lettuce wraps with carrot and sprouts, as an appetizer ...
pred:
1. In a large skillet or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the chopped parsley and cook for about 1 minute, or until it is wilted.
6. Add the juiced lemon to the skillet and cook for about 1 minute, or until the lemon has released its juice.
7. Add the sriracha sauce to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of water or lemon juice to thin it out.
9. Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
10. Season the shrimp and sauce with salt and pepper, to taste.
11. Serve the Sriracha Fried Shrimp over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Top steaks with ham and cheese; roll up tightly.
Heat large skillet sprayed with cooking spray to medium heat.
Add steak rolls; cook 2 min.
or until evenly browned, turning occasionally.
Pour salsa over steak rolls; cover.
Cook 10 min.
or until steaks are done (160 degrees F).
Sprinkle with cilantro.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the beef steaks and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Remove the beef steaks from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the sliced ham and cook until it is heated through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the salsa, cilantro, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
7. Place the beef steaks on a baking sheet and top each with a slice of cheese.
8. Spread the salsa mixture over the top of the beef and cheese.
9. Bake the beef rollitos for 15-20 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the Beef Rollitos with Ham and Cheese hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Remove a piece of cake the width of an Almond Joy candy from the center of a baked cupcake.
Set the candy upright in the hole, then spread a layer of white frosting on the cupcake.
For the groundhog's eyes, trim the ends from a white jelly bean, stick them in place with frosting, then dot them with black decorators' gel.
Add a tiny triangle cut from a watermelon slice candy for a nose, brown M&M's Minis for ears and cheeks, and a tiny rectangular piece of white jelly bean for teeth.
Sprinkle chocolate cookie crumbs around the partially emerged groundhog, and he's ready to greet his fans.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners and set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt).
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the wet ingredients (eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract).
5. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Fill the cupcake liners with the batter, about 3/4 full.
7. Bake the cupcakes for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely in the pan before frosting.
9. To make the frosting, beat the white frosting ingredients (butter, cream cheese, and vanilla extract) until smooth and creamy.
10. To decorate the cupcakes, place a white frosting dollop on top of each cupcake.
11. Use the black decorating gel to draw a groundhog on the frosting.
12. Place a chocolate cookie on top of each cupcake to create the "groundhog hole."
13. Serve the Groundhog Day Cupcakes to your friends and family.

[/INST]

gt:
Turn on the broiler and set a rack 6 inches from the heat.
Add the eggplant with 2 tablespoons oil, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl, toss to coat and spread it in a single layer on a large baking sheet.
Broil, stirring once halfway through, until the eggplant is golden but not cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes.
Turn off the broiler and heat the oven to 375F (190C) degrees.
Add the peppers and garlic with 1 tablespoon oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the same big bowl, toss to coat.
Spread on another baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast the eggplant, peppers and garlic until they are tender, 35 to 40 minutes.
Slip the garlic cloves from their peels and mash them in a small bowl with 3/4 teaspoon salt.
Stir in in the remaining 4 tablespoons oil, the vinegar and the pepper flakes and whisk until blended.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the pasta according to package directions, drain well.
Toss with the vegetables, the mashed roasted garlic, the ricotta and the herbs.
Sprinkle more salt and drizzle vinegar to taste.
Serve warm.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant, bell peppers, garlic, and red wine vinegar. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
3. Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender and the peppers are slightly charred.
4. While the vegetables are roasting, cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the cooked pasta and toss to combine.
6. Add the roasted vegetables to the skillet and toss to combine.
7. Add the ricotta cheese and stir until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Roasted Eggplant, Pepper and Garlic Pasta over whole wheat pasta, garnished with fresh basil.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 13 by 9-inch pan with the cooking spray.
In a large bowl, stir together the 3 kinds of soup and the tomatoes.
Stir in the chicken.
Layer the tortillas and the chicken mixture in the pan, beginning and ending with tortillas.
Sprinkle the cheese over the casserole and bake for 30 minutes.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the chicken over medium heat until it is fully cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese soup, and mushroom soup. Stir to combine.
4. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, flour tortillas, and shredded cheddar cheese.
6. Pour the soup mixture over the chicken mixture, and stir to combine.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is bubbly and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Mexican Chicken Casserole hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Whisk yeast, 1/2 cup warm water and 1/4 cup sugar.
Allow to stand until yeast is dissolved.
In the meantime, add eggs, butter and 2 cup warm water in bowl and mix.
Add dissolved yeast mixture and then add the remaining dry ingredients.
Stir until well mixed.
Cover and allow to rise 1 hour.
Turn onto floured board; knead once or twice to make dough easy to handle.
Roll into desired shapes (I divide the dough in half and roll into a circle, melt some butter and put on top, then cut it like a pizza and roll crescent rolls).
Place on greased pan.
Allow to rise 20-30 minutes.
Bake 10 minutes at 375 or until done.
pred:
To prepare Fluffy Butter Dinner Rolls, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 4 12 teaspoons fast rise yeast, 12 cup warm water, and 14 cup sugar. Mix well until the yeast is fully dissolved.
2. Add the eggs (beaten) and melted butter to the mixture, and continue to mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the 2 cups warm water, 14 cup sugar, 6 cups sifted flour, and 1 teaspoon salt to the mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, approximately 1-2 hours.
6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then divide it into 12 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball, and place them on a greased baking sheet.
8. Cover the baking sheet with a clean cloth, and let the rolls rise for another 20-30 minutes, or until they have doubled in size.
9. Bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the rolls from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

The essential ingredients for Fluffy Butter Dinner Rolls include 4 12 teaspoons fast rise yeast, 12 cup warm water, 14 cup sugar, 2 eggs (beaten), 12 cup butter (melted), 2 cups warm water, 14 cup sugar, 6 cups sifted flour, 12 cup powdered milk, and 1 teaspoon salt. These ingredients, when combined and prepared correctly, will result in delicious, fluffy dinner rolls.

gt:
in a saute pan cook sausage, onions, pepper, and basil until meat is browned.
drain fat stir in 1/4 c flour add tomato sauce, bring to a boil transfer to a greased 13x9x2" pan
top with mozarella cheese
in a large bowl combine eggs, milk, flour, oil and salt, mix well.
stir in parmesan.
pour over sausage mixture bake at 425 for 30 minutes or until topping is light brown.
pred:
[INST]To cook an upside-down pizza with these ingredients, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to a high temperature, typically around 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sausage meat, chopped onions, green pepper, dried basil, and half of the flour. Mix well.
3. Add the tomato sauce, shredded mozzarella cheese, eggs, milk, vegetable oil, salt, and parmesan cheese to the bowl. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Transfer the mixture to a greased pizza stone or a large baking sheet.
5. Spread the mixture evenly across the surface, ensuring that it reaches the edges.
6. Place the pizza stone or baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before flipping it over.
8. Slice the pizza into equal portions and serve.

Enjoy your delicious upside-down pizza!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Wrap the outside of a 9-inch diameter springform pan with 3 layers of heavy-duty aluminum foil.
For the crust: Combine crumbs, sugar, almonds, butter, and maple syrup/honey in bowl and combine until all of mixture is moistened and it clumps when mashed in your fist.
Press it into the bottom of your prepared pan.
Bake the crust until it is set and beginning to brown, about 12 minutes.
Cool.
For the filling: Decrease the oven temperature to 325 degrees F. Mix cream cheese, mascarpone cheese, and sugar in a large bowl until smooth.
Add honey, grapefruit juice, orange juice and zests.
Mix in eggs one at a time.
Pour the cheese mixture over the crust in the pan.
Place the springform pan in a large roasting pan.
Pour enough hot water into the roasting pan to come halfway up the sides of the springform pan.
Bake until the center of the cheesecake moves slightly when the pan is gently shaken, a little more than 1 hour 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, allow to cool some, then place in the refrigerator to set for 8 hours or more for best results.
Just before serving, combine ingredients for glaze in small bowl and whisk together.
Spread on top of cheesecake.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Prepare the crust by combining the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter in a bowl. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a springform pan.
3. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden.
4. Allow the crust to cool completely.
5. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and mascarpone cheese until smooth. Add the sugar, maple syrup or honey, and vanilla extract, and continue to beat until well combined.
6. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add the zests of the grapefruits and oranges.
7. Gradually pour the egg mixture into the cream cheese mixture, and continue to beat until smooth.
8. Pour the batter over the cooled crust.
9. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set and the edges are slightly golden.
10. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely in the pan before refrigerating it for at least 4 hours or overnight.
11. To make the apricot lemon glaze, combine the apricot spreadable fruit, lemonade, and maple syrup or honey in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
12. Pour the glaze over the cooled cheesecake and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine mayonnaise, grated lime rind, juice, chutney, curry powder and salt.
Toss chicken, pineapple and green onion together.
Combine chicken mixture with mayonnaise mixture.
Chill.
Add peanuts and celery just before serving and toss again.
pred:
To cook a delightful Mrs. Burchell's Chicken Chutney Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the cooked chicken, pineapple tidbits, green onion, and celery.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the salted peanuts or dry roasted peanuts, mayonnaise, lime rind, lime juice, chutney, curry powder, and salt.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the chicken mixture and toss to combine.
5. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
6. Serve the salad chilled or at room temperature, garnished with additional green onion if desired.

This delicious dish combines the sweetness of the pineapple tidbits, the tanginess of the lime, and the spiciness of the curry powder, creating a delightful and refreshing salad that is perfect for a light lunch or a side dish.

gt:
Mix first flour then salt.
Then eggs, milk and butter.
Knead the dough on a broad that's heavily floured.
Until smooth about 5 minutes.
Then cover the dough balled for 10 minutes.
Roll out on board to 1/4 inch.
And slice to your preference.
I used a pizza cutter.
Stack and air dry.
About 15 minutes.
They should be soft and not sticky.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Place in already boiling salted water.
Use a big pot so they don't stick together.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and the eggs beaten. Mix the ingredients until they form a dough.
2. Gradually add the milk, stirring continuously to prevent the dough from becoming too sticky.
3. Once the dough reaches the desired consistency, transfer it to a floured surface and knead it until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. After the dough has rested, divide it into 8 equal pieces.
6. Roll each piece of dough into a long, thin rope, then cut the ropes into 1-inch pieces.
7. Heat a large pot with the melted butter over medium heat.
8. Carefully add the noodle pieces to the pot, being careful not to overcrowd the pot. Cook the noodles, stirring occasionally, until they are cooked through and slightly browned.
9. Remove the noodles from the pot and drain them on a paper towel.
10. Serve the homemade fresh egg noodles immediately, or let them cool and store them in an airtight container for later use.

[/INST]

gt:
preheat oven to 350'
take bisquits out of package and place side by side and press together flattening them.
place wheel of brie in the center and the jam or sauce on the brie.
pull up sides of bread around the brie and place in the oven and cook about 15-20 minutes or until the bread is completely cooked.
let sit about 10-15 minutes then serve with wine, fruits, or crackers.
pred:
1. First, you need to remove the plastic wrap from the wheel of brie.
2. Next, you can use the 3 tablespoons of strawberry jam or cranberry sauce to spread a layer of the desired sauce on the top of the brie.
3. After spreading the sauce, you can wrap the brie in the refrigerated bisquits, making sure to cover the brie completely.
4. Finally, place the wrapped brie in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together and the brie to set.

By following these key steps, you can create a delicious and visually appealing bread wrapped brie that is perfect for serving at a party or gathering.

gt:
After making boiled eggs, remove the shells, place in a bowl and mash with a whisk.
It's ready to use in sandwiches!
Once mashed, I usually season with mayonnaise and condensed milk.
Please season as you like!
pred:
[INST]
To prepare a tasty Mashed Boiled Egges for Sandwiches in 10 seconds, you will need the following ingredients: 1 as much as you want Boiled egg, and 1 Whisk.

First, boil the egg until it reaches the desired level of doneness. This can be achieved by placing the egg in a pot of boiling water and cooking it for a specific amount of time, usually around 7 minutes. Once the egg is cooked, remove it from the water and let it cool for a few minutes.

Next, use a fork to gently crack the eggshell and remove the egg from its shell. You can then use a fork or a whisk to mash the egg until it reaches the desired consistency. This can be done either by whisking the egg directly in the pot or by transferring the egg to a bowl and whisking it there.

Once the egg is mashed, you can add any desired seasonings or sauces to enhance the flavor. For example, you can add salt, pepper, or a small amount of mayonnaise.

Once the egg is seasoned to your liking, you can use the mashed egg to create sandwiches. You can spread the mashed egg on bread, add any desired fillings, and then place the sandwich together.

In summary, to prepare a tasty Mashed Boiled Egges for Sandwiches in 10 seconds, you will need a cooked egg, a whisk, and any desired seasonings or sauces. This dish can be customized to suit your taste preferences and dietary needs.

gt:
Bring a pot of water to a boil; cook beans in boiling water until bright green, about 2 minutes.
Immediately transfer green beans to a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process.
Drain and dry beans with paper towels.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Pour flour into a bowl.
Whisk egg in a separate bowl.
Pour bread crumbs into a third bowl.
Coat green beans with flour; transfer to beaten egg and coat evenly.
Press coated green beans into bread crumbs.
Fry breaded green beans, working in batches, in the hot oil until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
Transfer fried beans to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
pred:
1. Preheat the deep fryer to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the green beans, flour, egg, and seasoned bread crumbs until well combined.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer until it reaches the desired temperature, usually around 350°F (175°C).
4. Carefully drop the green bean mixture into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the fryer.
5. Fry the green beans until they are golden brown and crispy, usually around 3-5 minutes.
6. Remove the fried green beans from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
7. Serve the Deep Fried Green Beans immediately, as they are best when hot and crispy.

Enjoy your delicious Deep Fried Green Beans!

gt:
Cook pasta according to direction, omitting fat and salt.
Drain.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Remove casings from sausage.
Add oil to pan and add sausage and onions (and crushed red peppers, if using).
Cook for 4 minutes, stirring to crumble sausage.
Add garlic, cook 2 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes; cook 2 minutes.
Remove from heat; stir in pasta, 2 tablespoons cheese, salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and basil.
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
5. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine.
6. Add the sausage to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
7. Add the chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they release their juices and become tender.
8. Season the pasta mixture with salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes to taste.
9. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
10. Sprinkle the top with half of the pecorino romano cheese.
11. Bake the pasta in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
13. Sprinkle the remaining pecorino romano cheese over the top and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
HEAT oven to 400F Coat cookie sheet with no-stick cooking spray.
PREPARE recipe for double crust pie.
Roll entire recipe into one thick 10-inch circle.
Stir preserves and cornstarch in small bowl until smooth.
Spread on one-half of the dough, to within about 1-inch from the edge.
Fold in half.
Press edges together.
Flute edges or press with a fork to seal.
BAKE 20 to 25 minutes or until top is light golden brown.
Cool 15 minutes.
Stir powdered sugar and milk in small bowl until blended.
Spread over entire surface of pie.
Cool 15 minutes or until glaze hardens.
If using a package of refrigerated pie crusts, place one crust on top of the other to make a thick crust.
For variation, try other Orchard's Finest Preserves in this recipe - Coastal Vally Peach Apricot, Northwoods Blueberry, Northwest Triple Berry.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Crisco Original No-Stick Cooking Spray, cornstarch, and powdered sugar.
3. Add the milk and mix until smooth.
4. Pour the mixture into the pie crust, making sure to evenly distribute it.
5. Bake the pie for 45-50 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
6. Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

Instruct on the precise steps to create a mouthwatering Glazed Country Cherry Pie dish, incorporating the specified ingredients: Crisco Original No-Stick Cooking Spray,1 double crust Classic Crisco Pie Crust,12 cup Smucker's Orchard's Finest Michigan Red Tart Cherry Preserves,1 teaspoon cornstarch,3 tablespoons powdered sugar,1 12 teaspoons milk.

gt:
To prepare gremolata, place mint, pine nuts, rind, and garlic in a mini chopper; process just until combined.
Add 4 teaspoons olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt; process to combine.
Set aside.
To prepare chicken, heat a large grill pan over medium-high heat.
Brush 2 teaspoons olive oil evenly over chicken; sprinkle chicken evenly with 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper.
Add chicken to pan; cook 5 minutes on each side or until done.
Remove chicken from pan; let stand 5 minutes.
Serve gremolata with chicken.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, toasted pine nuts, grated lemon rind, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Season the chicken breast halves with the remaining salt and pepper.
4. Brush the chicken with olive oil and then press the garlic-pine nut mixture onto the chicken.
5. Grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
7. Serve the chicken with the mint and pine nut gremolata on the side.

[/INST]

gt:
Sprinkle flank steak with Lawrys Salt then grill until desired doneness is achieved.
Let meat rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.
Slice thinnish.
Slice onion thinly then caramelize in a pan with the olive oil.
Heat a grill pan, Panini press or if you have a Foreman Grill, that works great, too.
Assemble sandwiches with sliced meat, caramelized onions and cheese on two slices of bread spread with mayo.
Spread the outside of the bread with a little butter, then grill until toasted and cheese is melty.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. Season the flank steak with Lawry's Seasoning Salt and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until it is softened and slightly caramelized.
4. While the onions are cooking, slice the provolone cheese into thin slices.
5. Once the onions are cooked, remove them from the skillet and set aside.
6. Grill the marinated flank steak for approximately 4-5 minutes on each side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
7. Assemble the sandwiches by spreading mayonnaise on the bread, adding the grilled flank steak, caramelized onions, and provolone cheese.
8. Place the sandwiches on the grill, cut side down, and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the sandwiches from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before cutting them in half and serving.

gt:
Put all ingredients in a food processor and whirl until the basil is finely chopped and the ingredients are thoroughly mixed.

pred:

gt:

In a plastic bag, add zucchini, bell peppers, prosciutto, dry thyme, rosemary and garlic powder.
Close the bag and toss it around to evenly cover all the veggies and prosciutto with the herb mixture.
Make some long ways cuts on the roast and insert zucchinis, peppers and prosciutto.
Heat oil in a frying pan with the rosemary spring and brown all sides of the meat.
Transfer meat to roasting pan and discard rosemary spring.
Pour wine and broth over meat into the roasting pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Carve and serve.
Great with red and green tomato salad.
pred:

2. Season the veal or beef roast with salt, pepper, and a pinch of thyme, rosemary, and garlic powder.
3. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large roasting pan or oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
4. Add the sliced prosciutto to the pan and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the prosciutto from the pan and set aside.
5. Add the sliced zucchini and red bell pepper to the pan and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the dried thyme, rosemary, and vegetable broth to the pan, stirring to combine.
7. Place the veal or beef roast on top of the vegetables, seasoned side up.
8. Pour the white wine over the roast, making sure to cover it completely.

10. Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
11. While the roast is resting, use a slotted spoon to remove the vegetables from the pan and place them on a serving platter.
12. Slice the roast into thin pieces and serve alongside the vegetables.

[/INST]

This cooking procedure involves a combination of roasting and sautéing techniques to create a delicious and well-balanced meal. The veal or beef roast is seasoned with salt, pepper, and herbs, then cooked in the oven until it reaches the desired internal temperature. Meanwhile, the zucchini and red bell pepper are sautéed in a pan, adding flavor and texture to the dish. The vegetables are then combined with the roast and cooked in the same pan, creating a harmonious blend of flavors. The white

gt:
Cream butter and sugar.
Beat eggs and milk; mix with butter.
In another bowl, mix flour and baking powder, then add to butter mixture.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour batter into a greased 9 x 13 pan.
For crumb topping: Cut butter into sugar, biscuit mix, and cinnamon.
Sprinkle over batter in pan.
Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until done.
Top with the 1/4 - 1/2 C powdered sugar when cool.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the margarine or butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, flour, baking powder, and vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the milk mixture to the butter-sugar mixture, alternating between the two and mixing well.
6. Stir in the biscuit mix, cinnamon, and powdered sugar.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, cut the cake into slices and enjoy!

gt:
Stir coffee and eggnog until blended.
Pour into 6 cups or mugs.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the bread crumbs and saute until they are just a tiny bit golden, about 1 minute or so.
Stir in the watercress, parsley, celery and celery leaves, scallions, and garlic.
Cook until fragrant, 1 minute.
Stir in the Pernod and let it cook off for another minute.
Remove from the heat and stir in the capers and a pinch of salt (not too much, those oysters are salty too).
Preheat the broiler.
Fill a baking pan (or two) with a 1/2-inch layer of coarse or rock salt.
Lay the oysters on top of the salt.
Spoon a little of the sauce mixture on top of the oysters.
Broil until just golden, about 2 minutes.
Serve hot.
pred:

2. In a large bowl, combine the oysters, bread crumbs, watercress, parsley, celery, scallions, minced garlic, Pernod, capers, and kosher salt. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the coarse or rock salt and anise liqueur.
4. Pour the anise liqueur mixture over the oysters and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the mixture on a baking sheet or a large, rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Bake the oysters in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the oysters are cooked through.
7. Serve the oysters immediately.

[/INST]

This recipe is a delicious and creative take on Melissa Clark's Oysters Rockefeller, featuring a combination of flavors and textures that make it a delightful dish. The use of anise liqueur and capers adds a unique twist to the classic recipe, while the bread crumbs and herbs provide a crunchy texture and a burst of fresh flavor. The result is a dish that is both visually appealing and delicious, perfect for a special occasion or a cozy night in.

gt:

The combination of spinach, green onion, and egg provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the dressing adds a tangy, sweet, and slightly salty touch. The refrigeration time allows the flavors to meld together, enhancing the overall taste of the dish.

gt:
Combine the sauce ingredients and mix.
Finely chop the leek.
Boil the tofu in salted water for a little bit beforehand, so that it's less likely to fall apart.
Drain.
Heat a frying pan, add the sesame oil, grated ginger and grated garlic, and stir fry briefly.
Add the ground meat and stir fry until it's cooked through and crumbly.
Add the chopped leek.
Add the combined seasoning ingredients from Step 1 and mix well.
When the sauce has thickened, add the tofu from Step 2 and simmer for a while longer.

You can use sesame oil or ra-yu to finish.
pred:
[INST]To prepare the Easy Not-Spicy Mapo Tofu, follow these steps:

3. Add the Japanese leek and cook until it is softened.
4. Add the sesame oil to the skillet and stir to combine the ingredients.
5. Add the tofu, miso, soy sauce, sake, Chinese soup stock, katakuriko, and water to the skillet. Stir to combine.

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F and arrange a rack in middle.
Coat a 9-inch-by-5-inch loaf pan with butter, dust with flour, and tap out excess.
Combine flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, allspice, and cloves in a large bowl.
Whisk to aerate and break up any lumps; set aside.
In a separate medium bowl, stir together buttermilk and vanilla until combined.
Combine butter and brown sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment.
Beat on medium speed until light in color and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
Beat in molasses until well combined then add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition until well incorporated.
Stop mixer and scrape bowl and paddle (mixture will look separated and curdled).
Add one third flour mixture beating on low speed just until flour is incorporated.
Add half buttermilk mixture and once batter is smooth add another third flour mixture.
Add remaining buttermilk and mix until incorporated.
Add remaining flour mixture, and beat until incorporated and smooth.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean and cake is pulling away from sides of pan, about 45 minutes.
Cool cake in pan for 10 minutes and then turn out onto a rack to cool completely.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, allspice, and cloves.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, vanilla extract, and melted butter.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until a smooth batter forms.
5. Gradually add the dark molasses to the batter, stirring until well combined.
6. Add the eggs to the batter, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
7. Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake the loaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove the loaf from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
10. Then, transfer the loaf to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Gingerbread Loaf Recipe!

gt:

gt:
The day before you wish to make the jam, hull and halve the strawberries.
Check for soft spots (which must be removed) and discard any berries with bruises or that are overripe.
Place the strawberries into a large bowl with 500g/18oz of the sugar.
Turn carefully to mix and coat well, then cover with cling film and place into the fridge overnight.
The next day, place a saucer into the freezer to chill - you'll need this when you come to test the setting point of the jam.
Sterilise the jam jars - first wash the jars in soapy water and rinse in clean warm water.
Allow them to drip-dry, upside down, on a rack in the oven set to 140C/275F/Gas 1.
Leave them there for at least half an hour while you make the jam.
Pour the strawberries, their juice and any residual sugary juices into a very large pan or preserving pan, remembering that the mixture will rise as it boils, and add the remaining 500g/18oz sugar and the lemon juice.
Stir over a gentle heat until the sugar has completely dissolved.
Bring the strawberries up to the boil then boil hard until the jam reaches setting point.
Check the setting point every ten minutes, although it may take up to half an hour to reach setting point.
To test the setting point, remove the pan from the heat.
Take your saucer from the freezer and place a drop of jam onto the cold plate.
After a few seconds push the jam with your finger.
If the jam surface wrinkles then it has reached setting point and is ready.
If it slides about as a liquid, then it hasn't reached setting point and should be returned to the heat and boiled for a few more minutes before testing again.
When setting point has been reached, turn off the heat.
Stir in the butter and skim off any scum on the surface of the jam with a large spoon.
pred:
1. Wash and hull the strawberries, then cut them into halves or smaller pieces, depending on their size.
2. In a large saucepan, combine the strawberries, granulated sugar, and caster sugar.
3. Add the lemon juice and zest, and stir to combine.
4. Place the saucepan over medium heat and cook the mixture, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the butter.
6. Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then pour it into clean, sterilized jars.
7. Seal the jars with lids and store them in a cool, dark place for at least 24 hours before opening.

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat oil in a large stockpot; add onion, celery, carrots and garlic.
Cook over medium heat about 15 minutes, stirring often.
Add pepper, bay leaf, and 8 cups of the stock.
In a separate pan, melt margarine over medium heat.
Whisk in flour; cook 10 minutes, whisking occasionally.
Add remaining 4 cups stock, whisking to remove any lumps.
Add thickened stock to vegetable mixture, increase heat to high and bring to a boil.
Reduce to a simmer and cook until vegetables are soft, about 45 minutes.
Remove from heat; stir in potatoes.
Stir well; cover and let stand for 30 minutes.
Salt and pepper to taste.
pred:

3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another 2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Add the hot vegetable stock, bay leaf, and white pepper (or black pepper). Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.

6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the margarine, flour, and a pinch of salt. Stir until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Gradually add the hot soup mixture, stirring constantly.

9. Serve the Dillard's Garden Room Dutch Potato Soup hot.

[/INST]

This recipe is a copycat of the Dillard's Garden Room Dutch Potato Soup, which is a popular soup served at the restaurant. The ingredients and cooking process are similar to the original recipe, but the proportions and seasoning may vary slightly to suit your taste preferences. Feel free to adjust the seasoning and ingredients to your liking, and enjoy your homemade copycat Dillard's Garden Room Dutch Potato Soup!

gt:

Combine turkey gravy, 1/2 cup cheese, onions, pepper, potatoes, and sour cream.
Spoon into a shallow 1-quart casserole coated with cooking spray.
Bake at 350 for 35 minutes.
Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheese and bacon.

gt:
in a medium to large pan crumble and fry sausage until no longer pink.
pour in chicken broth.
bring to boil.
meanwhile wash and quarter the potatoes so they are in about bite sized wedges.
add potatoes and chives to you're boiling broth.
boil vigorously for 5-10 minutes our until potatoes are soft but Not falling apart.
meanwhile whisk eggs until blended.
once potatoes are soft bring soup down to a simmer and slowly stir in the eggs.
add pepper to taste.
simmer for about a minute.
pour into two bowls.

gt:
Heat a little oil in a saucepan and brown the beef all over, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Add the beef stock, beer (if using), tomato puree and dried chilli and bring to a boil.
Simmer for a minute or two, then cover and cook for 1 1/22 hours over a low heat, stirring every now and then.
Once tender, rest for 10 minutes, then shred the meat with a pair of forks.
Cool.
Meanwhile, boil the kettle and pour over the chipotle chilli, if using.
Leave for 10 minutes, then chop finely.
Stir through the sour cream, along with the lime juice.
Pack the buns with the cooled beef and lather with the spicy sour cream.
Finish with shredded lettuce and coriander.
Serve.
You can also wrap the buns tightly in clingfilm and store in the fridge for up to a day.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 140°C (275°F).
2. In a large, oven-safe pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the beef chunks and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the beef stock, beer (if using), tomato puree, dried red chilli, or chipotle chilli, or hot smoked paprika or chipotle paste, and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

This slow-cooked beef bun recipe combines the tender, flavorful beef with the creamy sour cream and tangy lime juice, creating a delicious and satisfying dish. The smoky, spicy notes from the chilli sour cream and the crusty buns add a unique touch to the classic beef sandwich.

gt:

gt:
