3. In a small bowl, mix the margar

gt:
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add in green onions, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes- cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly
Reduce the heat to medium and add in shrimp- cook for about 5 minutes or until shrimp turns pink
Season with salt and lots of black pepper and stir in parsley
Toss with cooked pasta
Sprinkle with desired amount of parm cheese
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the green onions and minced garlic, stirring occasionally. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the onions are softened.
2. Add the crushed red pepper flakes, lemon peel, and lemon juice to the skillet. Stir to combine.
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet, stirring to coat them evenly with the sauce. Cook for about 3-4 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and pink.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
6. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot.
7. Add the cooked shrimp to the pot with the pasta, stirring to combine.
8. Add the chopped parsley and grated parmesan cheese to the pot. Stir to combine.
9. Serve the Lemon shrimp scampi immediately, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

[/INST]

This recipe provides a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the fresh taste of lemon, the zesty kick of red pepper flakes, and the richness of parmesan cheese. The combination of shrimp, pasta, and the lemon-garlic sauce creates a delightful and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Honey Mustard Sauce: Whisk all the ingredients together Serve warm or cold.
Easy BBQ Sauce: Combine all ingredients in a pot& cook over low heat until the sugar is dissolved.
Serve warm or cold.
Garlic Dill Sauce: Mix all the ingredients and chill until ready to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the beef with salt and pepper, then place it in a large mixing bowl.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the spicy mustard, fresh lemon juice, honey, vegetable oil, brown sugar, ketchup, hot sauce, and sour cream.
4. Pour the sauce mixture over the beef in the mixing bowl, and toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer the beef to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until the beef is cooked through and tender.
6. Remove the beef from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
7. In a small saucepan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.
8. Add the fresh parsley, and cook for an additional 1 minute or until the parsley is wilted.
9. Pour the garlic-parsley mixture over the beef in the baking dish.
10. Serve the beef fondue immediately, allowing guests to dip the beef pieces into the sauce.

Enjoy your delicious "Love is in the Air" Beef Fondue, and share the love with your friends and family.

gt:
Melt butter in large, leavy pot over medium-high heat.
Add carrots and next 6 ingredients and saute until vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
Discard bay leaf.
Transfer mixture to processor and blend until smooth.
Return mixture to pot.
Add stock and all remaining ingredients.
Boil soup over medium-high head to blend flavours, about 15 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Working in batches, puree soup in blender until smooth.
Return soup to pot.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bring soup to simmer.
Divide among serving bowls, and sprinkle with roasted Pumpkin seeds that have been hulled or roasted peanuts.
This is so very yummy!
pred:
To make a delicious "the Bomb" Pumpkin Soup dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and shallot, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the chopped carrot and cook until softened, about 10 minutes.
5. Add the bay leaf, chicken stock, and cook until the carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.
6. Add the canned pumpkin, canned unsweetened coconut milk, and sweetened condensed milk. Stir to combine.
7. Add the ground nutmeg, cinnamon, coriander, ground allspice, and yellow curry powder. Stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender.
9. Remove the bay leaf.
10. If desired, add roasted hulled pumpkin seeds or roasted peanuts for extra texture and flavor.

Enjoy your delicious "the Bomb" Pumpkin Soup dish!

gt:
Slice onions in half and then slice them so you get half-rounds.
Meanwhile, warm the butter and oil in a saute pan over medium heat.
When the oil is good and hot, add the onions, cayenne (I always add in more than the recipe), salt and pepper and saute for 10 minutes stirring pretty frequently.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20-30 more minutes until the onions are browned and caramelized.
I always find I have to cook my onions longer to get the caramelization I like.
When done, remove from heat and allow the onions to cool.
Into the bowl of your electric mixer, add the cream cheese, sour cream and mayonnaise and mix on low speed fitted with the paddle attachment.
Continue until all the ingredients are mixed.
Add the onions and mix well continuing on low speed.
Serve at room temperature.
Adapted from Ina Garten.
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the onions into thin slices and place them in a large mixing bowl.
3. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
4. Add the vegetable oil and cayenne pepper to the saucepan, stirring to combine.
5. Carefully pour the hot butter mixture over the onions in the mixing bowl, making sure to coat them evenly.
6. Season the onions with salt and pepper, then transfer the mixture to a baking dish.
7. Roast the onions in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized and tender.
8. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let the onions cool slightly.
9. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and mayonnaise.
10. Add the caramelized onions to the cream cheese mixture and stir to combine.
11. Season the dip with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Serve the Caramelized Onion Dip with pita chips, crackers, or vegetables for dipping.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Mix all ingredients, except avocados, in bowl.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spoon into each avocado half and serve.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crumbled feta cheese, chopped red onion, and chopped parsley.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
4. Add the whisked ingredients to the bowl with the feta cheese mixture, and toss to combine.
5. Cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into the bowl with the feta cheese mixture.
6. Gently toss the avocado mixture with the feta cheese mixture until well combined.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the avocado is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the Stuffed Avocado Salad warm or at room temperature.

gt:
Combine flours, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.
Mix together milk and oil and stir into dry mixture just enough to moisten all ingredients, then fold in banana.
Spoon onto a hot well greased griddle.
Turn once.
Makes 10 to 12.
pred:
1. Preheat your stovetop or griddle to medium heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 23 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of whole wheat flour, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the 113 cups of milk, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, and the finely chopped bananas.
4. Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until a smooth batter forms.
5. Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Pour a small amount of batter onto the skillet, spreading it evenly to form a thin pancake. Cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the edges are slightly browned and the pancake is cooked through.
6. Flip the pancake and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the other side is also cooked through.
7. Repeat with the remaining batter, stacking the cooked pancakes on a plate as they are finished.
8. Serve the Banana Pancakes warm, drizzled with syrup or butter, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat olive oil.
Saute onion and pepper until onion starts to turn translucent.
Add all other ingredients, except lime juice.
Add 1 to 2 cans of water, simmer about 10 minutes,or until heated through.
Add salt and chili powder or pepper to taste.
Stir in lime juice.
pred:
To cook a delicious Easy Left-Over Turkey Chili dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the diced yellow pepper and continue cooking for another 5 minutes, until both vegetables are tender.
3. Add the turkey breast to the pot and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the canned tomatoes and green chilies, along with their juices, and stir to combine.
5. Add the canned white kidney beans or great northern beans, and the taco seasoning. Stir to combine.
6. Add the garlic salt, and stir to combine.
7. Bring the chili to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, or until the turkey is cooked through and the beans are tender.
8. Add the sliced black olives and chopped cilantro, stirring to combine.
9. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
10. Serve the Easy Left-Over Turkey Chili hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

This delicious Easy Left-Over Turkey Chili dish is perfect for using up leftover turkey and providing a warm, comforting meal. The combination of turkey, beans, and tomatoes creates a hearty and flavorful dish that can be enjoyed by the whole family.

gt:
Clean and cut up fruit accordingly except for the Lemon
Add to a serving bowl and toss with honey
Squeeze lemon over top and toss again and enjoy
pred:
[/INST]

1. Wash and peel the fruits, removing any seeds or pits.
2. Cut the fruits into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the papaya, kiwis, mango, cantaloupe, blueberries, blackberries, and lemon.
4. Squeeze the juice of the lemon over the fruit mixture.
5. Add the honey and mix well.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the fruit salad chilled and enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Pound lamb out to about 1 1/2 inches thick.
In a large saute pan heat butter over med heat and saute mushrooms until soft.
Set mushrooms aside until later.
Season lamb liberally with salt and pepper.
Layer lamb with shallots, chevre and criminis.
Roll the lamb into a log and tie with butchers twine.
In a large saute pan, heat oil over med-high heat and sear lamb on all sides.
Place lamb on wire rack with baking sheet underneath.
Roast for about an hour until internal temp is reached (140 for rare, 170 for well done, I usually go about 155 and it's nice and pink but not bloody).
Let the lamb rest about 10 minute to prevent juice from running and it drying out.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the leg of lamb with salt and pepper on all sides.
3. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the mushrooms from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the minced shallot and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
6. Add the cheese to the skillet and stir until melted.
7. Add the cooked mushrooms back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Season the lamb with salt and pepper.
9. Place the lamb in a large roasting pan and stuff it with the mushroom and cheese mixture.
10. Tie the lamb with butchers kitchen twine to ensure even cooking.
11. Roast the lamb in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare.
12. Remove the lamb from the oven and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Leg of Lamb Stuffed With Mushrooms and Chevre!

gt:
In medium bowl, combine cantaloupe, honeydew, cilantro, mint, jalapeno, lime juice, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, stirring until well mixed; set aside.
In small bowl, stir together ginger, curry powder, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper.
Spread mixture evenly all over non-skin side of each fillet.
In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat oil on medium 1 minute.
Add salmon, ginger side down, and cook 10 minutes or until salmon just turns opaque in center, turning over once.
Serve salmon with melon salsa.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the grated ginger, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish, and brush them with the vegetable oil.
4. Sprinkle the ginger-curry mixture evenly over the salmon fillets.
5. Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. While the salmon is cooking, prepare the melon salsa by combining the cantaloupe and honeydew in a large bowl.
7. Add the chopped cilantro and mint leaves, and mix well.
8. Squeeze the fresh lime juice over the melon mixture, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the cooked salmon with the melon salsa on the side.

[/INST]

gt:
Cream the butter with the sugars until fluffy.
Beat in the egg and the vanilla extract.
Combine the dry ingredients and beat into the butter mixture.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by large spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or 10-12 minutes for a crispier cookie.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until smooth.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the baking soda, baking powder, salt, and instant coffee.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the flour and mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden and the centers are set.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious The Real Chocolate Chip Cookies ( Neiman Marcus ) Copycat!

gt:
Boil the potatoes in plenty of salted water for 15 minutes or until tender.
Whilst still hot, mix with the yoghurt and cheese and allow to more or less cool.
Add the celery chunks and grapes along with plenty of black pepper and mix thoroughly.
Transfer to a clean bowl, cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Remove from the fridge 30 minutes before serving, mixing in any water that may have separated or adding more yoghurt or mayo if the dressing has been sucked up by the potatoes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. Place the potatoes in a large mixing bowl, and toss them with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
4. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet, and roast them in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
5. While the potatoes are cooking, wash the celery and grapes thoroughly.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, celery, grapes, crumbled blue cheese, and Greek yogurt.
7. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Mix everything well, and serve the salad immediately.

This step-by-step guide will help you create a delicious and satisfying Celery Black Grape and Blue Cheese Potato Salad dish using the provided ingredients. The combination of the tender and flavorful potatoes, crunchy celery, sweet grapes, and tangy blue cheese creates a delightful and satisfying salad that can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course.

gt:
Coarsely chop the jalepenos (food processor is best).
Add the onion; coarsely chop.
Leave the jalepenos and onions in the bowl.
Cut each tomato into four pieces and chop.
Pour into bowl; stir in seasonings.
Chill at least two hours before serving; overnight is better.
Before serving, pour off liquid.
Liquid can be used to season Mexican dishes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the jalapenos, tomatoes, and onion into small, evenly sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, mix the minced garlic, cilantro, and salt.
4. Add the chopped jalapenos, tomatoes, and onion to the bowl, and mix well.
5. Place the bowl in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the bowl from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Stir the ingredients together to combine and serve the Pico de Gallo immediately.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Pico de Gallo!

gt:
Add the flour and sugar to a large bowl.
Add the sourdough starter and 140 ml of milk.
Mix and knead.
Once it's mixed together, add the remaining milk as needed.
Knead for about 5 minutes, spreading out and tapping on the palm of your hand.
Add the margarine in about 4 parts and continue to mix and knead until smooth.
Let rise until the dough becomes 2.5 to 3 cm, then divide the dough in half.
Make each piece round and let sit for 20 minutes.
Use your hands to stretch the dough until just smaller than the pound cake pan, then roll up from the edges.
Place the dough in the pans that have been coated in shortening and let rise a second time until double in size.
In this and the previous step, be careful not to let it dry out.
Use a razor to cut the dough and place the butter in the slits.
Place in the 220C preheated oven (together with the baking pan) and cook for about 13 minutes and it's complete!
Using the strongest bread flour, a small size, high baking temperature, and short baking time, you get this nice and soft fluffy bread.
A texture just like the professional brands!
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]To create a Pound Cake-Shaped Fluffy Butter-Top Bread, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sourdough starter, sugar, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the margarine (or butter) and milk.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it is smooth and elastic.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
7. Prepare two 7 mm x 4 cm pans by greasing them with butter.
8. After the dough has risen, punch it down and transfer it to a floured surface.
9. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
10. Use a cookie cutter or a round cutter to cut out circles of dough.
11. Place the dough circles on the prepared pans, spacing them evenly.
12. Cover the pans with a damp cloth and let the dough rise for about 30-60 minutes, or until it has risen by about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
13. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
14. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for about 10-15 minutes.
15. After the bread has cooled, use a spatula to spread a layer of butter on top of the bread.
16. Serve the Pound Cake-Shaped Fluffy Butter-Top Bread warm, and enjoy!

gt:
Combine egg yolks, mayonnaise, mustard, and hot sauce in a food processor; puree until smooth.
Spoon egg yolk mixture into a pastry bag with a decorative tip; pipe filling into the cavity of the egg white halves.
pred:
To make a delicious Zippy Deviled Eggs dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, hot yellow pepper sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. Carefully remove the yolks from the hard-boiled eggs and place them in a separate bowl. Mash the yolks with a fork or a whisk until smooth.
4. Add the mashed yolks to the mayonnaise mixture and stir to combine.
5. Carefully fill the egg whites with the yolk mixture, dividing it evenly among the 12 halved eggs.
6. Place the filled eggs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the eggs in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the whites are set and the yolks are still slightly runny.
8. Carefully remove the baked eggs from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Using a spoon, carefully scoop the yolks back into the egg whites, creating a creamy filling.
10. Serve the Zippy Deviled Eggs immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of paprika or chopped chives, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Zippy Deviled Eggs!

gt:
Spread cheese on tortillas.
Sprinkle with vegetables.
Roll up; wrap each in plastic wrap.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour.
Cut into 1-inch pieces to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and spinach) and mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and seasonings (such as salt, pepper, and herbs like oregano and basil).
4. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and mix gently to combine.
5. Spread the vegetable mixture evenly over the three tortillas, leaving a small border around the edges for the roll-ups.
6. Roll up each tortilla, enclosing the vegetable mixture, and place the roll-ups seam-side down on a baking sheet.
7. Bake the tortilla roll-ups for 15-20 minutes, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the vegetables are cooked through.
8. Serve the Veggie Tortilla Roll-Ups warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix all ingredients except 1/2 cup each of the cheese and croutons.
Spoon into 1-1/2-quart casserole dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and croutons.
Bake 30 minutes or until heated through.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the broccoli florets, ham, rotini pasta, and MIRACLE WHIP Dressing. Mix well.
3. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. Sprinkle half of the KRAFT Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese evenly over the top.
5. Dot the top with half of the seasoned croutons.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the croutons are golden brown.
7. Remove from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Sprinkle the remaining KRAFT Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese evenly over the top.
9. Dot the top with the remaining seasoned croutons.
10. Return the casserole to the oven, and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the croutons are golden brown.
11. Serve and enjoy!

[/SYS]

gt:
1.
Beat together butter and sugar until creamy.
2.
Add eggs and lemon zest.
3.
Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
4.
Incorporate dry ingredients into the bowl of wet ingredients, alternating with milk.
I added vinegar to the milk last time and uh ... hello moist cake.
Worth a try!
5.
Butter a loaf pan and dust with flour.
6.
Bake at 350 degrees until beautifully golden (about an hour).
7.
To make the glaze, mix the sugar and lemon juice and brush on top of the loaf while still warm.
I usually cut a piece off the end and dip it in the juice ... yum!
Enjoy!
pred:
To create Moms Tangy Lemon Loaf, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.

3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

4. Squeeze the zest of the whole lemon into the mixture and add the lemon juice.

5. Gradually add the flour, salt, and baking powder to the mixture, mixing until just combined.

6. Gradually add the milk, alternating with the dry ingredients, until the batter is smooth and well-combined.

7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.

8. Bake the loaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

9. Allow the loaf to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

10. Once cooled, slice the loaf and serve.

Enjoy your delicious Moms Tangy Lemon Loaf!

gt: Mix all the ingredients together bring to boil cook covered till beans are tender to eat about 2 and a half hours I use vinegar hot sauce with mine
pred:
1. Rinse the beans thoroughly and pick out any debris or stones.
2. In a large pot, combine the beans, smoked sausage, smokey bacon, and vegetable broth.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the beans are tender but still have a slight crunch.
4. Add the margarine to the pot and stir to melt.
5. Add the chopped onion and continue to cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the onion is tender and translucent.
6. Season the beans and onions with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Great Northern Beans and Onions hot, over rice or with your favorite side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
In the crock of a slow cooker, stir together the chicken cubes and Alfredo sauce.
Cover, and cook on Low for 2 hours.
Add Parmesan cheese and Swiss cheese; cover and cook for another 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper and stir in cheeses before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the Alfredo sauce and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for about 5 minutes.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the grated Parmesan cheese and garlic powder.
5. Add the cooked chicken back to the pan and stir to combine with the sauce.
6. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the mixture to a slow cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the chicken is fully cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
8. Serve the Slow Cooker Chicken Alfredo over cooked pasta.

[/INST]

gt:
Drain the salsa over a fine strainer (push the liquid through the strainer with a spoon to speed up the process) set aside.
Using a sharp knife slice the hard-boiled eggs in half.
Carefully remove the yolks from 14 eggs and place into a food processor (save the whites from 2 eggs or just eat them lol!
).
Place the 24 egg whites halves on a plate or serving platter.
Add in all remining ingredients except finely shredded cheddar cheese, seasoned salt and pepper; process for about 10 seconds or until smooth.
Add in seasoned salt and pepper to taste, and process again.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl.
Add in 1 cup finely grated cheddar cheese and mix with a spoon until blended.
Spoon or pipe about 1 tablespoon (or more if desired) into the egg white halves.
Sprinkle each top of egg with some grated cheddar cheese, then sprinkle with a small amount of paprika.
Cover the eggs with plastic wrap and refrigerate for a minumum of 4 hours before serving.
pred:
To make the salsa, combine the following ingredients in a bowl: 14 cups of medium salsa, 1 tablespoon of sour cream, 2-3 large green onions, finely chopped, 14 teaspoons of garlic powder, seasoned salt, and pepper to taste. Mix well.

To assemble the deviled eggs, carefully remove the yolks from the hard-boiled eggs and mash them in a bowl. Add the Miracle Whip, mustard mania or prepared mustard, and mix well. Add the salsa mixture, garlic powder, seasoned salt, and pepper to taste. Fold the mashed egg mixture into the salsa mixture, ensuring that the ingredients are well combined.

To assemble the deviled eggs, spoon the mixture into the egg whites, dividing it evenly among the 14 eggs. Sprinkle the tops with finely grated cheddar cheese, and if desired, a dusting of paprika.

Serve the Mexi Salsa Deviled Eggs immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Boil 1 cup maple syrup and walnut pieces in heavy medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir mixture frequently until syrup begins to get cloudy, about 2 minutes.
Pour mixture onto sheet of foil and cool.
Chop praline finely.
Whisk pancake mix, 3/4 cup water, and brandy in small bowl to form smooth thin batter.
Heat medium (7- to 8-inch-diameter) nonstick skillet over medium heat.
For each crepe, brush skillet with oil and pour in very scant 1/4 cup batter, rotating skillet so batter covers bottom.
Cook until edges brown, about 40 seconds.
Loosen edges with spatula, lift, and turn crepe over.
Cook until bottom browns in spots, about 30 seconds.
Turn out onto paper towel.
Repeat with remaining batter, placing crepes between paper towels.
Fold crepes into quarters and divide among 4 plates.
Sprinkle generously with praline and drizzle with creme fraiche and maple syrup.
*Sold at some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores.
pred:
[INST]1. Preheat a non-stick skillet or crepe pan on medium heat.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the pancake mix, water, and brandy or orange juice until smooth.
3. Pour the batter onto the preheated skillet or pan, creating a small well in the center for the praline filling.
4. Cook the crepes for about 1-2 minutes, until the edges start to curl up and the center is set.
5. Carefully flip the crepes and cook for another minute or until the edges are golden brown.
6. Transfer the crepes to a plate and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In the meantime, prepare the praline filling by combining the walnut pieces, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl.
8. Once the crepes are cool enough to handle, place one crepe on a plate and spoon a small amount of the praline filling onto the center of the crepe.
9. Roll the crepe over the filling, folding it in half if desired, and serve immediately.
10. Repeat the process with the remaining crepes and filling.

Enjoy your delicious Crepes with Maple-Walnut Praline and Creme Fraiche dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease and lightly flour a rimmed 9x13-inch baking sheet.
Beat cake mix, water, vegetable oil, and egg whites together in a bowl using an electric mixer on low speed until moistened, about 30 seconds.
Beat batter on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Pour batter into prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes.
Cool cake for at least 30 minutes.
Gently release cake onto a clean towel.
Place a second clean towel on top of cake and smooth out any wrinkles in towel.
Slowly roll cake around top towel.
Strain strawberries, reserving juice.
Mix strawberry juice and icing together in a bowl until icing turns pink.
Stir strawberries and strawberry glaze together in a separate bowl.
Gently unroll cake and remove top towel.
Spread icing onto cake; top icing with strawberry mixture.
Carefully roll cake around the filling; slice into rounds.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white cake mix, water, and vegetable oil. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the egg whites and mix until the batter is smooth and well combined.
4. Spread the batter evenly into a greased and floured 9-inch round cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. While the cake is cooling, prepare the frosting by beating the buttercream icing until it is smooth and fluffy.
8. Once the cake is cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into equal slices.
9. Spread a layer of frosting on the bottom slice of the cake.
10. Place a layer of sliced strawberries on top of the frosting.
11. Spread a layer of buttercream icing over the strawberries.
12. Place the second slice of cake on top of the buttercream icing.
13. Spread a layer of strawberry glaze over the top slice of cake.
14. Repeat the process with the remaining slices of cake and frosting.
15. Place the final cake slice on top of the glaze.
16. Chill the cake in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until the glaze is set.

Enjoy your delicious Strawberry Roll Cake!

gt:
Cream butter and 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar in bowl with hand mixer.
Add egg yolks, water and vanilla.
Then add dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda) and mix together and pat into a greased 10 x 14 pan.
Sprinkle chocolate chips and chopped nuts on top.
The chocolate chips and chopped nuts can be left out and the cookie is still delicious.
Beat the remaining 1 cup brown sugar and the two egg whites till stiff peaks form.
Gently spread on top of chocolate chips and nuts.
Spread to the edge of the pan.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350 F, cool and cut into squares.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the water, vanilla, and flour mixture, alternating between the two.
5. Combine the baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Stir in the chocolate chips and chopped nuts.
8. Spread the batter evenly into a greased and floured 9x9 inch baking dish.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Allow the bars to cool completely before cutting into squares.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Spread 16 Holiday Ritz Crackers evenly with 1 tsp.
Philadelphia Cream Cheese Product.
Top evenly with 1 tsp.
cocktail sauce and 1 medium frozen, cooked shrimp thawed and cleaned.
Sprinkle with chopped green onions.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the Philadelphia Cream Cheese Product and cocktail sauce until smooth.
3. Spread the mixture onto the crackers, making sure each cracker is covered.
4. Place the shrimp on a baking sheet and season with salt, pepper, and any additional desired seasonings.
5. Bake the shrimp in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until they are cooked through and pink.
6. Remove the shrimp from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Carefully peel the shrimp from their shells and place them on top of the crackers with the cream cheese mixture.
8. Garnish with finely chopped green onions.
9. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Enjoy your delicious Mini Shrimp Cocktail Bites!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
In a saucepan, combine the maple syrup, tomato sauce, vinegar, lemon juice, brown sugar, garlic, ginger and 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper; bring to a boil.
Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, set each rack of ribs on a large rimmed baking sheet, meaty side up, and season all over with salt and pepper.
Roast the ribs for 30 minutes, shifting the pans from top to bottom halfway through cooking.
Brush the ribs with some of the sauce and roast for about 1 1/2 hours longer, brushing with the sauce every 15 minutes and shifting the pans occasionally.
If the pan juices begin to burn, add a few tablespoons of water to the pans and scrape up any caramelized drippings; baste the ribs with the drippings.
Remove from the oven.
Preheat the broiler and position a rack 8 inches from the heat source.
Put both racks of ribs on 1 baking sheet, meaty side down, and brush with the sauce.
Broil the ribs for 2 to 3 minutes, until glazed and lightly crusty.
Turn the ribs, brush with any remaining sauce and broil for about 3 minutes, or until glazed and crusty; transfer to a work surface.
Cut in between the bones, mound the ribs on a platter and serve.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the maple syrup, tomato sauce, red wine vinegar, and fresh lemon juice. Set aside.
3. Season the pork spareribs with salt and pepper.
4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the pork spareribs to the skillet, and cook for about 5-7 minutes, until they are browned on all sides.
6. Remove the pork from the skillet, and place it on a baking sheet. Pour the maple-tomato sauce mixture over the pork, and use a spoon to evenly coat the ribs.
7. Roast the pork in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
8. Remove the pork from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into individual portions.
9. Serve the Maple-Roasted Pork Spareribs with your choice of side dishes, such as mashed potatoes, rice, or a green salad.

Enjoy your delicious Maple-Roasted Pork Spareribs!

gt:
Melt butter and unsweetened baking chocolate in 2-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally, 6-10 minutes or until smooth.
Cool 20 minutes.
Combine melted chocolate mixture, sugar, 1 cup flour, cocoa, eggs, baking powder and salt in bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until well mixed.
Stir in remaining flour and 1 1/2 cups chocolate chips.
Cover; refrigerate at least 2 hours.
Heat oven to 350F.
Shape level tablespoonfuls of dough into balls.
Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 7-9 minutes or until edges are set and cookies begin to crack on top.
Cool 2 minutes on cookie sheets; remove to cooling rack.
Cool completely.
Microwave 1/2 cup chocolate chips and shortening in bowl 1 minute.
Stir until chips are melted.
Drizzle mixture over cooled cookies.
Let stand at least 30 minutes or until chocolate is set.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and shortening until smooth. Add the sugar and continue to cream until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the baking powder and salt.
4. Gradually add the flour and cocoa, mixing until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips.
5. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is fully cooled, cut it into squares and serve.

Enjoy your Triple Chocolate Temptations!

gt:
Heat olive oil in a skillet; add onion and saute until tender.
Add tomatoes and remaining ingredients, and cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring gently.
Pour mixture into a shallow baking dish, and bake at 325 degrees F.
for 15 to 20 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the drained and rinsed canned tomatoes and artichoke hearts to the skillet. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the dried sweet basil leaves, dried parsley, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
6. Serve the Scalloped Tomatoes and Artichokes hot, garnished with additional fresh basil leaves if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large pan on medium then add garlic & zucchini.
Cook for 3 minutes.
Add chopped green pepper.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add can of tomatoes and cook until warmed through.
Drain pasta then portion it on plates & top with generous spoonfuls of the vegetables.
Sprinkle with the two types of cheese.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the zucchini, mushrooms, and green bell pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, melt the butter over low heat.
4. Add the minced garlic to the melted butter and stir until combined.
5. Pour the melted butter mixture over the vegetables in the mixing bowl, and toss to coat evenly.
6. Spread the vegetable mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly browned.
8. In a large pot, combine the canned Italian diced tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
10. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, then drain and set aside.
11. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked pasta, roasted vegetables, and the sauce from the pot.
12. Stir to combine, and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Remove the skin of the luffa vegetables and cut into big chunk.
With oil sautAS doubled dried shrimp / dried prawn / hae bee and dice garlic and shallot till fragrant for 2 to 3 minutes then add small red chili pepper
Add luffa vegetables and water then mix well and bring to a boil with lid cover
Off heat and top spring onion and serve immediately
BELOW ARE FEW RECIPE USING DRIED SHRIMP /DRIED PRAWN / HAE BER ,I AM GLAD TO SHARE WITH YOU
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Wash the luffa thoroughly and cut it into bite-sized pieces.
- Rinse the dried shrimp/prawn and chop it into small pieces.
- Chop the red chili pepper and shallot into small pieces.
- Wash the spring onion and garlic cloves.
- Cut the spring onion into small pieces.
- Cut the garlic cloves in half.
- Rinse the water and set aside.
- Heat the oil in a wok or large pan over medium heat.

2. Cook the dish:
- Add the dried shrimp/prawn and red chili pepper to the hot oil. Cook for a few seconds until the shrimp/prawn turns golden brown.
- Add the chopped shallot and garlic cloves to the wok. Cook until the shallot is softened and the garlic is fragrant.
- Add the spring onion and cook for a few seconds until it becomes slightly wilted.
- Pour the water into the wok and stir to combine the ingredients.
- Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes or until the luffa is tender.
- Season the dish with salt to taste.

3. Serve the dish:
- Serve the Luffa With Dried Shrimp dish over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 300F Wrap tortillas in foil and bake until heated through, 10 to 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, season chicken with salt.
Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large heavy skillet over high heat until very hot.
Add chicken and cook, stirring until browned on all sides, about 6 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl.
Reduce heat to medium and add the remaining 1 teaspoon oil to skillet.
Add onion and cook, stirring, until they start to brown around the edges, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add bell pepper, garlic, jalapeno and cumin.
Cook, stirring, until peppers are bright green but still crisp, 2 to 3 minutes more.
Stir in salsa and reserved chicken.
Cook, stirring, until chicken is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in cilantro.
Spoon into warmed tortillas and garnish with scallions, queso fresco, tomatoes and sour cream.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken strips with the salt, canola oil, and minced garlic. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced onion, green bell pepper, and minced jalapeno pepper.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken mixture and cook until browned and cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
6. Add the onion and bell pepper mixture to the pan, stirring occasionally, and cook until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the prepared hot salsa to the pan, stirring to combine.
8. Return the cooked chicken to the pan and stir to combine.
9. Add the ground cumin and stir to coat the chicken and vegetables evenly.
10. Transfer the chicken and vegetable mixture to a large baking dish.
11. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
12. Serve the Authentic Spicy Chicken Tacos with your choice of garnishes, such as sliced scallions, chopped fresh tomato, reduced-fat sour cream, and chopped fresh cilantro.

[/INST]

Next, marinate the chicken strips with salt, canola oil, and minced garlic for at least 30 minutes. In a separate bowl, mix the sliced onion and green bell pepper with minced jalapeno pepper. Heat a skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat and cook the chicken and vegetable mixture until browned and cook

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Prepare the onion, garlic, tomatoes, and carrots and place them on a cookie sheet.
Cover with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place in the oven and roast for an hour.
Remove the vegetables from the oven and transfer to a food processor.
Puree until completely smooth (or transfer to a large pot and use an immersion blender.
Transfer the pureed vegetables to a large pot and heat of medium low heat.
Pour in the chicken broth and tomato sauce and season with basil.
Add in one tablespoon of sugar and taste, if it still tastes slightly bitter from the tomato sauce slowly add in the other tablespoon of sugar, a little at a time, keep tasting to suit your tastes.
Salt and pepper to taste and reduce heat and allow to simmer 15 minutes so the flavors meld.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]To prepare the ingredients, you can start by washing the onion and garlic thoroughly. Then, you can cut the onion into quarters and chop the garlic head into cloves. Next, you can remove the woody tip from the garlic head and trim the onion into halves. After that, you can halve the roma tomatoes, core and seed them, and chop them into quarters. Finally, you can rough chop the carrots.

To prepare the ingredients for the soup, you can heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, you can add the onion and garlic, stirring occasionally, and cook until the onion is softened and translucent.

Next, you can add the carrots to the pot, stirring occasionally, and cook until they are tender but not mushy. You can then add the chopped roma tomatoes, breaking them up with a spoon if they are too large.

After that, you can pour in the canned tomato sauce and chicken broth, stirring to combine. You can then add the dried basil, sugar, salt, and pepper to taste. You can bring the soup to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and the flavors have melded together.

Once the soup is cooked to your liking, you can serve it hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of fresh basil, if desired. Enjoy your delicious Simple Roasted Tomato Soup!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Arrange the drained pears and peaches in an ungreased 8-inch square or 7 x 11 glass baking dish.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs with a wire whisk until blended.
Beat in 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 cup sour cream and 1 tsp.
vanilla extract until smooth.
Pour over fruit.
In the same bowl, mix all the topping ingredients until crumbly.
Sprinkle over fruit mixture.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes, or until topping is golden brown and center is set.
Cool at least 15 minutes; serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if you like.
Store custard in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, brown sugar, nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
4. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
5. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter with the sliced peaches and pears.
6. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
8. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Streusel Fruit Custard!

gt:
In a heavy sauce pan, whisk together the cocoa, sugar and salt.
Whisk in milk, Frangelico, and eggs.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until steaming hot and starting to thicken, about 6-8 minutes.
Whisk in cream and remove from heat.
Transfer into your freezing container (for a traditional ice cream maker) or into a container with a spout (for a modern ice cream maker where the freezer requires freezing and no outside salt/ice is used in the freezing process) and chill in refrigerator for 4 hours.
When ready to freeze, if using an ice cream maker, follow your manufacturer's directions.
Add crushed biscotti during the final 10 minutes of churning in the freezer or ice cream maker.
Garnish with additional biscotti.
pred:
To craft Gastronomic Gelato Italiano, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the unsweetened cocoa powder, sugar, and sea salt until well combined.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the milk, eggs, and whipped cream until well combined.
3. Gradually pour the cocoa mixture into the milk mixture, whisking continuously to ensure a smooth consistency.
4. Add the Frangelico and whisk until fully combined.
5. Crush the biscotti into small pieces and add them to the mixture.
6. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
7. Once chilled, pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
8. Once the ice cream is fully churned, transfer it to an airtight container and place it in the freezer to harden for at least 2 hours.
9. Once hardened, scoop the gelato into bowls and serve immediately.

This recipe creates a rich, creamy, and decadent Gastronomic Gelato Italiano, perfect for enjoying as a dessert or a treat.

gt:
In a 5-6 quart slow cooker sprayed with vegetable cooking spray, place all ingredients plus 1 soup can of water, and stir well.
Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours.
pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
1. In a large saucepan, combine the cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, and chicken broth.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the rice, celery, and frozen vegetables to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
4. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the vegetables are tender.
5. Season the mixture with poultry seasoning and salt and pepper to taste.
6. Add the cooked turkey or chicken to the saucepan and stir to combine.
7. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes or until the turkey or chicken is fully cooked through and the rice is heated through.
8. Serve the Colorful Rice and Turkey hot.
