gt:
Preheat the oven to 400.
Spread the pistachios in a pie plate and toast for about 5 minutes, or until the nuts are lightly browned.
Let the pistachios cool completely, then coarsely chop them.
In a blender, combine the pistachios with the basil, mint, lime juice, vinegar, mustard, cayenne and olive oil.
Blend at low speed until pureed.
Add the ice cubes and blend at high speed until the sauce is very smooth.
Scrape the basil emulsion into a small bowl and season with salt and black pepper.
Light a grill or heat a lightly oiled grill pan.
Brush the shrimp with vegetable oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Grill them over a hot fire for 1 minute per side, or until lightly charred and just cooked through.
Alternatively, cook the shrimp in the grill pan over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes per side.
Serve the hot shrimp with the basil emulsion alongside for dipping.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the pistachios, basil, mint, lime juice, rice vinegar, dry mustard, and cayenne pepper. Season the shrimp with salt and pepper.
3. Brush the shrimp with olive oil and coat them with the pistachio-basil mixture.
4. Place the shrimp on the grill or grill pan, and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through and the shells are crispy.
5. While the shrimp are cooking, place the ice cubes in a bowl and cover them with a damp cloth.
6. Once the shrimp are cooked, remove them from the grill or grill pan and place them in the bowl with the ice cubes. Let them rest for a few minutes.
7. After the shrimp have rested, remove them from the ice and transfer them to a serving dish.
8. Drizzle the extra-virgin olive oil over the shrimp and serve immediately.

[/SYS]

By following these precise steps, you can create a mouthwatering Grilled Shrimp with Basil Emulsion dish that is both visually appealing and delicious.

gt:
Pre-heat oven to bake at 375
Spray cooking pan with non stick spray and set to the side.
Bring water to boil for noodles.
Once water is hot, add noodles and cook until tender.
Mix all spices, onion, bell pepper, garlic, ground beef and ground Chuck together.
Mix thoroughly before Browning meat.
Brown meat.
Once meat is Brown set to side.
Mix Italian blend cheese, cheddar cheese and parmesan cheese with the meat in a large bowl.
Once cheese has been added, then add the tomatoes, spaghetti sauce and tomato paste to the meat.
Stir together thoroughly.
Add meat mix to baking pan in its entirety.
Add noodles and then mix the meat with the noodles until all ingredients are blended together.
Add mozzarella cheese to the top of the bake.
(I add some extra sprinkles of oregano as well)
Bake at 375 for 45 minutes to an hour, depending upon how Brown you prefer your cheese.
pred:
[<SYS>]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef and ground chuck over medium heat until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook until they are softened.
5. Stir in the garlic, oregano, sweet basil, thyme, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and parmesan cheese. Cook for a few minutes until the cheese is melted and the spices are fragrant.
6. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Pour the tomato paste and tomato sauce over the pasta mixture, and stir to coat everything evenly.
8. Add the shredded mozzarella cheese and stir until it is melted and combined with the other cheeses.
9. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish and top with the remaining shredded mozzarella cheese.
10. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
11. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/SYS]

[<SYS>]
This delicious and comforting dish is perfect for a cozy night in or a gathering with friends and family. The combination of pasta, ground beef, and cheese creates a hearty and satisfying meal that is sure to be a hit. Enjoy!
[/SYS]

gt:
Season pork chop
Combine hot sauce, syrup, brown sugar & butter in microwavable container.
Microwave for about 1 minute or until butter melts.
Stir sauce and spoon or brush over pork chop
(Fire) broil for 10 minutes
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper, then set aside.
3. In a small bowl, mix the hot sauce, syrup, butter, and brown sugar.
4. Heat the oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and let it melt.
5. Place the pork chops in the skillet, and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are browned and cooked through.
6. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and place them on a plate.
7. Pour the sauce mixture over the pork chops, and let it cook for 1-2 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
8. Serve the Hot and Sweet Pork Chops immediately, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

This dish is delicious and easy to prepare, with a balance of flavors from the hot sauce, syrup, and brown sugar. The pork chops are tender and juicy, while the sauce adds a rich and sweet touch.

gt:
Mash butter in a bowl until smooth; stir in coconut sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla extract.
Spread butter mixture onto each piece of toast.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the softened butter, coconut sugar, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract until well combined.
3. Spread the mixture evenly over the two slices of toasted bread.
4. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the coconut sugar mixture is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it into even pieces.

Enjoy your delicious Coconut Sugar Cinnamon Toast!

gt: Add in part of the dry beef in the cheese ball; roll the ball in the rest.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, minced scallions, and Worcestershire sauce until smooth.
3. Add the Buddig dry beef and mix until well combined.
4. Shape the mixture into a ball, and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Bake the beef cheese ball in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
6. Remove the beef cheese ball from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Dried Beef Cheese Ball Recipe!

gt:
Slice tomatoes into medium sized slices.
Slice mozzarella into medium sized slices (not too thin or too thick).
Cut avocados in half lengthwise, remove and discard pits, slice diagonally into medium sized slices, trying to keep them as the same size as the tomatoes and mozzarella slices.
Slice red onion very thinly sliced (if using).
On medium sized plate or platter, arrange tomatoes, avocados, onions, and mozzarella, shingle style - filling the outer rim of plate and working your way into the middle.
Fit in a basil leaf on top of the mozzarella slices.
Lightly salt and sprinkle black pepper over the top to taste.
Drizzle with Fresh Basil Dressing to taste.
Note that all of the dressing is not meant to be used.
Reserve remainder for other use.
(Great on sandwiches, salads, topping for some soups, etc.
).
Decorate with more fresh basil leaves if desired.
Fresh Basil Dressing:.
Blend the basil, oil, mayonnaise, vinegar, shallots or onions, salt and pepper in a blender or food processor until smooth.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
NOTE: If serving this salad for company, you may want to slice the avocado at the last minute because it browns easily.
To prevent this from happening too quickly, you may sprinkle the avocado with lemon juice.
But it's just as easy slicing the avocado at the last minute and fitting it under the tomato slices.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the vine-ripened tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, avocados, red onion (if using), and fresh basil leaves.
3. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Drizzle the olive oil over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
5. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, balsamic vinegar, and shallots or onions.
6. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
7. Transfer the salad to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Remove the salad from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the salad immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degree F. Butter a 9 to 10-inch bundt pan with butter and sprinkle with flour.
Whisk the flour, baking soda, salt and nutmeg together.
Set aside.
Beat the butter until creamy and then add the sugar.
Beat on medium speed until pale and fluffy.
Add the vanilla and then the eggs one at a time.
Reduce the mixer speed to low and mix in the bananas.
Finally, add the sour cream and half the flour mixture.
Wait a minute or two and then add the rest of the flour mixture.
Sprinkle a tablespoon of flour over the chocolate chips and fold into the batter.
Scrape the batter into the bundt pan, rap it against the counter to de-bubble the batter and smooth the top.
Stick it into the 350 degrees F oven for 45 minutes; halfway through, rotate the bundt pan to even the browning process.
It will be done when you stick a toothpick in and it comes out clean.
Wait till it cools down and sprinkle powdered sugar on top.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Stir in the vanilla extract and mashed bananas.
6. Gradually mix in the sour cream and powdered sugar.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
8. Fold in the chocolate chips.
9. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
10. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
11. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious Late Night Chocolate Chip Banana Bread!

gt:
Heat barbecue to medium heat.
Rub chicken with seasoning; grill 6 to 8 min.
on each side or until done (165 degrees F).
Cool completely.
Cut chicken into bite-size pieces; place in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. Season the chicken breasts with the Cajun seasoning, then grill them until cooked through and slightly charred, flipping them halfway through the cooking process.
3. While the chicken is grilling, cook the pasta according to the package instructions. Drain the pasta and set aside.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, spring lettuce mix, grape tomatoes, red pepper, peas, carrots, green onions, and cilantro.
5. In a small bowl, mix the Kraft Rancher's Choice Dressing with the chopped fresh cilantro.
6. Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
7. Add the chicken to the bowl with the pasta mixture and toss everything together to combine.
8. Serve the Grilled Chicken, Veggie and Pasta Salad immediately, allowing the flavors to meld together.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, combine persimmon puree, sugar, lemon juice, orange zest and nutmeg.
Boil for 30 minutes, or until slightly thickened.
Pour into sterilized jars and seal.
Store in the freezer.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 100°C (212°F).
2. In a large, non-reactive saucepan, combine the persimmon puree, sugar, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the mixture thickens slightly.
4. Stir in the orange zest and nutmeg.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Carefully pour the mixture into clean, sterilized jars, leaving about 1/2 inch of headspace.
7. Seal the jars with lids and process them in a boiling water bath canner for 10 minutes.
8. Remove the jars from the canner and let them cool completely.
9. Store the jams in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat butter in tight, fully covered saucepan.
Add onion and garlic, cook over low heat for 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and juice and bring to a boil.
Sprinkle rice on top of tomatoes.
Add salt, pepper cayenne and soup mix.
Cook for 15 minutes.
Then add green pepper, celery, parsley and basil.
If necessary, add a little water or tomato juice and cook for another 5 minutes.
Transfer to a casserole dish and add shrimp, chicken and juices, sliced mushrooms.
Cover tightly.
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes 350F till shrimp are cooked, but not overdone.
pred:
To create a delicious Jambalaya, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the 14 cups of butter over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and crushed garlic, cooking until softened.
3. Add the 1 (28 ounce) can of tomatoes, and cook until the liquid has evaporated.
4. Stir in the 12 cups of long grain rice, and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
5. Add the 1 teaspoon basil, 1 teaspoon salt, 12 teaspoon pepper, and 14 teaspoon cayenne, stirring to combine.
6. Add the 1 tablespoon soup mix, and stir to combine.
7. Add the 12 cups of green pepper, chopped, and 12 cups of celery, sliced, to the pot.
8. Add the 14 cups of dried parsley, and stir to combine.
9. Cook the mixture over medium heat for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
10. Add the cooked shrimp and cubed chicken breasts to the pot, stirring to combine.
11. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the shrimp is cooked through and the chicken is heated through.
12. Serve the Jambalaya hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Jambalaya!

gt:
Cream butter, cheese, and sugar until fluffy.
Blend in remaining ingredients.
Cover and chill.
Press out cookies on un-greased baking sheet.
Sprinkle with colored sugars.
Bake at 375 F 7-8 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and cream cheese until smooth.
3. Add the sugar, egg, lemon rind, and lemon juice, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour and baking powder, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
6. Using a cookie cutter or a round cookie cutter, cut out the dough into desired shapes.
7. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These Lemon-Cheese Spritz Cookies are perfect for a delicious and refreshing dessert or snack. The combination of lemon rind and juice adds a zesty flavor to the cookies, while the cream cheese and butter provide a rich, tender texture. The cookies are easy to make and can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

gt:
Prepare Pasta Salad as directed on package.
Add meat, pickles and tomato; mix lightly.
Serve immediately.
Or, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To create a mouthwatering Patio Pasta Salad dish, follow these steps:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, and then drain and set aside.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, chopped ham, and chopped turkey.
3. Add the diced tomato, and then mix well.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients: mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper.
5. Pour the dressing over the pasta mixture, and then toss to combine.
6. Add the chopped pickles, and then toss again.
7. Serve the Patio Pasta Salad immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

<</SYS>>

This mouthwatering Patio Pasta Salad dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed outdoors or indoors. The combination of flavors and textures from the pasta, ham, turkey, tomato, and pickles creates a delightful and satisfying dish.

gt:
Saute onions in butter in a dutch oven.
If not enough butter add more, 2 TB at a time until enough.
Cook over med-high heat until onions begin to brown and caramelize.
Add brown sugar, add stock and mix well.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer 25 minute season with salt and pepper.
Add sherry and Worcestershire.
If not enough liquid add some water using the beef stock can.
Make bread croutons.
Heat oven to 350F Cut bread to fit soup cups and place bread on cookie sheet.
Drizzle with butter-garlic mixture and bake till crispy, about 7-10 minute.
Put soup into soup cups (ovenproof bowls) and put bread slice on top of each.
Top each with slice of cheese.
Then top each slice with heaping tsp of shredded jack cheese.
Set soup cups in oven on cookie sheet and broil for 1-3 min or till cheese melts.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the brown sugar and cook until the onions are caramelized, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the beef stock, salt, and cracked pepper, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the onions are tender and the flavors have melded together.
7. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. In a small bowl, mix the cooking sherry and Worcestershire sauce.
9. Pour the sherry mixture into the pot with the onion mixture, stirring to combine.
10. Add the melted butter, garlic powder, and shredded monterey jack cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and the soup is smooth.
11. Serve the soup in bowls, garnished with a slice of provolone cheese on top.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a large bowl, toss the lettuce with the radishes and chives.
In a small bowl, whisk the mayonnaise with the buttermilk and vinegar.
Gradually whisk in the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Just before serving, drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss well.
Serve.
pred:
To cook a delicious Bibb-and-Radish Salad with Buttermilk Dressing, follow these steps:

1. Wash and dry the 3 large heads of Bibb lettuce thoroughly.
2. Tear the leaves into bite-sized pieces and set aside.
3. Slice the 8 radishes thinly, and set aside.
4. Chop the snipped chives into small pieces and set aside.
5. In a large bowl, mix the mayonnaise, buttermilk, red wine vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, salt, and freshly ground pepper.
6. Add the torn Bibb lettuce leaves, sliced radishes, and chopped chives to the bowl.
7. Gently toss the ingredients to combine, ensuring that the salad is evenly coated with the dressing.
8. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

This delicious salad can be enjoyed as a light and refreshing side dish or as a main course, depending on the portion size. The combination of the crunchy lettuce, tender radishes, and the tangy dressing creates a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Combine fruit, sugar and lemon juice in a large saucepan.
Bring slowly to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves.
Stir in liquid pectin.
Return to a rolling boil.
Boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Skim foam if necessary.
Ladle hot jam into hot jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.
Adjust two-piece caps.
Process 10 minutes in a boiling-water canner.
(Note: Add appropriate additional processing time for high altitudes).
Recipe variation:.
Add 1 teaspoon whole cloves, 1/2 teaspoon whole allspice and 1 cinnamon stick tied in a spice bag to jam during cooking.
Remove spice bag before filling jars.
pred:
1. Wash and peel the peaches or pears, and remove the pits and cores.
2. In a large bowl, combine the peeled and chopped peaches or pears, sugar, and lemon juice.
3. Stir to mix well.
4. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and let the mixture sit at room temperature for about 3-4 hours, or until the peaches or pears are tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.
5. Stir the mixture again, and let it sit for another 30 minutes.
6. After 30 minutes, stir the mixture again, and then let it sit for another 30 minutes.
7. Stir the mixture one last time, and then pour it into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Cover the dish with plastic wrap, and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until the mixture has set.
9. Remove the dish from the refrigerator, and let it sit at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes before cutting it into desired slices.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Melt butter and mix with cocoa powder.
Alternate adding in powdered sugar and milk, mixing the whole time.
You may have to add more powdered sugar if it needs to be thickened.
Mix in lime juice.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, cream the melted butter or margarine and cocoa powder together until smooth and well combined.
2. Gradually add the powdered sugar, mixing until fully incorporated.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, lime juice, and extra milk.
4. Slowly pour the milk mixture into the butter and cocoa mixture, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
5. Once the mixture is smooth and creamy, add more milk if needed to achieve the desired consistency.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. After chilling, the frosting is ready to use. Spread it on cakes, cookies, or other desserts for a delicious, tangy, and chocolatey treat.

[/INST]

gt:
In medium bowl, mix shredded meat from roasted chicken, cilantro, and enchilada sauce.
Place 1 flour tortilla in 10- to 12-inch skillet.
Top with half of chicken mixture and 1/3 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese; repeat layering, then top with 1 final tortilla.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese; bake at 450F 8 to 10 minutes, or until heated through and cheese has melted.
To serve, top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and diced avocado.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken, chopped cilantro, green chile enchilada sauce, and Monterey Jack cheese. Mix well.
3. Spread a layer of the chicken mixture onto the bottom of a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.
4. Place the three flour tortillas on top of the chicken mixture, overlapping them slightly.
5. Spread the shredded lettuce or spinach evenly over the tortillas.
6. Pour the remaining chicken mixture over the top of the tortillas and lettuce.
7. Dice the tomatoes and avocado, and sprinkle them evenly over the top of the chicken mixture.
8. Bake the Triple Decker Tortilla Pie in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Triple Decker Tortilla Pie!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Whisk cocoa powder, ancho chile powder, cumin, black pepper, and chipotle pepper in a bowl.
Set aside.
Generously season tenderloins with salt, then coat in the cocoa powder mixture.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Place tenderloins in the skillet and reduce heat to medium.
Cook until browned on each side, about 4 minutes.
Transfer tenderloins to a baking dish; cook in the preheated oven until pork is slightly pink in the center, about 20 minutes.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
Whisk cherry preserves, vinegar, and oregano in a small saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil and cook 30 seconds.
Remove from heat; season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon sauce over pork tenderloin and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the ground ancho chile pepper, cumin, black pepper, and dried chipotle pepper.
3. Season the pork tenderloins with the spice mixture, then season with kosher salt.
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork tenderloins and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the cherry preserves, white vinegar, and oregano. Cook over medium heat until the preserves have melted and the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Place the pork tenderloins back in the skillet and cook until the meat is cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
8. Remove the pork from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Cocoa Cherry Pork dish over a bed of rice or your preferred side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Layer arugula, blood oranges, goat cheese, walnuts and pomegranate arils on a platter or in a bowl.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together pomegranate juice, lemon juice, Dijon and honey.
Slowly whisk in olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle dressing on salad and toss to combine.
pred:
1. Wash the fresh arugula thoroughly to remove any dirt or pesticides.
2. Cut the peeled blood oranges into rounds and remove the seeds.
3. Crumble the honey goat cheese using a fork or your hands.
4. Toast the chopped walnuts in a dry pan over medium heat until they are fragrant and slightly golden.
5. Combine the arugula, blood orange rounds, crumbled honey goat cheese, toasted walnuts, pomegranate arils, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and honey in a large bowl.
6. Whisk the olive oil, salt, and pepper together to create a vinaigrette.
7. Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
8. Serve the salad immediately, garnished with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil and a sprinkle of coarse salt and ground black pepper.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and visually appealing Arugula, Blood Orange & Honey Goat Cheese Salad.

gt:
Cut chicken into bite sized pieces.
Saute chicken pieces in a little olive oil until browned.
While chicken is browning, combine the ranch and Italian dressings in measuring glass or bowl.
When chicken in browned, pour dressing mixture in and cook on low heat until mixture is just beginning to boil and beat throughout.
Pour chicken mix over egg noodles or pasta.
Sauce can easily be doubled.
pred:
To cook a delightful Italian Ranch Chicken dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through. This should take about 5-7 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine 12 cups of Italian dressing and 12 cups of ranch dressing. Stir until well combined.
6. Add the cooked chicken breasts to the bowl with the dressing mixture. Toss the chicken to coat it evenly with the sauce.
7. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This Italian Ranch Chicken dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of Italian dressing and ranch dressing, creating a unique and delightful taste. The chicken is tender and juicy, while the sauce adds a rich and creamy element to the dish.

gt:
Sift and measure the flour.
Re-sift the flour with the other dry ingredients.
Work the butter into the dry ingredients with your fingers.
Add the dried fruit to the flour mixture and mix thoroughly.
Add the milk and mix until just incorporated.
Do not over mix.
Divide the dough into two equal parts.
On an ungreased cookie sheet, pat into a round about the thickness of a biscuit (about 3/4 to 1 inch thick).
Cut into wedge shaped pieces, like a pie and bake for 15 minutes at 450 degrees.
Serve warm with fresh Clotted Cream (see my recipe box for my Clotted Cream recipe).
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
3. Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients. Using your hands or a pastry cutter, mix the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the milk and stir until the dough comes together. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more milk, a tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. Fold in the dried strawberries, cherries, and blueberries.
6. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and shape it into a disk.
7. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured baking sheet and pat it down to form a 1/2-inch thick circle.
8. Bake the scones for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and firm to the touch.
9. Remove the scones from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet. Then, transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Very Berry Scones!

gt:
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Evenly coat the bottom of two 13-by-9-inch baking dishes with 1 cup of the gravy each.
Mix the cheeses together in a large bowl until evenly combined, and line a baking sheet with paper towels; set aside.
Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking, about 5 minutes.
Test the oil temperature by carefully dipping the edge of a tortilla in the oilit should bubble vigorously.
Once the oil is hot, use a metal spatula to carefully submerge the tortillas one at a time until bubbles form around each, about 5 to 10 seconds.
Flip and fry an additional 5 seconds or until the edges of each tortilla are slightly crisp but not browned.
Transfer to the prepared baking sheet and arrange in a single layer.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas, separating the layers with paper towels.
Blot the tortillas with paper towels to soak up any excess oil, then fill each with 2 heaping tablespoons of the cheese mixture and 2 teaspoons onion.
Roll to enclose the filling and set the tortillas in the baking dishes, seam side down, placing 12 enchiladas in each dish.
Evenly distribute the remaining 1 cup gravy over both baking dishes and top with the remaining 2 1/2 cups cheese.
Bake until the enchiladas are hot and bubbly, about 25 to 30 minutes.
Let cool about 10 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-5 minutes.
3. Add the shredded cheddar cheese and Monterey Jack cheese to the skillet. Cook until the cheese is melted and the mixture is smooth, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the Chile Gravy to the skillet, stirring to combine.
5. Place the corn tortillas on a flat surface, and spoon a small amount of the cheese mixture onto the center of each tortilla.
6. Roll the tortillas up, enclosing the cheese filling, and place them seam-side down in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
7. Pour any remaining cheese mixture over the enchiladas, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the enchiladas are hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the Cheese Enchiladas hot, garnished with sour cream, guacamole, or your preferred toppings.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat the oil in a heavy pot (wide enough to hold the artichokes with room to spare) over medium-high heat until it just begins to smoke.
Stand the artichokes cut sides down in the oil, wait a minute, then reduce the heat to medium-low, sprinkle in the garlic and salt, and cook, without stirring, just until the garlic turns golden and smells toasty, about 3 minutes.
Pour in the wine, cover the pot and cook, without stirring, at a vigorous simmer until you can insert a sharp knife into the thick artichoke bottoms with barely any resistance, about 25 minutes.
Five minutes or so before theyre fully tender, scatter on the capers and cover again.
Uncover, raise the heat to medium-high, and bring the liquid to a boil.
Cook until all the wine has evaporated (the bubbling sound will become a sizzle), about 3 minutes.
Add the mint and keep cooking the artichokes in the oil (its OK if a few of them tip over), until the cut sides of the artichokes are deep golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
Lower the heat if necessary to prevent the artichokes from getting too dark.
Arrange the artichokes prettily on a plate, and scoop the capers, oil and slightly crispy mint over top.
Serve straightaway or at room temperature.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the baby artichokes with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the artichokes are tender and slightly browned.
3. While the artichokes are roasting, in a small saucepan, heat the white wine over medium heat until it simmers. Add the capers and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the capers are softened and the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the roasted artichokes from the oven and let them cool slightly.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the roasted artichokes, white wine sauce, and mint leaves. Toss everything together until well combined.
6. Serve the pot-roasted artichokes immediately, or refrigerate the mixture for a few hours to allow the flavors to meld together.

[/SYS]

Note: If you prefer a different type of mint, you can substitute it for the black mint leaves. Just make sure to use enough leaves to give the dish a burst of fresh, minty flavor.

gt:
Combine the sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, cocoa, and salt, sift in the flour (to remove some of the larger pieces particularly in whole wheat flour), and mix.
Mash the bananas.
Add the water, skim milk, vanilla, and egg to the mashed bananas and mix.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients and stir.
Heat the griddle to medium/medium-high, and spray with non-stick cooking spray.
Pour the batter into the griddle.
Flip when bubbles appear.
Cook until golden brown on both sides.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, unbleached all-purpose flour, sugar or Splenda sugar substitute, salt, cinnamon, cocoa powder, baking powder, and vanilla extract.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the water, skim milk, and egg whites or egg substitute.
3. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
4. Fold in the mashed bananas.
5. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Pour the batter onto the pan, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Cook the pancakes until bubbles appear on the surface and the edges are slightly dry, about 2-3 minutes per side.
6. Serve the pancakes warm, topped with your favorite fruit, syrup, or yogurt.

[/INST]

gt:
Peel and separate sections of oranges.
Remove white pith from sections.
If any slices are too wide, slice them in half lengthwise.
Place orange sections in a bowl, and pour honey on top.
Stir gently to blend well.
Place in the fridge for about 20 minutes to chill.
Chop the dates.
Toast pine nuts (or almonds) in a nonstick pan for 2 minutes.
Chop the mint leaves.
Take the bowl with the oranges out of the fridge, and add all of the remaining ingredients.
Sprinkle cinnamon over it, then top with coconut, if desired!
pred:
1. Wash and peel the Navel Oranges, removing the seeds and membranes. Cut the oranges into segments, reserving the segments for the salad.
2. In a small bowl, mix the honey and the chopped dates.
3. Toast the pine nuts or almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until they become fragrant and lightly browned.
4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped oranges, dates, pine nuts or almonds, and mint leaves.
5. Add the cinnamon and shredded coconut (if using) to the bowl, and toss everything together to mix well.
6. Serve the Orange Date Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

This Orange Date Salad is a delicious and refreshing dish that can be enjoyed as a snack or a light meal. The combination of the sweetness of the honey, the tanginess of the oranges, and the earthy flavors of the pine nuts or almonds, mint, and cinnamon creates a delightful and satisfying taste experience.

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Line a rimmed baking pan with aluminum foil.
Place a rack on top of foil.
Rub olive oil on both sides of chicken and generously season with salt and black pepper.
Arrange lemon slices and rosemary on the rack and place chicken, skin-side up, onto the rack.
Roast in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 45 to 55 minutes.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Transfer chicken to a serving platter and tent a piece of aluminum foil over it.
Discard lemon and rosemary and remove rack.
Pour wine into the baking pan and gently loosen the bits of food in the pan with a wooden spoon, being careful not to tear the foil.
Strain pan juices into a saucepan and bring to a boil; cook until sauce is slightly reduced, about 5 minutes.
Spoon sauce over chicken.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, then place it in the bowl with the olive oil mixture. Toss the chicken to coat it evenly.
4. Heat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
5. Place the chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Roast the chicken for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing it into portions.
8. While the chicken is resting, prepare the lemon and rosemary butter.
9. In a small bowl, mix the lemon zest, juice, and rosemary leaves.
10. In a small saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat until it is melted and foamy.
11. Slowly pour the lemon and rosemary butter mixture into the saucepan with the melted butter, stirring constantly.
12. Cook the sauce over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until it reaches your desired consistency.
13. Serve the chicken with the lemon and rosemary butter sauce on the side.

Enjoy your delicious Butterflied Roast Chicken with Lemon and Rosemary dish!

gt:
Combine above ingredients in a medium bowl, mix well.
Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes prior to serving.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the hidden valley ranch dressing mix with the mayonnaise.
2. In a larger bowl, combine the buttermilk, black pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. Gradually pour the mayonnaise mixture into the buttermilk mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Spicy Ranch Dressing over salads, sandwiches, or as a dip for chicken wings or other dishes.

This Spicy Ranch Dressing recipe combines the tangy flavor of the buttermilk with the creaminess of the mayonnaise, and adds a spicy kick from the paprika and garlic powder. The result is a delicious and flavorful dressing that can be enjoyed on a variety of dishes.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt the mint chocolate chips in a double boiler.
In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar.
Blend in the melted chocolate.
Add the corn syrup.
Sift and gradually add the dry ingredients.
Roll into one inch balls and dip tops in white sugar.
Place 3 inches apart on greased cookie sheet.
Bake about 8 minutes.
Watch as they burn easily.
pred:
[/INST]

For Grandma's Chocolate Mint Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the karo white corn syrup, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Fold in the mint chocolate chips.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Grandma's Chocolate Mint Cookies!

gt:
Boil raisins for 2 to 3 minutes, reserving raisin water.
Cream margarine and sugar.
Add eggs, oatmeal and 9 tablespoons raisin water.
Add flour, baking soda, spices and salt.
Stir in raisins.
Drop by a rounded teaspoonful onto cookie sheet.
Bake 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10-12 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the raisins, water, and melted butter. Mix well.
3. Add the white sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt to the bowl. Mix until a smooth dough forms.
5. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

The cooking procedure for Oatmeal Raisin Cookies III involves several steps, including preparing the dough, chilling it, rolling it out, cutting it into desired shapes, and baking it. The dough is made by combining the raisins, water, and melted butter, then adding the remaining ingredients like white sugar, eggs, and flour. After chilling the dough, it is rolled out and cut into shapes using cookie cutters or a knife. The cookies are then baked in the oven at a high temperature until they are golden brown around the edges. Finally, the cookies are removed from the oven, allowed to cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet, and then transferred to a wire rack to cool completely.

gt:
In a medium bowl, combine the eggs and basil; set aside.
Heat the oil in a large oven proof skillet.
Add the corn, zucchini, and green onions.
Cook and stir for 3 minutes; add tomatoes and cook uncovered over medium heat about 5 additional minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Pour the egg mixture over vegetables in skillet and cook over medium heat.
As the mixture sets, run a spatula around edge of skillet, lifting egg mixture so uncooked portion runs underneath.
Continue cooking and lifting edges until egg mixture is almost set, the surface of the frittata will be moist.
Sprinkle with cheese and place the skillet under broiler 4 to 5 inches from heat.
Broil 1 to 2 minutes or until the top is set and cheese is melted.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the crushed basil or dried basil, and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
4. Add the frozen corn and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the corn is heated through.
5. Add the thinly sliced zucchini and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender.
6. Add the thinly sliced green onions and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until they are slightly wilted.
7. Add the chopped roma tomato and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the tomatoes are heated through.
8. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well combined.
9. Add the cooked corn, zucchini, green onions, and tomatoes to the egg mixture.
10. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Pour the egg mixture into a well-greased 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
12. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the egg mixture.
13. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is fully cooked.
14. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Corn Frittata With Cheese!

gt:
Beat milk, pudding and 1/2 of the whipped topping in medium bowl with wire whisk 1 minute.
(Mixture will be thick.)
Spread in crust.
Spread remaining whipped topping over pudding layer in crust.
Enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
Garnish as desired.
pred:
To create a delicious 5 Minute - Double Layer Chocolate Pie, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs using a rolling pin or a food processor.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed graham crackers, melted butter, and sugar. Mix until well combined. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie dish.
4. Bake the pie crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden. Remove from the oven and let it cool completely.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chocolate instant pudding mix and milk. Whisk until smooth and well combined.
6. In a separate bowl, whisk the non-dairy topping until smooth.
7. Pour the chocolate pudding mixture over the cooled pie crust.
8. Spread the non-dairy topping evenly over the chocolate pudding layer.
9. Bake the pie for 30-35 minutes, or until the filling is set and the pie is slightly puffed.
10. Allow the pie to cool completely before cutting and serving.

Enjoy your delicious 5 Minute - Double Layer Chocolate Pie!

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Adjust salt and pepper.
Serve with tortilla chips.
pred:
To make a delicious Cowboy Caviar dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the black-eyed peas, minced jalapeno pepper, minced garlic, and apple cider vinegar. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 30 minutes to marinate.

2. In a small bowl, mix the canola oil, green onions, salt, and pepper.

3. After the marinating time has passed, drain the black-eyed peas and discard the marinade.

4. Add the marinated black-eyed peas to the bowl with the canola oil mixture, and toss to coat the peas evenly.

5. Serve the Cowboy Caviar immediately, garnished with additional green onions if desired.

This dish combines the flavors of black-eyed peas, jalapeno, garlic, and apple cider vinegar, creating a unique and delicious Cowboy Caviar experience. The addition of the canola oil mixture and green onions adds a touch of freshness and depth to the dish.

gt:
Mix lemon juice, 3 tablespoons olive oil, and sage leaves in a large container and place turkey breast halves into the marinade.
Allow meat to marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature, turning turkey breasts over occasionally.
Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Remove turkey breasts from marinade and reserve the marinade and sage leaves.
Sprinkle turkey on both sides with sea salt and black pepper.
Grill turkey breasts on the preheated grill until they show grill marks, the meat is no longer pink inside, and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 30 minutes.
Turn turkey pieces over after 15 minutes.
While turkey is grilling, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil with unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot and bubbling.
Pour reserved marinade, including sage leaves, into the oil and butter and cook, stirring often, until the marinade has evaporated and the sage leaves are crisply fried, 10 to 15 minutes.
Transfer grilled turkey breasts to a cutting board and season again with salt and black pepper if desired; thickly slice the turkey on the diagonal and arrange on a platter, topped by fried sage leaves and garnished with lemon halves.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
3. Season the turkey breast halves with the prepared mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Place the turkey breast halves on the grill or grill pan, skin side down, and cook for 4-5 minutes or until the skin is golden brown and crispy.
5. Flip the turkey breast halves and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the turkey breast halves from the grill or grill pan and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin pieces.
7. In a small bowl, mix the butter, sage leaves, and lemon juice.
8. Place the turkey breast slices on a serving platter and drizzle the sage butter mixture over them.
9. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Grilled Turkey Breast with Fresh Sage Leaves.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Mix lentils, onion, oats, and cheese in a large bowl and mix well.
Add the beaten egg and mix well.
Add about 1/2 c of sauce, garlic, basil, salt, and pepper.
Add remaining sauce so long as the mixture will not be too sloppy.
Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray and pour/scrape the lentil mixture into it.
Even out the top surface with a spatula or fork.
Bake uncovered 30-40 minutes or until top is golden and crispy.
Let cool at least 5 minutes.
Turn out onto serving platter and garnish with parsley, if desired.
Variations:.
Add chopped celery, different sauces, different cheeses (or no cheese!)
or try more traditional poultry spices instead of the Italian ones.
Serve with all the 'fixins: mushroom gravy, mashed potatoes, squash, and salad.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked lentils, slightly mashed or drained canned lentils, onion, rolled oats, grated cheddar cheese, beaten egg, tomato sauce, garlic powder, dried basil, seasoning salt, and black pepper.
3. Mix well until the ingredients are evenly distributed.
4. Pour the mixture into a loaf pan, lined with parchment paper or sprayed with cooking spray.
5. Bake the loaf for 45-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the loaf to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the pan and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once cooled, slice the loaf into desired portions and serve.

This Lentil Oat Loaf is a delicious and nutritious meal that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of lentils, oats, and cheese provides a satisfying texture and a balanced mix of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats. The tomato sauce adds a rich, savory flavor, while the garlic and basil enhance the overall taste. The seasoning salt and black pepper provide a subtle, yet flavorful kick, making this loaf a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
You need HEAT RESISTANT earthenware cups, saucers, and a heatproof coaster.
You need 4 cls of cognac, but the Zaar recipe editor would not allow me to post that - which is about a 1 jigger measure.
Place the cup in the saucer (it is preferable to put the saucer on a plate or tray).
Fill the coffee cup with cold coffee, up to two centimetres below the top of the cup, then slowly pour 1 cl of the Cognac onto the coffee (best to use the back of a tea/coffee spoon, so it floats and can catch light).
Pour the remaining 3 cls of Cognac into the saucer, then place 2 3 sugar cubes in the cognac.
Light the sugar cubes with a match; the Cognac will slowly ignite, heating the coffee and combining with the sugar to form a Cognac liqueur.
(It is important to let the Cognac burn and extinguish naturally; if not, too much alcohol will remain in the mixture, and the special 'alchemy' between the coffee and the Cognac will be lost.
).
When the flame has extinguished, wait for a little while for the handle to cool down, place the cup on the coaster.
Empty all or part of the contents of the saucer into the cup (depending on personal taste and sweetness required).
Your Brulot Charentais is now ready to drink.
Salut!
pred:
To make Brulot Charentais - Angel's Flames - French Flambe Coffee, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, combine the cold brewed coffee, cognac, and sugar.
2. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is warm.
3. Carefully ignite the mixture with a long-handled lighter or a flame-proof spoon. This will create a flame effect, which is the signature feature of Brulot Charentais.
4. Continue to cook the mixture for about 30 seconds, or until the flames subside and the coffee has reached the desired temperature.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Pour the Brulot Charentais - Angel's Flames - French Flambe Coffee into a coffee mug or a heat-resistant glass.
7. Enjoy your delicious and visually appealing Brulot Charentais - Angel's Flames - French Flambe Coffee.

This recipe combines the rich flavors of cold brewed coffee, cognac, and sugar, creating a warm and inviting beverage that is both delicious and visually striking. The flame effect adds an element of excitement and sophistication to the drink, making it a perfect choice for a special occasion or a unique coffee experience.

gt:
Combine all filling ingredients in bowl.
Divide into 4 equal portions.
Wrap each in plastic food wrap; freeze at least 30 minutes.
Heat oven to 350F.
Flatten each chicken breast to about 1/4-inch thickness by pounding between sheets of waxed paper.
Place 1 portion frozen filling onto each flattened breast.
Roll and tuck in edges of chicken; secure with toothpicks.
Melt 1/4 cup butter in 8-inch square baking dish in oven.
Combine all remaining chicken ingredients in small bowl.
Dip chicken rolls in melted butter; coat with crumb mixture.
Place chicken into prepared baking dish; sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake 50-60 minutes or until chicken is fork tender.
Remove toothpicks before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the softened butter, chopped green onion, chopped fresh parsley, salt, pepper, and dried thyme leaves.
3. Add the chicken breasts to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the butter mixture.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the panko bread crumbs, chopped fresh parsley, salt, and coarsely ground pepper.
5. Dip each chicken breast into the butter mixture, then coat it with the panko bread crumb mixture.
6. Place the breaded chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and golden brown.
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into individual pieces.
9. Serve the Country-Style Chicken Kiev hot, garnished with additional chopped fresh parsley if desired.

This recipe provides a delicious and satisfying meal, using the provided ingredients to create a flavorful and visually appealing dish. The combination of the buttery, herb-infused breading and the tender, juicy chicken creates a satisfying and comforting meal that can be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Process first 3 ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
Transfer strawberry mixture to a large bowl; fold in whipped topping.
Spoon into 6 (6-ounce) dessert dishes.
Cover and chill at least 4 hours.
pred:
1. First, gather all the ingredients: 1 12 cups fresh strawberries, 1 (8 ounce) container light cream cheese, 12 cup powdered sugar, and 1 34 cups frozen fat-free whipped topping, thawed.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the strawberries, light cream cheese, and powdered sugar. Mix until smooth and well combined.

3. Add the thawed frozen fat-free whipped topping to the mixture and continue to mix until the desired consistency is reached. This may require a bit of extra mixing to ensure the whipped topping is fully incorporated.

4. Carefully pour the mixture into individual serving cups or a large serving bowl, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until firm.

5. Serve the Cream Cheese Strawberry Mousse immediately or refrigerate for a few more hours for a firmer texture.

6. Enjoy your delicious Cream Cheese Strawberry Mousse - Weight Watchers dessert!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
In a small bowl combine the first amount of flour and baking soda.
Set aside.
In another small bowl toss the raspberries with the second amount of flour.
Set aside.
In a large bowl mash the bananas until they are very, very mashed.
Whisk in the brown sugar, Greek yogurt, egg, and milk until they are thoroughly combined.
Stir in the flour.
Lumps are OK.
Fold in the raspberries and chocolate chips, saving some to sprinkle on top.
Pour batter into the loaf pan and top with the remaining raspberries and chocolate chips.
Bake for 50-55 minutes.
pred:
[INST]To make a delicious Chocolate Chip Raspberry Banana Bread, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and raspberries.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the brown sugar, Greek yogurt, egg, milk, and melted butter.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.

gt:
Pour milk into large bowl.
Add dry pudding mixes.
Beat with wire whisk 2 min.
(Mixture will be thick.)
Gently stir in half of the whipped topping.
Spread half of the pudding mixture onto bottom of crust; cover with half of the cranberry sauce.
Sprinkle with walnuts; cover with remaining pudding mixture.
Refrigerate several hours or until set.
Top with remaining whipped topping just before serving.
Garnish with fresh cranberries, if desired.
Serve with remaining cranberry sauce.
Store leftover pie in refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cold milk, JELL-O Cheesecake Flavor Instant Pudding, and COOL WHIP Whipped Topping. Mix until smooth.
3. Pour the mixture into the prepared graham cracker crust.
4. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
5. Meanwhile, prepare the cranberry sauce by combining the canned cranberry sauce with the divided Cool Whip.

gt:
FOR Creamy Maple Syrup: Combine sugar, 1/2 cup evaporated milk, syrup and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in small saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved.
Remove from heat; stir in 2 tablespoons butter.
Makes 1 1/2 cups.
FOR FRENCH TOAST: whisk together eggs, remaining 1 cup evaporated milk, vanilla extract and cinnamon in medium bowl.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Dip 4 slices bread in milk mixture and then place in skillet.
Cook about 2 minutes per side or until golden.
Repeat 2 more times with with 2 tablespoons butter and remaining bread.
Keep warm in oven.
Serve with warm Creamy Maple Syrup.
Refrigerate any leftover syrup for another use.
Tip: One 12 fl.
oz.
can is all the evaporated milk you will need for this recipe.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, evaporated milk, maple-flavored pancake syrup, and vanilla extract.
2. In a separate bowl, mix together the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, and 2 tablespoons of butter.
3. Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, then coat it with the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
4. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. Add the buttered side of the bread slices to the skillet or griddle, and cook until golden brown, flipping once.
6. Serve the French Toast with a dollop of Creamy Maple Syrup on top.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C).
Beat egg whites with fork.
Stir in vegetable oil, vanilla, and lemon rind.
Blend in sugar until mixture thickens.
Measure flour by dipping method or by sifting.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt; blend into egg mixture.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls about 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet.
Flatten with oiled bottom of glass dipped in sugar.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until a delicate brown.
Remove from baking sheet immediately.
pred:
[COOK]
To make Stir and Drop Sugar Cookies II, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 3 egg whites, 2/3 cup vegetable oil, and 1 teaspoon lemon zest. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the 3/4 cup white sugar, 2 cups all-purpose flour, and 2 teaspoons baking powder to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Add the 1/2 teaspoon salt to the mixture and stir until well combined.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a splash of water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the desired consistency is reached.
6. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or until the dough is firm enough to handle.
7. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
8. Cut out the cookies using a cookie cutter or a round cookie cutter.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Stir and Drop Sugar Cookies II!

gt:
Mix shortening, sugar and eggs together.
Then sift flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt.
Add to egg mixture and stir well.
Once it is mixed, chill in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
Roll into a ball about the size of a walnut.
Roll the ball in a cinnamon sugar mixture of 2 tablespoons sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon.
Place on an ungreased baking sheet, cook at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly brown.
Yummy, easy cookies.
Enjoy.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Combine the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating between the flour mixture and the sugar mixture, mixing well after each addition.
6. Stir in the cinnamon and any additional desired flavors.
7. Roll the dough into small balls and place them on a greased baking sheet.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Snickerdoodles!

gt:
Several hours before baking:.
In a small bowl, combine flour and salt.
In a food processor, combine 1/2 cup confectioner's sugar, pecans, and coconut.
Process till pecans are finely ground.
With electric mixer, beat butter till creamy.
Add the pecan mixture, beat till well blended.
Beat in lime zest and vanilla.
Scrape down sides of bowl and add flour mixture beating until just combined.
Remove the dough from the bowl, wrap in plastic and chill until firm, about 3 hours.
To bake:.
Heat oven to 350*F. Measure the dough into heaping teaspoon size pieces and roll each piece between the palm of your hands to form a ball.
Place the balls 1 1/2" apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake until edges of cookies just begin to brown., 12 to 14 minutes.
Let cool on cookie sheets 3 to 4 minutes, then roll in confectioner's sugar while they are still very warm.
Repeat rolling to create a delicate powdery coating.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the softened butter and lime zest until smooth.
4. Add the vanilla extract and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the sugar to the butter mixture, mixing until the dough comes together.
6. Add the coconut and pecans to the dough, mixing until well combined.
7. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
8. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
9. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 1 inch (2.5 cm) apart.
10. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

These Lime Nut Buttons are a delicious and refreshing treat that can be enjoyed as a snack or served as a dessert. The combination of the crunchy pecans, sweet coconut, and tangy lime flavors creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors.

gt:
* If using any other egg replacer you'll need to add 1 tsp of xanthan gum to your dry ingredients.
My egg replacer already has xanthan gum in it
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F and line a 12 hole cupcake tin with paper liners
Mix the flour, starch, baking powder, baking soda, salt and xanthan if using together in a large bowl
Mix the sugar, milk, mixed egg replacer, oil, vanilla and lemon juice in another
Mix the wet ingredients into the dry and beat smooth
Pour into the cupcake liners, 3/4 full, and bake for 15 - 20 minutes until nicely domed and a toothpick tests clean
Let cool completely on a wire rack
Meanwhile put the icing sugar, cocoa, butter, vanilla and coffee in a bowl and beat together
Beat until smooth.
If you like your icing thicker just add extra icing sugar
Chill for an hour while the cupcakes cool, then frost them
These are best eaten the same day you make them.
You can part freeze them, then individually double wrap in clingfilm and continue freezing them in a lidded container, then defrost unwrapped as required
You can leave out the cocoa as I've done (I discovered I forgot to buy more....) for a plain coffee icing.
I actually mixed 2 tbsp of ground flaxseed through my icing instead of adding extra icing sugar to compensate and it gave a great speckled effect and texture
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the potato starch, sorghum flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the rice milk, sugar, egg replacer, coconut oil, vanilla extract, lemon juice, and melted coconut oil.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fill cupcake liners with the batter, about 3/4 full.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.
8. To make the frosting, combine the coffee, cocoa powder (if using), and vanilla extract in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the frosting reaches your desired consistency.
9. Once the cupcakes are cooled, spread a layer of frosting on top of each cupcake.
10. If desired, you can add a sprinkle of cocoa powder or a drizzle of melted chocolate on top for extra flavor and decoration.

Enjoy your delicious Vickys Vanilla Cupcakes with Coffee/Mocha Icing!

gt:
In large coffee mug, combine cocoa, sugar and salt.
Microwave milk in microwaveable cup or bowl for about 1 1/2 minutes.
Slowly add hot milk to cocoa mixture while stirring.
Stir in vanilla and cinnamon and microwave an additional 30 seconds.
Stir well and enjoy!
pred:
1. In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
2. Add the cocoa and sugar, stirring to combine.
3. Add the salt, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Stir in the ground cinnamon (cinnamon sugar) to taste.
7. Serve the hot Cinna-Chocolate in a mug, garnished with whipped cream and a sprinkle of ground cinnamon if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Momma's Hot Cinna-Chocolate!

gt:
Heat milk, sugar and coffee in a medium saucepan over medium heat until boiling.
Reduce heat to low and add chocolate and caramels, stir until caramels are completely melted.
Pour into mugs and garnish with sweetened whipped cream, chocolate shavings and a caramel.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Caramel Mocha Hot Chocolate, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, combine 4 cups of whole milk and 1/4 cup of granulated sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.

2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the mixture has thickened slightly.

3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of instant coffee powder. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.

4. In a separate saucepan, melt 8 ounces of chopped semi-sweet chocolate over low heat.

5. Stir the melted chocolate into the milk mixture.

6. Add 8 pieces of Werthers soft chewy caramels or any soft caramel candy to the mixture. Stir until the caramels are melted and well combined.

7. Pour the Caramel Mocha Hot Chocolate mixture into a mug or a large glass.

8. Optionally, you can add a small amount of whipped cream or a sprinkle of cocoa powder on top for extra flavor and presentation.

Enjoy your delicious Caramel Mocha Hot Chocolate!

gt:
Place all of the peach ingredients into a bowl, mix together, turn in over a medium heat, and bring to a boil for about 1 minute to dissolve.
Be careful not to let it boil over.
Pour into a container, let cool, and place it into the fridge to solidify; during that time, prepare the next color so you can save time.
Make the white color in the same manner as step 1.
Pour over the solidified step 2, let cool, and place into the fridge.
Make the green color in the same manner as step 1.
Pour on top of a solidified step 4, let cool, and place in the fridge.
Cut into rhombus shapes after it solidifies, garnish, and it is done.

1. In a saucepan, heat the strawberry syrup over medium heat until it reaches a boil.
2. Add the Kanten powder to the boiling syrup, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
3. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring continuously to ensure the Kanten powder is fully incorporated.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the Kanten powder has fully dissolved and the mixture has thickened slightly.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the melon syrup, stirring to combine.
7. Gradually pour in the remaining milk, stirring continuously to ensure the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
8. Return the saucepan to the heat and let the mixture come to a boil.
9. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
10. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
11. Pour the mixture into a mold or a container with a spout, allowing it to set in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until it has fully set.
12. Once the jelly is set, carefully remove it from the mold or container and cut it into desired shapes using a sharp knife or cookie cutters.
13. To make the shaved ice syrup, place the syrup in a saucepan and heat it over medium heat. Once the syrup has reached a boil, let it simmer for about 10 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
14. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
15. Pour the shaved ice syrup over the jelly, allowing it to soak in for a few minutes.
16. Serve the Tricolored Agar-based Milk Jelly with Shaved

gt:
Cut the pork into 4~5 cm pieces, and season with sake and soy sauce.
Roughly chop the cabbage and cut the green peppers into chunks.
Slice the garlic.
Heat oil in a frying pan, saute the cabbage and green peppers briefly, and remove from the pan.
Mix the ingredients together.
Coat the meat from Step 1 in katakuriko, and cook in the frying pan from Step 2 without oil ( See Hints).
The fat will render from meat as it changes color, so add the garlic at this point, and saute together.
Add the doubanjiang and quickly saute...
Return the vegetables from Step 2 to the frying pan, and saute together.
Add sesame oil for the finishing touch, give it a quick stir and it is done.
This is the Hatcho miso that I use.
Hatcho miso is bean miso.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Sliced pork belly meat (or pork offcuts)
- Sake
- Soy sauce
- Katakuriko
- Cabbage
- Green peppers
- Vegetable oil
- Garlic
- Doubanjiang
- Hacchou Miso
- Soy sauce
- Sake
- Sugar
- Sesame oil

2. Prepare the pork:
- In a large bowl, combine the sliced pork with the soy sauce, sake, and Katakuriko. Allow the mixture to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
- In a separate bowl, mix the garlic, Doubanjiang, and Hacchou Miso.

3. Prepare the stir fry:
- Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
- Add the marinated pork to the skillet and stir-fry until it is cooked through and slightly browned.
- Add the garlic mixture to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes.

4. Add the cabbage and green peppers to the skillet and stir-fry until they are tender but still crisp.

5. Season the dish with the soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar.

6. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with sesame seeds if desired.

gt:
Reserve 1 tablespoon of olive oil,now heat the remainder in a medium saucepan
Add the garlic and a pinch.of salt and over low heat.stirring until golden brown.then remove the pan from the heat.do not let the garlic burn as it will taint its flavor.if its burn you will have to start over.
Meanwhile, bring a large saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil.add the spaghetti and remaining olive oil and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, until tender.
Drain the spaghetti thoroughly and return to the pan.
Add the oil and garlic mixture to the spaghetti and toss to coat.season with pepper,add the chopped fresh parsley, and toss to coat.
Put on a plater and serve warm, serve immediately.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the crushed parsley and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the cooked spaghetti to the saucepan and toss to combine.
6. Season the pasta with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Sunshine's spaghetti olio e aglio immediately, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

Please provide the step-by-step instructions for cooking a delicious Sunshine 's spaghetti olio e aglio from scratch using the following ingredients: 1/2 cup olive oil,4 garlic cloves, crushed,3 tbsp chopped fresh parsley,1 lb cook spaghetti,1 salt and pepper to taste.

gt:
In a large bowl, stir together oats, flours, salt, baking powder and baking soda.
Cream together butter and brown sugar until well combined.
Add eggs and vanilla and cream until light and fluffy.
Mix in mashed banana.
Add dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Chill dough for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
To make large bear paws, scoop cookie dough onto baking sheet using a large cookie or ice cream scoop (mine was 3 tablespoons).
With damp hands, flatten dough into an oval shape, about 1/2 inch thick.
Use a knife to mark the claws.
Bake for 12_13 minutes until lightly browned and set.
For mini bear paws, scoop out about 1/2-tablespoon-sized scoops, flatten into small ovals, and mark claws.
Bake for 810 minutes until lightly browned.
Immediately after taking cookies out of oven, re-mark the claws with a knife so theyre visible.
Allow to cool for 10 minutes on cookie sheet before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.
Cookies will stay soft and cake-like.
You can also freeze them for up to 3 months.
