1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flours, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Stir in the mashed bananas, vanilla, and melted chocolate chips.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
8. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Allow the loaf to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Banana Bread Bear Paws!

gt:
Cut the Chinese chives into 3 cm lengths, and mix with the beaten eggs.
Pour water into a pot, when it boils, add soy sauce, dashi stock powder, and salt and check the taste.
Add more if needed.
Lower the heat, add the mixture of Chinese chives and eggs slowly.
Spread it on surface of the soup shaking the pot slightly, then turn up the heat.
It comes to the boil quickly, then turn the heat off.
Cover with a lid, leave for 10 minutes, and it is done!
The Chinese chives will cook in residual heat.
Warm it up before serving.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Clear Soup with Chinese Chives and Eggs dish, follow these steps:

1. Gather the ingredients:
- 1 bunch of fresh Chinese chives
- 2 eggs
- 1200 ml of water
- 4 tablespoons of Usukuchi soy sauce
- 1/2 tablespoon of Dashi stock granules
- 1 dash of less than 1 teaspoon of salt

2. Prepare the chives:
- Remove the chives from the stems and chop them into small pieces.
- Set aside.

3. Prepare the eggs:
- Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them together.
- Set aside.

4. Prepare the broth:
- In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
- Add the Dashi stock granules and salt, and stir to dissolve.
- Reduce the heat to low and let the broth simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until it reaches the desired consistency.

5. Add the chives and eggs:
- Carefully ladle the hot broth into a separate bowl, leaving the chives behind.
- Add the whisked eggs to the broth, stirring gently to combine.
- Let the eggs cook for a few minutes, or until they are fully cooked and the whites are set.

6. Serve the soup:
- Pour the cooked egg mixture back into the pot with the broth.
- Stir gently to combine.
- Serve the Clear Soup with Chinese Chives and Eggs hot.

Enjoy your delicious Clear Soup with Chinese Chives and Eggs dish!

gt:
Stir together all ingredients just until blended.
Cover and chill up to one week.
pred:
To craft Pimiento Cheese, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded cheddar cheese, diced pimentos, and mayonnaise.
2. Mix the ingredients together until well combined and creamy.
3. Add the Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper to the mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the Pimiento Cheese for at least 2 hours or overnight for the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Pimiento Cheese on crackers, as a sandwich filling, or use it as a spread for sandwiches or wraps.

Enjoy your homemade Pimiento Cheese!

gt:
Pour the coconut into the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth, approximately 10 minutes.
(If using a Vitamix, blend for approximately 3-5 minutes.)
Transfer to an airtight container and store at room temperature for a couple months.
Do not refrigerate.
Note: If your butter doesnt get as smooth as a nut butter, you can add 1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil to help it along.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 2-23 cups of unsweetened shredded coconut and 1 cup of coconut oil.
3. Mix the ingredients until well combined and the coconut is evenly coated with the oil.
4. Spread the coconut mixture onto a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
5. Bake the coconut mixture in the preheated oven for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Once the coconut is golden brown and fragrant, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Using a spatula or a butter knife, scrape the coconut mixture onto a large mixing bowl.
8. Add 1/2 cup of honey and 1/2 cup of vanilla extract to the coconut mixture.
9. Mix the ingredients until well combined, and then transfer the mixture to a food processor or a blender.
10. Process the mixture until it reaches a smooth and creamy consistency.
11. Transfer the coconut butter to an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

This homemade coconut butter can be used as a spread on toast, added to smoothies, or used as a base for various desserts and baked goods.

gt:
Mix all ingredients except butter and cornflakes.
Place mixture in greased 9x13 pan.
If using cornflakes, mix them with the butter and top the potatoes with the mixture.
Bake and 350F for 45 minutes.
*OAMC*--- Freeze as is, then when you're ready to eat them, thaw the potatoes, then cook as directed.
Simple as that!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded hash browns, O'Brien potatoes, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese, and melted butter (if using). Mix well.
4. Pour the soup mixture over the potato mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish, and spread it evenly.
6. If desired, sprinkle crushed corn flakes on top of the mixture.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious Cheesy Potatoes!

gt:
In a large saute pan slowly render bacon pieces until browned.
Set bacon aside.
Add chicken and veggies and toss to coat in fat.
Season.
Cook on medium heat until cooked.
Add bacon bits when chicken is nearly finished cooking.
Variations; Dried Sriracha seasoing, cilantro, oregano, habanero, salsa, corn, zucchini, yellow squash, chipotle, shallots, ground chicken, tequila
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices of your choice.
3. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet, and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
4. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the ranch seasoning packet according to the package instructions.
5. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, cook the thin sliced strips of red and green bell peppers until they are tender.
7. Add the small dice of red onion to the skillet, and cook until they are softened.
8. In a small bowl, mix the dried oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper to taste.
9. Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.
10. Add the cooked chicken strips to the skillet with the vegetables, and stir to combine.
11. Pour the ranch seasoning mixture over the chicken and vegetables, and stir to coat evenly.
12. Serve the Chicken-Bacon-Ranch Tacos with your choice of tortillas, toppings, and any desired condiments.

Enjoy your delicious Chicken-Bacon-Ranch Tacos!

gt:
Put the bread flour and all-purpose flour into a large bowl and mix well.
In a different bowl, add the egg, salt, water, and baking soda.
Stir well until the salt dissolves.
Create a well in the middle of the flour, pour in the salt water prepared in Step 1 and mix well using your hands.
It will be very dry and hard to mix at first, but keep kneading patiently and try not to add more water.
When the dough comes together, put it in a large plastic or Ziploc bag, seal and step on it with your feet to knead the dough.
(When the dough flattens out, fold it into quarters and step on it again.)
Repeat the stepping and folding process 3 times, and leave the dough to rest for 2-5 hours.
If you have a pasta machine, set the dial to 4 or 5, and cut the dough into thin noodles.
If you don't have a pasta machine, roll the dough out with a rolling pin to about 2 mm thick, and slice into 2 mm noodles.
Dust the noodles evenly with cornstarch (or katakuriko) to prevent the noodles from sticking to each other.
If you divide the noodles into 150 to 160 g portions, you'll have exactly 5 servings.
If you prefer rippled noodles, squeeze the noodles well.
Boil the noodles in plenty of boiling water, taking care not to let it boil over, for 1.5 minutes.
Noodles containing baking soda will make the water boil over, so be careful!
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread flour, all-purpose flour, and salt.
2. Add the egg and mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the water, stirring constantly to form a smooth dough.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 30 minutes.
6. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
7. Divide the dough into 8 equal portions.
8. Roll each portion into a smooth ball.
9. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Using a sharp knife, cut a cross on the top of each ball.
11. Bake the balls in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they reach a golden brown color.
12. Allow the baked balls to cool for a few minutes before rolling them out into thin, even sheets.
13. Spread a thin layer of water on the surface where you will be rolling out the dough.
14. Place the rolled-out dough on the surface and use a rolling pin to roll it out to your desired thickness.
15. Place the rolled-out dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
16. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
17. Place the baking sheet with the dough in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the dough is cooked through and golden brown.
18. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into desired shapes.
19. To assemble the Ramen Noodles dish, cook the noodles according to the package instructions.
20. In a large bowl, combine the cooked noodles, the cooked dough, and your desired toppings (e.g., sliced vegetables, cooked meat, or additional seasonings).
21. Serve the Ramen Noodles dish

gt:
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces (if you can buy pre-cut-pieces of chicken, use them).
Peel the sweet potato if necessary and cut into bite-sized pieces.
I cut it in half lengthways and slice into 1 cm thickness.
Soak in a bowl of water.
Drain the sweet potato.
Put them in a bowl and cover with cling film.
Microwave at 600 W for about 2 and half minutes.
Meanwhile, heat a pan first (refer to the helpful hints section).
Add the chicken and 1 tablespoon of sake (not listed in the ingredients) and cover with a lid.
Cook over a medium heat.
Turn over the chicken.
When the colour of the chicken has changed and cooked through about 70 to 80 % (about 2 to 3 minutes) uncover and clean the excess juice and fat from the bottom of the pan.
Add the butter and sweet potato.
Cook until golden brown (over a medium to high heat).
Add the mixed seasonings at the end.
Reduce the sauce and use it to coat the chicken and sweet potato.
This has the same combination of butter and sweet potato.
'Sweet Potato Flavoured with Butter, Served with Ogura and Vanilla Ice Cream'.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Cut the sweet potato into bite-sized pieces and toss them in a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt. Spread them out on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
3. While the sweet potatoes are roasting, season the chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and any other desired herbs or spices. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat and cook the chicken thighs until they are browned on both sides and cooked through. This should take about 10-15 minutes.
4. In a small bowl, mix the margarine, miso, sugar, and sake or water. Set aside.
5. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the sweet potato pieces and cook them until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. Add the chicken back into the skillet and pour the miso mixture over the top. Stir to combine and cook for a few more minutes until the chicken is heated through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Serve the Braised Sweet Potato & Chicken with Butter and Miso over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal.

gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350F.
Butter bowls or ramekins.
Melt chocolate and butter in a metal bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water, stirring until smooth.
Remove bowl from heat and cool, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes.
Whisk in egg yolk and a pinch of salt until combined.
Beat egg white in a bowl with an electric mixer at medium-high speed until it holds soft peaks.
Gradually add sugar, beating, and continue to beat until white just holds stiff, glossy peaks.
Whisk about one fourth of white into chocolate mixture to lighten, then fold in remaining white gently but thoroughly.
Divide batter between bowls or ramekins.
Cover each bowl with a small square of foil and crimp foil tightly around rim.
Put bowls in a baking dish, then add enough boiling-hot water to reach halfway up side of bowls, making sure that foil is above water.
Bake until puddings are just set, about 30 minutes.
(Puddings will be gooey to the touch.)
Transfer bowls to a rack and cool puddings, uncovered, about 1 hour.
Just before serving, unmold puddings into serving bowls.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the butter and chocolate over low heat. Stir gently until the chocolate has melted and the mixture is smooth.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy.
4. Carefully pour the melted chocolate mixture into the egg yolk mixture, stirring gently to combine.
5. Divide the mixture evenly between the prepared bowls or ramekins.
6. Carefully pour a small amount of hot water into the bottom of each bowl or ramekin, making sure not to disturb the chocolate mixture.
7. Bake the chocolate minks in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly wobbly.
8. Remove the minks from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before carefully transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the chocolate minks have cooled, place them in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

10. To serve, scoop a small portion of coffee ice cream into each chocolate mink.

[/INST]

This cooking procedure involves melting unsalted butter, chopping fine-quality bittersweet chocolate, separating an egg, and combining various ingredients to create Chocolate Minks. The final product is a delicious dessert that can be enjoyed with coffee ice cream.

gt:
Combine yogurt, oats, and berries in a bowl.
Mix well and chill in fridge overnight.
Remove from fridge in the morning, stir and enjoy!
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a large bowl, combine the yogurt and oats.
2. Stir in the frozen mixed berries.
3. Optionally, you can add a pinch of salt and a drizzle of honey for extra flavor.
4. Serve the breakfast immediately or store in an airtight container for later consumption.

This breakfast is not only delicious but also nutritious, as it provides a balance of proteins, carbohydrates, and vitamins from the yogurt, oats, and berries. The yogurt provides a source of protein and calcium, while the oats are rich in fiber and complex carbohydrates. The mixed berries are packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, which contribute to overall health and well-being.

gt:
Fry bacon in a medium skillet until crisp; remove bacon, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings in skillet.
Set bacon aside to drain on papertowels.
Add green pepper, onion, and potatoes to skillet; cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the potatoes are browned.
Sprinkle cheese over potatoes, and stir until cheese melts.
Pour eggs into skillet; cook over low heat, stirring gently, until done.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with bacon, and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the green bell pepper and onions until softened.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and beaten eggs. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Grease a baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
6. Pour the potato and cheese mixture into the baking dish.
7. Top the mixture with the cooked bacon and green bell pepper mixture.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Farmer's Breakfast hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Measure 1/3 cup coating mix into shaker bag, then use to coat chicken as directed on package.
Place in foil-lined 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake 20 min.
or until chicken is cooked through (170F).
Serve with the pasta sauce for dipping, the mixed vegetables and breadsticks.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the SHAKE 'N BAKE Ranch & Herb Seasoned Coating Mix with 1/4 cup of water.
3. In a separate bowl, toss the cut chicken breasts with the seasoned coating mixture.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
5. Spread the coated chicken pieces on the prepared baking sheet.
6. Bake the chicken for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through and the coating is golden brown.
7. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the pasta sauce by warming the CLASSICO FAMILY FAVORITES Traditional Pasta Sauce in a saucepan.
8. In a large bowl, toss the hot cooked mixed vegetables with the warmed pasta sauce.
9. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
10. Cut the cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces and add them to the vegetable mixture.
11. Serve the Ranch Chicken Fingers Meal on a plate, garnished with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Ranch Chicken Fingers Meal!

gt:
Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and cook until soft but not browned, stirring constantly, about five minutes.
Add flour, garlic and Old Bay and whisk to incorporate.
Whisking constantly, slowly add the milk and half-and-half.
Stir in crab meat and turn the heat to low.
Let the soup simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
After 20 minutes, stir in the sherry and let the soup cook for about five more minutes before serving.
Top with additional Old Bay if desired!
Enjoy!
(Recipe from Old Bay.)
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
5. Gradually add the half-and-half, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add the Old Bay seasoning, sherry, and crab meat. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Using a hand blender or food processor, puree the mixture until smooth.
10. Return the mixture to the saucepan and heat over low heat for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.
11. Serve the Cream of Crab Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Lightly peel cucumbers, less perfect is ok!
Thinly slice and place in a colander.
Liberally cover with salt, shake up and place more.
Place colander in a sink or on a towel as the salt will make the cucumbers "leak" any moisture.
Leave them like this for at least an hour.
In a jar or dish mix together water, vinegar, sugar and dill - a dash of salt and pepper is good too.
Add cucumbers, with OUT rinsing them.
Store in fridge overnight.
YUM!
pred:
1. Wash the cucumbers thoroughly and peel them slightly.
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced cucumbers, white vinegar, water, sugar, salt, and pepper.
3. Allow the mixture to sit for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Stir the mixture well and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour before serving.
5. Taste the salad and adjust the seasoning as needed.
6. Serve the Refrigerator Cucumber Salad chilled.

[/INST]

Ingredients:
- 2 medium cucumbers, thinly sliced
- 23 cup white vinegar
- 23 cup water
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- salt
- pepper
- 1 tablespoon dried dill weed

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Brown ground beef with taco seasonings, drain.
Mix all soups, milk, and sour cream with Ro-Tel in a bowl.
Crush some of the chips slightly.
I use the turkey cooker throw away pan from walmart the large one -- makes easy clean up.
This is a layering effect --.
First I use a spoon full or so, just to line the bottom of the pan.
Next pour in half of the chips,half meat, half soup, and then half cheese.
Repeat.
Be sure to spread evenly.
Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake for 5 minutes.
I like to use a little extra cheese sometimes.
A sure-fire crowd pleaser!
Enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks. Drain any excess fat.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, cheddar cheese, shredded, and taco seasoning. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the Campbell's Cream of Mushroom Soup, milk, and Rotel tomatoes & chilies.
5. Pour the soup mixture over the ground beef mixture, and mix well.
6. Spread the mixture evenly into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Add the chopped onion (optional) on top of the mixture.
8. Sprinkle the nacho Doritos (family size) evenly over the top of the casserole.
9. Dot the sour cream evenly over the top of the nacho Doritos.
10. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the casserole is hot and bubbly.
11. Serve the casserole immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a mortar and pestle, crush the garlic.
Add the pepper and salt and continue mashing until mixture becomes a thick paste.
Transfer to a jar along with the lemon juice and canola oil.
Shake well.
In a large bowl, toss together the lettuce, tomatoes and onion.
Just before serving, add the cheese and just enough dressing to coat.
(There will be extra dressing, but it keeps well.)
Toss well.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the garlic, pepper, salt, and lemon juice until well combined.
3. Add the canola oil to the bowl and whisk until the mixture is emulsified.
4. Add the rinsed, dried, and torn romaine lettuce to the bowl and toss to coat the lettuce evenly with the dressing.
5. Transfer the lettuce mixture to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Roast the lettuce in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the lettuce is tender and slightly wilted.
7. Remove the lettuce from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Add the halved cherry tomatoes and sliced red onion to the bowl with the dressing.
9. Toss the ingredients together until the tomatoes are coated with the dressing.
10. Transfer the salad to a serving platter or individual plates.
11. Crumble the feta cheese over the salad and serve immediately.

This recipe provides a simple yet delicious way to enjoy a fresh and healthy salad using the available ingredients. The combination of the tangy lemon juice, creamy feta cheese, and crunchy vegetables creates a satisfying and refreshing dish that can be enjoyed as a side or a main course.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Lightly grease a 2-quart casserole.
Combine all ingredients and stir well.
Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice, monterey jack cheese, chicken breasts, and drained green chilies.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the fat-free evaporated milk, egg substitute (or eggs), and cilantro.
4. Pour the milk mixture over the chicken and rice mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Sprinkle the top with the remaining cilantro.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the casserole is heated through.
8. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious Chicken & Rice Casserole!

gt:
Mix ingredients.
Serve well chilled.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the white grape juice and 7-Up soda.
2. Add the club soda to the mixture, stirring gently to combine.
3. Serve the Easy punch immediately, garnishing with a lemon wedge if desired.

[/INST]
