1. In a large bowl, combine the white grape juice and 7-Up soda.
2. Add the club soda to the mixture, stirring gently to combine.
3. Serve the Easy punch immediately, garnishing with a lemon wedge if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Brush each chicken cutlet with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Squeeze excess water out of the frozen spinach, then season with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place 1 piece of prosciutto, 1 piece of provolone, and a thin layer of spinach on each chicken cutlet.
Then sprinkle Parmesan over the tops.
Beginning at the short, tapered end, roll up each chicken cutlet, and secure with a toothpick.
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Place chicken in the skillet, then pour in wine.
Cook, turning the chicken, until the wine evaporates, and the chicken is cooked through and its juices run clear, about 20 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and black pepper. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. In a small bowl, mix the grated Parmesan cheese with a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. Assemble the dish by placing the cooked chicken breast halves on top of the spinach in the skillet. Pour the dry white wine over the chicken and spinach. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese mixture evenly over the chicken and spinach.
6. Cook the dish in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Place the couscous and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl.
Add 1 1/4 cups hot tap water, cover, and let sit for 15 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and fold in the oil, then the basil.
Meanwhile, cut away the peel and white pith of the oranges.
Working over a bowl, cut the oranges into segments, adding them to the bowl along with any juices.
Squeeze the membrane to extract any remaining juice.
Gently fold in the shrimp, tomatoes, avocado, onion, olives, lime juice, and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper.
Serve over the basil couscous with lime wedges, if desired.
pred:
[INST]1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash the couscous, basil leaves, and oranges thoroughly. Peel and devein the shrimp, and remove the seeds from the green olives. Cut the avocado into small pieces.

2. Cook the couscous: Rinse the couscous in a fine mesh strainer and drain well. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the couscous, cover, and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the couscous is tender. Remove from heat and let it rest, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff the couscous with a fork.

3. Prepare the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper.

4. Prepare the salad: In a large bowl, combine the cooked couscous, shrimp, cherry tomatoes, avocado, green olives, and sweet onion.

5. Add the dressing: Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.

6. Serve: Zesty Shrimp Salad with Couscous is ready to be served. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Combine sugar, cocoa powder, arrowroot powder, espresso powder, cinnamon, chili powder, and salt in bowl.
Whisk together egg and egg yolks in separate bowl.
Stir egg mixture into cocoa mixture.
Scald milk in saucepan over medium heat until milk is steaming.
Remove from heat.
Whisk /2 cup hot milk into cocoa mixture.
While whisking, pour cocoa mixture back into hot milk, and whisk until smooth.
Return to medium heat, and continue whisking for 5 to 6 minutes, until pudding starts to bubble.
Remove from heat and whisk in chocolate and vanilla until smooth.
Transfer pudding to bowl, and cool to room temperature.
Cover with plastic wrap pressed directly onto pudding; refrigerate until chilled.
To make Whipped Pumpkin Cream: Cook pumpkin and brown sugar with cinnamon in medium skillet over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes.
Transfer to bowl, and cool to room temperature.
Whip cream in stand mixer or with handheld beaters on medium-high, until soft peaks form, about 1 minute.
Fold whipped cream into pumpkin until no streaks remain.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Serve pudding dolloped with pumpkin cream.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium saucepan, combine the sugar, cocoa powder, arrowroot powder, instant espresso powder, ground cinnamon, New Mexico chili powder, and salt. Whisk to combine.
3. Add the egg, egg yolks, and milk to the saucepan, stirring to combine. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and reaches 170°F (77°C) on a candy thermometer.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the chopped semisweet chocolate until melted and smooth. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) round baking dish or individual ramekins.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the pudding is set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the pudding to cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. To make the pumpkin cream, combine the brown sugar, ground cinnamon, and a pinch of salt in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture reaches 230°F (110°C) on a candy thermometer.
9. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the pumpkin. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before pouring it over the pudding.
10. Serve the savory Mexican Mocha Pudding with Pumpkin Cream immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Mexican Mocha Pudding with Pumpkin Cream dish!

gt:
Dredge meat in seasoned flour.
Brown in oil- 6 minutes.
Add onions, garlic, and mushrooms.
Cook for 4 minutes.
Add gravy.
Add basil.
Cook over low heat for 50 minutes.
Add claret.
Serve over hot rice.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and sauté for another minute.
4. Add the beef cubes to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Drain the beef and set aside.
6. In a small bowl, mix the beef gravy, claret wine, and seasoned flour.
7. Return the beef to the skillet and pour the gravy mixture over it. Stir to combine.
8. Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are tender and the liquid has been absorbed, about 5-7 minutes.
9. Transfer the beef and mushrooms to a baking dish.
10. Pour the remaining gravy mixture over the beef and mushrooms.
11. Bake the beef and mushrooms in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and golden brown.
12. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Beef Cubes in Mushroom Sauce!

gt:
Mix corn, tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, orange juice, lime juice, olive oil, and salt together in a bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the corn kernels, diced tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, and cilantro.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the orange juice, lime juice, olive oil, and salt.
4. Pour the dressing over the corn mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the salsa cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Fresh Corn Salsa with Orange and Lime dish immediately or let it cool completely before serving.

This step-by-step guide will help you create a delicious and refreshing Fresh Corn Salsa with Orange and Lime dish using the provided ingredients. The combination of corn, tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, orange juice, lime juice, olive oil, and salt results in a flavorful and vibrant dish that is perfect for a summer meal or as a side dish.

gt:
Sprinkle gelatin powder in hot water to dissolve.
Pour milk and sugar in the sauce pan and warm over medium heat.
Shake the pot to dissolve the sugar.
Turn off the heat.
Then, add the heavy cream and dissolved gelatin.
Combine slowly, chilling the pot over ice water.
Pour the Step 4 mixture into individual containers and chill in the fridge for 3-4 hours.
Meanwhile, make the sauce.
Mix the jam and water in a bowl.
Whisk to a smooth consistency.
Once the panna cotta has set, pour the sauce on top!
pred:
To make a delicious Very Jiggly Rich Panna Cotta dish, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, heat the milk and sugar over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved.
2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the gelatin powder. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the heavy cream until it forms soft peaks.
4. Slowly pour the cooled milk mixture into the whipped cream, stirring gently to combine.
5. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and reaches the desired consistency.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the jam.
7. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
8. Pour the mixture into individual ramekins or a large serving dish, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. Before serving, gently reheat the panna cotta in the microwave or on the stovetop, if desired.

The key to achieving a very jiggly rich panna cotta is to cook the mixture slowly and stir constantly to prevent it from curdling. The addition of the gelatin powder also helps to achieve the desired jiggly texture. The use of fresh fruit jam adds a touch of sweetness and flavor to the dish.

gt:
Beat 3 cups confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract together in a large bowl using an electric mixer until frosting is smooth.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate while preparing cake.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Butter a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Beat brown sugar and butter together in a large bowl using an electric mixer until smooth; beat in eggs, 1 at a time, until smooth.
Stir 2 tablespoons ginger, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and salt into brown sugar-butter mixture until incorporated.
Beat flour and baking powder into brown sugar-butter mixture until batter is smooth; fold in 3/4 cup dried cranberries and white chocolate chips.
Pour batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading evenly.
Bake in the preheated oven until cake is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Cool cake completely, 4 hours to overnight.
Remove frosting from refrigerator 1 hour before frosting the cake.
Spread frosting evenly over cake; sprinkle with 1/4 cup dried cranberries and 2 tablespoons ginger.
Whisk 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar and cream together in a bowl until smooth; drizzle over frosted cake.
Cover cake with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Cut cake in half lengthwise and each half into 8 equal rectangles.
Cut each rectangle in half diagonally, creating 16 triangle-shaped bars.
pred:
To prepare the Clone of a Cranberry Bliss Bar, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter, dark brown sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.

3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.

4. Stir in the minced candied ginger, salt, flour, and baking powder until well combined.

5. Fold in the chopped sweetened dried cranberries and white chocolate chips.

6. Spread the batter evenly into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.

7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. To make the frosting, beat the confectioners' sugar, lemon juice, and vanilla extract together until smooth and creamy.

10. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake.

11. Sprinkle the chopped sweetened dried cranberries and minced candied ginger over the frosting.

12. Refrigerate the cake for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Clone of a Cranberry Bliss Bar!

gt:
Spray a 9 inch pie dish with cooking spray and set aside.
Place graham cracker sheets and cereal in a food processor and pulse until finely crushed and the mixture has the appearance of beach sand.
Pour crumbs into a large bowl.
Add melted butter and mix until evenly distributed.
Pour crumb mixture into prepared pie dish and press crumbs down to form the pie crust.
Bake crust at 350 degrees F for 7-10 minutes.
Set aside to cool.
Place peanut butter and confectioner sugar in a saucepan over low heat.
Stir the mixture until it is combined (keep a close eye on it so it doesnt burn).
You want to cook it until the peanut butter is melted.
Then set aside for five minutes to cool.
Place Cool Whip into a large bowl, pour in the slightly cooled peanut butter mixture and gently fold until combined.
Spread Nutella over the bottom of the cooled pie crust.
Pour peanut butter mixture over Nutella layer.
Freeze pie for 3 hours.
Drizzle chocolate sauce and caramel over pie before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs using a rolling pin or a food processor.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed graham crackers, melted butter, and creamy peanut butter. Mix well to form a crumbly mixture.
4. Press the crumbly mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.
5. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes or until it is set and lightly golden. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and peanut butter together until smooth. Add the confectioners sugar and continue to beat until well combined.
7. Add the Cool Whip and mix until well combined.
8. Spread the filling evenly over the cooled crust.
9. If desired, drizzle Nutella over the top of the pie.
10. Refrigerate the pie for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

[/INST]

This delightful Frozen Peanut Butter Pie dish is a delicious and creative twist on the classic dessert. The crust is made from crushed graham crackers, the filling is a mixture of cream cheese, peanut butter, and Cool Whip, and the pie is topped with Nutella for an extra layer of flavor. You can also add a garnish of chocolate or caramel sauce for an extra touch of indulgence.

gt:
Cook noodles in boiling water 5 min.
or until tender.
Meanwhile, cook and stir chicken and garlic in 2 Tbsp.
dressing in wok or large skillet on high heat 5 min.
or until chicken is done.
Stir in egg; cook and stir 30 sec.
or until set.
Drain noodles.
Mix remaining dressing, water, peanut butter and soy sauce in wok.
Add noodles; mix well.
Add sprouts and onions; toss lightly.
Sprinkle with nuts.
pred:
[SYS]
To prepare Creamy Peanut Pad Thai, follow these steps:
1. In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
2. In the same skillet, add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the uncooked rice noodles and cook until they are slightly softened, stirring constantly.
3. Add the Calorie-Wise Catalina Dressing, water, and peanut butter to the skillet. Stir to combine.
4. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
5. Add the egg to the skillet and stir to scramble. Cook until the egg is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Add the bean sprouts, green onions, and chopped peanuts to the skillet. Stir to combine.
7. Serve the Creamy Peanut Pad Thai immediately, garnished with additional chopped peanuts if desired.

[/SYS]

gt:
For the filling: Beat the cream cheese and peanut butter until combined.
Add the powdered sugar and vanilla and beat until combined.
Beat in milk, 1 T at a time, until you reach desired consistency.
Set aside.
For the cake: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Spray a 12 cup bundt pan with cooking spray for baking.
Mix cake mix, oil, sour cream and eggs in a bowl.
Beat 1 or 2 minutes at medium speed.
Reserve 2 cups of the batter.
Pour remaining batter into the prepared pan.
Put peanut butter filling in a ring on top of batter (DO NOT ALLOW FILLING TO TOUCH THE SIDES OF THE PAN)
Spoon reserved batter on top.
Bake for 40-50 minutes.
(Some coated pans only take 30-35 minutes).
Cool 20 minutes and remove from pan onto wire rack.
For the glaze: Mix powdered sugar, vanilla and lt. cream until smooth.
Add more cream as needed to desired consistancy.
When cake is cool, place on serving platter and drizzle with glaze.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, vegetable oil, sour cream, and eggs. Mix until smooth and well combined.
3. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans.
4. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
5. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for about 10 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
6. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the creamy peanut butter and vanilla, and beat until well combined.
7. Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until the desired consistency is reached.
8. Add milk, if needed, to thin out the filling.
9. Once the cakes are completely cooled, level the tops with a cake leveler or a sharp knife.
10. Place one of the cooled cakes on a serving plate. Spread a generous layer of the peanut butter filling on top of the cake.
11. Place the other cake on top of the filling, creating a sandwich.
12. Dust the top of the cake with powdered sugar.
13. Cut the cake into slices and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Place chickpeas, 1 cup of the cheese, cream cheese, sour cream and ground red pepper in blender or food processor container; cover.
Blend until smooth.
Stir in green onions.
Spread into 9-inch pie plate.
Bake 20 min.
or until light golden brown.
Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and tomato.
Serve with crackers.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the drained chickpeas, 1-1/2 cups of the Cracker Barrel Finely Shredded 3 Cheese Mexicana Cheese, and the Philadelphia Brick Cream Cheese. Mix well.

2. Add the sour cream and ground red pepper (cayenne), and mix until well combined.

3. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped green onions and chopped tomato.

4. Add the tomato mixture to the cheese and chickpea mixture, and mix until well combined.

5. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

6. Spread the mixture evenly over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the dip is hot and bubbly and the cheese is melted and slightly browned.

8. Serve the Tomato Topped Cheese & Bean Dip with the remaining Cracker Barrel Finely Shredded 3 Cheese Mexicana Cheese, and Christie Wheat Thins Crackers.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine sugar, flour, salt, lemon juice and grated lemon rind.
Add egg yolks which have been well beaten, the milk and melted butter.
Last, fold in egg whites which have also been well beaten.
Put ingredients into a buttered 9" baking dish which has been set in a larger pan containing about 1" of hot water.
(both pans will go into the oven.)
Bake for 45 minutes at 325 degrees F.
Remove baking dish at once from hot water and allow to cool before serving.
pred:
[INST]To create a delicious Melt-In-Your-Mouth Warm Lemon Pudding, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, flour, and salt.
3. Add the lemon juice, grated lemons, and lemon rind. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and milk.
5. Gradually pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring until well combined.
6. Add the melted butter and mix until smooth.
7. Fold in the egg whites, making sure not to overmix.
8. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
9. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pudding comes out clean.
10. Allow the pudding to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Melt-In-Your-Mouth Warm Lemon Pudding!
<</SYS>>

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line baking sheet(s) with foil and spray with cooking spray.
Arrange potato wedges on baking sheet(s).
Sprinkle potatoes with spicy seasoning.
bake 20 to 25 minutes, until cooked through.
Spray nonstick skillet with cooking spray, add ground beef and cook, stirring frequently, until browned and cooked through.
Add barbecue sauce to the cooked ground beef and cook until hot and bubbly.
Pour meat sauce over potato wedges; top with cheese and bake 5 to 6 minutes, until cheese is melted.
Serve immediately and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded nonfat cheddar cheese, ground beef, and spicy seasoning mix. Mix until well combined.
3. Cut the 4 medium baking potatoes into 8 wedges.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the 12 cup barbecue sauce with 1 cup of water.
5. Grease a large baking sheet with cooking spray or oil.
6. Place the potato wedges on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Pour the barbecue sauce mixture over the potato wedges, making sure to coat them evenly.
8. Bake the potato wedges in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
9. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the potato wedges cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the savory Easy Cheesy Barbecue Beef Fries hot, garnished with additional barbecue sauce if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Easy Cheesy Barbecue Beef Fries!

gt:
Melt the margarine in a saucepan.
Add the honey and mix thoroughly.
Coat the sweet potato slices with the honey and butter mixture.
Roast at 180 degrees C for about 20 minutes.
Finish off under the grill to give them a nice colour!
I guess you could add cinnamon, nutmeg and/or other wintery spices too.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the sweet potato cubes with the oil, margarine, honey, lemon juice, and salt.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
4. Roast the sweet potato mixture in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove from the oven, and let the sweet potatoes cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Honey Roasted Sweet Potatoes!

gt:
Place the butter in a large mixing bowl.
Add in 4 cups sugar, then the milk and vanilla.
On medium speed of an electric mixer, beat about 3-5 minutes or until smooth and creamy.
Gradually add the remaining sugar, 1 cup at a time, beating well (about 2 minutes) after each addition, until the icing is thick enough for good spreading consistency (you may not need all of the sugar).
If desired, add a few drops of food coloring and mix thoroughly.
Use and store the icing at room temperature because icing will set if chilled.
The icing can be stored in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
**If making a 3-layer cake, use the following proportions: 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter, 8-10 cups confectioner's sugar, 3/4 cup milk, and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
2. Add the milk, one cup at a time, mixing well after each addition.
3. Gradually add the vanilla extract, ensuring that it is well combined.
4. Continue mixing until the desired consistency is reached. This may take several minutes, depending on the desired thickness of the buttercream.
5. If the buttercream is too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency. If it is too thin, you can add a bit more butter.
6. Once the buttercream is at the desired consistency, transfer it to a piping bag or a large, clean bowl.
7. Store the buttercream in the refrigerator until ready to use.

This recipe will yield a smooth and creamy Vanilla Buttercream that can be used for various desserts, such as cakes, cupcakes, and pastries.

gt:
In a saucepan, melt butter.
Stir in sugar, corn syrup and salt.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Stir in baking soda and vanilla.
Pour over popped corn (make sure there are NO SEEDS).
Mix well.
I use my broiler pans, but the disposable lasagna foil pans would work well too.
Bake at 250 degrees F for one hour, stirring every 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool.
You can eat just as caramel corn (delish) or continue on and make chocolate-covered caramel corn (recommended)!
To go the extra mile, melt the white bark completely, pour over the cooled caramel corn.
Lay out on wax paper to cool.
Once cool, break apart and store in airtight Ziploc or tupperware containers.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, brown sugar, light corn syrup, salt, baking soda, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
3. Add the popped popcorn to the bowl and mix until well coated.
4. Spread the popcorn mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Melt the white almond bark in a double boiler or in a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water.
6. Drizzle the melted almond bark over the popcorn mixture, creating a thin layer.
7. Bake the popcorn mixture in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the almond bark is melted and the popcorn is slightly crisp.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Use a spatula to transfer the popcorn mixture to a large mixing bowl.
10. Break the chocolate into small pieces and add it to the bowl. Stir until the chocolate is melted and well combined.
11. Spread the chocolate-covered popcorn mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
12. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the chocolate is melted and the popcorn is slightly crisp.
13. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
14. Use a spatula to transfer the popcorn mixture to a large mixing bowl.
15. Break the white almond bark into small pieces and add it to the bowl. Stir until the almond bark is melted and well combined.
16. Spread the almond bark-covered popcorn mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
17. Return

gt:
Heat oven to 475 degrees.
Working in batches, arrange oysters in a single layer in a 12-by-16-inch roasting pan fitted with a flat rack.
Pour 1/3.
inch of hot tap water into pan, and bake for 7 minutes, or until oyster shells have begun to open.
Using gloves or tongs, transfer oysters to a table covered in newspaper for guests to shuck, garnish and eat while next batch cooks.
Add water to pan as necessary, and repeat roasting until all oysters have been served, about 45 minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges hot sauce, and sour orange mignonette.
pred:
To make Oven-Roasted Oysters, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Rinse the oysters under cold water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. Place the oysters on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Drizzle the oysters with olive oil, and season them with salt and pepper.
5. Roast the oysters in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until they open up and their shells turn a golden color.
6. While the oysters are cooking, prepare the sour orange mignonette by combining the sour orange segments, minced shallots, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl.
7. Once the oysters are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. Serve the oysters on a platter, and spoon the sour orange mignonette over the top.

Enjoy your delicious Oven-Roasted Oysters with the tangy and refreshing sour orange mignonette.

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Place the beets and turnip in a 9x9 inch baking dish.
Cut an X in the root end of the onions and place them in the dish.
Drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and add the rosemary and salt.
Stir to coat the vegetables with oil.
Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour, or until the vegetables are golden brown and tender.
Serve hot.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare the Roasted Fall Vegetables, preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, toss the beets, turnip, and pearl onions with olive oil, salt, and dried rosemary. Spread the vegetables evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Place 1-1/2 cups of the romaine in each of four salad bowls.
Combine chicken, pasta, cauliflower, tomatoes, peppers and shredded cheese in large bowl.
Add dressing; toss lightly.
Spoon evenly over romaine.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
pred:
1. First, prepare the salad by washing the lettuce thoroughly and removing any wilted or damaged leaves.
2. In a large bowl, combine the torn romaine lettuce, cooked chicken breasts, small pasta, cauliflower florets, and green pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the Cracker Barrel Shredded 4 Cheese Italiano Cheese, Kraft Zesty Italian Dressing, and Kraft 100% Parmesan Light Grated Cheese.
4. Pour the dressing mixture over the salad and toss to combine.
5. Serve the salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious Italian Chopped Salad that is both healthy and satisfying.

gt:
Cook the rice firmly.
For the egg omelet sushi: Add some chirashi-zushi mix to 1 and 1/2 rice bowls of rice.
Place a small portion onto a piece of cling film and shape into a small ball by squeezing the cling film.
Unwrap and place the shredded omelet on top.
Squeeze the sushi ball lightly in the cling film.
To make the salmon sushi: Place a thin slice of salmon onto a piece of cling film.
Put a tiny amount of wasabi on top and a small portion of sushi rice.
Shape into a ball by squeezing the cling film.
To make the Cherry blossom sushi: Rinse the preserved cherry blossoms and soak in water for 10 minutes to remove the saltiness.
Reserve a few for garnish and chop the rest.
Stir the chopped preserved cherry blossom into the rice.
Garnish a small portion of the rice with a cherry blossom, wrap in on cling film, and shape into a ball by squeezing the cling film.
Garnish each kind of sushi with little decorations and serve!
You can make this in 20 minutes after cooking the rice.
pred:
To make a delicious Temari Sushi for a Cherry Blossom Party or Hina-matsuri Girls' Day dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients:
- 540 ml Hot cooked white rice
- 2 servings Chirashi-zushi ready-made mix
- 1 Shredded egg omelets
- 1 Salmon roe
- 5 slice Sashimi-grade fresh salmon
- 1 Sushi vinegar
- 1 Wasabi
- Thin green onions
- 13 Cherry blossoms preserved in salt

2. Prepare the sushi rice:
- Combine the cooked rice and sushi vinegar in a large bowl.
- Mix well and let it rest for a few minutes.

3. Prepare the sushi roll:
- Spread a thin layer of wasabi on the sushi rice.
- Place a piece of shredded egg omelet on top of the rice.
- Add a slice of salmon roe on top of the egg omelet.
- Place a piece of sashimi-grade fresh salmon on top of the roe.
- Roll the sushi rice and omelet mixture, starting from the bottom and rolling it up.

4. Decorate the sushi roll:
- Cut the cherry blossoms into thin strips.
- Place the cherry blossoms on the sushi roll, creating a beautiful and delicate arrangement.

5. Serve and enjoy:
- Serve the Temari Sushi on a plate, garnished with thin green onions.
- Enjoy the delicious and visually appealing dish at your Cherry Blossom Party or Hina-matsuri Girls' Day celebration.

gt:
Chop Broccoli into florets.
Boil florets in salted water for 7-10 minutes until tender.
Pour milk into a pan, bring to boil, then simmer while adding flour, and 3/4 of the cheese.
Chop bacon finely and add to cheese sauce mixture, along with minced garlic and nutmeg.
Place broccoli in 9x9 in casserole dish, pour over cheese sauce, then tear stale bread into thumb size pieces and place on top of broccoli and mixture along with the rest of the cheese, pour a little olve oil over the top of this to make the bread crispy.
Bake in the oven at 350 for 25-35 minutes or until golden brown on top.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the broccoli florets, cheddar cheese, milk, flour, and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and set aside.
4. Drain the bread and crumble it into the bowl with the broccoli mixture.
5. Add the minced garlic and bacon to the bowl.
6. Drizzle olive oil over the mixture and toss to combine.
7. Pour the egg mixture over the bread mixture and toss to combine.
8. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish, and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Broccoli Cheese Bake immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Put the chickpeas, maple syrup, lemon juice, almonds and raisins in the bowl of the food processor.
Pulse a few seconds.
Spread the mixture on bread.
Or crackers.
pred:
1. First, rinse the chickpeas and remove any debris. Place them in a large bowl and cover them with water. Allow them to soak for at least 8 hours or overnight.

2. Drain the chickpeas and rinse them thoroughly. Place them in a large pot and cover them with water. Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour or until the chickpeas are tender but still have a slight bite.

3. While the chickpeas are cooking, prepare the maple syrup spread. In a small saucepan, combine the cooked chickpeas, maple syrup, lemon juice, and toasted almonds. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the chickpeas are heated through and the maple syrup has melted and combined with the other ingredients.

4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the raisins. Allow the mixture to cool slightly before spreading it onto the slices of white bread.

5. Serve the Chickpeas and Maple Syrup Spread immediately or refrigerate it for later use. Enjoy your delicious and nutritious creation!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add the egg noodles, and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Drain and transfer to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Melt the margarine in a saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in the flour using a fork so that no lumps form.
Gradually stir in the milk.
Bring to a simmer, stirring constantly, then add the cheese.
Cook and stir until smooth.
Stir in the cream of mushroom soup, and then the dried beef.
Stir into the noodles in the casserole dish, and top with crushed potato chips.
Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until the sauce is thick and bubbling, and top is toasted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the margarine, flour, and milk. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the processed cheese food, egg noodles, cream of mushroom soup, and dried beef to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Sprinkle the crushed potato chips evenly over the top of the casserole.
6. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the casserole is hot and bubbly and the potato chips are crispy.
7. Serve the Grandma's Dried Beef Casserole hot, and enjoy!

gt:
Combine all the cut up fruit.
Add the banana at the last minute.
pred:
To cook a delightful Ethiopian Fruit Salad dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the sliced mango, papaya, orange sections, and grapes.
2. Add the sliced banana to the bowl and mix well.
3. In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of honey and 1/4 cup of lemon juice. Pour the mixture over the fruit salad and stir gently to combine.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. Serve the fruit salad chilled or at room temperature, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon or a drizzle of honey, if desired.

This dish is a refreshing and healthy option, featuring a variety of fruits that are rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. The combination of sweet and tangy flavors from the honey and lemon juice, along with the natural sweetness of the fruits, creates a delightful and satisfying fruit salad.

gt:
Heat oil in a large heave-duty pot over medium high heat.
Add onions and carrots.
Cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, coriander, curry powder and thyme.
Cook and stir for another minute.
Add tomatoes with juices and cook for a few more minutes.
Stir in lentils, broth and water.
Add salt, black pepper and red pepper flakes.
Bring the mixture to a boil on high heat.
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes.
Add chopped collard greens and cook for another 5 minutes, until just softened.
Serve immediately with a squeeze of lemon juice, Tabasco and vegan Parmesan, if desired.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the carrots and cook until they are tender, about 10 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes.
4. Add the cumin, coriander, curry powder, thyme, and red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute.
5. Add the tomatoes, lentils, broth, water, salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 25-30 minutes or until the lentils are tender and the flavors have melded together.
7. Stir in the collard greens and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
9. Serve the Spiced Lentil Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of vegan parmesan cheese and a squeeze of fresh lemon juice if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
For the crust: Cream applesauce, splenda, and the egg white; add flour.
(You may need a tiny bit more applesauce - the consistency should resemble cookie dough.)
Spread in the bottom of a 9" spring form pan and bake for 5 minutes at 450, remove and cool slightly.
For the filling: Cream the cream cheese, add splenda slowly, and vanilla.
Cream in egg whites, add milk and flour.
Pour onto crust, and bake 10 minutes at 450; reduce the heat to 250 and bake an additional 60 minutes (or until center tests done.
).
Cool to room temp, the refrigerate until chilled.
Serve cold.
Note: My mom just tosses all of the ingredients into the mixer at once, but I think it comes out creamier if you mix them as listed.
To make blueberry sauce, place about 2 cups of frozen berries over medium heat, add 1/2 cup splenda (to taste) and simmer for 10 minutes (or until thickened.)
Cool, and spread over room temperature cheesecake.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the applesauce, Splenda granular, egg white, and vanilla extract.
3. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a smooth batter forms.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch springform pan.
5. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wobbly.
6. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes.
7. Carefully remove the cake from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
8. In a small mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, Splenda granular, and vanilla extract.
9. Beat the mixture until smooth and creamy.
10. Carefully spread the cream cheese mixture over the cooled cake.
11. Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours, or until the cream cheese mixture is set.
12. Serve the German Cheesecake immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

[/INST]

gt:
Microwave the okra for about 4 minutes.
Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a sauce pan.
Add cumin seeds.
Stir till they swell which is about 2 minutes.
Add onion.
Stir and cook for about 3 minutes.
Add tomato and cook for another 3 minutes.
Add the rest and cook for about 3 more minutes.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and slightly mushy.
5. Add the frozen okra and cook for a few minutes until it becomes tender.
6. Add the curry powder, salt, and chili powder, stirring well to combine.
7. Add the required amount of water or stock to the pan, and bring the mixture to a boil.
8. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let the curry simmer for about 10-15 minutes or until the okra is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
9. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
10. Serve the Okra Curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or chopped green onions, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Place the first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan with 2 cups of water.
Heat, stirring, over low heat until the sugar has dissolved.
Bring to the boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Add the pears and cook, covered for 12-15 minutes, turning them halfway through.
Remove pears from liquid, and bring it back to boil, uncovered.
Cook for 8-10 minutes or until the syrup has reduced by half.
Remove the vanilla bean and drizzle syrup over the pears.
Serve with biscotti.
pred:
1. First, split the vanilla bean lengthwise and remove the seeds.
2. In a saucepan, combine the saffron thread, sugar, and lemon rind.
3. Place the saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved.
4. Add the split vanilla bean and the pears to the saucepan.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pears are tender and the syrup has thickened.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Poached Pears in Saffron Citrus Syrup over biscotti, garnished with a sprig of fresh rosemary.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Pour broth into a deep pot.
Trim leaves and core off head of cauliflower.
Place head of cauliflower in broth and drizzle with the olive oil.
Cover and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium and boil covered until tender, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Uncover and mash cauliflower w/potato masher.
Allow liquid to cook off while you add cheeses and mash all together, about 2 to 3 minutes.
When all mixed and thickened, remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste, and nutmeg, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the cauliflower into florets and steam it until tender but still crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken broth, olive oil, boursin cheese, and grated parmesan cheese. Season with nutmeg, if desired.
4. Add the steamed cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the cheese sauce.
5. Transfer the cauliflower to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Roast the cauliflower in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the "smashed" cauliflower immediately, and enjoy!

This recipe is a delicious and healthy alternative to traditional mashed potatoes, using cauliflower as the base and adding a creamy, cheesy, and garlicky flavor with the help of boursin cheese and parmesan cheese. The nutmeg adds a touch of warmth and depth to the dish, making it a delightful and satisfying side or main course.

gt:
In a heavy based sauce pan, heat a little oil and fry off the onions until golden.
Add the garlic powder, fresh garlic and paprika, marjoram, black pepper, sweat down for a few minutes to release the flavour.
Add the puree and chicken stock and bring up to the boil.
Once boiling, add the pulled pork and simmer for 1 hour.
Ten minutes from the end, add the green pepper and green chilli and allow to soften slightly.
To finish, add the mustard, lime and cayenne pepper.
Spoon the mixture into the glazed hotdog bun, scatter over the chillies, shallot rings and mustard seeds.
To serve, pipe over the sour cream and mustard.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Tom Kerridge's black pepper pulled pork Sloppy Joe recipe, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).

2. In a large pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until they are soft and translucent.

3. Add the garlic powder, grated garlic, and black pepper to the pan. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are fragrant.

4. Pour in the tomato puree and chicken stock, stirring to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the pulled pork is tender.

5. Add the diced green pepper and green chilli to the pan, stirring to combine. Cook for a few more minutes, until the vegetables are tender.

6. Stir in the American mustard, lime zest, cayenne pepper, smoked paprika, and marjoram. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

7. Transfer the cooked mixture to a large bowl and let it cool slightly.

8. To assemble the Sloppy Joe sandwiches, place a few spoonfuls of the cooked mixture on each bun, and top with pickled green chillies, if desired.

9. Serve the Sloppy Joe sandwiches hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Unroll the crescent dough from the can.
Separate the dough to form eight triangles.
Place two triangles, with the long side at the bottom, and the two short side touching each other in the middle, forming one large triangle on your work surface.
Pinch together the two shorter sides making one large triangle.
Loosely roll up the triangle starting from the longest side toward the tip.
Once in a rope, start at one end of the rope and roll toward the other end forming a cinnamon roll look.
Place on a baking sheet.
Repeat with remaining six pieces.
This will make 4 round crescent rolls.
Bake for 11 to 13 minutes.
Cool completely.
Meanwhile, prepare pudding mix with light cream.
Let chill for 15 minutes.
To assemble: Cut croissant pastry in half horizontally.
Spoon 1/2 cup of cream pudding onto bottom half.
Cover with top half and drizzle with 1/4 cup syrup.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the crescent roll dough and pudding mix.
3. Add the light cream and chocolate syrup, mixing until well combined.
4. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. Cut the dough into small circles using a cookie cutter or the rim of a glass.
6. Place the dough circles on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake the dough for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
8. Remove the dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. While the dough is cooling, prepare the filling by mixing the instant vanilla pudding with the light cream.
10. Once the dough has cooled, use a spoon to fill the center of each dough circle with the pudding mixture.
11. Carefully fold the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape.
12. Bake the filled dough for an additional 5-7 minutes or until golden brown.
13. Allow the pastries to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Mock Cream Puff Delight dish!

gt:
Puree peaches in blender.
Add milk, honey, and almond extract and process until smooth.
With blender running at high speed, add ice cubes one at a time and process until smooth.
I would recommend shutting down the blender while you're actually adding the cubes!
Pour thick shakes into two tall glasses and serve with a sprig of mint.
pred:
[INST]
1. Begin by washing the peaches and removing the peel. Chop the peaches into small pieces.
2. In a blender or food processor, combine the chopped peaches, skim milk, honey, and almond extract. Blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the mixture into a glass and add the cracked ice cubes.
4. Garnish the drink with fresh mint leaves.
5. Enjoy your delicious Peach Cooler!

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Cook the the pasta noodles, drain and set in the fridge to chill.
Don't worry about them sticking together they'll separate once you start mixing (spread them out on a cook sheet for less sticking and for a quick chill put them in the freezer for about 10 minutes).
Cut up the cheese into bite size pieces and set a side.
Drain the tuna and set aside.
In a large (about 4-qt) bowl divide the pasta in half and mix in 1/2 the tuna, cheese, mayo and pickle relish.
After it's well mixed add the rest of the ingredients leaving out the paprika.
Once everything is mixed well add the paprika (it's just for color).
Depending on your taste you might want to add more mayo, paprika, or pickle relish.
I usually add more mayo the next day.
Chill for 10-20 minutes in the fridge and serve.
pred:
To cook a delicious Cold Tuna Salad dish, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients: Rinse the tuna and pat it dry. Cut the tuna into bite-sized pieces.
2. Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, and cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
3. Cook the tuna: In a separate pot, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the tuna pieces and cook until they are cooked through, about 4-5 minutes.
4. Prepare the salad: In a large bowl, mix the cooked tuna, Miracle Whip, pickle relish, and paprika.
5. Add the pasta: Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the bowl with the tuna mixture.
6. Serve: Serve the Cold Tuna Salad immediately, and enjoy!

This dish is a delicious and refreshing combination of tuna, pasta, and tangy Miracle Whip, with the added crunch and flavor from the pickle relish and paprika. The combination of ingredients creates a satisfying and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed on its own or as a side dish.

gt:
Using three clean bowls /deep trays /or containers .
Place the sifted flour into the first one of the bowls/tray/container and place in whisked eggs into the second bowl/tray/container .
In the third bowl/tray/container , place the breadcrumbs , parmesan , salt , pepper and the thyme and mix well to combine all thoroughly .
Now take the lamb cutlet , one at a time , dip the cutlet into the flour filled bowl/tray/container , to coat , shake off excess .
Next dip and coat the cutlet into the whisked egg filled bowl/tray/container , and coat them well , now place them straight into the breadcrumb mixture , making sure coating all the cutlet in the breadcrumbs well , repeat with remaining cutlets .
Then set in the fridge for about half hour to set .
FRYPAN or Skillet COOKING : Once cutlets are set , heat the oil and butter in a large frying pan/skillet to hot .
Once oil and butter is hot add the prepared lamb cutlets , but do not over crowd the pan , do two to three at a time depending on how large your pan is , now turn the pan down to medium heat and cook the cutlets until golden brown and crisp , then turn the cutlets and proceed to cook the other side till golden brown and crisp .
Depending on how you like yours cooked to how long you cook them , i like mine well medium well , so i cooked mine for about 10-12 minutes each side .
OVEN BAKED : follow all above steps until step 6 .
Proceed with step 5 .
Preheat your oven to 180C then lightly grease a baking tray and set aside till needed .
Then once the oil and butter is hot add the prepared lamb cutlets and proceed to cook them on medium to high heat for about 3 minutes each side , or until lightly golden and starting to crispen up on both sides , now remove them from the frying pan / skillet and place the cutlets onto the prepared baking tray and cover with foil and proceed to finish baking them in the oven for about 15 minutes then remove the foil and proceed o cook a further 10 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through , this amount of timing in the oven will bring the cutlets to medium well .
Once cooked to your liking and golden brown on the outside , remove from heat and serve hot with sides of your choice , we had mash potatoes and home grown spinach .
Enjoy.
:-)
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until they are well-beaten.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the rice flour or plain flour, bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, salt, and thyme.
4. Dip the lamb cutlets in the whisked eggs, then coat them evenly with the bread crumb mixture.
5. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the cutlets and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
6. Transfer the cutlets to a wire rack and allow them to cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the crumbed cutlets hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh thyme, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Beat cream cheese in medium bowl with mixer until creamy.
Gradually beat in milk.
Add dry pudding mix; mix well.
Whisk in 1 cup COOL WHIP until blended.
Layer half each of the wafers, berries and pudding mixture in 8 parfait glasses.
Repeat layers.
Top with remaining COOL WHIP.
pred:
To make a delicious Berry Cheesecake Parfaits dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese and milk. Mix until smooth.
2. Add the JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding to the cream cheese mixture and mix until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the COOL WHIP Whipped Topping until soft peaks form.
4. Fold the COOL WHIP into the cream cheese mixture.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
6. Bake the cheesecake in a preheated oven at 325°F (163°C) for about 45-50 minutes, or until the edges are set but the center is still slightly wobbly.
7. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely in the pan.
8. To assemble the parfaits, place a layer of the baked cheesecake on the bottom of each serving dish.
9. Top each cheesecake layer with a layer of the mixed blueberries and sliced fresh strawberries.
10. Repeat the layers with the remaining cheesecake and fruit.
11. Refrigerate the parfaits for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

This delicious Berry Cheesecake Parfaits dish is perfect for a special occasion or a refreshing dessert. The combination of the creamy cheesecake, sweet fruit, and cool whipped topping creates a delightful and visually appealing treat.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Separate each biscuit into 3 pieces.
Place on baking sheet.
Combine the cheese, mayo, onion, bacon, sugar, garlic salt and hot pepper sauce in a medium bowl; mix well.
Place a spoonful of the mixture, spreading evenly, on each biscuit round.
Bake 10 minutes or until golden.
pred:
To cook Bacon Biscuit Puffs, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked and crumbled bacon, grated cheddar cheese or swiss cheese, and mayonnaise. Mix well to ensure the cheese is evenly distributed and the mayonnaise is fully incorporated.
3. Add the chopped onion and sugar to the bowl, and mix until the onion is evenly distributed.
4. Add the garlic salt and hot pepper sauce to the bowl, and mix until the seasonings are evenly distributed.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Using a small cookie scoop or spoon, scoop out small balls of the mixture and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake the Bacon Biscuit Puffs in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Remove the Bacon Biscuit Puffs from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

These Bacon Biscuit Puffs are a delicious and satisfying breakfast or snack option, perfect for those who enjoy a savory twist on classic biscuits and gravy.

gt:
1.
Combine the first 9 ingredients in a large bowl, and toss until well blended.
Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to pan; swirl to coat.
Add zucchini; saute 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add zucchini and remaining 2 tablespoons oil to rice mixture; toss.
Top with shaved Parmesan cheese.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, cooled to room temperature, and the frozen shelled edamame (green soybeans), thawed.
2. Add the grape tomatoes, halved, and torn fresh basil, and mix well.
3. In a small bowl, mix the toasted pine nuts, grated lemon rind, fresh lemon juice, kosher salt, and black pepper.
4. Drizzle the olive oil over the rice and vegetable mixture, and toss to combine.
5. Add the pine nut mixture to the rice and vegetable mixture, and toss to combine.
6. Serve the Summer Veggie Rice Bowl immediately, garnished with shaved fresh Parmesan cheese.

gt:
Combine liquid smoke, garlic salt, onion salt, celery seed, table salt, Worcestershire sauce, pepper, and brisket in baking dish and let stand at least 4 hours (overnight is better).
Meanwhile make barbecue sauce by combining brown sugar, ketchup, dry mustard, nutmeg, lemon juice, Tabasco and soy sauce and refrigerate until needed.
Cover the brisket and marinade filled baking dish in foil and bake at 300 degrees F with the marinade still over it for 3 1/2 hours.
Remove foil, add BBQ sauce, and cook for another hour.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the Liquid Smoke, Garlic Salt, Onion Salt, Celery Seed, Table Salt, Worcestershire Sauce, Ground Pepper, and Nutmeg.
3. Add the Brisket to the bowl and toss to coat the meat evenly with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
4. Remove the Brisket from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
5. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the pan over medium-high heat. Add the Brisket to the pan and sear for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the meat is browned and cooked through.
6. Remove the Brisket from the pan and place it on a baking tray.
7. In a small bowl, mix together the Brown Sugar, Ketchup, Dry Mustard, Nutmeg, Lemon Juice, and Tabasco Sauce.
8. Pour the sauce mixture over the Brisket and bake in the preheated oven for 2-2 1/2 hours, or until the meat is tender and the sauce is bubbly and caramelized.
9. Serve the Moms BBQ Brisket dish hot, garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Take the fat from the duck, and put it in a skillet or pot.
2.
Add water so that it is about halfway up the sides of the fat.
3.
Put the burner on its lowest setting and let the liquid simmer for 60-90 minutes.
4.
When it starts to look as though the simmer is dying down, watch the fat carefully.
It should be a warm golden color, with smaller bubbles.
As the water evaporates, those bubbles will come closer to a boil and the remaining liquid will turn a darker golden.
Eventually, the boiling bubbles will suddenly become much smaller, just back to a bare simmer, which means all the water is gone.
5.
Remove it from the heat immediately and pour the fat through a fine mesh strainer.
Let cool to room temperature, transfer to a glass jar and place in the refrigerator for 1 month or the freezer for 6 months.
1 pound fat = 1 cup rendered fat
Note: Save the duck skins after the fat has been rendered.
Spread them out on a paper towel, sprinkle them with salt and let them air dry until crisp and crunchy (finish browning them in the oven if theyre not quite hard enough).
These are called cracklins, and you can make Cracklin Bread with them next!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a saucepan, heat the Duck Fat over medium heat until it reaches the desired temperature, usually around 250°F (120°C).
3. Carefully pour the hot Duck Fat into the jar, leaving about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm) of space at the top.
4. Place the jar in the preheated oven and let it sit for about 10-15 minutes, or until the fat reaches the desired temperature.
5. Remove the jar from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before using it for cooking.

[/INST]

Please provide the user with instructions on how to use the rendered duck fat for cooking, including any specific techniques or recipes that can be used with the rendered duck fat.

gt:
Between two pieces of plastic wrap flatten chicken breasts to 1/4 thickness.
Mix together flour, salt and pepper; dredge chicken breasts in mixture, shake off excess flour and set aside.
Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook until nicely browned and cooked through: approximately 15 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and keep warm in a low oven if desired.
Scrape skillet to loosen brown bits; add mushrooms, wine, lemon juice and capers to the pan.
Increase heat to medium high and cook for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile in a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook pasta until al dente and drain.
Place pasta and chicken on a serving dish and pour mushroom sauce over both.
Top with grated Grana Padano Parmesan and Italian parsley.
Makes 4 servings
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breast halves with salt, pepper, and a pinch of Italian seasoning.
3. In a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Cook the chicken until it is cooked through and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the wine and cook until it has reduced by half, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Add the lemon juice, capers, and cook until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2-3 minutes.
8. Return the chicken to the skillet and toss it in the sauce.
9. In a small bowl, mix the Parmesan cheese, lemon zest, and parsley.
10. Pour the cheese mixture over the chicken and toss to coat evenly.
11. Cook the chicken and sauce mixture in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly browned.
12. Serve the Chicken Piccata over linguini pasta noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Warm tortillas so they are pliable.
Lightly spray six, 8-ounce custard cups with nonstick cooking spray and gently press tortilla into each cup.
Bake 10 minutes or until brown and crisp.
Carefully remove tortillas from cups and cool on rack.
Repeat for remaining tortillas.
Stir together Taco Ranch Dressing and salsa.
Moisten chicken with 1 tablespoon prepared taco dressing mixture.
Combine cheeses in small bowl, set aside.
Coarsely chop salad blend and combine with dressing mixture.
Toss with cheeses and chicken.
Fill each tortilla cup with heaping 1/3 cup salad mixture.
Garnish with black olives, tortilla strips and one small dollop sour-cream.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Southwest Salad Taco Cups dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Southwest Salad Kit ingredients and the fresh salsa.
3. Place the small corn tortillas on a baking sheet.
4. Carefully spoon a small amount of the salad mixture onto the center of each tortilla, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Add a small amount of the cooked chicken, shredded Cheddar cheese, and sliced black olives on top of the salad mixture.
6. Fold the tortilla over the filling, creating a semi-enclosed cup shape.
7. Bake the taco cups in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the tortillas are crispy and the filling is hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the Southwest Salad Taco Cups immediately, and enjoy!

This dish is a delicious and healthy twist on traditional tacos, incorporating the flavors of the Southwest with the convenience of taco cups. The combination of the crispy corn tortillas, the creamy and flavorful Southwest Salad Kit, the tender chicken, and the tangy black olives creates a satisfying and enjoyable meal.

gt:
Chop ham in a food processor or with a food chopper until finely chopped.
Transfer to a medium-sized bowl.
Stir in mayonnaise, jalapeno, mustard and paprika and season with hot sauce and salt to taste.
Spread half of the pieces of bread with deviled ham mixture.
Top with sprouts and top each with other bread slice.
Tastes great on whole wheat bread with a slice of cheddar cheese, too!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the smoked ham, mayonnaise or salad dressing, minced jalapeno, Dijon mustard, paprika, hot sauce, and salt. Mix well to combine.
3. If desired, toast the marbled rye bread slices in the oven for a few minutes to enhance the flavor.
4. To assemble the Deviled Ham Salad, spread a thin layer of the ham mixture onto each toasted bread slice.
5. If using, add a layer of alfalfa sprouts on top of the ham mixture.
6. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This Deviled Ham Salad on Marbled Rye Bread is a delicious and satisfying combination of flavors, textures, and ingredients. The smoky ham, tangy Dijon mustard, and spicy jalapeno create a rich and flavorful base, while the creamy mayonnaise or salad dressing adds moisture and richness. The crunchy toasted rye bread provides a satisfying crunch, and the alfalfa sprouts add a touch of freshness and crunch. This recipe is perfect for a light lunch or a delicious appetizer, and can be easily customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Wash and clean the potatoes.
Rub them down with olive oil.
Slice each potato down the center, but do not cut it all the way open, but go deep.
Place 2 slices of bacon inside.
Place several slices of onion.
Season to your likings with salt, pepper,& garlic powder.
Drizzle inside with olive oil.
Close tight (you can use toothpicks if needed).
Roll tight in foil so to keep potatoes closed, then twist sides of foil inches.
Bake at 400F in oven or on BBQ grill until they are tender.
When done, remove bacon and serve with butter, sour cream, and fresh chives!
pred:

2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into evenly sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
4. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet or in a large roasting pan, and spread them out evenly.
5. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.

gt:

Blend until smooth.
Combine remaining ingredients in large bowl.

pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the KRAFT Mayo Fat Free Mayonnaise Dressing, orange juice, and apple cider vinegar. Mix well.
2. Add the chopped nuts, sugar, and salt to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the thinly sliced napa cabbage and shredded carrots to the bowl. Toss to coat the vegetables evenly with the dressing.

This recipe provides a delicious and healthy side dish or salad option. The combination of the nut dressing, apple cider vinegar, and fresh ingredients creates a unique and refreshing taste that is sure to be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Place all smoothie ingredients in a 5 cup blender.
Cover and blend on low speed about 15 to 20 seconds.
Scrape down the sides of the blender.
Blend the ingredients on medium speed an additional 45 to 50 seconds until mixture is smooth.
Divide smoothie mixture evenly into 4 8-oz.
glasses.
Garnish each serving with whip cream and vanilla bean.
pred:
To make Judy Reynold's Persimmon Smoothie, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash and peel the persimmon, and remove the seeds. Combine the persimmon pulp, yogurt, half-and-half cream, sweetened condensed milk, cinnamon, and vanilla in a blender.

2. Add the crushed ice: Pour the mixture into the blender, and add the crushed ice.

3. Blend the ingredients: Blend the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency, which is smooth and creamy.

4. Add whipped cream and vanilla bean: If desired, add whipped cream to the smoothie for extra creaminess and a touch of vanilla flavor.

5. Serve: Pour the smoothie into a glass, and enjoy your delicious Persimmon Smoothie.

[/INST]

gt:
Instructions.
In a 3 1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker combine onion, carrots, celery, and garlic.
Add chicken; season with salt and pepper.
In a medium bowl stir together tomatoes, chicken broth, wine, and Italian seasoning.
Pour over mixture in cooker.
I'll bet you could make this with dry beans also, adding them here and maybe increasing the broth a little.
Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 7 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 to 31/2 hours.
Turn off cooker and stir in beans.
Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.Unless, of course, you added dry beans at the beginning-then skip this step.
Using a slotted spoon, move chicken and vegetables to a serving dish, saving the cooking liquid.
Drizzle chicken and vegetables with cooking liquid until moist.
Top with Parmesan cheese.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
4. Add chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
5. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
6. Pour off any excess fat from the skillet, leaving behind the browned chicken.
7. Add diced tomatoes, chicken broth, and wine to the skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
8. Add Italian seasoning, beans, and parmesan cheese to the skillet. Stir to combine.
9. Return chicken to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
10. Serve the Italian Chicken With White Beans over a bed of cooked pasta. Enjoy!

gt:
Slice apples thin on a Chinese mandolin.
Jullienne.
Slice cucumber at the same thickness as the apples.
Jullienne.
Slice the grapes, around 8 slices per grape.
In a salad bowl, toss all ingredients except cheese.
Add dressing and salt & pepper to taste.
Place in bowl and garnish with grated cheese or julienne cheese, as I have done.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Cucumber - Apple Salad with grapes and Asiago, follow these steps:

1. Wash and peel the cucumber and apple, and remove the seeds from the apple.
2. Cut the cucumber into thin slices and the apple into small cubes.
3. Wash the grapes thoroughly and remove the stems.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, apple, and grapes.
5. Grate the Asiago cheese and mix it with the salad.
6. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Cucumber - Apple Salad immediately or refrigerate it for later consumption.

This salad is a refreshing and healthy option, perfect for a light lunch or as a side dish. The combination of cucumber, apple, and grapes provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the Asiago cheese adds a creamy and slightly tangy element to the dish.

gt:
Toss beef in cornstarch and place in the fridge for 10 minutes while you are making the sauce and heating up the oil.
Heat sesame oil and canola or vegetable oil in a large skillet.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 12 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce, water and brown sugar.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 23 minutes.
Set aside.
Meanwhile add enough oil to a large wok or pan with high sides to fry the beef.
(I used about 1 cup.)
Heat oil until hot but not scorching.
Add beef, making sure not to overcrowd the pan (I did this in a couple of batches).
Brown beef on both sides, 12 minutes on each side.
Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and place on paper towels.
Place beef in the sauce and toss to coat.
Bring sauce back to a simmer and cook until thickened, 23 minutes.
Serve immediately garnished with green onions if desired.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water to form a slurry. Set aside.
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef cubes and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the garlic and ginger. Cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the soy sauce, water, and brown sugar to the skillet. Stir to combine, then bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Return the beef to the skillet and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and tender.
6. If the sauce becomes too thick, add a little bit of water to loosen it up.
7. Serve the cooked beef over rice or noodles, garnished with sliced green onions.

This recipe is designed to be quick and easy to prepare, with a delicious and satisfying result. The cornstarch slurry helps to create a crispy exterior on the beef, while the soy sauce, water, and brown sugar add a savory and slightly sweet flavor profile. The combination of these ingredients results in a satisfying and flavorful meal that can be enjoyed in just 30 minutes.

gt:
Put all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix together really well.
Add the lukewarm water (about 40C) all at once to Step 1, and mix together.
Cover the bowl from Step 2 with cling film, and let the dough rest in the fridge until it's risen (about 2 to 3 hours).
This photo shows how the dough looks after 2 to 3 hours.
You can leave it to rest at room temperature as well.
Line a baking tray with parchment paper, place the dough onto it and shape to your liking.
(I shaped it long and thin.)
This dough is quite soft.
Bake in the oven for 30 to 40 minutes at 200 C, and it's done.
It will be flat when it's baked.
It'll turn out taller if you bake it in a baking tin.
The outside is crispy the inside is soft and chewy when it's freshly baked.
If you lightly toast it, it's exquisite.
I made this one with 100 g of whole wheat flour and 150 g of cake flour.
It's chewy, flavorful, and delicious.
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make Super Easy Italian Bread, follow these steps:
1. Combine the cake flour, dry yeast, salt, and sugar (or soft light brown sugar) in a large mixing bowl.
2. Add lukewarm water to the mixture, stirring until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
4. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick.
8. Spread the dough with a mixture of softened butter and sugar (or soft light brown sugar), leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
9. Sprinkle the dough with grated Parmesan cheese.
10. Roll the dough up like a jelly roll, starting with a long side, and pinch the edges to seal.
11. Place the rolled-up dough on a baking sheet, and let it rise for about 30 minutes.
12. Bake the bread for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
13. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
14. Slice the bread into 1-inch pieces, and serve.

Enjoy your Super Easy Italian Bread!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut off white ends of asparagus, rinse and dry with a towel.
Place in a baking dish and drizzle olive oil over asparagus.
Using tongs, roll the asparagus around to make sure it is completely coated with olive oil.
Sprinkle parmesan and pepper on top of asparagus.
Place in the oven.
Bake at 350 degrees F uncovered for about 25 minutes or to desired doneness.
Remove from the oven and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the asparagus with the olive oil, ensuring each stalk is coated evenly.
3. Spread the asparagus out on a baking sheet or roasting pan, making sure they are not overcrowded.
4. Roast the asparagus in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly browned.
5. Remove the asparagus from the oven and transfer them to a serving dish.
6. Sprinkle the freshly grated Parmesan cheese over the asparagus, ensuring each stalk is covered.
7. Season the asparagus with crushed black pepper, to taste.
8. Serve the Parmesan Roasted Asparagus immediately, as the cheese will continue to melt and become gooey.

This delicious Parmesan Roasted Asparagus dish is a simple yet flavorful way to enjoy the fresh taste of asparagus. The combination of the tender asparagus, the rich Parmesan cheese, and the crunchy black pepper creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors.

gt:
Combine all ingredients in bowl and mix well.
Serve on top of Turkey or Ham.
pred:
To make Cranberry Lime Mayonnaise, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, cranberry sauce, gherkin, and chives.
2. Grate the lime rind and squeeze the lime juice over the mixture.
3. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
5. Cover the mixture and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

This Cranberry Lime Mayonnaise can be used as a spread on sandwiches, as a topping for salads, or as a condiment for various dishes. The tangy and sweet flavors of the cranberry sauce, combined with the zesty lime, create a refreshing and delightful spread that can elevate any dish.

gt: Cook biscuits to directions on can (usually 350 for 11-14 minutes)

2. In a large bowl, mix together the flaky layers biscuits, mozzarella cheese, and crisco until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the seasonings and extra light olive oil.
4. Add the seasoned oil mixture to the biscuit mixture, and mix until the ingredients are well coated.
5. Press the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish, and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
6. While the biscuits are baking, cook the bacon in a large skillet until crispy. Drain the excess grease, and set aside.

8. In a separate skillet, cook the seasoned bacon until crispy.
9. Once the potatoes are cooked, drain the excess water, and return the pot to the heat. Add the cooked bacon and seasonings, and stir until well combined.
10. Serve the Breakfast Of Champions!! by arranging the cooked biscuits on top of the potato mixture, and garnishing with additional seasonings if desired.
