gt:
Place corn in the microwave with the husks on (yes with husks on) and cook for 8 minutes.
With a towel, remove the corn ears from the microwave and cut the bottom inch off so the the kernels are visible.
Stand corn up on the counter and pull the husks off from the top.
The ear of corn will slide out without any struggles and no silk attached (this is a great way to cook corn without the mess of husking) .
If you prefer to boil the corn or use your preferred way, thats fine too.
Now you need to roast the corn either on the grill or on a grill pan over high heat to get the corn to char on the outside.
If you dont have a grill you can lay the corn right on the grate of a gas stove, until charred on all sides.
Once roasted, cut the kernels off the cob and place kernels into a saute pan.
Add the mayo and the chili sauce and cook until warm over medium heat.
Remove from heat and add the coconut and cilantro.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy with your favorite BBQ or picnic meal.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the corn off the cob and remove the silk.
3. In a large bowl, mix the corn, mayonnaise, chili sauce, coconut, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the corn is tender and the coconut is golden brown.
5. Serve the Coconut Sweet Corn with Chili Mayo immediately.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
You are a helpful language and vision assistant. You are able to understand the visual content that the user provides, and assist the user with a variety of tasks using natural language.
<</SYS>>

Provide a cooking guide for preparing Coconut Sweet Corn with Chili Mayo and list the required ingredients as follows: 4 ears Fresh Corn,1/4 cups Mayonnaise,1/2 cups Chili Sauce (Not The Spicy Variety; Our Preferred Is Heinz),1/2 cups Flaked Coconut,3 Tablespoons Fresh Chopped Cilantro,1 pinch Salt,1 pinch Pepper.

gt:
Combine shrimp with garlic, pineapple juice, green onion and Sambal Olek in a zip-lock bag.
Marinate for 6 hours up to overnight in the fridge.
I place the zip lock bag in a container to prevent leaks from getting in the fridge.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat.
Remove shrimp from the marinade (reserve the marinade).
Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Working in 2 batches, to not over crowd the pan, saute 2-3 minutes per side for shrimp or until they are pink and curly.
Set aside on a plate once each batch is done.
Add pineapple into the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, then remove it from the pan and set aside.
Add marinade into the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes or until it has reduced by half and is caramel in color.
Add shrimp and pineapple back into pan, cook for another minute until shrimp and pineapple are warmed through.
Garnish with green onion and serve over rice.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, minced garlic, pineapple juice, green onion ends, sambal olek, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well to ensure the shrimp are evenly coated with the marinade.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or up to 2 hours.
3. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
4. In a separate bowl, combine the pineapple, green onion, and rice.
5. Remove the shrimp from the marinade and pat them dry with a paper towel.
6. Place the shrimp on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the shrimp in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the pineapple is slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the shrimp from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Spicy Pineapple Shrimp on a plate, garnished with green onion and rice.

This recipe combines the sweetness of the pineapple with the spiciness of the sambal olek and the savory flavor of the shrimp, creating a delicious and unique dish. The rice serves as a starchy base and complements the flavors of the shrimp and pineapple.

gt:
Heat panini grill.
Combine first 4 ingredients; spread onto 1 naan.
Cover with Singles and remaining naan.
Grill 5 min.
or until Singles is melted and sandwich is golden brown on both sides.
Cut in quarters.
pred:
1. Preheat a panini press or a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the mashed potatoes, peppercorn ranch dressing, garam masala, red chili powder or cayenne pepper, and a pinch of salt.
3. Spread a thin layer of the potato mixture on one side of each naan bread round.
4. Place the cheese slices on top of the potato mixture on the naan bread rounds.
5. Place the naan bread rounds with the cheese on top of the panini press or skillet.
6. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden brown.
7. Carefully remove the panini from the panini press or skillet and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Cut the panini into wedges and serve.

This Paratha Panini recipe combines the flavors of mashed potatoes, ranch dressing, garam masala, red chili powder, and cayenne pepper, along with the warmth of naan bread and the creaminess of cheese. The result is a delicious and satisfying sandwich that can be enjoyed as a meal or a snack.

gt:
Run reserved lemon wedge around the edge of a martini glass to moisten and then dip the glass in sugar.
Fill a shaker with cracked ice, add the lemon vodka, lemon juice, and sugar.
Shake well and strain into the sugared glass.
pred:
1. In a cocktail shaker, combine 1 12 fluid ounces of lemon-flavored vodka and 34 fluid ounces of fresh lemon juice.
2. Add a teaspoon of sugar to the shaker, and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds.
3. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a lemon wedge.
4. Serve immediately, and enjoy your Lemon Drop Cocktail!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add canola oil.
Throw in onions, cabbage, carrots, garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt, stirring to mix.
Let cool until vegetables are soft, about 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in chicken, green onions, peanuts, cilantro, remaining salt and pepper, tossing to coat, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add in 3/4 cup coconut milk and 1/3 cup sweet chili sauce, mixing thoroughly to combine.
Turn off heat.
Spray a 9x13 baking dish with nonstick spray.
Whisk together remaining coconut milk and sweet chili sauce.
Pour about 1/2 a cup or so on the bottom of the dish.
Slightly warm tortillas if desired to make them more pliable, then place a few spoonfuls of the chicken mixture in each, rolling up tightly and placing in the dish.
Cover with remaining coconut milk and chili sauce mix.
I usually take a spoon and cover every inch of the tortilla with the sauce, just to make sure its coated.
Bake for 20 minutes, then remove and top with additional peanuts and cilantro.
Since sauce is not as thick as traditional enchilada sauce, when you remove them from the oven, spoon sauce from the bottom of the dish all over the tortillas.
Additionally this can be done halfway through cooking too.
pred:
[INSTR]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the shredded chicken and cook until browned, then remove from the heat and set aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded carrots, cabbage, and chopped onions. Season with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
4. Roll out the tortillas and place them on a baking sheet. Spread a layer of the cooked chicken mixture on each tortilla, then roll them up to enclose the filling.
5. Place the enchiladas seam-side down in a baking dish. Pour the coconut milk and sweet chili sauce over the enchiladas, then bake for 20-25 minutes or until the enchiladas are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly.
6. Garnish with chopped green onions and crushed peanuts. Serve immediately.

[/INSTR]

[/SYS]

gt:
Bring a medium saucepan filled with salted water to a boil over high heat.
Blanch broccoli rabe by placing it in the boiling salted water for 2 minutes.
Drain broccoli rabe and cool it in an ice water bath.
Once cool, drain broccoli rabe and shake to remove excess water.
Chop on the into 1-inch pieces and set aside.
Cook pasta according to the package directions.
While the pasta cooks, heat a large frying pan over medium heat.
Add olive oil, garlic, 3 teaspoons of the anchovies, and red pepper flakes.
Cook until garlic begins to color and anchovies dissolve into the sauce.
Add drained and chopped broccoli rabe and saute until thoroughly heated and slightly wilted.
Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Add drained pasta and remaining 1 teaspoon anchovies and toss until pasta is coated with sauce and dish is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Adjust seasoning as necessary and serve.
pred:
1. In a large pot, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the broccoli rabe to the skillet and cook until it is tender but still vibrant in color, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the anchovy fillets to the skillet and cook until they are heated through and the flavors have melded together, about 2-3 minutes.
6. Season the cooked pasta with red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the pasta immediately, topped with the cooked broccoli rabe and anchovies mixture.

This savory Orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe, Red Pepper Flakes, and Anchovies Recipe is a delicious and hearty dish that combines the flavors of the pasta, broccoli rabe, anchovies, and red pepper flakes. The combination of ingredients creates a rich and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by both vegetarians and meat-eaters alike.

gt:
Thoroughly mix the garlic with the pepper, salt, and hot pepper; then stir in the parsley and set aside.
Heat half the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Add the slices from 1 tomato to the pan and cook for 1 minute.
Turn over and sprinkle the slices with the garlic mixture.
Continue to cook for another minute, shaking the pan occasionally; then turn the slices over again and cook until they are done, but not mushy.
Slide the tomato slices onto a plate then repeat with the rest of the oil & tomato slices.
Serve immediately after cooking.
Note: Do not try to cook more than two servings at a time or the tomatoes will end up overcooked.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the crushed garlic, salt, and pepper to taste.
3. In a large bowl, toss the sliced tomatoes with the olive oil, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Add the garlic mixture to the tomatoes, and toss to combine.
5. Spread the tomato mixture on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Roast the tomatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the tomatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. In a small bowl, mix the finely chopped hot pepper with the fresh parsley.
9. Carefully slice the roasted tomatoes into halves or quarters, depending on your preference.
10. Serve the Fried Tomatoes With Garlic on a plate, garnished with the parsley and hot pepper mixture.

Enjoy your delicious Fried Tomatoes With Garlic!

gt:
In a medium bowl, blend the butter with half of the garlic, 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice, the honey, horseradish and chopped parsley.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
In a small saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the parsley leaves until bright green, about 1 minute.
Drain and cool under running water.
In a blender, puree the parsley with 2 tablespoons of water and the remaining garlic and 1 tablespoon of lemon juice until nearly smooth.
With the machine on, gradually add the 1/3 cup of oil until incorporated.
Season the parsley sauce with salt and pepper.
Light a grill.
Brush the chicken thighs with oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill over moderate heat, turning occasionally, until charred in spots and just cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.
Brush the chicken all over with the honey butter and grill, turning and brushing, until glazed, about 2 minutes more.
Transfer the chicken to a platter or plates and serve with the parsley sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, lemon juice, horseradish, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, toss the chicken thighs in the olive oil to coat them evenly. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
4. Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush the chicken thighs with more olive oil and place them on the grill or grill pan. Cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
5. While the chicken is cooking, place the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Once the butter has melted, add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
6. Remove the chicken from the grill or grill pan and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. In a small saucepan, whisk together the honey mixture and the cooked garlic butter. Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat.
8. Once the chicken is cool enough to handle, slice it into thighs and serve the chicken with the parsley sauce.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat dressing in large saucepan on medium heat.
Add onions, garlic and jalapeno; cook and stir 5 min.
or until crisp-tender.
Add chicken, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, cumin and chili powder; bring to boil.
Reduce heat; simmer on medium-low heat 15 to 18 min., stirring occasionally.
Using a slotted spoon remove chicken breasts.
Using two forks shred the chicken; return to saucepan and simmer an additional 35 min., stirring occasionally.
Add corn and cilantro, cook 10 min.
longer.
Serve soup topped with cheese and crushed tortilla chips.
pred:
To prepare a perfect Spicy Chicken Tortilla Soup, follow these key steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, cooking until softened.
3. Add the jalapeno pepper and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Add the chicken breast halves to the skillet, cooking until browned on both sides and cooked through.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, cumin, chili powder, corn, and cilantro. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, shredded cheese, and tortilla chips. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Serve the Spicy Chicken Tortilla Soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and tortilla chips, if desired.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and hearty Spicy Chicken Tortilla Soup that is perfect for a cozy meal or a gathering with friends and family.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Line 24 cupcake cups with paper liners.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
With a pastry cutter, chop the shortening into the dry ingredients until the mixture becomes crumbly, then beat in the egg whites, vanilla extract, and 1 cup of milk to make a smooth batter.
Spoon batter into the paper-lined cupcake cups, filling them about 2/3 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean, 22 to 26 minutes.
Allow cupcakes to cool completely.
In a bowl, beat together the pudding mix and 2 cups of skim milk until the pudding is thickened, about 2 minutes.
Allow to stand for 5 minutes to finish thickening.
Spoon the pudding into a pastry bag with a medium tip.
To fill and decorate cupcakes, use a thin paring knife to cut a small hole, about 1/2 inch in diameter, into the top of a cupcake.
Insert the knife about 3/4 of the way down into the cupcake, and remove the core.
Use the pastry bag to fill the hole with pudding, piping in enough pudding to fill the hole flush with the top of the cupcake.
Frost the tops of the filled cupcakes with light whipped cream, spreading it into a smooth layer.
Place a blueberry in the center of each cupcake.
Around the blueberry, arrange 5 slices of strawberry, pointed ends outward, to make a star shape.
Store in refrigerator.
pred:
To cook a delicious Independence Day Cupcakes dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add the vegetable shortening and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until they are stiff and peaks form.
5. Gradually add the egg whites to the flour mixture, mixing until the batter is smooth and well combined.
6. Fold in the vanilla extract and milk.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the instant sugar-free vanilla pudding mix with the skim milk according to the package instructions.
8. Pour the pudding mixture into the batter and mix until well combined.
9. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
10. Fill each cupcake liner with the batter, about 3/4 full.
11. Bake the cupcakes for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
12. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
13. To assemble the cupcakes, place a dollop of light whipped cream on top of each cupcake.
14. Add a few thinly sliced strawberries or fresh blueberries as desired.
15. Serve the Independence Day Cupcakes immediately, and enjoy your delicious dessert!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Slice squash in half lengthwise and scrape out the insides with a spoon.
Place the squash halves on a foil lined rimmed baking sheet and drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes then remove from oven and set aside.
Keep the oven on.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat then add bell pepper and onion and saute until tender.
Then remove skillet from the heat.
Mix together bell pepper, onion, breadcrumbs and sour cream in a small bowl.
Stuff squash with mixture and top with cheese.
Bake for another 10 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the summer squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. Brush the cut sides of the squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
4. Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the squash is tender and slightly caramelized.
5. In a large skillet, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced green bell pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the diced onion and cook for another 5 minutes, or until softened.
7. In a small bowl, mix the bread crumbs with the light sour cream.
8. Add the cooked onion and bell pepper mixture to the bread crumb mixture and stir to combine.
9. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, to taste.
10. Carefully remove the roasted squash from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Scoop out the squash flesh and place it in a large mixing bowl.
12. Add the cooked onion and bell pepper mixture to the squash, and stir to combine.
13. Fill the squash shells with the stuffing mixture and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
14. Place the stuffed squash shells on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
15. Serve the Stuffed Summer Squash dish hot.

gt:
Brown chops in oil for 10 minutes.
Add peppers and mushrooms, cook 5 minutes.
Add garlic, tomatoes and tomato sauce.
Stir and cook 3 minutes.
Add wine.
Add seasonings.
Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced green peppers and cook until they are tender, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender, about 8 minutes.
5. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
6. Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and white wine.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
8. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Place the pork chops on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
10. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
11. Remove the pork chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
In a medium bowl, whisk together egg, parsley, garlic and crushed red pepper.
Mix in Gouda and Emmentaler.
One sheet at a time, place phyllo dough on a flat surface and brush with about 1 tablespoon butter.
Cut lengthwise into 4 strips.
Place a rounded teaspoon of the egg mixture at one end of each strip.
Fold corner of strip over the filling, forming a triangular fold.
Continue folding the length of the strip in triangular folds to form a small stuffed triangle.
Repeat with remaining phyllo dough.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly butter a large baking sheet.
Arrange stuffed phyllo triangles in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until lightly browned.
Serve warm.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk the egg and lightly beat it.
3. Add the minced parsley, garlic, crushed red pepper, and melted butter to the egg mixture. Whisk until well combined.
4. Add the shredded Gouda and Emmentaler cheeses to the egg mixture. Stir until the cheese is evenly distributed.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over the phyllo dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
6. Roll out the remaining phyllo dough to create a large rectangle. Place the cheese mixture on top of the rolled-out dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
7. Fold the edges of the phyllo dough over the cheese mixture, creating a half-moon shape.
8. Brush the edges of the dough with melted butter.
9. Bake the borek in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot.
10. Remove the borek from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 10 inch round cake pan.
In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, sugar, and fennel seed.
In another bowl, stir together the eggs, buttermilk, and melted butter.
Stir the wet ingredients into the flour mixture, until just blended using a large spoon.
Spoon the batter into the prepared pan.
Dot with the 3 tablespoons of chilled butter.
Bake for about 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden.
Cut into wedges and serve warm.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the sugar, fennel seed, and eggs.
3. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
4. Gradually add the buttermilk, stirring until the dough comes together.
5. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
8. Cut out circles of dough using a cookie cutter or a glass.
9. Place the circles of dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake the soda bread for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is cooked through.
11. Remove the soda bread from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before slicing it into wedges and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Carefully cut the acorn squash in half lengthwise, and scrape out seeds.
Place cut side down in a microwave-safe 10 inch glass pie plate, and add the water.
Cover with microwave-safe plastic wrap and vent one side.
Microwave on high power for 12 minutes, turning the dish a quarter turn twice, until the squash is tender when pierced with a fork.
Let stand, covered for 5 minutes.
Protecting your hand with a double thickness of paper toweling, spoon out the softened squash flesh and transfer to a food processor.
Add the buttrer and maple syrup and process until the mixture is pureed.
Season to taste with salt, and pepper, and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the acorn squash in half lengthwise, and scoop out the seeds and pulp.
3. Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet.
4. Drizzle the squash with water and place a piece of parchment paper or foil on top of each half.
5. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the flesh is tender and the skin is slightly charred.
6. Remove the squash from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Carefully scoop out the cooked squash pulp into a large bowl.
8. Add the butter, maple syrup, salt, and pepper to the bowl.
9. Using a hand mixer or a food processor, blend the squash mixture until smooth and creamy.
10. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
11. Serve the Pureed Acorn Squash With Maple Syrup warm or cold, as desired.

Enjoy your delicious Pureed Acorn Squash With Maple Syrup!

gt:
In a large bowl, combine the Chex, pretzels, Fritos, and nuts.
In a medium microwavable bowl, add butter, honey, and brown sugar.
Microwave for about 3 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Pour over the dry mixture and stir well.
Dump the snack mix on wax paper (or foil) to cool.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Chex Cereal, Pretzels, and Fritos.
3. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
4. Add the melted butter to the dry ingredients in the mixing bowl, stirring to combine.
5. In a separate small saucepan, melt the honey or Karo Syrup over low heat.
6. Add the melted honey or syrup to the dry ingredients in the mixing bowl, stirring to combine.
7. Add the brown sugar to the mixing bowl, stirring to combine.
8. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure even cooking.
10. Once the mixture is golden brown and crispy, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Once cooled, transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl and stir in the mixed roasted nuts.
12. Enjoy your delicious Sweet & Salty Snack Mix!

Please note that the cooking time may vary depending on the oven and the size of the baking sheet. Keep an eye on the mixture to ensure it does not burn.

gt:
In a medium saucepan, gently whisk together the cocoa powder and sugar.
Whisk in the cream, then turn the heat to medium and whisk it as it warms up.
When the mixture starts to heat up, add the butter and stir it in to melt.
Then when the mixture is nice and hot, add the vanilla and stir it to combine.
Let the sauce cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer it to a mason jar.
Store it in the fridge (it will become solid as it cools).
To serve, scoop out the amount you need and place it in a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat it for 20 seconds, then stir and heat for another 10 or until the sauce is warm.
pred:
1. In a saucepan, combine the unsweetened cocoa powder, sugar, and heavy cream.
2. Heat the saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar is fully dissolved and the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
3. Add the butter, cut into pieces, and stir until it is melted and fully incorporated into the sauce.
4. Reduce the heat to low, and let the sauce simmer for about 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and stir in the vanilla extract.
6. Let the sauce cool for a few minutes, then pour it into a container and refrigerate it until it reaches room temperature.
7. Serve the Hot Fudge Sauce over ice cream, waffles, or any other dessert of your choice.

Enjoy your delicious Hot Fudge Sauce!

gt:
Place cleaned and dried greens in large mixing bowl.
Greens should be torn into bite sized pieces.
Add vinaigrette and toss.
On a large platter arrange greens first covering platter.
Take eggs and spread neatly in a row at top of platter.
On opposite side, place sliced beets across in same manner.
Next to eggs spread onions across platter.
Next to beets, spread cooked chicken across platter.
Top middle row with sliced potatoes.
Sprinkle a touch of salt and pepper over the entire platter.
Top each serving with croutons.
Recipe by taylor68too
pred:
[INST]Taylor's Dinner Salad is a delicious and nutritious salad that combines a variety of fresh ingredients to create a satisfying and balanced meal. To prepare this salad, start by washing and drying the lettuce and potato thoroughly. Then, cut the potato into bite-sized pieces and toss them in a little bit of oil, salt, and pepper. Roast the potatoes in the oven until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.

Next, wash and dry the lettuce and red onion. Cut the onion into thin slices and the lettuce into bite-sized pieces. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, onion, and potatoes.

To make the vinaigrette, whisk together the vinaigrette ingredients (vinegar, oil, mustard, salt, and pepper) until smooth. Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to coat evenly.

To add some extra flavor and texture, you can add the sliced pickled beets and croutons. Finally, peel and slice the hard-boiled eggs and add them to the salad.

Taylor's Dinner Salad is a delicious and nutritious meal that can be enjoyed as a main course or as a side dish. The combination of ingredients provides a balance of flavors and textures, making it a satisfying and enjoyable meal. [/INST]

gt:
Place poblano, serrano, tomatillos and garlic on a roasting pan and roast under high temperature until skins are blackened.
You can also use the broiler, for quicker results, but watch carefully.
Remove blackened skin from poblano, rinse under cold water to remove seeds.
Add poblano, serrano, garlic, tomatillos and cilantro to a food processor and grind until smooth.
Add salt, pepper and comino and quickly pulse.
Here is where you want to taste for seasoning, before you add ground turkey.
Add turkey and vinegar and pulse until combined.
Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight.
Leaving the mix overnight is preferred, giving time for flavors to enhance.
When ready, heat pan, add a small amount of oil, and add your chorizo to the pan.
Cook until fully cooked, then add your eggs.
Cook until eggs are set.
Serve rolled in a tortilla, or omit eggs in the mix and serve meat with sunny side eggs.
pred:
To make Green Chorizo, you will need the following ingredients:
1 whole Poblano pepper, 1 whole Serrano pepper, 2 whole Tomatillos, 1 clove of garlic, a bunch of cilantro (stems removed and lightly chopped), 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper, freshly ground, 2 teaspoons of Comino (cumin), 1-1/2 pounds of ground turkey, 2 teaspoons of vinegar, and 8 whole eggs.

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the Poblano pepper in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes. Place the pepper halves, cut-side down, on a baking sheet. Roast the peppers in the preheated oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until the skin is blackened and the peppers are soft. Remove the peppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
3. Remove the skin and seeds from the roasted peppers, and then chop them finely.
4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped Poblano peppers, Serrano peppers, tomatillos, minced garlic, cilantro, salt, pepper, and cumin. Mix well.
5. Add the ground turkey and vinegar to the bowl, and mix everything together until well combined.
6. Transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl, and then add the eggs. Mix everything together until the eggs are well incorporated.
7. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
8. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
9. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
10. Scoop the chorizo mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, and shape it into a log or a flat patty.
11. Bake the chorizo in the preheated oven for about 30-4

gt:
Brown sausage with onion and peppers
Add eggs, salsa, and cheese mixing after each.
Dish into heated tortilla.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the onion and green pepper to the skillet and cook until softened.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and salsa together.
5. Add the cooked sausage and vegetables to the egg mixture, stirring to combine.
6. Fill the tortillas with the sausage and vegetable mixture, leaving a small border around the edges for the cheese.
7. Roll the tortillas around the filling, enclosing the cheese.
8. Place the filled tortillas on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the savory Breakfast Burritos warm, with a side of salsa and sour cream, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Melt butter in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat; add onion.
Cook 4 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Add the cauliflower, potato, carrot, and caraway seeds.
Cook 6 minutes or until cauliflower begins to brown, stirring frequently.
Add broth; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in salt and pepper.
pred:
1. Heat the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the cauliflower florets and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the diced peeled baking potato, carrot, and caraway seeds. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender.
5. Using an immersion blender or transferring the mixture to a blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy. Alternatively, you can use a regular blender, but be cautious not to overfill the blender and avoid any spills.
6. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed. Serve the Cauliflower Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper, if desired.

This recipe for Cauliflower Soup is a delicious and healthy option, as it is low in calories and high in nutrients. The combination of cauliflower, potato, and carrot provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the caraway seeds add a unique, slightly earthy taste. The soup can be enjoyed as a warm and comforting meal, or even as a light and refreshing lunch or dinner.

gt:
Peel and section oranges and grapefruit over a large bowl, reserving juice; add sections to juice.
Add jicama and radishes to orange mixture; toss gently.
Cover and chill 30 minutes.Combine rind and next 6 ingredients (through salt) in a small bowl, stirring until smooth.
Arrange lettuce in a large bowl.
Using a slotted spoon, place the orange mixture over lettuce; drizzle evenly with yogurt mixture.
Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds, pumpkinseed kernels, and cilantro.Wine note: Sparkling wine deserves a place at every holiday table, both for its celebratory allure and compatibility with many foods.
When celebrating Santa Fe style, look for Gruet Brut NV ($14) from New Mexico.
Made in the manner of true Champagne, it has lemony acidity that stands up to the acid of the yogurt dressing, while crisp grapefruit flavors echo the salad's citrus elements.
--Jeffery Lindenmuth
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Cut the oranges and grapefruit into segments, removing any seeds and membranes.
3. Cut the jicama into 1-inch cubes and the red radishes into 1/2-inch slices.
4. In a large bowl, mix the lime rind, lime juice, yogurt, mayonnaise, honey, and pepper.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the salt, black pepper, and cilantro.
6. Add the chopped romaine lettuce, pomegranate seeds, and pumpkinseed kernels to the large bowl with the dressing.
7. Toss the ingredients until they are evenly coated with the dressing.
8. Transfer the salad to a serving bowl and garnish with a sprinkle of the cilantro mixture.
9. Place the salad in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the lettuce is wilted and the dressing is slightly crispy.
10. Serve immediately and enjoy your Ensalada de Noche Buena!

gt:
For the waffles: Combine all the ingredients in a medium bowl and whisk together.
Set aside.
Heat waffle iron to medium-high and grease with cooking spray.
Pour batter onto waffle iron and cook until done.
Blueberry Fruit Sauce: Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Stir and cook until blueberries break down and sauce reduces and thickens.
Notes: Use any sweetener you like in place of agave.
1 tablespoon does not make a very sweet waffle so increase amounts as desired.
For a thicker fruit sauce, add 1 tablespoon of cornstarch while sauce cooks.
pred:
1. Preheat your waffle iron and prepare your workspace.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the oat flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg whites, yogurt, vanilla extract, agave, and canola oil.
4. Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until well combined.
5. Fold in the blueberries and water.
6. Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron, using a ladle or a spoon to evenly distribute the batter.
7. Cook the waffles according to your waffle iron's instructions, typically until the edges are golden brown and the center is cooked through.
8. Serve the waffles with the desired toppings, such as butter, syrup, or fruit.

Enjoy your delicious Oatmeal Blueberry Waffles!

gt:
Peel peaches, leave whole and place in acid solution, while you finish peeling all the peaches.
In a large pot, cook wine, white & brown sugars, lemon juice and one cinnamon stick.
Stir until all sugar is dissolved and mixture begins to boil.
Remove the cinnamon stick and reserve the syrup.
Rinse the peaches.
Stick two cloves into each peach and add the peaches to the reserved syrup, heating the peaches until slightly softened.
Remove from heat and allow peaches to sit in syrup overnight at room temperature.
Next day, remove the cinnamon and cloves from the peaches.
Slice the peaches into thick wedges and place back into the syrup.
Next add the shredded candied ginger into the peach mixture and reheat the peaches.
Once the peaches are hot, pack tightly into hot sterilized jars, make sure to add 1 stick of cinnamon to each jar.
Cover the peaches completely with hot syrup, make sure to release any air bubbles, adding more syrup if necessary.
Clean the rims and seal the jars.
Process quart jars for 25 minutes in a water bath canner.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Wash and peel the peaches, then cut them into large chunks.
3. In a large bowl, mix together the peaches, peach wine, sugar, and lemon juice.
4. Add the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and candied ginger to the mixture.
5. Cover the bowl and let the mixture sit in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. After the mixture has chilled, transfer it to a large baking dish or roasting pan.
7. Roast the peaches in the preheated oven for about 30-45 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the roasted peaches from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Spiced Peaches in Peach Wine warm, garnished with a dusting of powdered sugar if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Start by putting chicken, salsa, broth, and vegetables into your crock pot.
For the vegetables, I used a stew mix and a pepper and onion mix.
You can use whatever variety of frozen vegetables you like.
Season to your taste with salt, pepper, and hot pepper.
I used ghost pepper powder.
Ghost pepper is very hot so you can tame it with red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper or not use anything at all.
Let the chicken and vegetable mix cook on medium heat for 8 hours.
You can reduce the time by cooking on high.
The trick is to cook the chicken through.
After cooking, shred the chicken with two forks and add the black beans.
Mix everything together and add additional seasonings if necessary.
Serve plain or with sour cream and shredded cheese.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the chicken breast in chicken broth until fully cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
2. In the same pot, add the salsa, black beans, and frozen mixed vegetables. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
3. Add the cooked chicken back into the pot and stir to combine.
4. Season the soup with salt, pepper, and ghost pepper powder or red pepper flakes, to taste.
5. Simmer the soup for about 10-15 minutes, or until the flavors are well-blended and the chicken is fully cooked through.
6. Serve the Spicy Chicken and Black Bean Soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, if desired.

This recipe combines the flavors of spicy chicken, black beans, and vegetables to create a delicious and hearty soup. The use of frozen ingredients makes it a convenient option for those who want to enjoy a homemade meal without extensive preparation time.

gt:
Preheat your broiler.
In an 8 to 10-inch oven safe skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the shallot and mushrooms and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
Add the asparagus, Italian seasoning, thyme, crushed red pepper and a dash of salt and black pepper.
Cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream and a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Stir in the goats cheese, half of the Parmesan cheese and the veggie mixture.
Wipe out the pan with a dry paper towel, and then spray generously with a non-stick spray and heat over medium.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan, and cook for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are set but the middle is still runny.
Slide a rubber spatula around the edge a couple of times during these 8-10 minutes to prevent sticking and to allow the uncooked mixture to flow underneath.
Remove from heat and sprinkle on the remaining half of the Parmesan cheese.
Place the frittata under the broiler and broil until set and golden brown, about 3-4 minutes depending on how hot your broiler gets.
Remove from heat, garnish with fresh parsley, cut into 8 equal-sized wedges and serve immediately!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes. Season with Italian seasoning, thyme, crushed red pepper, salt, and black pepper.
4. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, heavy cream, and crumbled goat's cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the mushroom and asparagus mixture in the skillet. Cook over medium heat until the edges begin to set, about 5 minutes.
6. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the frittata is set and the edges are golden brown.
7. Remove the frittata from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Slice the frittata into wedges and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
The Spring Asparagus and Mushroom Frittata is now ready to be enjoyed. The dish is a delicious and nutritious meal that combines the fresh flavors of asparagus and mushrooms with the richness of goat's cheese and cream. The frittata is a versatile dish that can be served as a main course or a side dish, and it can be easily customized with different ingredients and seasonings to suit individual tastes.
<</SYS>>

gt:
Boil rice as directed on package with salt (usually every cup of rice is 2 cups of water).
Set aside.
In a medium pan, heat sofrito & onion until onion almost translucent.
Combine rest of ingredients, EXCEPT RICE, & bring to a boil.
Then simmer until potatoes are fork tender.
About 30 minutes.
If needed add a little chicken broth or water to keep saucy.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the rice, beans, sofrito, onions, sazon, adobo, salt, and pepper.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover.
3. Simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the beans are tender.
4. Add the tomato sauce, olives, and chicken broth or water. Stir well.
5. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve the dish hot and enjoy!

[/INST]

This delicious Puertorican WHITE Rice and Beans dish is a popular and comforting meal that combines the flavors of rice, beans, and a variety of spices. The ingredients, such as the white rice, pink or red beans, sofrito, sazon, adobo, and seasonings, work together to create a rich and satisfying dish that is perfect for a hearty meal or a side dish. The addition of the tomato sauce, olives, and chicken broth or water not only enhances the flavor but also adds moisture to the dish, making it even more enjoyable.

gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place fish in shallow baking dish; drizzle with 3 Tbsp.
dressing.
Bake 10 to 12 min.
or until fish flakes easily with fork.
Meanwhile, heat remaining dressing in large skillet on medium heat.
Add garlic; cook and stir 1 min.
Stir in spinach; cover.
Cook 2 min.
; uncover.
Cook 30 sec.
or just until spinach is wilted, turning frequently with tongs.
Place spinach on 2 serving plates; sprinkle evenly with 2 tsp.
cheese.
Top with fish and dressing reserved from bottom of baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. Rinse the salmon fillets and pat them dry with paper towels.
4. In a small bowl, mix the KRAFT Lite Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing with 1/4 cup of the dressing.
5. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
6. Place the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Brush the salmon fillets with the remaining 1/4 cup of KRAFT Lite Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing.
8. Roast the salmon fillets in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork.
9. While the salmon is cooking, heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until fragrant.
10. Add the baby spinach leaves to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, until they are wilted and slightly crispy.
11. Remove the salmon fillets from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes.
12. Slice the salmon fillets into thin pieces and serve them on a plate.
13. Sprinkle the cooked salmon with the remaining KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese.

Enjoy your Mediterranean Salmon for Two, a delicious and healthy meal that combines the flavors of salmon, garlic, and spinach with the tangy taste of the KRAFT Lite Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing and the richness of Parmesan cheese.

gt:
Put sugar and milk into a saucepan.
Heat gently, sitrring constantly until sugar dissolves.
Add condensed milk, butter, salt and golden syrup.
Stir until butter has melted.
Bring to the boil and continue boiling until the soft ball stage, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.
(Drop a little bit of the mixture to a cup of cold water, if the mixture forms a slight ball then is it done).
Remove from heat.
Cool slightly.
Beat until thick.
Pour into buttered tin.
Mark into squares.
Cut when cold.
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make Russian Fudge, follow these steps:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, milk, and sweetened condensed milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 240°F (115°C).
2. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the butter and salt. Stir until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth.
3. Gradually add the golden syrup, stirring continuously. The mixture will thicken as it cools.
4. Pour the fudge mixture onto a greased and floured surface or a silicone mat. Spread it evenly to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
5. Chill the fudge in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until it is firm.
6. Cut the fudge into desired shapes using a sharp knife or a cookie cutter.
7. Store the fudge in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Enjoy your delicious Russian Fudge!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees .
Spray mini- muffin tins.
Cook pasta according to box directions.
Set aside.
In medium size pan.
Combine butter & flour .
Whisk until butter is melted & flour us combined till smooth.
Slowly add milk & bring to a simmer.
Add 1&1/2 cups cheese , cream cheese, salt, pepper.
Stir until creamy & smooth.
In a large bowl.
Carefully stir pasta cheese sause & egg.
Until pasta is coated.
Spoon mac & cheese into mini - muffin tins.
Top eacg with a small piece of cheese.Bake 15 minutes.
Cool 5 minutes.
Remove bites.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large saucepan, cook the macaroni according to the package instructions until it is tender. Drain the cooked macaroni and set aside.
3. In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture turns light brown. This is called a roux.
4. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, and cook until the mixture thickens. This will take around 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper, stirring until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
6. Add the cooked macaroni to the saucepan and stir to combine.
7. In a small bowl, beat the egg-beaten and cream cheese together.
8. Pour the egg-beaten and cream cheese mixture over the macaroni and cheese mixture. Stir to combine.
9. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish or muffin tin.
10. Bake the macaroni and cheese bites in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
11. Allow the macaroni and cheese bites to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Start the day before.
Chop cheese into 1/2 inch thick rounds.
Marinate the cheese in 2 tablespoons olive oil and both the fresh and dried herbs.
Season lightly.
Put in the fridge overnight.
Half an hour before you wish to eat, take the cheese out of fridge and bring up to room temperature.
Preheat oven to 170 degrees C/350 degrees F.
Prepare salad by dividing greens and red onion between two plates.
Chop beetroot and divide.
Make the dressing with the remaining oil and vinegar.
Take the cheese and roll lightly in crushed walnuts to coat.
Bake in a lightly oiled roasting dish for 58 minutes until heated through and bubbling gently.
Use a fish slice to gently remove the cheese and place on top of the salad.
Season well, dress and eat!
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the goats cheese, 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, and the thyme and rosemary. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast the goats cheese in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until it is melted and slightly golden brown.
4. While the goats cheese is roasting, prepare the salad by washing the arugula, winter greens, and red onion thoroughly.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the arugula, winter greens, and red onion.
6. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste.
7. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
8. Once the goats cheese is done, let it cool slightly.
9. Add the crushed walnuts to the salad and toss to combine.
10. Serve the Baked Goats Cheese Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
STIR together Miracle Whip, cheese and seasoning.
SPREAD over chicken.
BAKE at 400F (200C) for 15 minutes or until done.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the Miracle Whip Original Spread, KRAFT 100% Parmesan Grated Cheese, and Italian seasoning. Mix well.
3. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
4. Place the chicken breasts in a single layer on a baking sheet.
5. Pour the Miracle Whip and cheese mixture over the chicken breasts, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Roast the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
8. Serve the cooked chicken with the Miracle Whip and Parmesan cheese mixture as a delicious and satisfying side dish.

This delightful MIRACLE WHIP Italian Chicken dish is a delicious and easy-to-prepare meal that combines the creamy texture of Miracle Whip with the rich, savory flavor of KRAFT 100% Parmesan Grated Cheese. The Italian seasoning adds a touch of zest, while the boneless, skinless chicken breasts provide a tender and juicy center. The dish is perfect for a cozy night in or a gathering with friends and family.

gt:
Place pork, onions, salt, pepper, cumin, and bay leaves into a large braising pan; cover with water; gently simmer over medium-heat 1 1/2 hours or until pork is tender; drain liquid from pork; remove bay leaves; trim pork into 1/2" pieces.
NOTE: A portion of the pork may be cooled and frozen at this point, then used for making carnitas later on.
Wipe braising pan dry; pour in vegetable oil and heat until oil almost smokes; brown pork in oil, stirring occasionally, for approximately 15 minutes.
While pork is still cooking, prepare the sauce: Remove most of the membranes and most of the seeds from the jalapeno peppers; bring chicken stock to boil in medium saucepan; add tomatillos, jalapenos, and garlic cloves and boil 3 minutes; pour hot contents of saucepan into blender; puree.
Pour sauce over browned pork; simmer 15 minutes over low heat; thicken, if desired, with a slurry of 3 tablespoons masa harina shaken with 1/4 cup water until smooth.
NOTE: You may make your chile verde as spicy or as mild as you like by simply increasing or decreasing the amount of jalapeno pepper seeds and membranes included in the sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pork, onion, salt, pepper, cumin, and bay leaves. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.

3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, chicken broth, tomatillo, jalapeno peppers, and garlic cloves.

4. Pour the marinade over the pork mixture, and stir to coat the pork evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.

5. After marinating, remove the pork from the bowl and shake off any excess marinade.

6. Place the pork on a baking sheet lined with foil or parchment paper. Roast the pork in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).

7. Remove the pork from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.

8. Serve the Spicy Green Chile Verde Pork with your favorite side dishes, such as rice, beans, or tortillas. Enjoy your delicious homemade pork!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Season seitan slices with parsley, 1/2 of the lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Fold each slice in half, seasoned-side facing inwards, and place in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining lemon juice over artichoke hearts; spread artichokes out between seitan slices.
Stir spicy tomato sauce and wine together in a bowl; pour over seitan and artichokes.
Toss croutons and olive oil together in another bowl.
Spread croutons and mozzarella cheese over tomato sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and bubbly, 30 to 40 minutes.
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced seitan and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the onion and garlic-flavored croutons to the skillet and cook until the onions are softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the artichoke hearts, parsley, and red wine to the skillet. Cook until the artichoke hearts are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Stir in the spicy tomato sauce and cook until the sauce is heated through and slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the seitan is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the Seitan Diavolo over pasta or rice, and enjoy!

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a standard 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan or use a paper loaf pan.
(My paper loaf pans are 7.835 x 2.87 inch so I split the batter in two and cut down the cooking timeless time with the oven on in the summer is wise!)
Beat eggs, oil, molasses, sugar, and vanilla in a large mixing bowl until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flours, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.
Combine the dry ingredients into the wet.
Once almost completely combined, stir in zucchini and walnuts.
Spoon the batter into the prepared pans.
The bake time for 1 large loaf pan is 5055 minutes.
For 2 smaller loaves, bake about 2530 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove bread from the oven, and place on a rack to cool for 20 minutes before slicing.
Recipe adapted from King Arthur Flours recipe for Whole Wheat Zucchini Nut Bread.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, coconut oil, molasses, and vanilla extract.
3. Gradually add the dry ingredients, such as whole wheat pastry flour, all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and ground cinnamon, stirring to combine.
4. Add the shredded zucchini and chopped walnuts to the mixture.
5. Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan and bake for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
6. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Zucchini Walnut Bread!

gt:
Put all ingredients into the crock pot (my chicken was partially thawed).
Cook on low for 6 hours stirring occasionally.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large bowl, combine the ranch dressing mix, sour cream, and cream of chicken soup. Stir until well combined.
6. Return the chicken to the skillet and pour the creamy ranch mixture over the chicken. Cook over medium heat, covered, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly, about 10-15 minutes.
7. Remove the chicken from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. Using a fork, shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
9. Pour the sauce from the skillet over the chicken and stir to combine.
10. Transfer the chicken and sauce to a 4-quart (4L) slow cooker. Cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until the chicken is tender and the sauce is heated through.
11. Serve the chicken and sauce over cooked pasta or rice.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix honey, turmeric, coconut oil, and black pepper together in a resealable container using a butter knife until thoroughly combined.
Cover and store in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, heat the coconut oil over medium heat.
2. Add the ground turmeric and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the honey and stir until the honey has melted and the mixture is smooth.
4. Gradually add the ground black pepper, stirring to combine.
5. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
7. Store the Turmeric Honey Paste in an airtight container in the refrigerator, where it will keep for several weeks.

This Turmeric Honey Paste can be used as a spread on toast, added to oatmeal, or used as a base for various dishes such as rice, vegetables, or even as a marinade for meats. The versatility of this dish allows for endless culinary possibilities.

gt: Combine in blender at high speed until smooth and foamy.
pred:
1. First, place the ripe and mashed banana in a blender or food processor.
2. Add the cold milk and blend until smooth and creamy.
3. Pour the banana mixture into a large bowl.
4. Add the vanilla ice cream to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
5. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and instant coffee powder.
6. Add the sugar and coffee mixture to the banana and ice cream mixture, stirring until well combined.
7. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or until it reaches the desired consistency.
8. Serve the South American Cooler in glasses, garnished with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon, if desired.

This delicious South American Cooler dish is a refreshing and creative twist on a classic ice cream treat. The combination of banana, milk, and ice cream provides a smooth and creamy texture, while the added coffee and sugar enhance the flavor profile. The refrigeration time allows the flavors to meld together, resulting in a delightful and satisfying treat.

gt:
In a large bowl spoon lemon juice over pears.
In another bowl, combine brown sugar and cinnamon.
Sprinkle brown sugar cinnamon combo over the pear slices.
Set indoor grill on high and grill for 4-5 minutes or until golden.
To serve, evenly distribute pear slices on to 4 serving dishes and drizzle with maple syrup.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, combine the peeled and cored pears with the lemon juice. Allow the pears to marinate in the lemon juice for about 30 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the brown sugar, cinnamon, and maple syrup.
4. Remove the pears from the lemon juice and pat them dry with a paper towel.
5. Brush the pears with the maple syrup mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Place the pears on the grill or grill pan, cut-side down, and cook for about 5-7 minutes or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Flip the pears and continue to cook for another 3-5 minutes or until they are fully cooked through.
8. Remove the pears from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Maple Grilled Pears With Brown Sugar and Cinnamon immediately, or let them cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Maple Grilled Pears With Brown Sugar and Cinnamon!

gt:
In a skillet on medium high heat place a tortilla and cover with sauce, the cheeses, pepperoni, and jalapeno.
Cook until the bottom gets crispy and the cheese melts.
Coat your baked chicken breast with buffalo sauce
You can totally do this with chicken strips and low fat cheese to make it easier and reduce calories.
Veggies would be a perfect topping.
pred:
To cook a delightful Flora's Low Carb Personal Pizzas and Buffalo Chicken dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Prepare your ingredients by washing and chopping the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
3. Grate the parmesan cheese and shred the cheddar cheese.
4. Spread a thin layer of pizza sauce on the bottom of a baking sheet or pizza stone.
5. Place the cooked chicken breast on top of the sauce.
6. Add the grated parmesan cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, and Buffalo sauce to the chicken.
7. Place the sliced jalapenos on top of the chicken and cheese mixture.
8. Place the sliced turkey pepperoni on top of the jalapenos.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

This delicious dish is perfect for those looking to enjoy a satisfying meal without the added carbohydrates found in traditional pizza crust. The combination of flavors and textures, along with the protein-rich chicken and turkey pepperoni, make it a satisfying and filling option.

gt:
Mix the glaze ingredients together in a small bowl, and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over moderately high heat.
Place the salmon fillets in the skillet, and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until.
golden, and just cooked through.
Transfer salmon onto plates.
Add honey glaze to skillet and simmer, stirring, for 1 minute.
Pour the honey-soy glaze over the salmon, and serve.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Ana's Honey and Soy Glazed Salmon dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the honey, soy sauce, fresh lime juice, Dijon mustard, and water.
3. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then brush them with the honey mixture.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the salmon fillets and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork.
5. Transfer the cooked salmon to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the glaze is bubbly and caramelized.
6. Remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This dish is a delicious and healthy option, as salmon is a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids, which are essential for heart health and brain function. The honey and soy glaze adds a sweet and savory flavor to the salmon, making it a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Fry bacon in a skillet on medium heat until done then drain, reserving bacon grease.
Set aside in a 9 x 13 baking dish.
Using some of the bacon grease, cook the chicken until it is no longer pink and the juices run clear.
Drain and add to bacon in the baking dish.
Saute shallots in 2 teaspoons bacon grease until transparent, then add to bacon and chicken mixture.
Mix well and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine all cans of soup, evaporated milk, and sour cream.
Whisk until it has a smooth texture and no lumps of soup.
Stir in garlic powder, pepper, basil, and Parmesan cheese and mix until well blended.
Pour the soup mixture over the meat and shallot mixture.
Stir until well blended then evenly spread in the baking dish.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until bubbly and brown around the edges.
Stir and serve over fettuccine noodles.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the chicken over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove from skillet and set aside.
4. In a large saucepan, combine the cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, evaporated milk, sour cream, garlic powder, pepper, and dried basil. Whisk until smooth.
5. Return the chicken to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Cook over medium heat until the sauce is heated through and the chicken is fully cooked.
6. Stir in the cooked bacon and parmesan cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy and bubbly.
7. Serve the Chicken Bacon Alfredo Sauce over cooked pasta or rice.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large bowl, beat softened butter with a mixer until light and fluffy.
Add brown sugar and beat until well combined.
Shake the instant coffee granules onto a saucer and using the back of a spoon, grind the coffee granules into dust.
Pour the coffee powder into the butter mix and beat until incorporated.
With the mixer on low, add the flour one cup at a time until well blended.
The dough will look crumbly.
Using a spatula or your hands, form the dough into a log (you can make them as small or as large as you like).
Wrap in waxed paper and put into the freezer for 20-30 minutes, or until firm.
Unwrap and slice into 1/4 slices.
Place onto ungreased cookie sheets about 1 apart.
Sprinkle liberally with granulated sugar.
Bake at 300F for 20 minutes, turning the tray once halfway through.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely.
The cookies will crisp up as they cool.
These are best served with a cup of coffee or hot chocolate, and are even better when theyre dunked.
Theyre also good dipped in dark chocolate.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the instant coffee granules and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the all-purpose flour, mixing until a soft dough forms.
5. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and pliable.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using cookie cutters or a sharp knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

Instruct on the proper storage and serving of Coffee Shortbread Cookies: Store the cookies in an airtight container or a sealed plastic bag to maintain their freshness for up to a week. Serve the cookies warm, as they will be even more delicious and moist. Enjoy your homemade Coffee Shortbread Cookies!

gt:
Place lettuce on platter.
Top with remaining ingredients.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. First, prepare the salad by washing and drying the lettuce, green onions, and cherry tomatoes.
2. Next, chop the avocado into slices.
3. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, green onions, cherry tomatoes, and avocado.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Caesar dressing, Parmesan cheese, and bacon bits.
5. Pour the dressing mixture over the salad and toss to combine.
6. Serve the Bacon and Avocado Caesar Salad immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Sieve the flour, salt, and baking powder in to a bowl.
Mix the oil and milk together and mix gently with a fork until it all holds together.
Divide the pastry into 4 equal pieces and form each piece into a ball.
Roll each piece of pastry out between two pieces of cling film making the pieces as thin as possible.
Line each tart tin with the pastry and trim the edges and prick the bases with a fork.
Line the cases with baking parchment and baking beans.
Bake the pastry cases for 6 minutes and remove from the oven.
Remove the tough outer leaves of the fennel, cut in half and slice.
Fry the fennel with the cardamom seeds in the butter and rapeseed oil, ensure the fennel does not brown too much.
After about 4 minutes add 2 tbsp water, 2tbsp of white wine season with sea salt and black pepper and cook until the liquid has evaporated and a little syrupy.
Whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, creme fraiche and cream.
Stir in the chives if using and season well with sea salt and black pepper.
Place the cooked fennel in the base of the tart tin and pour over the egg and cream mixture.
Cut the Brie into slices and place on top of the tart.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until just set and lightly browned.
Eat warm with salad leaves.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder.
3. Add the milk or water, and whisk until smooth.
4. Gradually add the cold pressed rapeseed oil, whisking until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and creme fraiche until smooth.
6. Gradually add the egg yolks to the batter, whisking until fully incorporated.
7. Add the white wine, and whisk until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
8. In a small bowl, mix the crushed cardamom seeds and the pinch of sea salt.
9. Add the cardamom mixture to the batter, whisking until fully incorporated.
10. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
11. Fold the whipped egg whites into the batter, gently folding until fully combined.
12. Carefully fold in the brie, ensuring it is evenly distributed throughout the batter.
13. Pour the batter into a greased and floured tart pan, ensuring the batter is evenly distributed.
14. Bake the tarts for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
15. Allow the tarts to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Fennel, brie and cardamom tarts!

gt:
I start this off by sauteing my mushrooms in a little bit of butter till they are soft I season them with salt and pepper a little garlic powder in a small six inch non stick skillet
After the mushrooms are cooked through I add my baby spinach usually a good size handful, I add salt to help wilt down the spinach and right at the end I hit the bottom of the pan w some white balsamic vinegar to amp up the taste.
I put the spinach and mushrooms in a bowl and wipe the pan out
Put the pan back on the heat and I add a coat of cooking spray then crack my eggs into the pan ( you can make scrambled or fried poached or any kind of egg you like) while your egg is cooking I put my tortilla on the plate and sprinkle the cheese in the bottom
When my eggs are done I slide them out of the pan into the tortilla on top of the cheese then put down the slices of tomatoes then drain any liquid out of the bowl your spinach and place on top of your tomatoes (the heat from the eggs and the spinach will heat your tomatoes and melt the cheese) I like to add a few dashes of hot sauce to the top then fold the whole wrap like a giant burrito cut down the middle and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cayenne pepper.
3. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a small amount of butter. Cook the spinach until it is wilted, then remove it from the heat and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, cook the mushrooms until they are tender, then remove them from the heat and set aside.
5. In a separate skillet, cook the sliced tomatoes until they are soft and slightly caramelized. Remove them from the heat and set aside.
6. In a large skillet, cook the shredded cheddar cheese until it is melted and bubbly.
7. Place the tortillas on a flat surface and spread a thin layer of butter on one side.
8. Place the cooked spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes on the buttered side of the tortilla, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. Add the melted cheese on top of the ingredients.
10. Fold the tortilla in half to enclose the ingredients, creating a half-moon shape.
11. Place the folded tortilla on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the baked wrap from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

[/INST]

This delicious and filling breakfast wrap is ready to be enjoyed. Don't forget to use the natural language assistant to help you with any questions or concerns you may have during the cooking process.

gt:
In a dutch oven, over medium heat, add the vegetable stock, onions, carrot, jalapeno, garlic, chili powder and cumin.
Cover and simmer 5 - 7 minutes, or until the onions and carrots are soft.
Add the tomatoes (with their juices) and the brown sugar; cover and cook for 5 minutes over high heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce the heat to low; stir in the beans and bulgur.
Simmer the chili, uncoverd, for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve garnished with yogurt, scallions, and cilantro.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the vegetable stock, onions, carrot, jalapeno, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and brown sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced tomatoes, with their juice, and the red kidney beans. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
3. Stir in the bulgur and yogurt. Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender and the flavors have melded together.
4. Stir in the scallions and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve the Vegetarian Chili hot, over rice or with crusty bread, as desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large bowl, combine the kale, shallot, salt and olive oil.
Toss well.
Add the feta and walnuts.
Serve immediately or keep for up to five days in the fridge.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the torn kale pieces, minced shallot, and 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil. Toss the ingredients together until they are well coated.

2. Add the salt to the kale mixture, and toss again to ensure that the kale is evenly seasoned.

3. Spread the kale mixture out on a large baking sheet or a roasting pan. Roast the kale in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the kale is tender and slightly wilted.

4. While the kale is roasting, crumble the feta cheese into small pieces.

5. Once the kale is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.

6. Add the crumbled feta cheese to the kale mixture, and toss everything together.

7. Add the chopped walnuts to the kale salad, and toss again to combine.

8. Serve the Kale Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

This flavorful Kale Salad with Walnuts and Feta is a delicious and nutritious side dish that can be enjoyed as a standalone meal or paired with other dishes. The combination of the tender kale, the tangy feta cheese, and the crunchy walnuts creates a delightful contrast of textures and flavors that make this salad a delightful addition to any meal.

gt:
Mix the butter and sugar together well and beat in the eggs.
Sift the flour and salt together; mix in to the butter mixture until thoroughly blended.
Add the lemon peel, nutmeg, and brandy, mix well and pour into two small buttered loaf pans or one large one.
Bake in a moderate oven (350F) for about 1 hour or until cake tests done.
pred:
[/INST]
