[INST]To make the Fresh Strawberry Bread, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg yolks one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
5. Gently fold the egg whites into the batter, alternating with the flour mixture, until just combined.
6. Fold in the crushed or diced strawberries.
7. In a small bowl, mix the baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the batter, mixing until just combined.
8. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
9. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
10. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Fresh Strawberry Bread!

gt:
Heat oven to 375.
Place bread on ungreased sheet.
Spread each slice with a scant tbsp of pesto.
Top with tomato and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake about 8 minutes or til hot and cheese is melted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Slice the French bread into 6 equal pieces.
3. In a small bowl, mix the pesto sauce and chopped tomatoes.
4. Spread a thin layer of pesto mixture on each slice of bread.
5. Top each slice of bread with a small amount of shredded mozzarella cheese.
6. Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Pesto Tomato Toast!

gt:
First quarter your potatoes.
Then mix your ingredients saving your oil for the last step.
Once all ingredients are mixed lay your mixture into your aluminum foil.
Then drizzle your oil over the mixture and close the foil around your entire mixture.
Cook until potatoes are soft to a fork.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Wash and peel the potatoes, then cut them into quarters.
3. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, onion, garlic, and green pepper.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded cheddar and mozzarella cheeses.
5. Add the olive oil to the potato mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
6. Transfer the potato mixture to a baking dish, and spread it evenly.
7. Pour the cheese mixture over the potatoes, and sprinkle with additional salt and pepper, if desired.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 45-55 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

1. Serve the Cheesy Potatoes hot, and enjoy the delicious, comforting dish.

gt:
Position two racks in the center and the bottom third of the oven, and preheat the oven to 350F (180C).
Spread 2 tablespoons sesame seeds on each of three unoiled baking sheets.
This will prevent the crackers from sticking and will give them a delicious crisp bottom.
Put the water, oil, and salt in a small bowl until combined.
Stir in the 1/2 cup sesame seeds.
Add the water-oil mixture and mix to form a rough dough.
Knead the dough in the bowl to form a ball, and turn out onto a lightly floured work surface.
Lightly flour a rolling pin.
Roll the dough out into a 22x14-inch rectangle, about 1/16-inch thick.
Using a fork, prick the dough all over to release trapped air and keep the dough flat.
With a pizza wheel or sharp knife, cut the dough into 2-inch squares or other shapes, or cut shapes with a 2-inch cookie cutter.
Using a spatula, transfer the crackers to the prepared baking sheets.
Bake until the crackers are light brown and firm to the touch, 15 to 20 minutes, switching the positions of the sheets halfway through the baking time.
When the first two sheets are finished, remove them, and bake the third one as directed.
Cool completely.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, sesame seeds, baking powder, and sea salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the canola oil, water, and the teaspoon of sea salt.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms.
5. Turn the dough onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm) and cut into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a knife.
7. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the crackers for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crisp.
9. Remove the crackers from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Coat the salmon in flour.
Cook the salmon in a preheated pan coated with oil.
Once one side has turned golden brown, add butter to taste, flip the salmon over, and cook until it has cooked all the way through to the center.
Prepare the sauce while the salmon is cooking.
First, finely chop the cucumber and paprika peppers, and lightly squeeze out the water.
Add , soy sauce, and mayonnaise, and mix thoroughly together.
Put it on top of the cooked salmon and it is done!
I use the leftover vegetable sauce the next day in bentos as a side dish.
Please check out.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Season the salmon with salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
4. Add the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the flour is lightly browned.
5. Gradually pour in the soy sauce, mayonnaise, and cucumber, stirring to combine.
6. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet, and season with salt and pepper.
8. Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
9. Serve the salmon with the colorful vegetable sauce on top. Enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.To prepare aioli, combine first 5 ingredients in a small bowl; set aside.To prepare crab cakes, combine bell pepper and next 7 ingredients (through black pepper) in a large bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Add panko and crabmeat; toss gently.
Divide the crab mixture into 12 equal portions, shaping each into a 1-inch-thick patty.Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add patties; cook 2 minutes.
Carefully turn patties over.
Place pan in oven; bake at 350 for 6 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the crabmeat, panko, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, garlic, red bell pepper, chives, parsley, black pepper, and minced garlic. Mix well.
3. Shape the crab mixture into small, evenly sized cakes.
4. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the crab cakes until golden brown, flipping them halfway through the cooking process.
5. Transfer the crab cakes to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
6. While the crab cakes are baking, prepare the herbed aioli by combining the mayonnaise, chives, parsley, lemon juice, and black pepper in a small bowl.
7. Serve the Mini Crab Cakes with Herbed Aioli on the side. Enjoy!

gt:
Sprinkle chicken with salt, pepper, and garlic powder
Place eggs in a shallow bowl
Combine panko and cheese in another shallow bowl
Dip chicken in the eggs, then dip them in the panko cheese mixture (cover chicken well)
Heat the oil in a skillet over med heat and cook until browned and done
Sprinkle with parsley and serve
pred:
To cook a delightful Parmesan Panko Chicken Tenders dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Season the chicken tenders with the kosher salt, black pepper, and garlic powder.
3. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and panko together until well combined.
4. Dip the seasoned chicken tenders into the egg mixture, then coat them evenly with the panko mixture.
5. Place the coated chicken tenders on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the chicken tenders in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
7. Remove the chicken tenders from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the grated parmesan cheese with the canola oil.
9. Once the chicken tenders are cool enough to handle, toss them in the parmesan-canola mixture to coat evenly.
10. Serve the Parmesan Panko Chicken Tenders immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.

This dish is a delicious and satisfying meal that combines the flavors of chicken, panko breadcrumbs, and Parmesan cheese. The crispy exterior and tender interior make it a delightful choice for any occasion.

gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a plastic bag, press out the air, seal it, rub in the flavors, and let sit in the refrigerator for an hour.
Peel the burdock root, and apply diluted vinegar to remove the astringency.
Round-off the ends and insert a bone-like cut in the middle for presentation.
Rinse off before using.
Wrap the meat around the burdock root.
Just keep wrapping.
Start with the small strips, applying the bigger strips last.
It'll take shape later, so for now just keep wrapping.
Add a thin layer of oil to aluminum foil and place the meat on top.
Season with black pepper, then wrap it up in foil.
You'll be forming the shape with the wrap, so use 2-3 sheets.
Once it's firmly wrapped and shaped into an iconic shape, place in a frying pan.
Add a small amount of water, just enough to cover the bottom, and boil.
Cover with a lid and cook steam-cook over low-medium heat for 40 minutes.
Discard the remaining water in the pan, wipe it clean with a paper towel, remove the aluminum foil, and cook until nice and brown, and it's complete.
This is the meat I used--pork offcuts.
It was pretty cheap.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, sugar, sake (if using beef, red wine), and mirin. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, combine the thinly sliced meat, grated garlic, and a pinch of black pepper.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the burdock root and ginger.
5. Add the meat mixture to the bowl with the marinade, tossing to coat evenly.
6. Allow the meat to marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
7. Heat a grill or grill pan, and cook the marinated meat on the grill or grill pan for 10-15 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
8. Remove the cooked meat from the grill or grill pan, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
9. Serve the Manga-Like Meat on a Stick with the marinade sauce for dipping.

[/INST]

gt:
Whisk together the soy sauce, sherry, garlic, brown sugar, and ginger in a bowl; pour into a large resealable plastic bag.
Add the chicken pieces, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a baking rack with cooking spray, and place on a baking sheet.
Remove the chicken from the marinade, and shake off excess.
Discard the remaining marinade.
Mix the wheat germ, bread crumbs, sesame seeds, parsley, black pepper, and paprika together in a separate large resealable plastic bag.
Add the chicken to the bag and shake to coat the pieces with the bread crumb mixture; transfer the coated chicken pieces to the prepared baking rack.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 1 hour.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of of a thigh, not touching bone, should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, dry sherry, minced garlic, brown sugar, ground ginger, and black pepper.
3. Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper, then toss them in the soy sauce mixture to coat evenly.
4. Heat a non-stick skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Spray the chicken pieces with cooking spray, then add them to the skillet or pan. Cook the chicken until it is browned and cooked through, flipping the pieces occasionally to ensure even cooking.
5. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the bread crumb mixture by combining the wheat germ, Italian seasoned bread crumbs, sesame seeds, dried parsley, and paprika in a small bowl.
6. Once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the skillet or pan and place it on a baking sheet. Drizzle the chicken with any remaining soy sauce mixture, then sprinkle the bread crumb mixture evenly over the top.
7. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the chicken is cooked through.
8. Serve the Oven-Baked Sesame Chicken hot, garnished with a sprinkle of sesame seeds if desired. Enjoy!

gt:
Place sweet potato chunks on the stove in a steamer basket.
Steam until tender but not overcooked, about 5 minutes.
Set aside.
Place broccoli and beans in steamer basket and steam until broccoli is tender but not overcooked, about 4 minutes.
Combine potatoes, broccoli and beans in large bowl and stir gently to mix.
Combine remaining ingredients and stir until blended.
Add to bowl and toss until vegetables are evenly coated.
Serve immediately if serving warm.
Or chill and serve cold.
pred:
To prepare the Steamed Sweet Potato, Broccoli, and Bean Salad, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Place the sweet potato chunks in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Roast the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. While the sweet potatoes are cooking, prepare the broccoli by washing it thoroughly and then cutting it into bite-sized pieces.
5. In a large bowl, combine the cooked sweet potatoes, broccoli, and drained chickpeas.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the light sour cream, lemon juice, curry powder, Dijon mustard, honey, and salt and pepper to taste.
7. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to combine.
8. Serve the Steamed Sweet Potato, Broccoli, and Bean Salad immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

This delicious and nutritious salad is perfect for a light meal or a side dish. The combination of sweet potatoes, broccoli, and chickpeas provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the light sour cream dressing adds a creamy, tangy touch. Enjoy!

gt:
1.
Cook noodles according to package directions; drain.2.
Heat a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon oil to pan; swirl to coat.
Add shrimp; stir-fry 4 minutes.
Remove shrimp from pan.
Return pan to high heat.
Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil; swirl to coat.
Add onion, celery, lemongrass, and ginger; stir-fry 1 minute.
Combine coconut milk and next 4 ingredients (through fish sauce) in a bowl, stirring with a whisk until sugar dissolves.
Add coconut milk mixture to pan; cook 3 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened.3.
Add noodles, shrimp, bean sprouts, basil, and mint to pan; toss to coat.
Divide noodle mixture among 4 shallow bowls; sprinkle with cashews and celery leaves.
Serve with lime wedges.
pred:
To make a delicious Thai Shrimp Curry dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and fully cooked through, about 3-4 minutes. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.

2. In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of peanut oil. Add the onion and celery, and cook until they are softened, about 3-4 minutes.

3. Add the minced lemongrass, grated ginger, and coconut milk to the skillet. Cook until the liquid has reduced and the flavors have melded together, about 5-6 minutes.

4. Add the Thai red curry paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, and rice vinegar to the skillet. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, to allow the flavors to meld together.

5. Add the cooked shrimp back to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp are heated through.

6. In a small bowl, mix the mung bean sprouts, thinly sliced fresh basil, and thinly sliced fresh mint.

7. To serve, divide the cooked shrimp curry into bowls and garnish with the mung bean sprout mixture. Serve with the remaining celery leaves and a lime wedge for squeezing.

Enjoy your delicious Thai Shrimp Curry dish!

gt:
STEAM asparagus until tender; drain and rinse under cold water.
DRIZZLE dressing over asparagus, toss to combine.
pred:
To cook a delightful Asparagus Salad With KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette dish, follow these steps:

1. Wash the asparagus thoroughly under cold water to remove any dirt or debris.
2. Cut the asparagus into 1-inch pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the asparagus pieces with the KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing.
4. Toss the asparagus and dressing together until the asparagus is evenly coated.
5. Transfer the asparagus and dressing mixture to a serving dish.
6. Serve immediately, and enjoy the delicious and healthy Asparagus Salad With KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette.

This dish is not only delicious but also nutritious, as asparagus is a rich source of vitamins, minerals, and dietary fiber. The KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing adds a tangy and slightly sweet flavor to the dish, enhancing the overall taste experience.

gt:
In a mixing bowl beat the butter until creamy, using an electric mixer on medium speed.
Gradually add in the sugars, beat well to combine.
Add in the eggs, 1 at a time; beat just until the yellow disappears after each addition.
Add in the vanilla; stir to combine.
In another mixing bowl, mix together the flour and next 3 ingredients.
Gradually add to the butter mixture; beat until blended.
Stir in the oats, chocolate morsels, and pecans.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake in a 350 oven for 12 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for 3 minutes.
Transfer cookies to a wire rack to finish cooling.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter or margarine and the firm packed light brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the oats and white chocolate chips.
6. Stir in the baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
7. Chop the coarse chopped pecans.
8. Stir the pecans into the batter.
9. Drop the batter by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden and the center is set.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious White Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies!

gt:
Add hot water to bouillon cube in small bowl; let stand until dissolved.
Use wooden spoon to mix lard, pumpkin, baking powder and cinnamon in large bowl until blended.
Add masa harina and chicken broth; stir until mixture forms soft dough.
Spread 1/4 cup masa dough into 4-inch square down center of each of 16 banana leaves, leaving about 2 inches at top of leaf.
Top each with about 2 Tbsp.
each chiles and cheese.
Fold over sides and both ends of each leaf to completely enclose filling.
Tie closed with strips cut from some of the remaining banana leaves.
Pour 3 cups water into tamalera.
Use enough of the remaining banana leaves to line bottom and side of tamalera.
Add tamales, overlapping as necessary to fit; cover with remaining leaves.
Steam 1 hour or until tamales are done, adding water to tamalera if needed.
(Tamales are cooked when they pull away from leaves.)
Cool slightly.
Serve with sour cream.

[INST]
1. In a large pot, combine the hot water, chicken bouillon cube, and lard. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the lard is melted and the mixture is smooth.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the CALUMET Baking Powder, ground cinnamon, and pumpkin.
3. Add the pumpkin mixture to the lard mixture, stirring to combine.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the masa harina, banana leaves, and 1 cup of the pumpkin mixture. Mix well to form a dough.
5. Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball, then flatten it slightly.
6. Place the flattened dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
8. Place the tamale dough balls in the oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Remove the tamales from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. To assemble the tamales, place a spoonful of sour cream on the bottom of each tamale, then top with a layer of shredded cheese.
11. Fold the tamale in half, enclosing the filling, and secure the edges with a toothpick or string.
12. Place the tamales in a steamer or a large pot with enough water to cover them. Steam the tamales for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the filling is hot.
13. Serve the Pumpkin-Poblano Tamales warm.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Combine sour cream, soup, and chilis (and/or jalapenos) in a large sauce pan over medium heat.
When sauce is well heated, set aside.
Tortillas (step 1): Completely, but lightly cover both sides of one tortilla with shortening (Don't be afraid to use your hands), then place the tortilla on a microwave-safe plate.
Tortillas (step 2): Completely but lightly cover one side of the next tortilla and place it atop the first tortilla, shortening side up.
Repeat Step 2 until all tortillas are stacked, then microwave the entire stack on high for 4-5 minutes.
Allow to cool.
Combine shredded cheese and chopped onion in a bowl and gently mix together using your hands.
Lightly cover the bottom of a baking dish with some of the sauce (This will prevent the tortillas from becoming stiff and chewy as they cook).
Place a generous portion of the cheese/onion mixture onto a tortilla, then roll the tortilla like a cigar (not too tight though).
Place into the baking dish, seam side down to prevent the enchilada from unrolling.
Repeat until all tortillas have been stuffed, rolled, and placed into the baking dish (it may take more than one baking dish for 20 enchiladas).
Cover the enchiladas with the sour cream sauce and any leftover cheese/onion stuffing.
Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes, depending on your oven.
Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour cream, cream of chicken soup, and chopped green chilies. Mix well.
3. Spread a thin layer of vegetable shortening on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. Place a corn tortilla on the bottom of the dish, then pour a small amount of the sour cream mixture over the tortilla.
5. Add a layer of shredded cheese on top of the sour cream mixture.
6. Repeat the process with another tortilla, more sour cream mixture, and more shredded cheese.
7. Add the remaining tortillas, sour cream mixture, and cheese.
8. Bake the enchiladas in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the enchiladas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before cutting them into wedges and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Top one slice of bread with cheese, Thousand Island Dressing,sauerkraut and corned beef.
Spread outside of sandwich with dressing.
Cook in skillet on medium heat until lightly browned on both sides.
pred:
1. Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium heat.
2. Spread one side of each slice of rye bread with thousand island dressing.
3. Place the sauerkraut on the other side of the bread slices.
4. Place the corned beef slices on top of the sauerkraut.
5. Place the bread slices with the thousand island dressing on top of the corned beef.
6. Spread a thin layer of salad dressing on the top slice of bread.
7. Place the other slice of bread on top of the salad dressing.
8. Grill the sandwich for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the sandwich from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting it into halves or quarters.
10. Serve the Grilled Reuben Sandwich warm, with a side of coleslaw or a salad.

This Grilled Reuben Sandwich recipe combines the flavors of corned beef, Swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and thousand island dressing, creating a delicious and satisfying meal. The grilling process adds a smoky, charred flavor to the sandwich, making it even more appetizing. The combination of ingredients results in a unique and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed as a hearty lunch or dinner option.

gt:
Butter bread slices on both sides.
Cut an approximately 2 inch circle in the middle of each slice, using a cookie cutter or small glass.
Place buttered bread slices on a non-stick griddle pan, preheated over medium heat.
Add a bit of butter to the center of the bread, and gently crack your eggs into the hole.
Sprinkle eggs with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
When the eggs begin to set around the edge of the hole, flip.
Finish cooking eggs as you prefer (over easy or over medium).
The buttered bread "centers" can be grilled or toasted as well to sop up the extra yolk!
pred:

To make V for Vendetta's - Eggy in a Basket, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the 6 slices of whole wheat bread into halves.
3. Crack the 6 eggs into a bowl and whisk them together.
4. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
5. Add the whisked eggs to the saucepan and stir constantly until the eggs are fully cooked and the mixture is smooth.
6. Season the egg mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Spread the cooked egg mixture evenly over the bread halves.
8. Place the bread halves with the egg mixture on a baking sheet.
9. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the egg is set and the bread is golden brown.
10. Serve the Eggy in a Basket immediately.

Enjoy your delicious V for Vendetta's - Eggy in a Basket!

gt:
Place the cherries, cider vinegar, rice vinegar, onion, apple, white sugar, brown sugar, ginger, five-spice powder, salt, and nutmeg into a large pot.
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove the lid, and continue simmering until the desired consistency has been reached.
Chill before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, combine the cherries, cider vinegar, rice vinegar, onion, and Granny Smith apple. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the cherries are tender and the mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Add the white and brown sugars, minced ginger, Chinese five-spice powder, salt, and nutmeg to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
5. Cook the mixture for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until it reaches your desired consistency.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the chutney cool slightly.
7. Transfer the chutney to a clean, dry jar or container. Store the chutney in the refrigerator and let it cool completely before serving.

gt:
Heat oil in small saucepan over medium-low heat.
Add garlic; cook over very low heat until soft, about 1 hour (do not brown).
DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 month ahead.
Keep chilled and completely covered in oil.
Always use clean spoon to remove garlic.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the garlic cloves and cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are softened and fragrant.
4. Carefully add the sugar and stir to combine. Cook for another 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is caramelized and the sugar has melted and dissolved.
5. Carefully pour the hot garlic mixture into a heat-resistant container or airtight container, leaving a little room at the top for expansion.
6. Place the container in the preheated oven and bake for about 4-6 hours, or until the garlic is fully melted and the oil has turned a golden brown.
7. Remove the container from the oven and let it cool for a few hours or overnight.
8. Once the garlic has cooled, carefully transfer the garlic confit to a clean, dry container or airtight container, and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
9. To serve, use the garlic confit as desired, such as spreading it on bread, adding it to a sauce, or using it as a base for a dish.

[/INST]

In conclusion, making a flavorful Garlic Confit involves preheating the oven, heating olive oil, adding garlic cloves, cooking the garlic, adding sugar, baking the garlic mixture, cooling the garlic confit, and storing it in the refrigerator. This delicious and versatile condiment can be used in various dishes to enhance their flavor.

gt:
Cook the pancetta in a medium skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until browned and crisp, 810 minutes.
Add the butter to the skillet and keep warm over the lowest heat.
Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat.
Add the vinegar and reduce the heat to medium-low to maintain a gentle simmer.
Crack the eggs into 4 small cups.
Give the water a good circular stir, then tip 1 egg at a time into the center of the swirling water.
Simmer the eggs until the whites are white and the yolks remain soft, about 3 minutes.
Transfer the eggs with a slotted spoon to a clean dishcloth to drain.
Cook the sheets of pasta in a medium pot of salted boiling water over medium-high heat until just tender, 23 minutes.
Using a slotted spatula, divide the pasta between 2 warm plates, letting most of the water drain off before spreading the sheets out on the plates.
Put 2 poached eggs on top of the pasta on each plate, then spoon the pancetta and butter over the top of each.
Season with a little salt and lots of pepper.
Serve with shaved pecorino.
pred:
1. Begin by heating a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced pancetta and cook until it is crispy and browned, stirring occasionally.
2. Add the butter to the skillet and let it melt.
3. Carefully crack the eggs into the skillet, stirring gently to break them up. Cook the eggs until they are scrambled and cooked through.
4. Add the vinegar to the skillet and stir to combine the ingredients.
5. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the shaved pecorino.
6. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, then drain and toss it with the pancetta and egg mixture.
7. Season the pasta with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the Pasta Time! Deconstructed Carbonara immediately, garnishing with additional shaved pecorino if desired.

This recipe is a delicious and creative take on the classic carbonara, using a deconstructed approach to create a unique and satisfying dish. The combination of crispy pancetta, scrambled eggs, and shaved pecorino cheese results in a rich and flavorful pasta dish that is both satisfying and visually appealing.

Add all ingredients together, mix until incorporated real well
Grease a 8x8 pan and pour in your brownie mixture
Bake for about 20min or till done

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

4. Pour the mixture into a greased and floured 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.

gt:
Combine cream cheese, eggs, 1 cup sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer.
Mix on low speed until smooth.
Pour filling into graham cracker crust.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes.
Remove pie from oven.
Raise oven temperature to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
In a small bowl, blend sour cream, 2 tablespoons sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla together.
Gently spread mixture over pie.
Bake for five minutes before serving.
pred:

2. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the sugar, beating until smooth.
5. Add the vanilla extract and sour cream, mixing well.
6. Pour the mixture into the prepared graham cracker crust.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the edges are lightly golden.
8. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

gt:

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl.
Firmly press mixture into bottom and 1 inch up sides of a 9-inch springform pan coated with cooking spray.
Set aside.

To create the Brownie Cheesecake Torte, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the low-fat fudge brownie mix, instant coffee granules, cinnamon, and ground carrot baby food. Mix until well combined.
4. Press the brownie mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
6. Allow the brownie to cool completely in the pan.
7. In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened neufchatel cheese and fat free cream cheese until smooth.
8. Add the egg whites, one at a time, beating well after each addition.

10. Stir in the vanilla extract and cocoa.
11. Pour the cheesecake mixture over the cooled brownie layer.

13. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely in the pan.
14. If desired, drizzle chocolate syrup over the top of the cheesecake.
15. Top with fresh raspberries, if desired.

gt: Mix and serve.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the rolled oats with the yogurt and Truvia, Splenda, or sugar substitute of choice.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the fruit of choice (blueberries) with the yogurt and Truvia, Splenda, or sugar substitute of choice.
3. Layer the oat mixture and fruit mixture in a glass or a parfait glass.
4. Repeat the layering process until the glass is filled to the top.
5. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Fruit, Oatmeal, and Yogurt Parfait!

This dish is a healthy and refreshing breakfast option that combines the natural sweetness of the fruit with the creaminess of the yogurt and the crunchiness of the oats. The Truvia, Splenda, or sugar substitute of choice adds a touch of sweetness without the added calories or sugar content.

gt:
Place the peaches in a blender or food processor; process until finely chopped.
Combine peaches and remaining ingredients in a large bowl.
Pour peach mixture into the freezer can of an ice-cream freezer; freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
Spoon ice cream into a freezer-safe container; cover and freeze for 2 hours or until firm.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients for making peach ice cream. You will need 3 cups of sliced peeled peaches, 1 cup of half-and-half, 1/2 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of whole milk, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.

2. In a large bowl, combine the peaches, half-and-half, sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix well to ensure the peaches are evenly coated with the mixture.

3. Add the whole milk to the bowl and stir until the mixture is smooth.

4. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for at least 2 hours or overnight.

5. Once the mixture has chilled, transfer it to an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. This will help the ice cream to become smooth and creamy.

6. Once the ice cream is fully churned, transfer it to an airtight container and place it in the freezer to harden for at least 2 hours or until it reaches your desired consistency.

7. Once the ice cream is fully hardened, scoop it into bowls and enjoy your delicious homemade peach ice cream!

[/INST]

gt:
Mix potatoes and onion in crock pot; mix remaining ingredients except bacon; pour into crock pot.
Cover and cook on low setting 8 to 10 hrs or until potatoes are tender.
Stir in bacon.
Serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, onion, and water.
3. Cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and place it in the preheated oven.
4. Cook the potatoes for about 4 hours or until they are tender and can be easily mashed with a fork.
5. Remove the bowl from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cider vinegar, flour, sugar, salt, and celery seed.
7. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cooked potatoes and onion in the bowl.
8. Stir to combine, and let the mixture sit for about 15 minutes.
9. Add the crumbled bacon and pepper to the mixture, and stir to combine.
10. Serve the Hot German Potato Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

The essential ingredients for this Hot German Potato Salad are:
- 5 medium potatoes, cut into 1/4 inch slices (peeled or unpeeled, whichever you prefer)
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 13 cup water
- 13 cup cider vinegar
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon celery seed
- 14 teaspoon pepper
- 4 slices cooked bacon, crumbled.

gt:
Place roast on a rack coated with cooking spray in roasting pan.
Rub roast with salt and pepper and set aside.
Heat marmalade in microwave on high 10 seconds or till melted.
Add mustard and rosemary, stirring till blended.
Brush mixture over roast.
Bake at 425F for 45 minutes (or until meat thermometer registers 155 degrees).
Remove roast from pan, cover with foil and let stand for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, place roasting pan on stove top over medium heat and sprinkle flour over juices.
Gently and constantly whisk and cook for 1 minute.
Add broth, and cook 5 more minutes, whisking constantly until mixture thickens.
Serve with sliced pork.

1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork roast with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, mix the orange marmalade, dry mustard, rosemary, and flour.
4. Place the pork roast in a roasting pan, and pour the marmalade mixture over the top.
5. Roast the pork for 2 hours, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the roast reads 145°F (63°C).
6. Remove the roast from the oven, and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing it thinly.
7. Serve the pork roast with the orange glaze, and enjoy!

gt:
Prepare Dinner as directed on package.
Meanwhile, pull string cheese into thin strips.
Add string cheese to prepared Dinner; mix lightly.
pred:

6. Serve the Stringy Macaroni & Cheese immediately, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

gt:
Dressing: Chop the shallots, place in a pan with white wine & boil to reduce liquid by two thirds.
Add the cream and bring back to the boil.
then & pour into a clean container.
Add the chives, lovage and lemon juice and set aside.
When the dressing is cool, gently mix it with the creme fraiche.
Check the seasoning and adjust to taste.
Place the chopped chicken pieces in a bowl and add the creamy lovage dressing, mixing well, Serve on a bed of lettuce with a few chives, chive flowers and some chopped lovage leaves as a garnish - some crusty French bread would also be a wonderful accompaniment!
For picnics: Put the chicken and lovage salad into a sealed container and keep in the fridge until you need to pack your hamper.
Pack your lettuce and garnishes separately and garnish the salad it when you have arrived at your picnic spot.
Serve as a sandwich filling or with crusty bread - dont forget to pack your knives and forks!
pred:

4. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.

gt:
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir in the shrimp, garlic, and green onions.
Cook and stir until the shrimp are pink on the outside, and no longer translucent in the center, about 5 minutes.
Set the shrimp aside, and pour in the wine, cream, tomatoes, basil, and cayenne pepper.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the sauce will coat the back of a spoon, about 10 minutes.
Stir the shrimp back into the sauce, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Heat through and serve.

gt:
Mix the rice flour, 1/2 cup sugar, and the water together in a bowl into a soft dough; set aside.
Stir 1/2 cup sugar and sesame seeds together in a small bowl.
Toss the coconut with the salt together in a separate bowl.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Take a portion of the soft dough and roll it into a ball between the palms of your hands.
Pull lengthwise and shape into a tongue.
Drop into the boiling water.
The cake is ready when it floats.
Scoop it out with a strainer and roll it in the sugar and sesame seed mixture.
Place it on a serving platter.
Repeat with the rest of the dough.
Top the cakes with coconut and serve warm.
pred:
To make delicious Palitaw (Sweet Rice Cakes), follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of glutinous rice flour (malagkit), 1/2 cup of white sugar, and 1/2 cup of water. Mix well until the dough is smooth and pliable.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of sesame seeds and 4 ounces of grated coconut to the dough. Mix well to incorporate the ingredients evenly.
3. If desired, add 1 teaspoon of salt to the dough for added flavor.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. Preheat a non-stick frying pan or a wok over medium heat.
6. Roll out the dough into small balls or use a cookie cutter to shape the dough into desired shapes.
7. Carefully place the shaped dough balls onto the preheated pan or wok, and cook for about 2 minutes on each side or until they are golden brown.
8. Remove the cooked Palitaw from the pan or wok and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the Palitaw warm, and enjoy the delicious sweet treat!

until the liquid is almost absorbed.

7. Transfer the mixture to a large, buttered baking dish.
8. Cover the dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly.
10. Serve the Alplermagrone immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
In a saucepan, combine the sugar with 2 tablespoons of the water; cook over high heat until the sugar is dissolved.
Cook without stirring until the sugar begins to caramelize around the edges, 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat, add the pineapple, onion, crushed red pepper, vinegar and the remaining 3/4 cup of water; season lightly with salt.
Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until jamlike, 15 minutes.
Stir in the mint.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and crushed red pepper. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
2. Add the diced pineapple, red onion, and mint leaves to the saucepan. Cook for about 10-15 minutes or until the pineapple is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the vinegar. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, if needed.
5. Serve the Sweet-and-Sour Pineapple Chutney warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!

gt:
Whip together the butter, lime juice, and cilantro in a small bowl until well combined.
Transfer the butter mixture onto a large piece of plastic wrap, gently wrap and form the butter into a log.
Freeze until ready to use.
Prepare a grill for medium-high heat.
Mix together the steak seasoning and ancho chile powder in a small bowl.
Rub the seasoning blend onto both sides of the venison steaks.
Grill the steaks to preferred doneness, 5 to 8 minutes per side for medium.
Top each steak with a slice of the lemon-cilantro butter to serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the softened butter, lime juice, chopped cilantro, steak seasoning, and ancho chile powder until well combined.
3. Season the venison steaks with salt and pepper, then coat them evenly with the butter mixture.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, then sear the venison steaks for about 2-3 minutes on each side to create a nice crust.
5. Transfer the seared steaks to a baking tray or oven-safe dish, and bake them in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare.
6. Remove the steaks from the oven, let them rest for a few minutes, then slice them thinly across the grain.
7. Serve the Ancho Chile Rubbed Venison Steaks with Lime-Cilantro Butter on top of a bed of rice or quinoa, and enjoy your delicious meal.

gt:
In a small bowl, mix together the cornflour with 2 teaspoons water.
Set aside.
Cook the noodles for 3 minutes then drain under cold water and set aside.
Mix together the soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar and water in a bowl.
Heat a wok or large frying pan over a high heat, add 1 tablespoon of the oil and stir-fry the chicken for 5 minutes.
Remove and set aside.
Scrape the wok/frying pan clean.
Add the remaining oil and stir-fry the carrot and bok choy for 7 minutes.
Add the cooked somen noodles and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add the ginger, spring onion and chicken and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Stir through the sauce then, while stirring constantly, add the cornflour paste until the sauce thickens.
pred:
[INST]To prepare Teriyaki Chicken Noodles, follow these steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the dried somen noodles with cold water and let them soak for about 30 minutes.
2. In a small saucepan, heat the canola oil over medium heat. Add the gingerroot and garlic, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, and cornflour to the saucepan, and stir to combine. Cook for about 2 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly.
4. Drain the noodles and add them to the saucepan with the sauce mixture. Stir to combine, and cook for about 2 minutes, until the noodles are coated with the sauce.
5. Add the chicken pieces to the saucepan, and stir to combine. Cook for about 5 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve the Teriyaki Chicken Noodles over a bed of cooked rice or noodles, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Spray muffin tins with cooking spray.
Melt butter in a small bowl.
In another bowl, combine 3 tablespoons sugar with the cinnamon.
Separate crescent rolls into the perforated triangles.
Dip each triangle into butter, then cinnamon-sugar.
Do this on one side only.
With the butter-sugar side facing out, place each triangle into a muffin tin, pressing to make a cup.
Combine mascarpone cheese with remaining 2 tablespoons sugar using a fork.
Then, place 1 heaping tablespoon into each crescent roll cup.
Peel and slice peaches.
Place approximately 2 slices on top of cheese.
Lightly sprinkle a bit of sugar on top of each.
Bake for 11 minutes.
After removing from the oven, let stand for 5 minutes.
Then, slide a table knife between the cups and the muffin tin.
Cups should slide out easily.
Serve warm or at room temperature, on their own, or with a scoop of ice cream if you wish.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the 1/2 sticks of butter and 5 tablespoons of sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the cinnamon and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the refrigerated crescent rolls and the reserved 1/2 tablespoon of sugar.
5. Roll out the crescent rolls on a lightly floured surface to form a 12-inch circle.
6. Spray a 9-inch round baking dish with cooking spray.
7. Place the crescent roll dough in the prepared baking dish, pressing it down to fit the dish.
8. Spread the butter mixture evenly over the dough, then top with the sliced peaches.
9. In a small bowl, mix the mascarpone cheese or whipped cream cheese with a pinch of salt.
10. Pour the mascarpone mixture over the peaches.
11. Bake the peach cups in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
12. Allow the cups to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Peach Cups!

gt:
on lightly floured surface, roll out puff pastry slightly to a 12" square.
cut into 9 equal pieces.
whisk together egg yolk and cream.
brush along two sides of each piece of pastry.
place 1 tablespoon chocolate chips in the center of each piece of pastry, and fold over into a triangle, pressing closed.
freeze on baking sheet 20 minutes.
meanwhile, preheat oven to 400.
brush remaining egg yolk mixture liberally over turnovers.
bake 14 minutes or until golden brown.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare chocolate turnovers, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
3. In a small bowl, beat the egg yolk and cream or half and half together until smooth.
4. Add the chocolate chips to the egg mixture and stir until well combined.
5. Spread the chocolate mixture evenly over the pastry, leaving a 1-inch (2.5 cm) border around the edges.
6. Fold the pastry over the chocolate mixture, forming a half-moon shape.
7. Place the turnovers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the turnovers in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is set.
9. Allow the turnovers to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Sift together 1 cup flour, yeast & salt.
Add water & mix well (I like to use a pastry blender but its not necessary.
).
Slowly, 1/2 cup at a time, add in the rest of the flour.
Pour oil over dough and knead before shaping into a ball.
Put someplace warm to rise for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle corn meal over warm baking stone or over pizza sheet and roll dough out.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.
Top and bake as is your preference.
These are some other variations:.
Add Italian Seasoning to the dough before setting to rise.
Add chunks of cheese or shredded cheese while adding in the water.
Use wheat flour in place or white flour.
Roll pieces of string cheese into the edges to form stuft crust pizza (one of my hubby's faves).
pred:
To create a Basic Simple Pizza Crust, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, 14 ounces of yeast, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
2. Gradually add 1 cup of hot water to the mixture, stirring until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Cover the dough with a clean, damp cloth and let it rise in a warm, draft-free area for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough into a circle or your desired shape.
7. Transfer the dough to a pizza stone or a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Spread a thin layer of cornmeal over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges for the crust.
9. Bake the pizza crust in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
10. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before adding your desired toppings.

Enjoy your homemade pizza crust!

gt:
Preheat oven at 450
Slice puff pastry into 12 pieces
Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper or lightly greased
Bake 8-10 minutes or until puffed and golden
Combine sugar and cinnamon
Brush baked puff pastry pieces with melted butter
Gently coat with sugar/cinnamon
Let sit 5 minutes to dry
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Roll out the defrosted puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
3. Cut the pastry into 1-inch (2.5 cm) squares.
4. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon.
5. Place a spoonful of the butter mixture onto the center of each pastry square.
6. Fold the pastry squares in half to form a half-moon shape, pressing the edges to seal.
7. Place the filled pastries on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the pastries for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
9. Remove the pastries from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your Cheater Churros!

gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions, drain.
Brown ground turkey, ground sausage and onion together in the large skillet over medium high heat.
Drain off excess fat.
Add garlic, taco seasoning and salsa, mix well and reduce to low heat.
In a sauce pan over medium heat, combine and milk and velveeta, stirring consistently.
Cheese sauce to protein and mix well.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground turkey and ground sausage until browned.
3. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and stir to combine.
5. In a small bowl, mix the Taco seasoning, salsa, and milk. Pour the mixture over the pasta and turkey mixture.
6. Stir to combine and cook until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly.
7. Add the Velveeta to the skillet and stir until melted and fully incorporated.
8. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the sauce is heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Taco Mac & Cheese immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over med-high heat, add shrimp, cook for 2-3 minutes per side.
Add white wine, pesto and lemon juice, season with a little salt.
In a small sauce pot heat the olive oil, add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the bloody mary mix and butter, bring to boil, reduce by 25%, season with salt and pepper.
To serve, place the bloody mary sauce on the plate, arrange the shrimp over the top and.
Drizzle with the remaining pesto from the pan.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Pesto Shrimp With a Bloody Mary Butter Sauce, follow these steps:
1. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
2. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they are pink and fully cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
3. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
4. In a small bowl, mix the pesto sauce, white wine, lemon juice, and olive oil.
5. Return the skillet to the heat and add the shrimp back to the pan. Pour the pesto mixture over the shrimp and stir to combine.
6. Add the bloody mary mix to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat for about 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. Season the sauce with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. Serve the Pesto Shrimp With a Bloody Mary Butter Sauce over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Place a 13x9 baking pan inside of a larger roasting pan.
Bring a kettle of water to a boil as you get started.
Let the sugar and water come to boil over medium-high heat in a deep saucepan.
When it hits a boil, reduce heat to medium and allow it to simmer till the sugar mixture comes to a deep brown color, about 7-9 minutes.
Working swiftly pour liquid into the 13x9 baking pan you will be using.
Tilt pan to spread caramel evenly.
In the meantime, put eggs, milk, sweetened condensed milk and vanilla into a blender.
Blend for almost a minute, until ingredients are well combined and pale in color.
Allow air bubbles in mixture to subside.
Pour mixture into the baking pan over the caramel.
Set the roasting pan with the baking dish onto the middle rack of the heated oven.
Pour hot water into roasting pan to a depth of 1-1 1/2, almost half up the sides of the pan your pudding is in.
Bake for 50 minutes to 1 hour, until sides are set and center is still soft, but does not wobble.
Carefully remove pans from the oven and transfer baking pan of flan to a rack to cool.
Once cooled, cover dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until completely chilled.
Cut into slices and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine the sugar and water over medium heat. Stir until the sugar has dissolved.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition.
4. Gradually pour in the 1% milk, stirring continuously.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Remove the saucepan from the heat and add the canned sweetened condensed milk, stirring well.
7. Add the vanilla extract and stir to combine.
8. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) springform pan.
9. Place the pan in the preheated oven and bake for about 45-50 minutes, or until the flan is set and the center is slightly jiggly.
10. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for about 10-15 minutes.
11. Carefully run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen the flan.
12. Remove the flan from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
13. Once the flan is completely cooled, refrigerate it for at least 4 hours or overnight.
14. To serve, run a knife around the edges of the flan again and invert it onto a serving plate.
15. Enjoy your delicious Flan (Caramel Custard) dish!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Roughly chop the onion and add it into the butter.
Saute for about 5 minutes or until onions are translucent.
Remove from heat when done.
Meanwhile, slice the sweet potato with a mandolin into thin round slices.
Spray a 12 count standard sized muffin pan with non-stick spray to prevent the sweet potato from sticking.
Layer a couple of slices of potato into each of the 12 muffin wells, followed by a teaspoon of onion, a teaspoon of cheese, a few pieces of the rosemary and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add another layer of sweet potato (a couple of slices) followed again by onions, cheese, rosemary and salt/pepper.
Add a final layer of sweet potato and top with cheese, rosemary and 1 tablespoon of milk to each well.
Bake in a 350 F oven for 25 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and browned.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sliced sweet potato to the skillet and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the shredded Swiss cheese to the skillet and stir until melted and combined.
5. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, to taste.
6. Pour the milk into the skillet and stir until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
7. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Sprinkle the rosemary leaves evenly over the top of the mixture.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is cooked through.
10. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook and stir cabbage and onions in dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat 5 to 10 min.
or until tender.
Remove from skillet.
Brown meat in same skillet.
Stir in rice, soup and water until blended.
Layer 1/3 of the cabbage mixture and half the meat mixture in 13x9-inch baking dish.
Repeat layers; top with remaining cabbage mixture.
Cover.
Bake 1 hour.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, onions, and a pinch of salt. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, Tuscan Italian Dressing, and ground beef.
4. Add the beef mixture to the cabbage mixture, and mix well.
5. In a small bowl, mix the instant brown rice and water.
6. Pour the rice mixture into the large mixing bowl with the cabbage and beef mixture.
7. Stir in the condensed tomato soup and water.
8. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the casserole is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the Easy Layered Cabbage Casserole hot.

This delicious Easy Layered Cabbage Casserole is a nutritious and satisfying meal that can be enjoyed by the whole family. The combination of shredded cabbage, ground beef, rice, and tomato soup creates a hearty and flavorful dish that is easy to prepare and can be customized with additional ingredients or seasonings to suit individual tastes.

gt:
Stir together flour, baking powder and salt.
Gradually stir in enough warm water to form a crumbly dough; then work dough with your hands until it holds together.
Turn out onto a board and knead until smooth.
Divide into 12 pieces and shape each into a smooth ball.
Cover lightly with plastic film and let rest about 15 minutes.
For each tortilla, flatten one ball into a 4 or 5-inch patty, then roll into a 9-inch round, rolling from center to edges.
Turn tortilla often, stretching dough as you carefully peel it off board.
Make sure these are paper thin, the thinner, the better!
As each tortilla is shaped, place on preheated, dry, heavy griddle or heavy wide frying pan over medium-high heat.
On a preheated electric griddle set at medium-high heat or about 375 degrees.
Almost immediately, tiny blisters should appear.
Turn tortilla and immediately start pressing a wide spatula directly on top of it-- press gently but firmly all over the top.
Blisters will form over most of surface as you press.
Turn tortilla and press all over other side until bilsters turn a golden brown; tortilla should remain soft.
If tortillas stick or brown too quickly, reduce heat.
Stack tortillas as cooked inside a folded cloth towel within a plastic bag; close bag and let tortillas steam and soften until all are cooked.
Serve tortillas as soon as they are soft; or cool, remove from bag, wrap in foil, and refrigerate or freeze.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
2. Gradually add the water and mix until a dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Divide the dough into 8 equal portions.
7. Roll out each portion into a flat circle, about 1/4 inch thick.
8. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake the tortillas for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
10. Remove the tortillas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a saucepan, add the chicken and cook until inside is white.
(I use cooking spray).
Remove chicken, add onions and cook until soft, return chicken to saucepan and add green bell pepper and jalapeno.
Season with salt and pepper, add cabbage and cook for a few minutes.
Add the last three ingredients and cook for a few minutes longer.
Goes well with rice or pita.
pred:
1. Preheat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. Add the sliced onion and green bell pepper to the skillet, stirring occasionally. Cook until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the sliced jalapeno pepper to the skillet, stirring to combine with the vegetables. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the jalapeno pepper is slightly softened.
4. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper, then add them to the skillet. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear, about 5-7 minutes per side.
5. While the chicken is cooking, shred the cabbage using a cheese grater or a food processor.
6. Add the shredded cabbage to the skillet, stirring to combine with the chicken and vegetables. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the cabbage is slightly wilted.
7. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and white vinegar. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken, vegetables, and cabbage in the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly and the chicken is fully cooked through.
8. Serve the stir fried chicken and vegetables over rice or noodles, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro, if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Bring a large pot of water to boil and add a generous palmful of sea salt or kosher salt to the pot.
Add pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente.
While waiting for the water to boil, heat oil in a medium skillet.
Add garlic and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, and making sure it does not burn.
Then add onion, salt, pepper, fresh herbs and stir, cooking, for about 5 minutes.
Add the anchovies and their oil, raise the heat to medium-high, and cook for another 1-2 minutes, stirring until anchovies are dissolved.
Add tomatoes with their juice, as well as bay leaf and red pepper flakes.
Simmer for 5 minutes, then add olives and capers.
Simmer another 5-10 minutes, then taste and adjust seasonings.
Drain pasta and place in a large shallow bowl, then toss with the puttanesca sauce and serve.
pred:
To prepare a perfect Pasta Puttanesca Perfecto, follow these key steps:

1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually boiling for 8-10 minutes.
2. While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic and onion, sautéing until softened and fragrant.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, crushed red pepper flakes, and salt. Cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes start to release their juices.
5. Add the chopped anchovies, olives, capers, and oregano. Cook for a few more minutes until the flavors are well combined.
6. Drain the pasta and add it to the skillet with the sauce. Toss the pasta to coat it evenly with the sauce.
7. Add the chopped basil and bay leaf to the skillet. Cook for a few more minutes until the pasta is heated through and the basil is wilted.
8. Remove the bay leaf and serve the Pasta Puttanesca Perfecto immediately.

By following these steps, you will have a delicious and authentic Pasta Puttanesca Perfecto.

gt:
Slice the onions a quarter inch, 7mm, tick
Heat oil.
Add sausages and get some color on them.
Remove sausages from pan add sliced onion rings fry till caramelized but kinda firm in same oil.
Move the onion rings to a plate.
Season onion rings with, salt, paprika, garlic and parsley
If your sharing and the one you sare with doesn't like the ketchup or the mustard may be too spicy don't mix.
I left unmixed on the picture.
Put parsley on top.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it is soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the seasoned salt, granulated garlic powder, paprika, and chopped parsley to the skillet. Cook for another minute or until fragrant.
4. Add the Vienna sausages to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides, flipping them occasionally.
5. In a small bowl, mix the spicy horseradish mustard, Heinz tomato ketchup, and chopped parsley.
6. Remove the cooked sausages from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
7. Pour the spicy horseradish mustard mixture over the sausages.
8. Bake the sausages in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the mustard mixture is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
9. Serve the Vienna sausages and naked onion rings hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Start with 8 cups of fresh, clean snow.
Put into a large container or bowl.
Fold in 1/2 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons vanilla extract and finally, 1-cup milk
Mix well
Fold in final two cups of snow to give more texture and volume.
Serve immediately.
Will keep in freezer for short time.
Enjoy
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the 10 cups of fresh snow with the 1/2 cups of sugar.
2. Add the 2 tablespoons of vanilla extract and mix well.
3. Gradually pour in the 1 cup of milk, stirring continuously until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
4. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Cover the bowl and place it in the refrigerator to chill for at least 2 hours or overnight.
6. After chilling, the mixture should be cold and ready to be served.
7. Pour the mixture into ice cream molds or a large plastic container, cover, and freeze for at least 4 hours or until the ice cream is firm.
8. Once the ice cream is frozen, remove it from the molds or container and transfer it to a freezer-safe container or airtight plastic bag.
9. Store the ice cream in the freezer for up to 1 week.

This recipe for Quick Easy Simple Snow Ice Cream is a delicious and easy-to-prepare treat that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of fresh snow, sugar, vanilla extract, and milk creates a creamy, refreshing, and delightful ice cream that can be enjoyed on a hot summer day or anytime you want a cool and satisfying treat.

gt:
Shred the maitake mushrooms apart.
Slice the sausages on the diagonal.
Cut the cream cheese into 5 mm dice.
Take the root ends off the radish sprouts, and cut into 3 equal lengths.
Heat some olive oil in a frying pan, add the mushrooms and sausages and stir fry over medium heat.
When the mushrooms have wilted season well with salt and pepper, and turn off the heat.
Beat the eggs and mix with the milk and the stir fried ingredients.
Wipe out the frying pan with a paper towel.
Add more olive oil and pour in the egg mixture.
When the perimeter has cooked turn down the heat and put a lid on.
Cook for 3 to 5 minutes until the surface has just about solidified, then scatter with the cream cheese and radish sprouts.
Put the lid back on, heat for 1 to 2 minute, then turn off the heat and leave to rest for 5 minutes.
Slice into wedges and serve.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat a non-stick pan or omelette pan over medium heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the cream cheese, salt, and pepper until smooth.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together.
4. Add the sausages to the pan and cook until they are browned and cooked through.
5. Add the mushrooms to the pan and cook until they are tender.
6. Add the egg mixture to the pan, stirring gently to combine. Cook until the eggs are set and the omelette is cooked through.
7. Add the daikon radish sprouts to the omelette and stir gently.
8. Serve the Maitake Mushroom and Sausage Cheese Omelette hot.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix oats, chocolate chips, sunflower seed kernels, cranberries, protein powder, peanut butter, flax seed, and honey together in a large bowl using your hands to assure ingredients are well integrated.
Stir milk into the oats mixture with a spoon until the mixture is even in texture; divide and shape mixture into 10 balls.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, chocolate chips (if using), sunflower seed kernels, cranberries, protein powder, peanut butter, ground flax seed, honey, and skim milk.
3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly until well combined.
4. Using a spoon or your hands, form the mixture into small bite-sized balls.
5. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the bites in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are slightly golden brown and firm to the touch.
7. Allow the bites to cool for a few minutes before enjoying them.

These No-Bake Oatmeal Protein Bites are a delicious and nutritious treat that can be enjoyed as a snack or a meal replacement. The combination of oats, protein powder, and other ingredients provides a balance of energy, fiber, and essential nutrients. The chocolate chips add a touch of sweetness, while the sunflower seed kernels and cranberries contribute to the overall texture and flavor.

gt:
Combine first 5 ingredients.
Spoon over toast slices just before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the quartered cherry tomatoes, KRAFT 2% Milk Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, chopped fresh basil, and KRAFT Lite Zesty Italian Dressing.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on two slices of toasted French bread.
4. Place the bread slices with the toppings on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
5. Serve immediately and enjoy your Quick Bruschetta for Two!

gt:
Remove the bones from mackerel and cut into smaller pieces.
Put the soy sauce, garlic powder, soy sauce, sake and the chopped mackerel pieces into a baggie and mix gently by hand.
Leave to marinate for at least 30 minutes or half a day in the fridge.
Cut broccoli into pieces and put into a pan of boiled water with a pinch of salt.
Cook for as long as you like (par boiled is ok) then drain water.
Heat oil in a sauce pan and fry the mackerel on medium heat with the lid on.
Turn and fry until it is well cooked.
Then add the broccoli and stir fry on medium heat for a minute.
Shake the pan a little to mix it up but not too much.
Finally, add the half cut mini tomatoes into the pan.
Season with salt and pepper if needed, serve on a warmed plate and enjoy!
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash the mackerel and remove any bones. Cut the broccoli into florets and chop the mini tomatoes into halves.

2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.

3. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until fragrant.

4. Add the soy sauce, sake, and garlic powder to the skillet. Stir to combine.

5. Add the mackerel to the skillet and cook until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

6. Add the broccoli florets to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until they are tender but still crisp.

7. Add the mini tomatoes to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional 1-2 minutes, until they are heated through.

8. Serve the Mackerel, Broccoli, and Garlic Stir-Fry over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
1.Preheat oven to 425F In a large bowl, mix together the sausage, onion, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper and milk or cream.
2.Unfold the puff pastry onto a lightly floured work surface.
Cut each sheet in two lengthwise to make four long rectangles.
Form a log of sausage down the center of each puff pastry sheet, leaving a 1-inch edge.
Starting from a long edge, roll the puff pastry up and over the sausage, brushing the edge with the beaten egg to seal.
Pinch the ends closed.
3.Cut each roll into quarters.
Place the rolls seam-side down on a parchment or wax paper-lined baking sheet and brush the tops with the egg wash.
4.Place in the oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350F, and bake for another 30 to 35 minutes, or until the pastry is puffed and golden and the sausage is cooked through.
5.Let cool for a few minutes, then serve with ketchup.
Variations.
Add extra flavorings to your sausage mix as you like: chopped parsley, thyme, curry powder, crumbled sage, garlic powder, paprika.
Appetizer Portions: Cut each rolled up puff pastry log into 8 portions instead of 4 to make appetizer-sized sausage rolls.
Adjust down the cooking time to allow for the smaller size.
Sprinkle the rolls with sesame seeds or paprika before baking.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
3. Cut the sausage into small, evenly sized pieces.
4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped onion, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the milk or cream, egg, and water until well combined.
6. Spread the sausage pieces evenly on the pastry, leaving a 1/2-inch (1.3 cm) border around the edges.
7. Pour the egg mixture over the sausage pieces, making sure to cover them completely.
8. Roll the pastry over the sausage and egg mixture, pressing the edges to seal the filling.
9. Place the sausage roll on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the sausage rolls for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
11. Remove the sausage rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing them into individual servings.

[/INST]

This cooking procedure involves a few simple steps to create delicious Sausage Rolls the Australian Way. First, preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) to ensure that the pastry cooks evenly and the filling is hot and bubbly. Next, roll out the puff pastry to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm) and cut the sausage into small, evenly sized pieces. In a large bowl, combine the chopped onion, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper, and in a separate bowl, whisk the milk or cream, egg, and water until well combined. Spread the sausage pieces evenly on the pastry, leaving a 1/2-inch (1.3 cm) border around the edges. Pour the egg mixture over the

gt:
Boil the asparagus briefly so that it's still crisp, and cur diagonally into pieces.
Heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan and put inthe scallops.
When they are cooked a bit, add the white wine (or sake), put on a lid and seam-cook them.
Add the asparagus while there's still a little wine left in te pan.
Add the butter and soy sauce, coat the scallops and asparagus with them and serve.
pred:
1. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. Add the vegetable oil and cook the asparagus until it is tender but still crisp.
3. Remove the asparagus from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the white wine or sake and cook until it has reduced by half.
5. Add the baby scallops to the skillet and cook until they are opaque and fully cooked.
6. Add the asparagus back to the skillet and toss everything together.
7. In a small bowl, mix the butter and soy sauce.
8. Pour the butter and soy sauce mixture over the scallops and asparagus in the skillet.
9. Cook everything together for a few minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.
10. Serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
in small dry skittle, toast pine nuts over med heat, shaking pan often until light golden 3-5 minutes, transfer to food processor and let cool.
in heatproof bowl, cover tomatoes with 1/2 cup boiling water, soak until softened, about 10 minutes.
drain, reserving 2 tablespoons soaking liquid.
add tomatoes and reserved liquid to food processor.
add tomato paste, pepper and salt, finely chop, with motor running add oil in thin steady stream until pureed.
pulse in Parmesan cheese and garlic.
To Make again:.
Refrigerate in air tight container for up to 5 days, or freeze for up to 6 months.
pred:
[INST]
To prepare Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto, follow these steps:
1. In a food processor or blender, combine the pine nuts, sun-dried tomatoes, tomato paste, black pepper, salt, and garlic.
2. Blend the mixture until it reaches a smooth consistency.
3. With the food processor running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil.
4. Once the oil is fully incorporated, add the grated parmesan cheese.
5. Blend the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
7. Use the pesto immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

The required ingredients for this recipe are:
- 14 cups pine nuts
- 12 cups dry packed sun-dried tomato
- 3 tablespoons tomato paste
- 14 teaspoons black pepper
- 1 pinch salt
- 13 cups extra virgin olive oil
- 14 cups grated parmesan cheese
- 1 garlic clove, minced

Enjoy your delicious Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto!

gt:
Divide watermelon cubes among 4 serving plates.
Crumble blue cheese on top and drizzle with olive oil.
Season generously with salt and pepper and serve.Nutritional information is based on a 3/4-cup serving
pred:
1. Wash and cut the watermelon into bite-sized pieces.
