Transfer chicken to a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
Sprinkle with Cajun seasoning.
Top with mushrooms and cheese.
Cover and bake at 350F for 30-35 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, seasoned bread crumbs, and cajun seasoning.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mushrooms, muenster cheese, and vegetable oil.
4. Add the chicken cubes to the egg mixture, then coat them evenly with the mushroom mixture.
5. Place the coated chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through and golden brown.
6. Serve the Mushroom Muenster Chicken over a bed of rice or noodles.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine all ingredients except cacao nibs in a food processor and process until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl once or twice.
Add cacao nibs and process for 10-15 seconds more until incorporated and chopped up just slightly.
Keep refrigerated.
Great for dipping with apple slices or other fruit, cookies, etc.
* Note: I used extra firm tofu because thats what I had on hand and it came out fine/smooth.
If you have silken, it would probably be even better.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the tofu, oats, peanut butter, sugar, vanilla extract, salt, and cacao nibs.
3. Mix the ingredients until well combined and smooth.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Scoop the cookie dough mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, and shape it into a flat, even layer.
6. Bake the cookie dough for 20-25 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden brown.
7. Remove the baked cookie dough from the oven and let it cool completely on the baking sheet.
8. Once the cookie dough is fully cooled, you can serve it with your favorite dipping items, such as pretzels, bananas, or apples.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large stockpot or Dutch oven, melt the stick of butter over medium-high heat.
Add the onions, 1 teaspoon salt, and black pepper.
Saute for 5-7 minutes, until onions have begun to sweat.
Add garlic, thyme, and bay leaves and cook down for 25-30 minutes until onions are extremely soft and caramelized (stirring frequently).
Then add the wine, being sure to scrape the bottom of the pan.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and then simmer until the wine has evaporated, about 8-15 minutes.
Remove the bay leaves and thyme springs.
Dust the onions with the flour and cook over medium-low for 5-7 minutes to get rid of the raw flour taste.
Add the beef broth, and bring to a simmer for 10 minutes (or until ready to serve).
When ready to serve soup, ladle about 1-1 1/2 cups of soup into an oven safe bowl or soup crock, top with a toasted baguette slice, 1 tablespoon of parmesan cheese, and lastly, 2 slices of provolone cheese.
Repeat with remaining bowls of soup.
Place all of the prepared soup bowls onto a baking sheet and place in the oven.
Broil for 2-5 minutes until the cheese is browned and bubbly (keep a close eye on them).
Serve hot.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced onions and cook until they are softened and translucent, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the salt, pepper, and garlic to the pot, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Pour in the red wine, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced by half.
6. Add the flour to the pot, stirring continuously to create a roux. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the roux is light golden in color.
7. Gradually pour in the beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30-45 minutes, or until the onions are tender and the flavors have melded together.
9. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Carefully ladle the soup into a large bowl or a pot, and let it cool for a few more minutes.
11. Meanwhile, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
12. Once the soup has cooled, carefully transfer it to a large, oven-safe casserole dish or a deep baking dish.
13. Place the casserole dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 30-45 minutes, or until the soup is hot and bubbly, and the croutons are golden brown.
14. Remove the casserole dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
15. Carefully transfer the soup to a serving bowl or individual bowls, and garnish with the shaved Parmesan cheese and sliced provolone cheese.
16. Serve the savory French Onion Soup immediately, and enjoy!

Remember, practice

gt:
Slice pound cake into 8 equal slices.
Slice each peach into 8 equal slices and discard pits.
Lightly spray one side of the peach slices and cake slices with cooking spray.
Put them on a platter to take them out to the grill.
Heat grill on high for 10 minutes and make sure that the grill surface is clean.
Lower heat to medium-low and place food on grill, with the sprayed side down.
Grill for 5 minutes then spray the tops of everything before turning.
Grill the other side for 5 more minutes.
Serve each slice of cake with 1/8th of the fruit and a whipped topping or ice cream.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill or grill pan to medium heat.
2. Cut the pound cake into 1-inch cubes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pound cake cubes, peaches, and cooking oil spray. Toss to coat the pound cake and peaches evenly.
4. Spread the coated pound cake and peaches evenly on the grill or grill pan.
5. Cook the pound cake and peaches for approximately 5-7 minutes, or until they are golden brown and slightly crispy.
6. If desired, add whipped topping or ice cream to the pound cake and peaches before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Grilled Pound Cake & Peaches!

gt:
Mix together the soy sauce, sake, ginger, garlic, tobanjan, brown sugar, and salt in a bowl to make the marinade.
Pour three-fourths of the marinade into a baking dish or rimmed sheet pan; reserve the rest.
Lay the chicken in the marinade and flip the halves 4 times to generously coat all over.
Use a rubber spatula or your hands to make sure all the crevices are well coated.
Marinate the chicken halves for 10 minutes, turning once.
Preheat a grill to medium.
Grill the chicken, covered, for about 35 minutes.
Start by grilling skin side down for about 2 minutes.
Flip the chicken and brush on the reserved marinade.
Flip the chicken about every 7 minutes, brushing on more marinade after each turn.
The chickens are done when very juicy with meat pulling away from the bone.
Rest the chicken for 5 minutes, cut into serving pieces, and serve.
pred:
To cook a delicious Ginger-Garlic Half Chicken dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sake, grated ginger, garlic, tobanjan, brown sugar, and salt.

3. Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.

4. Place the chicken in a large, shallow baking dish or roasting pan.

5. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the chicken, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.

6. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into serving pieces.

8. Serve the Ginger-Garlic Half Chicken with your choice of side dishes, such as rice, noodles, or a mixed green salad.

The key to a delicious Ginger-Garlic Half Chicken dish is the balance of flavors and the careful preparation of the ingredients. The soy sauce and sake provide a savory, umami-rich base, while the grated ginger and garlic add a spicy, aromatic kick. The tobanjan and brown sugar enhance the flavors with a touch of sweetness, and the salt balances the taste. The result is a mouthwatering, well-rounded dish that is both satisfying and flavorful.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In a saute pan, gently cook the garlic and onion in half of the olive oil until soft.
Add the tomatoes, herbs, spice and seasonings.
Cover pan and simmer 5 minutes.
Cut up the cauliflower into florets and stir into the tomato sauce mixture.
Cover pan and cook another 10 minutes.
Transfer the mixture into a shallow, ovenproof dish, and drizzle with the remaining olive oil and the lemon juice.
Grate the feta cheese on the top and garnish with black pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for approximately 25 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped onion, minced garlic, and Italian plum tomatoes. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cinnamon.
3. Add the bay leaf and dried oregano, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and olive oil.
5. Add the whisked lemon juice mixture to the onion and tomato mixture, and mix well.
6. Add the cauliflower florets to the bowl, and toss to coat the cauliflower evenly with the tomato and herb mixture.
7. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a baking dish, and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and slightly golden.
8. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Add the feta cheese to the cauliflower mixture, and stir to combine.
10. Serve the Kounoupithi hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degree F.
Lightly coat twelve 2-1/2-inch muffin cups with nonstick cooking spray; set aside.
In a large bowl, stir together all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, wheat germ, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, salt, and baking soda; set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine egg, pumpkin, buttermilk, applesauce, brown sugar, and oil; add pumpkin mixture all at once to flour mixture.
Stir just until moistened.
Divide batter evenly among prepared muffin cups, filling each about two-thirds full.
Bake about 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted near centers comes out clean.
Cool in muffin cups on a wire rack for 5 minutes.
Remove from muffin cups.
* To make 3/4 cup sour milk, place 2-1/4 teaspoons lemon juice or vinegar in a glass measuring cup.
Add enough milk to make 3/4 cup total liquid; stir.
Let mixture stand for 5 minutes before using.
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make Apple-Pumpkin Muffins, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the nonstick cooking spray, all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, wheat germ, pumpkin pie spice or apple pie spice, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Whisk until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the Egg Beaters egg substitute, pumpkin, buttermilk, unsweetened applesauce, and Splenda brown sugar blend.
4. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fill the muffin cups in a muffin tin with batter, filling them about 3/4 full.
6. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Apple-Pumpkin Muffins!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Combine warm water, 1 teaspoon sugar and yeast in a mixing bowl.
Let stand for 5 minutes.
Yeast will foam and expand.
Using an electric mixer on low speed, add milk, butter, 1/3 cup sugar, salt, eggs and about 1/2 cup flour.
Continue adding 1/2 cup of flour at a time, scraping down bowl occasionally, until a soft dough forms.
You may have as much as 1/4 to 1/3 cup of remaining flour.
Turn dough out onto floured surface and knead in the remaining flour.
Continue kneading dough for 10 minutes, adding just enough flour so dough wont stick.
Form dough into a ball and place in a large greased bowl, turning the dough to cover with oil.
Cover loosely and let the dough rise in a warm spot for one hour, or until doubled in size.
Punch down dough and return to floured surface.
Let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
Divide dough in half, and then continue dividing each piece until you have 48 individual pieces.
Spray a 24-cup muffin pan with cooking spray.
Roll dough pieces into balls and place four balls into each muffin cup.
Cover muffin pan and let rolls rise in warm spot for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Mix egg yolk with two teaspoons of water and brush egg wash over tops of rolls.
Bake in 400 degrees oven for 10-12 minutes, watching to make sure the tops dont burn.
pred:
To cook Lucky Four-Leaf Clover Rolls, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5-10 minutes or until the yeast is foamy.
2. Add the melted butter, milk, and egg yolk to the yeast mixture, stirring well to combine.
3. Gradually add the flour, one cup at a time, stirring until the dough comes together. If the dough is too sticky, add a bit more flour, and if it's too dry, add a bit more water.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then roll it out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
8. Spread the dough with the remaining sugar, leaving a 1/2-inch (1.5 cm) border around the edges.
9. Place the dough on a greased baking sheet or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the rolls in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until they are golden brown.
11. Remove the rolls from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Lucky Four-Leaf Clover Rolls!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F
Cream together sugars and butter.
Add in eggs and vanilla extract until mixed.
In a separate bowl combine all other dry ingredients (except chips and nuts) and add to the creamed mixture.
Once ingredients are combined, add chips and nuts and mix well.
Scoop heaping tablespoon of mixture onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 14 minutes.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
Great served warm.
Enjoy!
pred:
To prepare a delicious Oatmeal, Chocolate Chip & Walnut Cookies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt, mixing until well combined.
6. Fold in the oats, chocolate chips, and chopped walnuts.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Oatmeal, Chocolate Chip & Walnut Cookies dish!

gt:
Preheat oven to 300F.
Mix cereal, popcorn and pretzels in 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Mix butter, Worcestershire sauce and salt until well blended.
Drizzle evenly over cereal mixture; toss to coat.
Bake 30 minutes, stirring after 15 minutes.
Cool completely.
Store in airtight container at room temperature.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded wheat cereal, popped popcorn, and small unsalted pretzels.
3. Melt the butter or margarine in a small saucepan over low heat.
4. Add the melted butter or margarine to the cereal mixture, stirring to coat the ingredients evenly.
5. In a small bowl, mix the melted butter or margarine with the Worcestershire Sauce and seasoned salt.
6. Pour the Worcestershire Sauce mixture over the cereal mixture, stirring to combine.
7. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
8. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cereal is golden brown and crisp.
9. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Holiday Snack Mix dish!

gt:
Place black-eyed peas into a container, and cover with several inches of water.
Allow to stand for 12 hours.
Drain the water from the black-eyed peas.
Place peas into the bowl of a food processor, and pulse until coarsely ground.
Stir in the egg whites, salt, flour, and cayenne pepper to taste until dough consistency.
Add more flour if necessary to hold the mixture together.
Form into small balls, each about 2 inches diameter.
Heat the oil in a heavy, deep skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) over medium-high heat.
Carefully drop the balls into the hot oil, and fry until brown, about 5 minutes.
You may need to lower the heat slightly after cooking the first kala balls.
Turn frequently to brown evenly on all sides.
pred:
1. First, rinse the dried black-eyed peas and let them soak in water for at least 8 hours or overnight.
2. Drain the soaked black-eyed peas and transfer them to a large mixing bowl.
3. Add the egg whites, salt, and cayenne pepper to the bowl. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
4. Gradually add the all-purpose flour to the mixture, stirring until the ingredients are well combined.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
6. Using a spoon or your hands, form the mixture into small balls or patties.
7. Carefully place the patties into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
8. Cook the patties until they are golden brown on both sides, flipping them halfway through the cooking process.
9. Remove the fritters from the oil and drain on paper towels.
10. Serve the Kala (Black-Eyed Pea Fritters) hot, as a side dish or appetizer, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Wash the asparagus and snap of the tough bottom stem.
Bring to a boil 1 1/2 cups water in a fairly large saucepan (large enough so the spears can lay flat).
Slice the lemon and put it in the pot along with the oregano and water.
When it is at a roiling boil put in the asparagus cover and cook 3 minutes.
The spears should be heated through but still crisp.
pred:
To make a delicious Lemon Asparagus II dish, follow these steps:
1. Wash and trim the asparagus, making sure to remove the tough ends.
2. In a large skillet or pan, heat some butter or margarine over medium heat.
3. Add the asparagus and cook for 3-4 minutes, until they are tender but still slightly crisp.
4. In a small bowl, mix 12 tablespoons of freshly grated lemon zest with 12 tablespoons of freshly chopped oregano.
5. Season the cooked asparagus with salt and pepper, and then toss them in the lemon-oregano mixture.
6. Serve the Lemon Asparagus II dish immediately, garnished with a drizzle of lemon juice and a sprinkle of freshly grated lemon zest.

This dish is a delicious and healthy option, as asparagus is a nutrient-rich vegetable that is high in vitamins, minerals, and fiber. The lemon zest adds a bright, citrusy flavor, while the oregano provides a warm, herbal touch. The combination of these ingredients creates a delightful and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed as a side or main course.

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended.
Stir in juice concentrate; pour into crust.
Bake 40 min.
or until centre is almost set.
Cool completely.
Refrigerate cheesecake 3 hours.
Drizzle with caramel topping and sprinkle with nuts just before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the frozen apple juice concentrate, mixing until well combined.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared graham cracker crust.
6. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is slightly wobbly.
7. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan.
8. In a small saucepan, heat the caramel ice cream topping over low heat, stirring constantly, until smooth and melted.
9. Spread the melted caramel evenly over the cooled cake.
10. Sprinkle the chopped dry roasted peanuts evenly over the caramel layer.
11. Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours or until the caramel is set.
12. Serve the Caramel Apple Crisp Cheesecake immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Caramel Apple Crisp Cheesecake!

gt:
Toss kale, spinach, lettuce, carrot, cucumber, and red bell pepper together in a large mixing bowl.
Mix balsamic vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, sea salt, pepper, garlic powder, and lemon pepper in a jar with a tight-fitting lid; seal and shake until mixed completely.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to coat.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the torn kale, spinach, romaine lettuce, carrot, cucumber, and red bell pepper.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice, sea salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, and lemon pepper.
3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
4. Serve immediately or refrigerate for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C
Peel and dice the sweet potato and place on an oven tray or cookie sheet.
Pour over the teaspoons of olive oil and season with salt and sprinkle with the smoked paprika.
Toss to coat all of the sweet potato in the oil.
Spread the sweet potato to a single layer and roast in the oven for approx 20-25 minutes, turning the sweet potato after 10 minutes.
Continue to cook (if required) until cooked thru.
Remove from oven and cool.
While the sweet potato is cooking- mix all of the dressing ingredients together and mix thoroughly.
Add both the lime zest and juice.
Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Set aside.
Mix the remaining salad ingredients in a bowl (except the sliced apple).
When ready to serve, peel and finely slice the apple.
Toss the apple into the salad and add the salad dressing and sweet potato cubes.
Toss together lightly.
Serve and Enjoy.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the sweet potatoes with the smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Spread them out on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, honey, and zest from the limes.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the baby spinach leaves, sun-dried tomato, shallot, and feta cheese.
5. Drizzle the lime dressing over the spinach mixture and toss to coat evenly.
6. Add the roasted sweet potatoes to the spinach mixture and toss to combine.
7. Serve the Rsc#11 - Salad With a Lime Dressing immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

[/INST]

This recipe combines the natural sweetness of the roasted sweet potatoes with the tangy, refreshing flavor of the lime dressing. The crunchy texture of the baby spinach and sun-dried tomato adds a contrasting element to the dish, while the feta cheese provides a creamy, slightly salty taste. The shallot adds a subtle onion flavor, and the apple slices add a touch of sweetness and crunch. This versatile salad can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish, and it can be easily customized to suit individual preferences.

gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place half the ribs in single layer on large sheet heavy-duty foil.
Mix seasoning and honey; rub half evenly onto both sides of ribs.
Bring up foil sides.
Double fold top and both ends to seal packet.
Repeat to make second packet.
Place packets on baking sheet and bake 2 hours or until ribs are done.
Heat barbecue to medium-high heat.
Remove ribs from foil; discard foil.
Brush ribs with barbecue sauce and grill 2 to 3 min.
per side, until lightly charred, turning occasionally.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the dry mustard, ground black pepper, and honey.
3. Season the ribs with the dry mustard mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Place the ribs in a baking dish and pour the honey mixture over them.
5. Bake the ribs in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the meat is tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
6. Remove the ribs from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

These steps involve preparing the ingredients, seasoning the ribs, baking them in the oven, and allowing them to rest before serving. The result is a delicious and flavorful Chipotle and Honey Glazed Ribs dish that can be enjoyed with friends and family.

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
To make the cranberry stuffing, coarsely chop the cranberries and pearl onions in a food processor.
In a medium bowl, fold together the contents of the food processor, bread crumbs, Parmesan, pecans, sage, thyme, and rosemary.
Lay turkey cutlets out on a cutting board, cover them with a piece of plastic wrap and gently pound them with a mallet until they are even in thickness.
To stuff the cutlets, evenly divide the stuffing amongst the center of the cutlets.
Tightly roll them up and secure them lengthwise with a large toothpick or two.
If any stuffing pops out, pop it back into the rolls with your fingers.
Arrange the cutlets along a cast iron pan or an oven-safe dish.
If using something other than cast iron, brush oil along the bottom of the dish.
Next, lightly brush olive oil along the outside of the cutlets and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake at 375 degrees F oven for 3035 minutes and then serve immediately.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cranberries, pearl onions, bread, Parmesan, pecans, sage, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Place the turkey cutlets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Spread the cranberry mixture evenly over the top of each turkey cutlet.
5. Drizzle the olive oil over the top of the cranberry mixture.
6. Bake the turkey cutlets in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the turkey cutlets from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
For the cookie: Beat butter and margarine until fully combined.
Add in sugars and beat until well blended.
Add vanilla and egg.
Slowly add in the flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt.
Combine with hands if necessary.
Shape into tow 12-inch logs about 2 inches wide, 2 inches high.
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Slice cookies about 1/4 inch thick, bake in a 350 degrees F oven for about 10 minutes.
Cool and enjoy!
For the cream filling, beat melted butter with Crisco.
Beat in sugar, vanilla and heavy cream until smooth and fluffy.
Spread about 1 tablespoon of filling between two chocolate wafers.
Enjoy!
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and margarine together.
3. Add the brown sugar and granulated sugar, and continue to cream until light and fluffy.
4. Add the melted butter flavored Crisco, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
7. Fold in the melted butter and heavy cream.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Separate the garlic bulb into cloves, remove the thick skins from each clove, and cut the garlic into thin slices.
Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large, heavy skillet.
Add the asparagus and salt to taste.
Saute until the asparagus is tender and the skin has shriveled slightly, about five minutes.
Add the garlic, and continue to saute for another minute until the garlic is translucent.
Adjust salt, add the pepper and parsley, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the green garlic with a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the asparagus and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
4. Transfer the cooked asparagus to a baking dish.
5. Drizzle the green garlic-infused olive oil over the asparagus.
6. Season the asparagus with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Roast the asparagus in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy.
8. Remove the asparagus from the oven and toss it with the chopped parsley.
9. Serve the Asparagus With Green Garlic immediately.

gt:
Glaze:.
Mix all ingredients together and set aside.
Kabobs:.
Soak twelve 6 to 8 inch wooden skewers in water 30 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Alternate sausage, water chestnuts and pineapple on skewers.
Coat kabobs with glaze.
Cover and grill kabobs about 4 inches from heat for about 10 to 12 minutes, turning and brushing with glaze once, and until sausage is firm and light brown.
pred:
To make a delicious Polynesian Kabobs dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, combine the pork sausage, water chestnuts, pineapple chunks, honey, reserved pineapple juice, soy sauce, and nutmeg. Mix well to ensure even distribution of the ingredients.
3. Thread the pork sausage and water chestnuts onto skewers, alternating between the two.
4. Brush the grill or grill pan with a little oil to prevent sticking.
5. Grill the kabobs for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the pork is cooked through and the water chestnuts are tender.
6. Serve the Polynesian Kabobs warm, garnished with a sprinkle of ground nutmeg for added flavor.

The key to making a delicious Polynesian Kabobs dish is to ensure that the ingredients are well-balanced and complement each other. The pork sausage provides a savory flavor, while the water chestnuts add a crunchy texture and a touch of sweetness. The pineapple chunks bring a tangy, fruity taste, and the honey adds a subtle sweetness. The soy sauce and nutmeg enhance the overall flavor profile, while the pepper adds a touch of heat. By following these steps and using high-quality ingredients, you can create a delicious and satisfying Polynesian Kabobs dish.

gt:
Combine the soy milk, sake lees, and white miso in a pot and let it sit for a while (to soften the sake lees).
Once the sake lees have softened, mix until everything becomes smooth.
Add the minced onion and garlic and heat on low for 5 to 10 minutes.
Add the rice and mix.
Adjust the flavor with salt.
Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with microwaved brussels sprouts and top with black pepper.
pred:
[INST]
1. In a large saucepan, heat the soy milk over medium heat.
2. Add the sake lees to the soy milk, stirring to combine.
3. In a small bowl, mix the white miso with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
4. Add the miso mixture to the soy milk, stirring to combine.
5. Add the cooked rice to the soy milk mixture, stirring to coat the rice evenly.
6. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat.
7. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened.
8. Add the cooked rice mixture to the skillet, stirring to combine.
9. Cook the risotto over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice is tender and creamy.
10. Season the risotto with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Macrobiotic Cream Risotto immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 F.
For the filling: Place apples and pomegranate arils in a 2 quart baking dish.
Drizzle with honey and lemon juice.
Sprinkle the arrowroot powder and cinnamon, and give it a stir.
Pour 1 tablespoon of the coconut oil (in the topping list) evenly over the top.
For the topping: In a small bowl, whisk together the almond flour, coconut, chopped nuts, ginger and nutmeg.
Combine the remaining 3 tablespoons coconut oil and the honey in a small bowl or cup then stir it into the dry mixture.
You should have a thick, crumbly mixture.
Spread the topping evenly over the fruit.
Cover dish with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the apples are tender.
If you plan on making the yogurt topping, just combine all ingredients into a bowl and stir well.
Serve the breakfast crumble with a spoonful or two of yogurt drizzled on top.
Note: Arrowroot powder is a grain-free substitute for flour or cornstarch and works like a thickener.
If you dont have or cant find it, either leave it out or substitute an equal amount of cornstarch or double the amount of all-purpose flour.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the almond flour, shredded coconut, and chopped nuts.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the melted coconut oil, honey, freshly squeezed lemon juice, arrowroot powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla extract.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, and mix until the batter is well combined.
5. Spread the mixture evenly over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the crumble is golden brown and set.
7. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
The night before you want to prepare the pork, rub mustard all over it and generously sprinkle with your rub.
I used about 1/4 cup of rub for the 2 1/2 pound roast.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
The next day take the pork out of the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.
Meanwhile, start your charcoal grill.
Let it heat to high and once the fire calms down, move the coals to one side of the grill.
Place the pork on the side of the grill without the charcoal.
Cover the grill and cook until the pork reaches 150 F, about 3 hours.
Take the pork off the grill and put it on a clean platter.
Loosely tent it with foil for 20 minutes so the juice runs back into the meat.
Cut into slices and serve.
To make the rub: In a bowl, mix together all of the rub seasoning.
Please note when making this recipe, you will have lots of rub leftover for future use.
Store leftovers in an airtight container or bag in the pantry.
The rule of thumb: To smoke pork it takes about an hour per pound.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the pork sirloin tip roast with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the Dijon mustard, rub seasoning, paprika, brown sugar, cumin, chili powder, and black pepper.
4. Rub the seasoning mixture all over the pork roast, ensuring that it is evenly distributed.
5. Place the pork roast in a roasting pan, and pour any remaining seasoning mixture over the top.
6. Roast the pork in the preheated oven for about 2-2.5 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
7. Remove the pork from the oven, and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
8. Serve the pork roast with your choice of side dishes, such as mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or a salad.

Enjoy your delicious Smoked Pork Sirloin Tip Roast dish!

gt:
Boil potatoes till tender about 20 minutes.
Drain into colander.
Rice or mash potatoes and place back in pot.
Warm milk, butter add cream cheese in a pot over low heat to a simmer.
Stir into the potatoes adding the remaining ingredients folding in well.
Place in serving bowl and garnish with additional kosher salt and paprika.

gt:
boil shrimp in salt water (large pot, 1Tbsp salt) if shrimp r precooked defrost fully in cold water instead of boiling them.
tips: bring water to boil before throwing shrimp in, they will float to the surface when done.
dont leave the shrimp in too long, you want them tender not chewy!
cool shrimp in cold water ( ice speeds up the process of coarse.)
when cooled, or defrosted, peel shrimp and devein (to devein shrimp, run a paring knife along the outer curve of the shrimp almost 1/4in deep from top to bottom youll see it!)
its poop u dont want to eat that part!
throw the shrimp in the bowl with all other ingredients, toss well, but gently u dont want to mash the avocado or tomatoes... chill for atleast an hour n enjoy!
great with saltine crackers and a slice of lime
a great add-in is chunked octopus.
pred:
1. In a large salad bowl, combine the shrimp, chopped tomatoes, diced onion, chopped cilantro, and diced green pepper.
2. Add the tomato juice, ketchup, hot sauce, citrus soda, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well.
3. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Serve the shrimp cocktail as a refreshing appetizer or snack.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut each date along one side, removing the pit and replacing it with a toasted Marcona almond.
Place a teaspoon of the cheese inside the date and close it.
Wrap each date with half a slice of bacon and secure it with a toothpick.
Bake in a 400-degree oven until golden brown, about 5 to 7 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Clean the dates by removing the pits and any remaining fruit.
3. Cut the dates into halves or quarters, depending on their size.
4. Cut the almonds in half, lengthwise.
5. In a small bowl, mix the almonds with a pinch of salt.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the blue cheese with a pinch of salt.
7. In a large bowl, mix the almonds and blue cheese together.
8. Add the dates to the bowl and mix until well coated.
9. Cut the bacon into small pieces.
10. Place the dates and almond mixture in the center of the bacon pieces.
11. Wrap each date and almond mixture with a bacon piece, securing it with a toothpick.
12. Place the wrapped dates on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the dates are cooked through.
13. Remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
14. Serve the Dates Stuffed With Almonds and Blue Cheese immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Dates Stuffed With Almonds and Blue Cheese dish!

gt:
Place a sheet of wax paper on a flat baking sheet sized to fit in your freezer; set aside.
Beat eggs together in a bowl.
Stir together the four, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a second bowl.
Mix together the panko and Parmesan cheese in a third bowl.
Flour the clams well, shaking off any excess.
Dip clams into the eggs, then into the panko mixture, pressing it evenly onto the clams.
Place on prepared baking sheet, cover with wax paper; freeze until firm.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry clams until lightly browned, about 1 minute on each side.
Do not overcook or they will become tough.
Place on paper towels to drain.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs and set aside.
3. In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder until well combined.
4. Dip each cleaned and dried razor clam in the whisked eggs, then coat it evenly with the flour mixture.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the panko and shredded Parmesan cheese.
6. Dip the coated clams in the panko mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
7. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat.
8. Carefully place the coated clams in the hot oil, being cautious not to overcrowd the pan.
9. Cook the clams for about 3-4 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
10. Remove the clams from the oil and place them on a wire rack or paper towels to drain and cool.

[/INST]

1. Serve the Panko-Breaded Fried Razor Clams immediately, garnished with lemon wedges and chopped parsley, if desired. Enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Preheat oven 350 degrees.
Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, place face down in shallow glass pan, with water to cover bottom of pan ,.
Roast Squash in oven 45 min till skin is fork tender aka poke easily with fork .
(I recommend roasting night before so has time to cool in refrigerator).
Scrape out the spaghetti squash into bowl (should be stringing) allow to cool.
Drain any liquid off squash, Add 2 eggs, parmareggio cheese, salt, and pepper mix.
In a preheated frying pan add pat of butter, Place small amounts of squash mixture flattening in to small (size of your palm) pancakes (too big can't flip them).
Fry carefully till both sides are golden brown, remove set on side in a warm oven.
***Please note Spaghetti Squash Pancakes can be made ahead of time and reheated in oven.
At same time - Place Ragu in a pot and bring to temperature slowly.
Take shrimp seasoned with salt and pepper saute in a pan with garlic till pink and non translucent cooked.
Lay baby arugula on plate, sprinkle with balsamic vinegar.
Stack Spaghetti Squash Pancake, Ragu Sauce, Shrimp, and sprinkle with goat cheese crumbles.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Spread the spaghetti squash on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized.
3. In a large bowl, mix the Ragu Pasta Sauce, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
5. Cook the pasta according to package instructions.
6. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked pasta, shrimp, egg mixture, and spaghetti squash.
8. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the Warm Shrimp Nest Salad #Ragu on a plate.

[/INST]

gt:
Cut the bread and pineapple into bite-sized cubes and add to a 9x13 pan.
In a saucepan, heat the cream over medium heat.
Meanwhile put the chocolate chips into a medium-sized bowl.
Once the heavy cream begins to simmer remove it from the heat and pour over the white chocolate chips.
Whisk the white chocolate and the heavy cream until the chocolate is melted.
Add the sugar, milk, eggs, egg yolks and vanilla and whisk.
Pour the mixture over the bread and pineapple.
Sprinkle with the coconut.
Allow the bread pudding to sit for 1 hour and then bake for 45 minutes in a 350 degrees F oven.
If it is getting too brown, cover the bread pudding with foil.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Hawaiian bread, pineapple, heavy cream, white chocolate chips, sugar, milk, eggs, beaten, and vanilla extract.
4. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
5. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the pudding to cool for a few minutes before serving.
7. Sprinkle the sweetened shredded coconut on top of the pudding before serving.

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 100C Place a large serving bowl inside to warm.
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to boil.
Drop in the trimmed broccoli.
When the water returns to the boil, cook for 2 minutes exactly and then scoop the broccoli into a colander resting over a mixing bowl.
Heat the oil in a large heavy-based non-stick frying pan over medium heat.
Saute the garlic for a few seconds until it smells gragrand and add the anchovies.
Stir with a wooden spoon until th eanchovies have melted.
Tip in the chilli and the reserved broccoli.
Bring the broccoli cooking water back to the boil and drop in the pasta.
It will take just 2-3 minutes to cook.
As soon as the pasta is ready, drain it through the colander now resting in the sink, give it a big shake and then tip it into the frying pan, with the butter and parmesan.
Toss well and transfer to the heated serving bowl.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli florets and stems with the olive oil, garlic, and chili pepper. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Spread the broccoli mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender and slightly browned.
4. While the broccoli is cooking, cook the linguine according to package instructions.
5. In a large pot, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
6. Add the linguine to the pot and toss to coat the pasta with the butter.
7. Add the roasted broccoli to the pot and toss to combine.
8. Season the pasta and broccoli mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the linguine and broccoli mixture immediately.

[/INST]

This recipe is a delicious and healthy combination of vegetables and pasta, providing essential nutrients and a satisfying meal.

gt:
in mixing bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, soda and salt.
stir thoroughly.
cut in butter till crumbly,.
add buttermilk.
stir just enough to moisten.
turn on lightly floured surface.
knead 8 to 10 times.
put in greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
bake at 350 for 1 hour or until browned and inserted toothpick comes out clean.
this may also be baked in a casserole or on a baking sheet.
VARIATION;add one cup raisins or currants.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. Cut the cold butter or margarine into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients.
4. Mix the ingredients until the dough comes together, then turn it out onto a floured surface.
5. Knead the dough a few times to make it smooth and elastic.
6. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1 inch (2.5 cm).
7. Cut the dough into rounds or squares, depending on your preference.
8. Place the rounds or squares on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the bread for 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
10. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These are the basic steps to cook a delicious Irish Soda Bread dish using the provided ingredients. Remember to follow the recipe carefully and adjust the baking time and temperature according to your oven and the size of the bread you are making. Enjoy your homemade Irish Soda Bread!

gt:
In a medium bowl, add rinsed and drained black beans.
Pour lime juice over the beans and coat evenly.
Add in chopped red onion.
Add cilantro to the bowl as well.
Take the pineapple and chop into smaller pieces (chunk size is too large for salsa); add to the bowl.
Slice open the jalapeno, removing the seeds and white pith on the inside.
Mince into small pieces and add to the bowl of salsa.
Dash with salt and pepper.
Mix the entire contents of the bowl throughly, cover and refrigerate until cold.
Serve with tortilla chips, on top of grilled chicken.
pred:
1. First, rinse the black beans and drain them.
2. In a large bowl, combine the black beans, lime juice, red onion, and minced cilantro.
3. Add the chopped pineapple, jalapeno, sea salt, and pepper to the bowl.
4. Mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the Pineapple Black Bean Salsa as a topping for tacos, nachos, or as a side dish.

This Pineapple Black Bean Salsa is a delicious and refreshing twist on traditional salsa recipes. The combination of sweet pineapple, tangy lime juice, and spicy jalapeno creates a unique and flavorful taste that is perfect for a variety of dishes.

gt:
Heat oven to 375.
Grease and flour bottom of pan.
Add water to reserved pineapple juice to make 3/4 cup.
In large bowl, combine all bread ingredients and stir till moist.
Pour batter into pan and bake at 375 for 55-60 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.
Cool loaf in pan for 15 minutes.
Remove from pan, cool for 45 minutes.
Glaze: In small bowl, combine all glaze ingredients and stir until well blended.
Drizzle over cooled loaf.
HIGH ALTITUDE: Add 1 tbsp flour to mix.
Bake at 375 for 50-60 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crushed pineapple, banana bread mix, eggs, oil, and chopped strawberries. Mix until well combined.
3. Pour the batter into a greased and floured loaf pan.
4. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
5. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
6. While the bread is cooling, melt the melted chocolate chips in a small saucepan over low heat.
7. Once the bread is completely cooled, spread the melted chocolate chips evenly over the top of the bread.
8. Sprinkle the powdered sugar evenly over the chocolate chips.
9. Cut the bread into slices and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Banana Split Bread!

gt:
Combine all the -marked ingredients and sift.
Bring the margarine to room temperature or microwave to soften.
Add margarine and sugar into a bowl and whisk until creamy.
Add the beaten eggs in small batches.
Add milk and continue to whisk.
Add the ingredients into the bowl from Step 3 and mix lightly with a spatula.
Dice the white chocolate into 1 to 1.5 cm squares.
Divide into two portions.
Mix one portion of the chocolate into the dough.
Pour the dough into muffin cups and fill to about 70%.
Top the dough with the remaining chunks of chocolate.
Preheat the oven to 180C/356F.
Bake for 20 minutes.
If you pierce one in the middle with a skewer and it comes out clean, they're done.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, cream the margarine (or butter) and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the egg and milk to the creamed mixture, and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. Fold in the white chocolate chips.
7. Grease a muffin tin with cooking spray or butter, and fill each cup with the batter.
8. Bake the muffins for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Chocolate Muffins With White Chocolate Chips!

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Oil or butter a 9- or 10-inch cast iron skillet or a 2-quart souffle dish or baking dish.
Combine the water, milk and salt in a heavy medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Slowly add the cornmeal in a very thin stream while stirring all the time with a whisk or a wooden spoon.
Turn the heat to low and stir for 10 to 15 minutes, until the mixture is smooth and thick.
Remove from the heat and stir in the butter.
One at a time, stir in the egg yolks, then add the optional cheese and corn kernels, and the jalapenos.
In a medium bowl or in the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the egg whites on medium until they form stiff but not dry peaks.
Stir 1/4 of the egg whites into the cornmeal mixture and gently fold in the rest.
Scrape into the prepared baking dish.
Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes until spoonbread is puffed and beginning to brown.
Serve at once.
Chill leftovers.
pred:
To create Jalapeno Spoonbread, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cornmeal, milk, and butter. Whisk until smooth and well-combined.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, whisking well after each addition.
4. Stir in the corn, jalapenos, salt, and pepper.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.

This Jalapeno Spoonbread recipe is a delicious and spicy twist on traditional spoonbread. The addition of jalapenos adds a kick to the dish, while the Gruyere cheese, if used, provides a creamy, savory contrast. Enjoy this unique and flavorful dish!

gt:
Boil macaroni to al dente, strain, and set aside.
Be sure to salt the pasta water and dont rinse the noodles!
In a sauce pan, melt butter and whisk in the flour until a smooth paste-like consistency is reached.
Add in the milk, half-and-half, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Stir constantly until the mixture comes to a boil, then remove from the heat and pour into the macaroni noodles that are sitting aside.
Stir well and mix in almost all of the cheddar cheese.
Transfer immediately to a baking dish and sprinkle remaining cheddar cheese on top.
With the oven set to 350 degrees F, bake covered for 10 minutes then remove the cover and bake for another 15 minutes, setting the oven to broil for the last 5 minutes.
Broil until the top is golden brown (watch carefully).
Remove from the oven and devour.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large saucepan, melt the 4 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
3. Add the 4 teaspoons of all-purpose flour and cook, stirring constantly, for about 1 minute.
4. Gradually add the milk, half-and-half, and a pinch of salt and pepper, to taste.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Meanwhile, cook the elbow macaroni according to the package instructions, until it is al dente.
7. Drain the cooked macaroni and add it to the saucepan with the cheese sauce.
8. Stir the macaroni and cheese mixture until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
9. Transfer the macaroni and cheese mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
10. Bake the macaroni and cheese in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
11. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Mamas Mac n Cheese!

gt:
Preheat oven to 180C fan forced (200C normal/conventional).
Put the onions in a gratin (or baking) dish that is just large enough to hold them in one layer.
Pour over the stock and sprinkle with seasonings, sugar, balsamic and oil.
Cook in the oven for about 1 hour or until tender, tossing every now and then.
Serve the onions with a sprinkling of parsley.
pred:
To make a delicious Italian Baby Onions dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the chicken stock, salt, pepper, brown sugar, and balsamic vinegar. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the baby onions and cook until they are tender but still slightly crunchy, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Carefully transfer the baby onions from the skillet to the pot with the simmering liquid. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the onions are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Stir in the parsley, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the flavors are well-blended.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy the delicious Italian Baby Onions dish.

gt:
Mix ingredients in skillet.
Do NOT saute' or cook veggies first or you will get mush.
Season with seasoning salt or salt and pepper to taste.
Cover, and leave on highheat until food begins to steam and you see steam coming out from under the lid.
Turn off heat and leave on burner for 1 hours.
Do not lift cover during cooking period.
pred:
1. Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or pan, cook the hamburger until it is browned and drained.
3. Add the green pepper, onion, and celery to the pan and cook until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the mixed mushrooms, tomatoes, and rice.
5. Add the seasoning salt or creole seasoning to the vegetable mixture, stirring to combine.
6. Pour the tomato mixture over the hamburger and vegetables in the pan.
7. Stir the ingredients together and cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the mixture is heated through.
8. Serve the American Chop Suey over a bed of rice, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

gt:
Wash cucumbers and slice thinly.
Peel onions, slice and seperate into rings.
Pack clean gallon jar with layers of cucumbers and onion rings.
In a saucepan, heat remaining ingredients until just boiling.
Pour over cucumbers and onions in jar and cover with lid.
Let cool and refrigerate.
The amount of cucumbers is approximate because the yield is dependent on the size of cucumbers you use.
pred:
To prepare Easy Bread and Butter Pickles, follow these steps:

1. Wash the cucumbers thoroughly and cut them into spears.
2. In a large pot, combine the cider vinegar, sugar, turmeric, celery seeds, mustard seeds, and pickling salt. Stir to dissolve the sugar and salt.
3. Add the cucumber spears to the pot, making sure they are fully submerged in the vinegar mixture.
4. Cover the pot and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 24 hours.
5. After 24 hours, drain the pickles and rinse them thoroughly with cold water.
6. Transfer the pickles to a clean jar, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace.
7. Store the pickles in the refrigerator and let them sit for at least 24 hours before serving.

These easy-to-follow instructions will yield delicious and tangy Easy Bread and Butter Pickles.

gt:
Just mix the beer with the green food coloring and you are done!
In this photo I used Pale Ale.
If you mix it with Guinness the froth turnes green!
pred:
1. First, ensure that the beer is cold and chilled.
2. Open the beer can or bottle and pour it into a glass.
3. Add one drop of green food coloring to the beer, ensuring that the color is evenly distributed.
4. Stir the beer gently to mix the coloring evenly.
5. Enjoy your delicious Green Beer!

Please note that this is a simple recipe, and the actual cooking process may vary depending on the specific ingredients and preferences of the user.

gt:
Heat oil in a large pot.
Saute the onion until it starts to brown a little.
Add the chicken and cook each piece so it's browned on both sides.
Add potatoes and carrots.
Cook for a few minutes while stirring.
Add the tomatoes and cook for another few minutes while stirring.
Cover the pot and continue to cook on medium for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in the garlic and all the spices.
Mix well with other ingredients.
Add the zucchini, tomato paste, and a little salt and mix in.
Pour in enough water to just cover everything.
Bring to a boil, turn to low and let simmer for 45-50 minutes until every thing is well cooked and the stew has thickened.
Just before serving, stir in the chopped coriander.
Enjoy with basmati rice or bread :)
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and any additional spices of your choice.
3. Heat the oil in a large oven-safe pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
4. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
6. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
7. Add the carrots, potatoes, and zucchini to the pot and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
8. Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, coriander leaves, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
9. Return the chicken to the pot and add the remaining ingredients.
10. Stir to combine and bring the mixture to a simmer.
11. Cover the pot with a lid and place it in the preheated oven.
12. Bake for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
13. Remove the pot from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350f
Remove crust from bread, then roll flat with a rolling pin
Mix together cream cheese, 1/2 cup of sugar and yolks.
Spread mixture on bread, then roll it up like a roll
In a shallow dish mix remaining sugar and cinnamon
Coat roll lightly with melted butter, then roll the roll in the cinnamon and sugar mix.
Place on an non greased baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes
pred:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, sugar, egg yolks, and melted butter. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the ground cinnamon and mix until well combined.
4. Spread the mixture evenly over the top of the loaf of bread.
5. Place the bread, with the cinnamon mixture on top, in a greased loaf pan.
6. Bake the bread for 30-35 minutes, or until it is golden brown and the bread is cooked through.

8. Serve the rolls warm, with butter and your favorite spread, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Cinnamon bread rolls!

gt:
Place the popped popcorn into a large bowl.
Pour in the apple chips.
Melt the butter in the microwave in a small bowl.
Heat it for 30 seconds at a time until melted.
Once melted, stir in the sugar, cinnamon and salt.
Pour the butter over the popcorn and apple chips and toss until well-coated.
Note: The best thing about making your own popcorn is that you can control what goes on it!
Feel free to add more or less of the butter, cinnamon, or sugar to meet your personal taste!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the popped popcorn, apple chips, and melted butter.
3. Stir until the popcorn is evenly coated with the butter.
4. Add the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, and salt, stirring to combine.
5. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the popcorn mixture in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the popcorn is golden brown and the sugar is melted and caramelized.
7. Remove the popcorn mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
