gt:
In a large bowl, layer the tomatoes, bell peppers and onion, seasoning each layer with salt as you go.
Keep making layers until you run out of vegetables.
Cover the bowl, and refrigerate for 4 to 5 hours.
Pour the vegetables into a colander and rinse off the salt under running water.
Put them into a pot with a lid, and stir in the vinegar, brown sugar, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, white sugar, whole cloves, and corn syrup.
Bring to a boil, and then simmer over medium heat, uncovered, for about 30 minutes.
The tomatoes will start to turn pale.
When the vegetables are very soft, press them through a sieve, being sure to find all of the cloves and remove them.
Cool the sauce and store in the refrigerator.
pred:
[INST]
1. Wash and peel the green tomatoes, red bell pepper, and white onion.
2. In a large pot, combine the green tomatoes, red bell pepper, white onion, and pickling salt. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
3. Remove the vegetables from the pot and let them cool.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the white vinegar, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, and dark corn syrup.
5. Add the cooled vegetables to the bowl with the vinegar mixture and stir to combine.
6. Allow the mixture to sit at room temperature for about 24 hours, stirring occasionally.
7. After 24 hours, strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean pot.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the ketchup reaches your desired consistency.
9. Remove the ketchup from the heat and let it cool completely.
10. Store the ketchup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
If you need to roast the garlic: Cut off the point/top of the bulb of garlic to expose the tops of the cloves inside (cut as close to the top as you can).
Sprinkle some olive oil and salt over top, rub it in a little so that each clove gets a little oil on it.
Place the bulbs into an oven proof dish and wrap snugly with foil (or maybe you have a garlic baker, even better!).
Roast in a 375 degree oven for about 40 minutes.
Tops should be nicely brown but not burnt.
Let cool.
Squeeze out the roasted garlic into a food processor or blender.
Add the rest of the ingredients except the water and mix very well.
Start adding the water, a bit at a time until you get the consistency you like.
Adjust salt & pepper to your tastes, and you're done!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Clean the garlic heads thoroughly, removing any loose skin or cloves.
3. Place the garlic heads on a baking sheet, cut side up, and drizzle with the extra virgin olive oil.
4. Roast the garlic in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the cloves are soft and the garlic is slightly browned.
5. Remove the garlic from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Once the garlic is cool enough to handle, squeeze the cloves out of their skins and discard the skins.
7. In a food processor or blender, combine the roasted garlic, chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, parsley, salt, cumin, paprika, and water.
8. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
9. Taste the hummus and adjust the seasoning as needed.
10. Transfer the hummus to a serving bowl and drizzle with additional olive oil, if desired.
11. Serve the Roasted Garlic Hummus With Tahini immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

This Roasted Garlic Hummus With Tahini is a delicious and flavorful dip that can be enjoyed as a snack or served as a side dish. The roasted garlic adds a rich, earthy flavor, while the tahini provides a creamy, slightly nutty taste. The combination of these ingredients results in a satisfying and satisfying dish that can be enjoyed with pita chips, vegetables, or crackers.

gt:
Brown ground beef or venison and drain.
In medium bowl combine soup, onion, milk, and salt and pepper.
In a 2 quart baking dish (11x7) alternately layer the potatoes, soup mixture, meat and cheese.
Repeat layers, ending with cheese on top.
Bake, covered, at 350 degrees for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, until potatoes are tender.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground venison or beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the sliced potatoes to the skillet and cook until they are tender, stirring occasionally.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and cheddar cheese.
5. Pour the mixture over the meat and potatoes in the skillet, stirring to combine.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve hot and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat butter and sugar in large bowl with mixer until well blended.
Add bananas, sour cream and eggs; mix well.
Add combined dry ingredients; mix just until moistened.
Stir in nuts.
Pour into greased and floured 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Bake 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 5 min.
; remove from pan to wire rack.
Cool completely.
Cook chocolate and cream in small heavy saucepan on very low heat 3 to 5 min.
or until chocolate is completely melted, stirring frequently.
Cool 5 min.
or until slightly thickened.
Drizzle over bread.
Let stand until glaze is set.
Refrigerate leftovers.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray or butter.
3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the mashed bananas, sour cream, eggs, and mix until well combined.
5. Gradually add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the chopped walnuts and chocolate chips.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
8. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
9. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

[/INST]

This delicious Chocolate-Glazed Banana Bread dish is a perfect treat for breakfast, dessert, or a snack. The combination of the softened butter, sugar, mashed bananas, sour cream, eggs, and flour creates a moist and flavorful bread. The addition of chopped walnuts and chocolate chips enhances the taste, while the glaze made from whipping cream and BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Chocolate provides a rich, smooth texture. The dish can be enjoyed warm or at room temperature, making it a versatile and satisfying option for various occasions.

gt:
Boil rice per package instructions.
The Uncle Bens version I purchased took about 810 minutes for al-dente.
(Please note these cooking times are for the boil-in-a-bag brown rice.
Uncooked brown rice takes about 30 minutes on the stove top and 15 minutes in the microwave.)
While the rice is cooking, add the lemon juice, olive oil, parsley, pepper, salt and Parmesan cheese to a medium bowl.
Add the cooked rice into the dressing mixture and toss to combine.
Garnish with extra Parmesan cheese and parsley if desired.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the 4 cups of Boil-in-a-Bag Brown Rice with the 18 teaspoons of salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the saucepan. Cook the rice for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water has been absorbed.

2. While the rice is cooking, in a small bowl, whisk together the 3 tablespoons of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and 1 tablespoon of fresh parsley, chopped.

3. Once the rice is cooked, remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the lemon-parsley dressing. Allow the rice to cool for a few minutes.

4. To serve, divide the cooked rice into individual portions and garnish each portion with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.

Enjoy your delicious 15-minute Lemon Parmesan Brown Rice!

gt:
Clean & dry your ice cream bucket then coat with a thin coat of cooking spray.
(You can use other containers with a lid.
A Tupperware type might work well too.
Choose smaller vessels for smaller dogs.)
Place the bones, toys, & fruit slices in the bucket.
Don't fret on arrangements too much, many of the items will float when you add the liquid.
Add the chicken broth & then top off the bucket with water.
Make sure to leave some space for the liquid to expand while freezing.
Put the lid on your bucket & transfer to a freezer or deep freeze.
Alow to freeze for eight hours.
Before serving to your furbabies, pull the bucket out of the freezer & set in a warm place for a few minutes.
Then turn out onto a non-breakable plate.
Serve to your pups on a hot summer day.
Feel free to adapt to your dog's tastes.
You can use other fruits or fresh veg like carrots or broccoli instead of fruit.
(Remember grapes & cherries are toxic to dogs.
Someone has kindly posted a list of toxic items for dogs in the question section, which may be helpful to you in creating your ice cake.)
Bones for dogs can be controversial, so these can easily be omitted if you'd prefer.
If you do use bones, be sure they are never cooked & from beef or pork & big enough that your dog can't swallow them.
pred:
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including the ice cream bucket, chicken broth, apple slices, peach slices, waterproof dog toys, marrow bones, and any other desired items.

2. Wash and sanitize all the ingredients to ensure they are clean and safe for consumption.

3. Fill the ice cream bucket with chicken broth, ensuring that it is at least half full. This will help keep the ice cream cold and provide a base for the toppings.

4. Add the apple slices and peach slices to the bucket, making sure they are evenly distributed.

5. If using marrow bones, place them in the bucket as well.

6. If desired, add the waterproof dog toys to the bucket.

7. Close the lid of the ice cream bucket and place it in the freezer for at least 4-6 hours or overnight.

8. Once the ice cream has fully frozen, carefully remove the bucket from the freezer and let it sit at room temperature for a few minutes to allow the ice cream to soften slightly.

9. Carefully remove the lid and serve the ice cream to your dog.

10. Enjoy the Doggy Ice Party Cake with your furry friend!

gt:
Mix dressing and Sriracha sauce until blended.
Heat oil in wok or large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add chicken; stir-fry 4 min.
or until no longer pink.
Add coleslaw blend; stir-fry 2 to 3 min.
or until chicken is done.
Add dressing mixture; stir-fry 1 to 2 min.
or until heated through.
Top with onions.
Serve over rice.
pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the Buffalo-Ranch Dressing and Sriracha sauce until well combined.

2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken strips and cook until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.

3. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.

4. In the same skillet, add the coleslaw blend and cook until the cabbage is tender, about 3-5 minutes.

5. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.

6. Pour the Buffalo-Ranch-Sriracha sauce mixture over the chicken and stir to coat evenly. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

7. Serve the Buffalo-Ranch Chicken Stir-Fry over a bed of hot cooked long-grain white rice.

[/INST]

gt:
Chop the apple into thin pieces.
Place the apple, mulberries, and sugar in a heat-resistant container.
Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 8 minutes.
While the filling is cooking, make the topping.
Add the flour, oatmeal, wheat bran, sugar, and cinnamon to a bowl and mix.
Pour in the vegetable oil and stir.
Add the egg and milk and stir some more.
Remove the filling from the microwave and stir in 1 tablespoon of flour and mix.
Add another 1/2 tablespoon of flour and mix.
Top the filling with spoonfuls of the topping batter.
Bake in an oven preheated to 200C for 15 minutes and it's done.
Serve with ice cream while still piping hot.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, oatmeal, wheat bran, sugar, and cinnamon powder.
3. Add the vegetable oil and egg to the bowl, and mix until a smooth batter forms.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch round cake pan.
5. Arrange the apple slices and mulberries on top of the batter, alternating between the two fruits.
6. Bake the cobbler in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cobbler comes out clean.
7. Remove the cobbler from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the Apple & Mulberry Cobbler warm, garnished with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F, and butter and flour a 12-cup bundt pan.
Pour the melted butter into the bottom of the bundt pan, sprinkle on 1/2 cup of the sugar, layer on the sliced banana and top with the chopped nuts.
In a bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In a separate bowl, beat together the remaining sugar, room temperature butter, eggs, buttermilk and vanilla.
Mix in the mashed bananas.
Slowly beat the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until everything is fully incorporated.
Pour the batter over the walnuts in the bundt pan and bake in the pre-heated 350 degrees oven for 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool thoroughly in the pan (allow a couple of hours) before turning the cake out onto a plate or stand.
Dust with powdered sugar, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a bundt cake pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the melted butter and light brown sugar until smooth.
3. Add the peeled and sliced banana, chopped walnuts, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the buttermilk, and mix until just combined.
6. Gently fold in the mashed bananas.
7. Pour the batter into the prepared bundt cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, dust the cake with powdered sugar and serve.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt together in a small bowl.
Beat butter, white sugar, and vanilla extract together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth.
Add cashew butter, brown sugar, egg, and milk to the butter mixture; beat until smooth.
Gradually add flour mixture and mix until just incorporated into a dough.
Roll dough into 1 1/2-inch balls and arrange onto a baking sheet.
Lightly press a fork into the top of the balls to make a crosshatch pattern.
Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes.
pred:
[<SYS>>
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a large bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and continue to mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the cashew butter and firmly packed brown sugar.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Cashew Butter Cookies!
</SYS>>

gt:
Combine first 5 ingredients in mixing bowl and beat for 1 minute.
Combine remaining ingredients except nuts and add to applesauce mixture beating until smooth.
Stir in nuts.
Spoon into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees 40-45 minute.
Allow to cool in pan on rack for 10-15 minutes, then remove from pan and continue to cool on rack.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, applesauce, and vegetable oil.
3. Add the eggs, milk, flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and nuts. Mix until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
5. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
6. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Enjoy your delicious homemade Applesauce Nut Bread!

gt:
Steam the carrots until tender.
Drain the carrots, and, if desired, reserve the water to make a sauce to serve with the loaf.
Mix together the cooked carrots and lentils.
Mash them coarsely with a potato masher.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pack the mixture into a well-oiled loaf pan.
Decorate the top of the loaf with nut halves, if desired.
Bake at 350 F for 35-40 minutes, or until firm and golden brown.
After baking, let the loaf stand for about 5 minutes, and then unmold it onto a serving platter.
For an attractive presentation, surround the unmolded loaf with sliced ripe tomatoes, or any other colorful vegetable.
Serve with the sauce of your choice.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked lentils, carrots, onion, sage, curry powder, shoyu or tamari, and oats.
3. Add the walnuts or pecans and parsley, and mix well.
4. Pour the mixture into a loaf pan or a lined baking sheet.
5. Bake the loaf for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the loaf to cool for a few minutes before slicing it into equal portions.
7. Serve the Lentil-carrot Loaf warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
In a medium bowl, sprinkle the gelatin over the water and let stand for 5 minutes.
Add the espresso and 1/4 cup of the sugar and stir until thoroughly dissolved.
Pour into four 1/2-cup molds or a loaf pan, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, 2 to 3 hours.
Meanwhile, in another bowl, whip the cream with the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar until it holds soft peaks.
Dip the molds in warm water and turn the desserts out onto plates or cut the gelatin into 1-inch squares and mound in wineglasses or bowls.
Garnish each serving with whipped cream and sprinkle with ground coffee.
pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the cold water and unflavored gelatin. Let it sit for a few minutes until the gelatin has softened.
2. In a separate saucepan, heat the hot brewed espresso over medium heat until it reaches a simmer.
3. Slowly pour the hot espresso into the gelatin mixture, stirring constantly.
4. Add the sugar, heavy cream, and stir until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish that has been greased or lined with parchment paper.
6. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
7. After refrigeration, remove the mixture from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
8. Carefully pour the mixture onto a serving platter or individual plates.
9. Garnish with a sprinkle of coarsely ground coffee on top.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Place tahini, water, lime juice, and salt in a blender or food processor (dont fill food processors above the liquids line).
Blend or process until smooth, then drizzle in oil while continuing to blend.
Sauce will thicken when oil is added.
Taste and season with more salt if needed, quickly pulsing to combine.
Chill in refrigerator for an hour or two, or use immediately if you dont mind room temperature cream.
Will keep at least a few days in the refrigerator.
Notes: 1.
Tahini is simply sesame seed butter.
See the linked blog post for more details on where to find it.
Its 100% nut-free, but note that often nut and sesame allergies go hand-in-hand, so be sure to check if youre serving it to a crowd.
2.
See linked blog post for optional ways to flavor your homemade sour cream.
3.
The recipe is vegan (and dairy-free), gluten-free, and nut-free.
pred:
[/INST]

1. In a small bowl, mix the tahini, water, and fresh lime juice until smooth.
2. Add the kosher salt and stir to combine.
3. Gradually add the avocado oil or olive oil, stirring continuously until the desired consistency is reached.
4. Taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. Store the sour cream in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

This Nut Free Vegan Sour Cream is a delicious and healthy alternative to traditional sour cream. It is made with simple, natural ingredients and can be used as a topping, spread, or ingredient in various recipes.

gt:
Heat on high one stick real butter adding the one cup sugar and the light corn syrup.
Stir and heat to boil until thoroughly mixed.
Add peanut butter and stir until melted.
Add 7 to 9 cups crispy rice cereal.
Press in 9 x 13-inch pan.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, sugar, and light corn syrup.
3. Add the peanut butter and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the crispy rice cereal, stirring to ensure even distribution of the cereal.
5. Press the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
7. Allow the treats to cool for a few minutes before cutting into squares.
8. Enjoy your Peanut Butter Crispy Rice Treats!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oil in a pan.
Saute Onion, Garlic and Ginger.
Add Pumpkin, sweet potato and stock and bring to boil.
When the veggies are tender, add all items to a blender and blend until smooth.
Stir through the basil, nutmeg, cream, salt and pepper and then serve on your pasta.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, cooking until the onion is softened.
3. Add the ginger powder and cook for a few more seconds.
4. Add the cubed butternut pumpkin and sweet potato to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the chicken or vegetable stock, bring to a boil, and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add the basil and nutmeg to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for a few more minutes until the flavors are well-incorporated.
7. In a separate bowl, whisk the cream until it is smooth.
8. Add the cooked ravioli to the skillet, stirring to combine with the sauce. Cook for a few minutes until the ravioli is heated through.
9. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Transfer the dish to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the ravioli is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
11. Serve the Pumpkin and Sweet Potato Ravioli hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves if desired.

This Pumpkin and Sweet Potato Ravioli recipe combines the flavors of pumpkin and sweet potato with the richness of cream, creating a delicious and comforting dish that can be enjoyed during the colder months. The addition of nutmeg and ginger adds warmth and depth to the dish, while the basil provides a fresh, herbal touch. The ravioli serves as a delicious and satisfying main course, perfect for sharing with family and friends.

gt:
Mix all the ingredients in a bowl.
Store in an airtight container no longer than 6 months.
pred:
To make a delicious Creole Seasoning dish, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of onion powder, 1 tablespoon of onion flakes, 3 tablespoons of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of celery seed, 1 tablespoon of dried oregano, 1 tablespoon of dried basil, 2 tablespoons of dried thyme, 1 tablespoon of black pepper, 1 tablespoon of white pepper, 12 tablespoons of cayenne pepper, 3 tablespoons of paprika, 2 tablespoons of smoked paprika, and 1 tablespoon of sea salt.
2. Add a squeeze of lime and the zest of a lime to the mixture.
3. Combine all ingredients well, ensuring that the seasonings are evenly distributed.
4. Use the Creole Seasoning mixture to season your desired dish, such as chicken, fish, or vegetables. You can also use it as a base for a sauce or marinade.

This Creole Seasoning dish is a versatile and flavorful addition to various meals, enhancing the taste and aroma of your dishes.

gt:
Put the banana in the freezer the night before making this.
Blend all of the ingredients (except the Oreos) together in a food processor until smooth, about 30 - 60 seconds.
Once everything has become creamy and fluffy, break apart and add in the Oreos.
Agitate shortly 3 times.
Don't blend too much!
When the Oreos have been crushed and blended into the mixture, pour into your choice of cups and it's done!
If it's too loose at this point, place it in the freezer for a little while to let freeze.
I also made it with diced frozen avocado in place of the banana.
This version is with Vitamin E, fiber, and minerals.
pred:
1. First, peel the frozen banana and place it in a blender or food processor.
2. Add 50 ml of heavy cream (or use 50 ml soy milk + 2 small cubes of cream cheese) and blend until smooth.
3. Add 2 tsp of condensed milk or sugar and blend again until smooth.
4. Add 3 Oreo or Kit Kats to the blender and blend until the cookies are finely chopped.
5. Pour the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate for 15-20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. After refrigeration, use a spoon to scoop the mixture into a cone-shaped mold or a cup.
7. Place the mold or cup in the freezer for 1 minute.
8. After 1 minute, remove the mold or cup from the freezer and use a spoon to scoop the mixture into a bowl.
9. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for later consumption.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 325.
Layer half of the sheets of phyllo one sheet at a time, in a greased 11x7x2 baking pan, brushing each sheet evenly with butter and folding ends over if necessary to fit into pan.
Keep unused sheets covered with plastic wrap while assembling baklava to prevent drying.
Mix 1/4 cup of the sugar and cinnamon; stir in walnuts.
Sprinkle nut mixture evenly over buttered phyllo in pan.
Layer remaining phyllo, one sheet at a time, over nut mixture, brushing each sheet evenly with butter.
Cut diagonally into squares, cutting completely through all layers.
Bake in preheated oven until crisp and golden, about one hour.
Combine remaining sugar, the water, lemon juice and honey in small saucepan; cook and stir over low heat until sugar dissolves.
Heat to boiling; pour evenly over hot baklava.
Let stand loosely covered 8 hours or overnight.
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]To make Greek Baklava, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with melted butter.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the phyllo pastry, sugar, and ground cinnamon. Mix well.
4. Add the chopped walnuts and mix until well combined.
5. Pour the water and lemon juice over the mixture and stir to combine.
6. Pour the mixture onto the prepared baking dish, spreading it evenly.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
8. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Once cooled, use a sharp knife to cut the baklava into squares.
10. Serve the Greek Baklava warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 220C.
Spray baking sheets with oil and mound good tablespoons of parmesan on top, leaving space between.
Cook in the oven for 3-5 minutes.
When ready, remove with a palette knife (or fish slice) and lay over wine bottles.
Mix together mayonnaise, mustard, spring onion, celery, lemon juice and dill.
Taste for seasoning.
Add flaked trout or salmon and gently mix.
Then spoon tablespoons of the mixture on to parmesan cups.
Garnish with dill sprigs and serve.
pred:
To create Salmon Parmesan Cups, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil flavored cooking spray, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, green onion, celery, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Place the smoked trout fillets or smoked salmon fillet in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. Pour the prepared mixture over the trout or salmon, ensuring that it covers the fish evenly.
5. Bake the trout or salmon in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the topping is golden brown.
6. Carefully transfer the cooked trout or salmon to a serving plate.
7. Use a spoon to scoop out the cooked fish and topping mixture, creating small cups.
8. Serve the Salmon Parmesan Cups immediately, garnished with chopped fresh dill if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Salmon Parmesan Cups!

gt:
In a bowl, season the rice with sesame oil, toasted sesame seeds and a little salt.
Taste and add more salt if desired.
Slice the carrot into thin strips, season with sesame oil and salt.
Microwave for 30 seconds.
Slice the takuan into thin strips as well.
Parboil the komatsuna and drain.
While it's still hot, season with sesame oil and a little salt.
Mix together with your hands and squeeze out the excess water.
Add 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 teaspoon soy sauce and 1 teaspoon sesame oil to the meat and stir fry in a pan.
If you divide the filling ingredients into small portions like the photo, it makes assembling easier.
Spread rice evenly on the nori, leaving 1cm bare at the top.
Line the filling ingredients a little below the center of the seaweed.
Roll up all at once, wrapping in the filling.
Press firmly, in the position shown in the photo, to make a nice shape.
Cut as desired, arrange on a serving dish and it's done!
Great for bentos!
Leftover filling can be a side dish!
What to do with leftover filling?
Add gochujang and sesame oil and make Bibimbap.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the rice and let it drain.
- Cut the carrot into bite-sized pieces.
- Cut the crabsticks into bite-sized pieces.
- Cut the cheese into small cubes.
- Slice the beef into thin strips.
- Cut the nori seaweed into thin strips.
- Toast the sesame seeds.
- Grind the sesame oil.
- Prepare the takuan pickles or thin omelet.
- Cut the green vegetable (Komatsuna or other) into bite-sized pieces.

2. Prepare the rice:
- Cook the rice according to the package instructions.
- Once the rice is cooked, let it cool for a few minutes.

3. Assemble the rolls:
- Place a small amount of cooked rice in the center of a nori sheet.
- Add a small amount of sesame oil and a pinch of salt.
- Fold the nori sheet over the rice, creating a half-moon shape.
- Repeat this process with the remaining ingredients, adding a bit of sesame oil and salt to each roll.

4. Serve and enjoy:
- Serve the Colorful Kimbap rolls with a dipping sauce, if desired.
- Enjoy the delicious and colorful Korean Nori Seaweed Rolls.

gt:
Mix cream cheese, sugar, sour cream and eggs.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake at 350F for 25 minutes or till a 3 inch circle in center jiggles.
Cool 3 hours or overnight.
Serve with desired topping.
Lemon Jello is especially pretty.
pred:
To make a delicious Simple Cheesecake, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs and mix them with the melted butter. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
3. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and continue to beat until fluffy.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Pour the batter over the crust in the pan.
6. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the center is set.
7. If desired, you can add a layer of sour cream mixed with sugar (optional) or cherry pie filling (optional) or fresh strawberries (optional) or Jello gelatin (optional) before baking.
8. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 15-20 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Simple Cheesecake!

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Sift flour with 1/3 cup sugar 3 times.
In a large bowl, beat egg whites and salt with electric mixer until foamy; add cream of tartar and beat until soft peaks form.
Gradually beat in the remaining 1/3 cup of sugar and beat until stiff peaks form; fold in vanilla.
In two additions, gently fold in flour mixture until just combined.
Divide batter between the two pans; place on sheet pan.
Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until browned and toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Invert pans on cooling grid to cool.
Loosen cakes from pans with spatuals; remove from pans.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
3. Add the egg whites and cream of tartar, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the vanilla extract and mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
5. Pour the batter into a well-greased and floured 12-cup muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
6. Bake the cakes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cakes to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

Once the cakes are fully cooled, you can use them to make the Mini Angel Food Cakes for Two. To do this, you can cut each cake in half horizontally, creating two equal portions. Place one portion on a serving plate, and then top it with a dollop of whipped cream. Repeat the process with the remaining cake and whipped cream, creating a visually appealing presentation.

[/INST]

By following these steps, you can successfully prepare and cook Mini Angel Food Cakes for Two using the provided ingredients.

gt:
Heat oil in wok.
Add curry paste and sambal oelek and fry for one minute.
Add chicken and stir fry for around 4 minutes, or til golden.
Add all other ingredients, bring to a boil and let simmer for around 8-10 minutes til sauce thickens slightly.
Serve on a bed of rice with lemon wedges and roti bread.
(You can add veggies such as green beans to the recipe, just throw in at step 4 and let simmer).
pred:
1. In a large skillet or wok, heat the peanut oil over medium heat. Add the red curry paste and sambal oelek, stirring to combine. Cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
2. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until it is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the light coconut milk, fish sauce, brown sugar, and crunchy peanut butter to the skillet. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the chicken is fully cooked.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Serve the Creamy Peanut Chicken over rice or noodles, garnished with a lemon wedge, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Creamy Peanut Chicken!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease lightly a 9x5 loaf pan.
In a large bowl, stir flour,sugar,beer,cheese and chilies together.
Spread into greased pan evenly.
Pour melted butter over top Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned.
NOTE: Check to see if a fork,knife or toothpick comes out clean when inserted to see if bread is done.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the self-rising flour, sugar, and melted butter. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Add the beer, shredded cheddar cheese, and diced green chilies to the bowl. Mix until the dough forms a cohesive, soft dough.
4. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a greased and floured loaf pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the bread for 30-35 minutes, or until it is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious Cheddar and Chile Beer Bread!

gt:
Cut steak into 2.
5 cm cubes, dredge in the flour mixed with the curry powder.
Lightly brown the meat in a pan with the oil and onions.
Place in the Slow Cooker and add all other ingredients.
Mix well, cover and cook on 1 (Low) for 8-9 hours, or 2 (High) for 4 hours, or (Auto) for 6-7 hours.
Serve with fluffy steamed rice.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix the flour, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Dust the steaks with the flour mixture, making sure they are evenly coated.
4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steaks and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until they are browned and cooked through.
5. Remove the steaks from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the onions and garlic. Cook until the onions are softened and translucent.
7. Add the ginger and cook for another minute.
8. Pour in the beef stock and vinegar. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 1-2 hours or until the sauce has thickened.
9. Add the steaks back into the skillet and let them cook in the sauce for about 15-20 minutes or until they are heated through.
10. Remove the steaks from the skillet and let them rest for a few minutes.
11. In a small bowl, mix the lemon rind and beef stock to make a sauce.
12. Pour the sauce over the steaks and serve the Beef Curry over rice or with your preferred side dish.

[/INST]

gt:
Thinly slice 2 lbs of yellow squash
Broil squash and onions in water for 10 minutes
drain in strainer and let set
Melt vegan butter in medium saucepan and add almond flour and stir
Add warm Soy milk to saucepan and stir until thickened
remove mixture from heat
Add 1 1/2 cups of cheese, cayenne powder, salt and ground black pepper, Stir until completely melted
Add squash and stir well
Spray Olive Oil Spray onto the Casserole Dish completely.
Spoon squash mixture evenly in the casserole dish
in a medium mixing bowl, add 2 cups of egg whites and organic bread crumbs, mix well.
Spread bread crumb mixture over the top of squash mixture and add 1/2 cup cheese.
Bake at 350F for 25-30 minutes.
let cool for 10-15 minutes and serve
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yellow squash, thinly sliced white onion, and vegan butter. Season with sea salt, black pepper, and cayenne powder, to taste.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the almond meal/flour, soy milk, and egg whites.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the vegetables, and mix until well combined.
5. Add the shredded cheese, almond meal/flour mixture, and bread crumbs to the bowl. Mix until everything is evenly distributed.
6. Spray a baking dish with Pam olive oil spray, and pour the mixture into the dish.
7. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the vegetables are tender.
8. Remove the casserole from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This recipe creates a delicious and satisfying Crusted Cheesy Squash Casserole that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of the tender squash, onion, and cheese, along with the crispy bread crumb topping, makes for a delightful and comforting meal.

gt:
Heat olive oil in heavy medium skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini, garlic, and oregano; saute about 2 minutes, until garlic is just golden.
Add salsa, lower heat, and simmer until zucchini is just tender, around 4-6 minutes.
Sprinkle cheese over zucchini, cover and cook until cheese melts and zucchini is done to your liking.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add the zucchini pieces to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender but still crisp.
4. Stir in the dried oregano and cook for an additional 1 minute.
5. Transfer the zucchini mixture to a large mixing bowl.
6. Add the salsa and shredded monterey jack cheese to the bowl, and mix well.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the Fiesta Zucchini hot, garnished with additional salsa if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Fiesta Zucchini!

gt:
Whisk together the water, bourbon whiskey, soy sauce, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice in a bowl, and pour into a plastic zipper bag.
Add the rib-eye steaks, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
Marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
Remove the rib-eye steaks from the marinade, and shake off excess.
Discard the remaining marinade.
Grill the steaks on high, 1 to 2 minutes per side, to sear the meat.
Move the steaks to a cooler part of the grill and cook for an additional 2 to 3 minutes per side, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, brown sugar, and Worcestershire sauce.
3. Season the steaks with salt and pepper.
4. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and sear the steaks for 2-3 minutes on each side to create a nice crust.
5. Remove the steaks from the pan and place them on a baking tray.
6. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the steaks, making sure to coat them evenly.
7. Place the tray in the preheated oven and cook for 12-15 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the steaks reaches 120°F (59°C) for medium-rare.
8. Remove the steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Bourbon Street Rib-Eye Steak!

gt:
Toast only one side of bread slices under broiler.
Cover to keep fresh and set aside.
Combine cheese, onions, and green pepper with 2/3 cup of the mayonnaise.
Season with garlic salt and cayenne pepper.
Refrigerate if making ahead.
Shortly before serving time, preheat oven to 350*F.
Spread untoasted sides of bread with remaining 1/3 cup mayonnaise.
Top with tomato slices, and then cheese mixture.
Sprinkle with bacon.
Bake 3 to 5 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the grated cheddar cheese, Jarlsberg or monterey jack cheese, green onions, green pepper, and mayonnaise.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on the bread rounds or slices of cocktail bread.
4. Bake the bread rounds or slices in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
5. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the sliced cherry tomatoes and crumbled cooked bacon to the cheese-filled bread.
7. Serve the Tomato Devils immediately, and enjoy!

gt:
Toss potatoes with oil, ancho chile powder, salt, and pepper.
Roast at 400 for approximately 25 minutes or until potatoes are caramelized and fork tender.
Cool potatoes.
Heat one tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large saute pan.
Sweat veggies with a pinch of salt.
Cool veggies.
Combine mayonnaise, vinegar, liquid smoke, veggies, bacon, scallions, and remaining dry ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper.
pred:
[INST]To create a delicious Smokey Ancho Chile Potato Salad, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked and diced maple bacon, red onion, and scallions.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the ancho chile powder, brown sugar, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and liquid smoke.
4. Add the diced potatoes to the bowl with the bacon mixture, and toss to coat the potatoes evenly.
5. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the diced celery and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper to the skillet, and stir to combine.
7. Pour the mixture over the potatoes, and toss to coat the potatoes evenly.
8. Transfer the potato mixture to a large baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and slightly crispy on the edges.
9. Serve the Smokey Ancho Chile Potato Salad immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Place all ingredients in bread pan in order as instructed.
Settings: White Basic and Medium Crust.
When finished, brush top lightly with butter.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the water, butter, honey, and salt.
3. Add the grated parmesan cheese, garlic powder, and yeast to the mixture.
4. Gradually mix in the bread flour until a dough forms.
5. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
6. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
7. Punch down the dough, and then shape it into a ball.
8. Place the dough on a greased baking sheet, and use a sharp knife to cut a cross on the top.
9. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
10. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large saucepan, bring chicken broth, the contents of the flavor packet from the noodles, and oregano or basil to boiling.
Break up noodles.
Add noodles and broccoli to saucepan; return to boiling, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 3 minutes.
Stir in chicken and heat through.
Ladle into bowls; sprinkle with almonds and serve.
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the chicken broth, ramen noodles, oregano or basil, and crushed red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
2. Add the frozen broccoli, and cook until it is tender but still slightly crisp. This should take about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the shredded or cubed chicken or turkey, and cook until it is fully cooked through.
4. Remove the pot from the heat, and stir in the toasted almonds.
5. Serve the Ramen Chicken Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper, if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
1.
Stand 16 wafers around edge of plastic wrap-lined 8-inch square pan.
Add boiling water to gelatin mix; stir 2 minute until completely dissolved.
Stir in ice until melted.
2.
Beat next 3 ingredients in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Gradually beat in gelatin.
Whisk in 2 cups COOL WHIP.
3.
Pour half the gelatin mixture into prepared pan; cover with 16 wafers.
Microwave preserves on HIGH 15 sec.
or until melted; brush onto wafers.
Top with remaining gelatin mixture and wafers.
4.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
Invert dessert onto plate; top with remaining COOL WHIP and fruit.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, sugar, and lemon zest. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the boiling water, and mix until well combined.
4. Add the thawed Cool Whip Topping, and mix until smooth.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the Jell-O lemon flavor gelatin and ice cube. Stir until the gelatin is fully dissolved.
6. Add the gelatin mixture to the cream cheese mixture, and mix until well combined.
7. Spread the mixture evenly over the vanilla wafer cookies, dividing it into 16 equal portions.
8. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or until firm.
9. In a small saucepan, heat the raspberry preserves over low heat, stirring occasionally, until smooth and heated through.
10. Cut the fresh raspberries into small pieces, and mix them with the preserves.
11. Spread the raspberry mixture over the lemon mousse squares, dividing it into 16 equal portions.
12. Refrigerate the lemon-raspberry mousse squares for at least 2 hours or until firm.

[/INST]
