gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions, drain.
Then in a large bowl that can be covered put pasta, chicken, oranges.
For Dressing: In a medium mixing bowl stir together BBQ sauce, mayo,& enough of the juice to make dressing thin but not runny.
Carefully fold dressing into salad, chill for a couple hours before serving.
pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, usually boiling for 8-10 minutes.
2. While the pasta is cooking, chop the cooked chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
3. Drain the pasta and set aside.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked chicken, chopped mandarin oranges, and barbecue sauce.
5. Add the drained pasta to the bowl and mix everything together.
6. Add the mayonnaise and mix well.
7. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
8. Serve the BBQ Pasta salad immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Enjoy your delicious BBQ Pasta salad!

gt:
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and saute for 1-2 minutes, then lower the heat to medium.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper and add in 3 chunks of butter and the lemon juice.
Continue to saute until cooked through (about 2 more minutes), turning occasionally to ensure an even cook.
Remove from heat, add capers and caper juice, sprinkle with the red pepper and parsley and add in remaining butter.
Toss until the butter is melted and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
Notes: This is a fabulous appetizer as well as a great meal with a hunk of crusty bread and a salad or even some pasta.
If you like cilantro more than parsley, feel free to substitute.
If you are not into capers (gasp!
), feel free to leave them outbut I wouldnt!
If you are cooking for a crowd and serving this as an appetizer, I would make 2 batches since it cooks up so fast.
That way it stays nice and hot while your guests gobble it up!
pred:
To cook Incredible 10-Minute Garlic Shrimp, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, stirring occasionally, until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are pink and cooked through.
4. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a small bowl, mix the butter chunks, lemon juice, capers, red pepper, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Pour the butter mixture over the cooked shrimp in the skillet.
7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly browned.
8. Serve the Incredible 10-Minute Garlic Shrimp immediately, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
To make the tart dough:
Using a pastry blender(or 2 knives), mix the flour, butter, salt, and pepper until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Using a fork, mix in 2 tablespoons of the oil and the water just until the bottom of the mixture begins to cling together.
If necessary, add an additional tablespoon of oil.
Gather the dough into a ball, flatten into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Roll out the chilled dough into a 14-inch circle and place it into a tart pan; set aside.
Spread the mustard over the bottom of the tart shell.
Sprinkle the Gruyere evenly over the mustard and alternately place the tomato and Camembert over the Gruyere.
In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1/2 cup of extra-virgin olive oil, all of the herbs, and the garlic together and brush two-thirds of the mixture over the tart.
Bake on the middle shelf of the oven for 35 minutes.
Remove the tart and brush it with the remaining oil.
Serve warm.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the cold butter and mix until the butter is evenly distributed throughout the flour mixture.
4. Gradually add the water and olive oil, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic, then wrap it in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the mustard, grated cheese, tomatoes, and camembert cheese.
7. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
8. Transfer the dough to a 9-inch (23 cm) tart pan with a removable bottom.
9. Press the dough into the tart pan, then spoon the cheese and tomato mixture evenly over the dough.
10. Bake the tart in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
11. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Carefully remove the tart from the tart pan and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
13. Once cooled, dust the tart with powdered sugar and serve.

[/INST]

This mouthwatering Tomato and Camembert Tart is a delicious and visually appealing dish that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of flavors and textures, along with the vibrant colors of the ingredients, make it an appealing and satisfying meal.

gt:
Put baked beans in a medium pot, over medium heat and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer til serving time.
Meanwhile, fry the bacon until desired crispness and drain on paper towels.
Fry the eggs in the same pan used to fry the bacon.
Toast the bread and spread with butter.
Place one egg on top of each slice of toast and serve with bacon and beans on the side.
pred:
1. Heat a large frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the butter to the pan and let it melt.
3. Crack the 4 large eggs into the pan, stirring gently to scramble them.
4. Add the 6 slices of smoked bacon to the pan, cooking until the bacon is crispy.
5. Carefully pour the 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can of baked beans into the pan, stirring to combine with the eggs and bacon.
6. Toast the 4 slices of whole wheat bread using the remaining butter in the pan.
7. Serve the Aussie Breakfast Fry-Up on a plate, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine all vegetables and cheese in a medium bowl.
Sprinkle with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle with olive oil, then vinegar.
Toss until vegetables are coated, and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the canned chick-peas, celery, green onions, tomatoes, avocado, cauliflower floret, Spanish olives, roasted red pepper, feta cheese (if using), and artichoke heart (if using).
3. In a small bowl, mix the garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
4. Pour the olive oil and balsamic vinegar into a separate small bowl.
5. Add the garlic powder, salt, and black pepper mixture to the large bowl with the vegetables and toss to combine.
6. Pour the olive oil and balsamic vinegar mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
7. Spread the marinated salad mixture onto a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
8. Serve the Mediterranean Marinated Salad immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat.
When the grill is ready, lightly oil the grilling surface.
Form the ground beef into four patties, and grill for 5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions, and fry until soft.
Remove the onions from the skillet, and crack the eggs in the same skillet over medium heat.
Cook until the yolks are solid, turning over once.
Remove eggs, and set aside.
Place the Canadian bacon in the same skillet, and fry until toasted.
Remove the bacon, and turn the heat to high.
Quickly fry the pineapple rings in the bacon drippings just until browned on each side.
To Assemble sandwiches: Set bottom of kaiser roll on a plate, and top with burger, a slice of cheese, a slice of Canadian bacon, one fried egg, fried onions, a few slices of beet, a slice of pineapple, a slice of tomato, and a leaf of lettuce.
Decorate the top bun with ketchup, mustard, relish and mayonnaise as desired.
Place over the burger.
Repeat with remaining burgers.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the sliced onion to the skillet and cook until it is soft and translucent.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and pour them over the beef and onion mixture. Cook the mixture in the skillet until the eggs are set and the beef is fully cooked.
5. Place the cooked beef and egg mixture in a large mixing bowl.
6. Add the sliced Canadian bacon, pineapple rings, sliced Cheddar cheese, drained beets, sliced tomato, lettuce leaves, ketchup (optional), yellow mustard (optional), dill pickle relish (optional), and mayonnaise (optional) to the bowl. Mix everything together until well combined.
7. Split the cooked mixture evenly between the four Kaiser rolls.
8. Place the filled rolls on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the Aussie Works Burger warm and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Trim all of the fat from the chicken breasts.
Gently flatten each breast between two sheets of plastic wrap using a cleaver to achieve uniform thickness.
Arrange the chicken in a baking dish.
Combine lemon juice and mustard in a mixing bowl and whisk to mix whiskey in the oil pepper corns and pepper flakes poor the marinade over the chicken.
Turn the breasts several times to marinade the chicken.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill to high.
Oil the grate.
Grill the chicken breasts until cooked, about 2 to 3 minutes per side, seasoning with salt and basting with any extra marinade.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Season the chicken breast halves with salt, pepper, and a pinch of paprika.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, mustard, olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
4. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the chicken out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the hot pepper flakes and black peppercorns over low heat until fragrant.
9. Carefully remove the chicken from the baking sheet and transfer it to a cutting board.
10. Using a sharp knife, cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
11. Return the chicken to the bowl with the lemon juice mixture and toss to coat evenly.
12. Season the chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
13. Serve the Chicken Alla Diavola (The Healthy Way!) immediately.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that the recipe provided is for a healthier version of Chicken Alla Diavola, which uses less oil and a more balanced seasoning approach.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Pre-Cook the rice, any method you like.
Preheat oven to 350 deg.
In a 3 Qt Dutch oven or other oven safe pan with cover.
Heat the olive oil add the garlic and ginger Saute until garlic just starts to turn brown.
Add Chicken and Saute until partially cooked.
Add Pineapple/w juice, Orange and zest, mix.
Add cooked Rice and mix well again.
Add wine and lime, mix.
Cover and place in oven for 20 minute.
If too much liquid take cover off, finished dish should be very moist with only a little liquid in bottom of pan.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger, and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the chicken cubes to the skillet, and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the orange zest, if using, and cook for another minute.
5. Add the pineapple tidbits, marcella wine, lime juice, and any remaining ingredients (such as orange juice, water, or pineapple juice). Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve the Pineapple Orange Chicken over a bed of white rice.

This delicious Pineapple Orange Chicken /w Rice dish is a perfect blend of sweet and tangy flavors, with the tender chicken, juicy pineapple tidbits, and the zesty orange all coming together to create a delightful meal.

gt:
Line medium bowl with several layers of paper towels.
Spoon ricotta cheese into bowl.
Let drain at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.
Beat egg, 1/3 cup Pecorino Romano cheese, salt, and white pepper in large bowl to blend.
Mix in ricotta.
Sprinkle 3/4 cup flour over and stir gently to blend.
Cover and chill dough 1 hour.
Do ahead Can be made 1 day ahead.
Keep chilled.
Cook gnudi in large pot of boiling salted water until very tender, about 8 minutes.
Makes 6 first course servingss.
Top with sauce of choice.
I made bolognese.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, egg, and 1/2 cup of the grated pecorino romano cheese.
3. Add the salt, pepper, and 3/4 cup of the flour, and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the remaining 3/4 cup of flour, stirring until the dough comes together.
5. On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
7. Meanwhile, prepare a baking sheet by lightly greasing it or covering it with parchment paper.
8. After the dough has rested, divide it into 12 equal pieces.
9. On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece of dough into a smooth ball.
10. Place the balls of dough on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart.
11. Using a fork, poke a few holes in each ball of dough.
12. Bake the gnudi in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
13. Remove the gnudi from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a serving platter.
14. Serve the gnudi with additional grated pecorino romano cheese on top, and enjoy your delicious Ricotta Gnudi dish!

gt:
Mix all ingredients except oil.
I just add a small amout of salt and pepper at this point, you can always add more later if you feel it needs it.
Gradually whisk the oil in with the others until it appears to be completely incorporated (no oil sitting on the top of the dressing mix).
Put your dry coleslaw mix (your favorite) in a bowl large enough to mix with the dressing.
I like to use a bowl that has a sealable lid for marinating.
Add dressing a little at a time and toss with the dry coleslaw mix until completely used.
Let marinate in the refrigerator at least an hour or overnight.
Enjoy.
(Cookiing time is the marinating time.
).
pred:
To cook a delicious Slaw Dressing (Tangy) dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, whisk together the 12 cups of Canola oil and 18 cups of rice wine vinegar.
2. Add the 2 tablespoons of Tabasco sauce (jalapeno flavor) and whisk until well combined.
3. In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, 12 teaspoons of Stone Ground mustard, 12 teaspoons of Yellow mustard, 12 teaspoons of sugar, and salt and pepper to taste.
4. Slowly pour the garlic mixture into the oil and vinegar mixture, whisking constantly to ensure the ingredients are well combined.
5. Taste the dressing and adjust the seasoning as needed.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dressing for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the Slaw Dressing (Tangy) over your favorite salad or as a dip for crudites. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat waffle iron according to manufacturer' s directions; spray lightly with vegetable cooking spray.
In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg.
Set aside.
In small bowl, combine oil, molasses, pumpkin and buttermilk and set aside.
Whisk together eggs and sugar until blended.
Add buttermilk mixture, whisking until blended.
Add to dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.
Pour batter into a hot waffle iron and bake approximately 5 minutes or until done.
Serve with syrup or whipped cream (or even powedered sugar).
pred:
[/INST]

To make Pumpkin Waffles, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your waffle iron and prepare your waffle batter by combining the following ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 12 teaspoons baking soda
- 14 teaspoons salt
- 34 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 12 teaspoons ground ginger
- 18 teaspoons ground nutmeg
- 2 teaspoons canola oil
- 1 teaspoon molasses
- 14 cup canned pumpkin
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 large egg
- 2 tablespoons sugar or 2 tablespoons Splenda granular

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and canola oil).
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the wet ingredients (pumpkin, buttermilk, egg, sugar or Splenda, and molasses).
4. Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Cook the waffles according to your waffle iron's instructions.
6. Serve the Pumpkin Waffles with your desired toppings, such as butter, syrup, or whipped cream.

Enjoy your delicious Pumpkin Waffles!

gt:
Combine sugar and water in a large saucepan; bring to a boil.
Cook until sugar dissolves; do not stir.
Brush down any crystals that form on edges of pan with a wet pastry brush.
Cook 2 minutes or until sugar caramelizes and turns pale amber, swirling pan occasionally.
Remove pan from heat; let cool 3 minutes.
Add strawberries; cover and let stand 10 minutes or until strawberries are tender.
Cook over low heat until caramel is liquefied.
Stir in peppercorns.
Using an immersion blender in pan, puree sauce until smooth.
(Sauce will thicken as it cools.)
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the sugar and water over medium heat. Cook until the sugar has dissolved, stirring occasionally.
3. Carefully add the hulled strawberries to the saucepan, stirring to combine. Cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the strawberries are soft and the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the crushed pink peppercorns. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the sauce to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
6. Pour the sauce into a clean bowl and refrigerate until chilled.
7. Serve the chilled strawberry sauce over ice cream, yogurt, or as a topping for desserts.

Enjoy your delicious homemade strawberry sauce!

gt:
Remove seeds from your pumpkin and place in a colander.
Place colander in your sink and rinse with water, removing as much of the stringy pumpkin guts as you can.
Pour seeds onto a rimmed baking sheet and allow to dry overnight.
The following day, pick out any remaining pieces of pumpkin.
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Spray a clean rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.
Toss seeds in a bowl with the olive oil and garlic salt.
Spread the seeds on the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.
Taste and season with additional garlic salt if desired.
pred:
[/INST]

To prepare Perfect Roasted Pumpkin Seeds, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil for easy cleanup.
3. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, garlic salt, and any additional seasonings you prefer.
4. Spread the olive oil mixture evenly over the lined baking sheet.
5. Add the raw pumpkin seeds to the baking sheet, ensuring they are evenly distributed.
6. Roast the pumpkin seeds in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the pumpkin seeds cool for a few minutes.
8. Carefully transfer the pumpkin seeds to a bowl, and toss them with the olive oil mixture to coat them evenly.
9. Season the pumpkin seeds with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the roasted pumpkin seeds immediately or store them in an airtight container for later use.

Enjoy your delicious Perfect Roasted Pumpkin Seeds!

gt:
Place frozen breasts in 12 inch frying pan and add all ingredients except cornstarch, water, and onions.
Bring to boil over medium high heat.
Reduce heat and simmer until meat is no longer pink in center of thickest part - about 20 minutes total.
Transfer chicken to platter and keep warm.
Boil pan juices over high heat, uncovered, 3 or 4 minutes.
Mix cornstarch with water and add to sauce; stirring until it boils.
Moisten chicken with sauce and serve over rice.
Sprinkle chicken with minced green onions.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the frozen cranberries and cook until they start to release their juices. Add the grated orange peel and cook for another minute.
4. Add the chicken broth, dry white wine, and cornstarch to the skillet. Stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
5. Add the dried fruit, orange juice, and green onion to the skillet. Stir to combine, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the chicken is fully cooked.
6. Serve the Chicken With Orange and Cranberry Sauce over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
Pour the pineapple juice among 2 ice-cube trays and place in the freezer for 4 hours or until set.
Combine lemonade and grapefruit juice in a large serving jug.
Add the ice cubes and serve immediately.
Notes & tips.
You can make the ice cubes (step 1) and chill the lemonade and grapefruit juice up to 1 day ahead.
Carry out step 2 just before serving.
pred:
1. Begin by pouring 500 ml of pineapple juice into a large mixing bowl.
2. Next, add 1 1/2 liters of chilled lemonade to the bowl, ensuring that the pineapple juice is fully combined.
3. Slowly pour in 1 1/4 liters of chilled ruby red grapefruit juice, also known as Ocean Spray brand, into the bowl, ensuring that the mixture is well-blended.
4. Stir the mixture gently to ensure that all ingredients are well-combined and the flavors are evenly distributed.
5. Once the mixture is fully combined, pour it into a pitcher or a large glass container, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to fully develop and the drink to reach the desired temperature.
7. Serve the Pretty Pink Drink in a glass, garnished with a slice of pineapple and a grapefruit slice, if desired.

This step-by-step procedure will help you create a delicious Pretty Pink Drink using the provided ingredients. Enjoy!

gt:
If using panini rolls, cut each roll in half.
If using regular bread, spread the outside of each slice with butter.
Spread 2 1/2 tablespoons of cranberry sauce each on 2 slices of bread.
Layer the brie over the cranberry sauce.
Top with 2 slices of bacon and the top layer of bread, remembering to keep the buttered side facing outwards.
I use a George Foreman grill to cook the panini- press the lid down to heat the sandwich right through and cook for a few minutes until the cheese has melted.
Alternatively, cook in a skillet, pressing the sandwich firmly with a spatula while cooking.
Serve hot!
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
1. Preheat a panini maker or a skillet over medium heat.
2. Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter.
3. Lay one slice of bread, buttered side down, on a clean surface.
4. Lay the other slice of bread, buttered side up, on top of the first slice.
5. Add a slice of cooked bacon on top of the second slice of bread.
6. Spread a generous amount of cranberry sauce on top of the bacon.
7. Add a slice of brie cheese on top of the cranberry sauce.
8. Place the other slice of bread, buttered side up, on top of the cheese.
9. Place the sandwich in the panini maker or skillet, or cook it in a skillet over medium heat.
10. Cook the sandwich until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the sandwich from the panini maker or skillet and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Wash every mussel thouroughly.
Scrub the shells (with a stiff brush, if necessary) and rinse under cold running water.
Pull the stringy "beards" out of the mussels, but you can also leave them.
Discard any mussel, that is open.
Keep them in cold water until use.
Bring all other ingredients in a large pot to a hard boil.
Add mussels and cook them for about 5 - 10 minutes or until all shells are opened.
Do not overcook, as mussels will become tough and rubbery.
Shake the pot during cooking, so that mussels are mixed.
Take mussels out of the pot with a slotted spoon.
Serve them hot with some cooking fluid and veggies.
NOTE: To eat mussels use an empty shell as a gripper.
NOTE: For guests you can prepare the mussels in portions.
So they are hot and can be served immediately from the cooking fluid.
NOTE: Typically served with a coarse rye bread, butter, salt and a glas of beer.
pred:
To cook Rheinisches Muschelessen (Rhenish Mussel Meal), follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the mussels, carrot, leek, onion, and white wine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes or until the mussels open.
3. Add the water and peppercorns to the pot, and continue to cook for another 5-7 minutes or until the mussels are cooked through.
4. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes.
5. Strain the cooking liquid through a sieve into a large bowl, discarding any remaining mussel shells or debris.
6. Add the salt, bay leaf (if using), and nutmeg (if using) to the cooking liquid. Stir well to combine.
7. Serve the Rheinisches Muschelessen (Rhenish Mussel Meal) hot, over rice or with crusty bread, as desired.

Enjoy your delicious Rhenish Mussel Meal!

gt:
Heat oil in frying pan over medium high heat.
Sautee peas for about 2 minutes.
Add almonds, salt and pepper and stir till evenly mixed.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the snow peas with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the snow peas out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Roast the snow peas in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy.
5. While the snow peas are cooking, toast the slivered almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat. Be careful not to burn them.
6. Once the snow peas are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
7. In a small bowl, mix the toasted almonds with the melted butter.
8. Add the toasted almond mixture to the cooked snow peas and toss everything together.
9. Serve the Slivered Snow Peas With Almonds immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

This recipe combines the natural sweetness of the snow peas with the crunchy texture of the toasted almonds, creating a delicious and satisfying dish. The melted butter adds a rich, creamy flavor to the dish, while the olive oil and salt provide a balanced taste. The combination of these ingredients results in a delightful and nutritious side dish that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with other dishes.

gt:
Cook soba noodles according to package directions.
Drain, run under cold water and set aside.
For the sauce, in a small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in cold water.
Stir together remaining ingredients for teriyaki sauce.
Set aside.
In a large cast iron skillet, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil over medium heat.
Pour shrimp into hot pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Saute until opaque and pink, 2-3 minutes.
Remove from hot pan.
Increase temperature to medium high heat and pour in remaining oil.
Stir fry squash, carrot, celery and edamame until carrots start to soften, 3 minutes.
Pour teriyaki sauce over veggies and stir until sauce thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and stir in cooked soba noodles, bean sprouts, green onions and shrimp.
Toss to coat in sauce.
Taste and add in salt, pepper and/or sugar, according to taste.
Serve immediately.
pred:
[/SYS]

To prepare Teriyaki Shrimp Soba Noodle Bowls, follow these steps:

1. Cook the noodles according to the package instructions, usually by boiling them in a pot of salted water until they reach the desired tenderness. Drain the noodles and set aside.

2. In a large skillet or wok, heat 2 tablespoons of the canola oil over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add the remaining canola oil and cook the yellow squash, carrot, and celery until they are tender but still slightly crunchy. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

4. Add the edamame to the skillet and cook until they are heated through.

5. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a small amount of water to create a slurry. Add the slurry to the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.

6. Add the cooked shrimp back to the skillet and stir to combine.

7. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, sesame oil, and minced ginger and garlic. Pour the sauce mixture over the shrimp and vegetables in the skillet and stir to combine.

8. Serve the Teriyaki Shrimp Soba Noodle Bowls over the cooked noodles.

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

gt:
Grease muffin cups and place the in the freezer until use.
Preheat oven (360F, 180C).
In a bowl mix flour, baking powder, baking soda and currants; set aside.
In a large bowl beat the egg slightly.
Add sugar, vegetable oil and buttermilk and mix thoroughly.
Add flour-currant mixture and stir just until combined.
Batter will be sticky.
Divide batter equally among the prepared muffin cups.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean.
Meanwhile prepare the meringue topping.
Beat egg whites and salt with a mixer on high speed until foamy and soft peaks are formed, then gradually add powdered sugar and beat until meringue is stiff.
At last fold in the currants carefully.
When muffins are done, remove from oven.
Spread the meringue topping on each muffin.
Put the muffins back into the oven and let the meringue topping dry out for about 5 - 10 minutes.
The meringue topping should be white or only slightly brown.
Remove muffins from oven and let cool down in muffin cups for 5 - 10 minutes.
Then remove the muffins from the cups and serve warm or let cool down completely.
NOTE: You can replace red currants by black currants or other small berries.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sifted powdered sugar.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
4. In a small bowl, mix the vegetable oil, buttermilk, and egg yolks until well combined.
5. Gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until just combined.
6. Fold in the red currants, reserving a few for garnish.
7. Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease the muffin tin with cooking spray.
8. Fill the muffin cups with the batter, dividing it evenly among the muffins.
9. Bake the muffins for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
10. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Once cooled, dust the muffins with powdered sugar and garnish with the reserved red currants.

Enjoy your delicious Red Currant Muffins!

gt:
Heat gas grill on medium or charcoal grill until coals are ash white.
Whisk Saute Express squares, soy sauce, hoisin sauce and ground ginger together in bowl.
Add ground beef, water chestnuts, green onions and bread crumbs; mix well.
Shape ground beef into 8 patties.
Place patties onto grill; grill, turning once, 8-10 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160F and meat is no longer pink in center.
pred:
[<SYS>>
To make delicious Kimchi Sliders, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, water chestnuts, green onions, and ginger. Season the mixture with soy sauce and hoisin sauce.
3. Shape the beef mixture into small patties.
4. Heat the Land O Lakes Garlic & Herb Saute Express squares in a pan over medium heat.
5. Add the chopped kimchi to the pan and cook until the kimchi is tender and slightly browned.
6. Place the beef patties on the pan and cook until they are cooked through.
7. Toast the slider buns.
8. Assemble the sliders by placing a cooked beef patty on a toasted bun, topping it with a spoonful of the kimchi mixture.
9. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve immediately.
</SYS>>

[<SYS>>
The process of making a delicious Kimchi Sliders dish involves several steps, including preparing the beef mixture, cooking the kimchi, toasting the slider buns, and assembling the sliders. The Land O Lakes Garlic & Herb Saute Express squares are used to cook the kimchi, while the soy sauce and hoisin sauce are added to the beef mixture for flavor. The water chestnuts add a crunchy texture, and the green onions and ginger provide a fresh, aromatic flavor. The toasted slider buns serve as the base for the sliders, and the chopped cilantro adds a touch of freshness and color to the dish. Overall, the combination of these ingredients results in a delicious and satisfying Kimchi Sliders dish.
</SYS>>

gt:
Combine watermelon, ice, and lime juice, blending until smooth.
To sweeten, add condensed milk to taste, while blending.
Pour and serve!
pred:
1. First, wash and chop the watermelon into small, even pieces.
2. In a blender, add the chopped watermelon, ice, and lime juice.
3. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. Add the condensed milk to the blender and continue blending until the desired consistency is reached.
5. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy your delicious Authentic Thai Watermelon Smoothie.

[/INST]

gt:
preheat oven to 350 and spray 9x13 pan with non-stick cooking spray.
melt chocolate with 3/4 cup butter and salt.
beat remaining 3/4 cup butter.
add sugar and beat well.
slowly add eggs, then vanilla.
slowly add chocolate.
add flour, and mix until just blended.
spread in prepared pan and bake 25-29 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
cool 30 minutes on wire cooling rack.
in saucepan over medium heat, melt chocolate, sugar, cream, and salt.
heat until slightly thickened.
when thickened, pour into bowl of stand mixer.
beat on medium high speed until cool, about 5 minutes.
add vanilla and beat 1 additional minute, then spread over brownies.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the unsweetened baking chocolate, softened butter, and salt.
3. Add the sugar and eggs to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
4. Add the vanilla extract and flour to the mixture, and mix until smooth.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out clean.
7. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan.
8. To make the fudge icing, combine the unsweetened chocolate, sugar, and salt in a small mixing bowl.
9. Heat the heavy cream in a small saucepan over low heat until it reaches a simmer.
10. Slowly pour the hot cream into the chocolate mixture, stirring gently until smooth.
11. Allow the icing to cool for a few minutes before spreading it over the cooled brownies.
12. Refrigerate the brownies and icing mixture for at least 30 minutes before cutting and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine all the * ingredients.
Form into small hamburger patties.
Sprinkle each patty with sesame seeds, shichimi spice, and katakuriko.
You can also add the shichimi spice to the meat mixture before forming if you'd prefer, but even if you choose to do so, make sure to sprinkle on the surface before frying too.
Heat oil in a pan.
Cook the patties on both sides, and when they turn golden brown, it's done.
They cook quickly, so be careful with the heat.
If you pack these in your lunchbox, bring a small container of ponzu sauce to dress them.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground pork, beaten egg, katakuriko, oyster sauce, sesame oil, salt, and toasted sesame seeds.
3. Form the mixture into small patties, approximately 1 inch in diameter.
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. Carefully place the patties in the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the skillet. Cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the patties are golden brown and cooked through.
6. Transfer the patties to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through and crispy on the outside.
7. Serve the patties on top of a bed of rice or noodles, garnished with a drizzle of oyster sauce and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

Enjoy your delicious For Your Lunchbox Sesame Shichimi Pork Patties!

gt:
Pre-heat oven to 425 degrees.
Drain green beans.
Cut bacon slices in half.
Wrap a good hand full (12-15) beans with the bacon & lay seam side down on a lined sheet pan sprayed with pam.
Repeat with remaining beans and bacon.
Bake about 25-30 minute until bacon is brown & beans are cooked.
Meanwhile, grate 1/4 to 1/2 of an onion to get it's juice and mix with the rest of the ingredients in a glass pyrex.
Microwave 1-2 minutes until butter is melted.
Stir well.
When bundles are done dip each bundle in sauce and place in serving dish.
Pour remaining sauce over bundles and serve.
These bundles can be assembled in advance with the sauce kept seperate.
These bundles do not freeze well raw or pre-cooked.
pred:
To create delicious Tangy Green Bean Bundles, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, cook the green beans in the butter until they are tender but still crisp. Season the green beans with the kosher salt, smoked paprika, and onion juice.

4. In a large bowl, combine the green beans, crispy bacon, and distilled white vinegar. Toss the mixture to coat the green beans evenly.

5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the tarragon vinegar, water, and onion juice. Pour the mixture over the green bean and bacon mixture, and toss to combine.

6. Transfer the green bean and bacon mixture to a baking dish. Drizzle the remaining butter over the top, and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the green beans are tender and the bacon is crispy.

7. Serve the Tangy Green Bean Bundles immediately, and enjoy the delicious combination of crispy bacon, tender green beans, and tangy flavors.

gt:
Cut the vegetables.
Cut into 1 cm wide.
If you are not using coarsely chopped beef, cut it into bite size.
Mix all ingredients in advance.
Pour oil in a pan and stir fry the beef.
Add grated garlic and transfer the beef to a plate when it is more or less cooked.
Add oil to the pan from step 3 and stir fry the vegetables.
When the vegetables are half cooked, add the beef from Step 3.
Stir fry the vegetables and meat together.
Continue stir frying while drizzling the sauce from step 2.
When it's mixed well, sprinkle salt and pepper.
Drizzle oyster sauce, mix well, then it is done.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned, then remove from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the green peppers, red bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Cook until the vegetables are tender, then add the soy sauce, sugar, sake, salt, and pepper. Cook for a few more minutes until the sauce has thickened.
4. Add the beef back to the skillet and stir to combine the ingredients.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
6. Serve the Beef with Green Peppers and Onions over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

[/INST]

gt:
Note: I always double this recipe and it still turns out great.
Preheat oven to 375F.
Grate cheese and set aside.
Boil pasta until al dente.
Rinse with cool water, place back in pot, and add a little butter to keep from sticking.
Over medium heat melt salted butter in a sauce pan.
Add mustard and dry ingredients, stirring for 2 minutes.
Pour in milk and whisk for 10 minutes until thickened.
Add 2 cups of cheese into the sauce until melted.
Pour sauce over the pasta and stir.
Add half of the pasta to a buttered casserole dish and sprinkle 1/2 cup of cheese on top.
Layer the other half of the pasta on top and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of cheese and bread crumbs.
Bake for 30 minutes or until top is bubbling and browned.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until it is al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the mixture becomes smooth and bubbly.
4. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
5. Add the grated cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and mustard to the saucepan, stirring until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
6. Combine the cooked pasta and the cheese sauce in a large mixing bowl.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish or a casserole dish.
8. Sprinkle the paprika over the top of the mixture.
9. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and bubbly.
10. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 450 degrees.
Arrange fillet in an 11X7 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
Combine mustard, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce, stirring well; spread mixture evenly over fillet.
Sprinkle breadcrumbs evenly over fish.
Bake, uncovered, at 450 degrees for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
Cut fillet in half, and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the butter-flavored cooking spray, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice until well combined.
3. Season the orange roughy fillets with salt and pepper.
4. In a separate small bowl, mix the reduced-sodium Worcestershire sauce and Italian seasoned breadcrumbs.
5. Dip the orange roughy fillets in the butter-flavored cooking spray mixture, then coat them with the breadcrumb mixture.
6. Place the fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Bake the fillets in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the breadcrumbs are golden brown.
8. Serve the Ww Dijon Fish Fillets immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Heat a wok or large skillet over medium heat and add oil.
Once oil is hot, add garlic, shallots, lemongrass, ginger, and chilies.
Stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Carefully stir in wine, fish sauce, and scallions.
Add in clams, stir the contents, and cover with a lid.
Allow clams to cook for 45 minutes or until shells have opened.
Plate clams and garnish with scallions and cilantro.
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the minced garlic and shallots, and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
3. Add the lemongrass, ginger, and chilies, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Pour in the white wine, and let it cook down until almost evaporated.
5. Add the fish sauce, and stir to combine.
6. Add the clams to the skillet, and cook until they open, about 4-5 minutes.
7. Remove the clams from the skillet, and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. Discard any clams that did not open.
9. Stir in the cilantro leaves, and serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Spread freshly popped corn into two large, shallow sheet pans with sides.
Remove any un-popped kernels.
Place pans in the oven to keep warm and crisp.
Combine butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, and salt in a 2-quart heavy saucepan.
Place on medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.
Continue to boil to the firm ball stage (248 degrees F on a candy thermometer).
Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon and the optional cinnamon extract.
I like the very natural cinnamon flavor attained from only using the ground cinnamon, but do as you want.
Then stir in baking soda.
Syrup will foam.
Take popped corn from oven and sprinkle evenly with coconut and almonds.
Pour hot caramel mixture over popcorn, in a fine stream.
Stir to mix well.
Return to oven for 45 minutes, stirring and scraping up caramel from pan the bottom of the pans every 15 minutes.
Cool and serve or store in an airtight container for up to a week.
pred:
1. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
2. Add the brown sugar and cinnamon, and stir until smooth.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 5 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth and syrupy.
4. Add the light corn syrup, salt, cinnamon extract, and baking soda, if using. Stir well to combine.
5. Carefully pour the mixture over the popped corn, making sure to coat all of the kernels evenly.
6. Spread the mixture out on a large baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
7. Roast the popcorn mixture in a preheated oven at 250°F (120°C) for about 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the popcorn is golden brown and the coating is crispy.
8. Remove the popcorn from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Once the popcorn is cool, add the shredded coconut and sliced almonds.
10. Serve the Cinnamon Caramel Corn with Coconut and Almonds immediately, or store it in an airtight container for later enjoyment.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
The essential ingredients for this Cinnamon Caramel Corn with Coconut and Almonds recipe are: 5 quarts of popped corn, 1 cup of unpopped kernels, 1 cup of unsalted butter, 2 cups of brown sugar, 1/2 cup of light corn syrup, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 tablespoon of ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons of cinnamon extract, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda (optional), 1 cup of shredded coconut, and 1 cup of sliced almonds.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Put all the ingredients into a bowl.
Heat for 30 seconds in a microwave.
Stir if the dashi stock hasn't dissolved completely, and it's ready!
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Tentsuyu (Tempura Dipping Sauce) and Ten-don (Tempura Rice Bowl) Sauce, follow these steps:

1. In a small saucepan, combine the soy sauce, mirin, dashi stock, and water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

2. Add the sugar to the saucepan and stir to combine. Continue to simmer for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

3. Remove the sauce from the heat and let it cool slightly. If desired, you can strain the sauce to remove any impurities or to achieve a smoother texture.

4. To serve, pour the Tentsuyu sauce into a small bowl, and serve alongside your Ten-don (Tempura Rice Bowl). You can also use the sauce to dip your tempura pieces in for added flavor.

Enjoy your Tentsuyu and Ten-don Sauce!

gt:
Saute the garlic and onions in oil on medium low heat for 10 minutes, or until onions are slightly browned, stirring occasionally.
Add corn, tomatoes, couscous and water.
Cover and cook on low heat for 5 to 8 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed and the couscous is soft.
Add parsley, Tabasco and cayenne.
Salt and pepper to taste, if desired.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the couscous, water, and a pinch of salt. Mix well and set aside for 5 minutes.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the onion to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until it becomes soft and translucent.
5. Add the frozen corn to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they become soft and slightly mushy.
7. Add the cooked couscous to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Season the couscous mixture with the parsley, cayenne, and Tabasco sauce. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
9. Transfer the couscous mixture to a baking dish or a large casserole dish.
10. Bake the couscous in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is hot and bubbly.
11. Serve the Spontaneous Couscous immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
*groundflax seed (measure after grinding; coffee grinder is good for grinding flax seed) Preheat oven to 375.
Lightly grease muffin tin.
Combine all ingredients.
Spoon batter into muffin tins about 3/4 full.
Bake for 15-20 minutes.
Makes 12-14 muffins depending on size.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, ground flax seeds, oatmeal, brown sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and vanilla.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the shredded carrot, finely chopped apple, and raisins.
6. Grease a muffin tin with cooking spray or use paper liners.
7. Fill each muffin cup with the batter, dividing it evenly.
8. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Whole Grain Health Muffins!

gt:
After grilling (or broiling) vegetables, let cool enough to handle.
Chop into 1/4" pieces and combine in a bowl with all remaining ingredients, except tortillas.
Divide between tortillas, spreading filling to within 1/2" of edge.
Roll up pinwheel style.
Wrap in plastic wrap and chill 1 hour, to allow flavors to blend.
Remove plastic wrap and slice in 1" slices and serve.
(do not serve ragged looking slices).
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. Cut the eggplant into 1/2-inch slices and brush with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Place the eggplant slices on the grill and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
4. While the eggplant is cooking, prepare the vegetables. Cut the red and green bell peppers into 1/2-inch slices and the zucchini lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Cut the mushrooms into 1/4-inch pieces.
5. Grill the vegetables in batches, brushing them with olive oil and seasoning with salt and pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
6. Once all the vegetables are cooked, let them cool slightly.
7. In a large bowl, combine the vegetables, eggplant, parsley, garlic, and crushed red pepper flakes.
8. Place the tortillas on a clean surface and spread a thin layer of balsamic vinegar on one side of each tortilla.
9. Roll up the tortillas with the vegetable mixture inside, starting from the bottom and rolling up to the top.
10. Cut the roll-ups into bite-sized pieces and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large standing mixer, combine margarine, Crisco, sugars, eggs, and vanilla.
Blend thoroughly.
In a separate bowl, sift together baking soda, salt and flour.
Turn mixer on low and slowly add dry ingredients.
Once thoroughly combined (about 2 minutes), let sit for a few minutes.
Add butterscotch, chocolate chips and coconuts.
Mix on low for about 30 seconds or until combined.
Portion out dough on a baking sheet and bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Makes about 3 dozen (depending on how much cookie dough you eat!).
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the Margarine and Crisco until smooth.
3. Add the sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla, mixing until well combined.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Combine the baking soda and salt, then add to the mixture.
6. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a dough forms.
7. Fold in the coconut, chocolate chips, and butterscotch chips.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the sole filets and let them absorb the seasoning.
Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
Cut the asparagus into 5 cm pieces.
Cut the cherry tomatoes in half.
Boil the asparagus in salted water.
Wipe off the moisture on the surface of the sole, and dust with cake flour.
Heat up a frying pan and melt the butter.
Pan fry the sole over medium heat for 2 minutes.
Turn the sole over, add the asparagus, cherry tomatoes and sake, cover with a lid and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the soy sauce and cook for one more minute to evaporate the moisture in the pan.
Arrange the sole on serving plates, and put the tomatoes and asparagus on the side.
Add parsley and butter and serve.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the sole fillets, season with salt and pepper, and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
4. Remove the fish from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the cake flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the flour is lightly browned.
6. Gradually pour in the sake, stirring constantly, and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Add the soy sauce, parsley, and cherry tomatoes to the skillet, stirring to combine.
8. Return the cooked sole fillets to the skillet and toss to coat the fish in the sauce.
9. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the fish is heated through and the sauce is slightly caramelized.
10. Serve the Brown Butter Sole Meuniere immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix cookie crumbs and butter; press onto bottom and up side of 9-inch pie plate.
Refrigerate while preparing filling.
Beat pudding mixes and milk in medium bowl with whisk 2 min.
(Pudding will be thick.)
Reserve 2 Tbsp.
melted chocolate.
Mix remaining chocolate with 1 cup pudding until blended; spread onto bottom of crust.
Add 3/4 cup Cool Whip and all but 3 Tbsp.
chopped toffee to remaining pudding; spread over pudding layer in crust.
Top with remaining Cool Whip and toffee.
Drizzle with remaining chocolate.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, chocolate wafer cookie crumbs, and Jell-O Chocolate Instant Pudding. Mix well.
3. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
4. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes or until it is set.
5. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the melted Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly, until it reaches a smooth consistency.
7. Pour the melted chocolate over the cooled crust.
8. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cold milk and Cool Whip Whipped Topping until smooth.
9. Spread the chocolate mixture evenly over the chocolate layer.
10. Refrigerate the pie for at least 4 hours or overnight.
11. Just before serving, add the chopped chocolate-covered toffee bars to the pie.
12. Refrigerate the pie for an additional 30 minutes or until the toffee bars are melted and the pie is set.

[/INST]

This delightful Fudge-Bottom Candy Crunch Pie dish is a delicious combination of chocolate, crunch, and creamy topping. The ingredients include chocolate wafer cookie crumbs, melted butter, Jell-O Chocolate Instant Pudding, cold milk, Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate, Cool Whip Whipped Topping, and chopped chocolate-covered toffee bars. The pie is baked, chilled, and then topped with the melted chocolate and Cool Whip, resulting in a delicious and satisfying dessert.

gt:
Mix flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowl using a fork.
Beat beer, egg and oil together in a separate bowl.
Stir into flour mixture until well blended.
Batter should be pretty smooth and moderately thick.
Dip fish, shrimp, or onion slices in coating and deep-fry in hot oil that has been heated to 350 degrees, until it becomes golden.
Drain, and serve while hot and crispy.
This recipe also works well with chicken tenders and vegetable pieces; whatever you like to coat with beer batter.
pred:
To cook a delicious Beer Batter for Fish, Shrimp & Onion Rings dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 23 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt, and 12 teaspoon baking powder.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and vegetable oil.
3. Gradually pour the beer into the egg mixture, stirring to combine.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until a smooth batter forms.
5. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat.
6. Pour a small amount of batter into the skillet, creating a circular shape. Cook until the edges are golden brown, then carefully flip the fish cake and cook for another minute or until golden brown on both sides.
7. Repeat with the shrimp, onion rings, or any other desired battered items.
8. Serve the cooked fish cakes, shrimp, or onion rings with your favorite dipping sauce.

Enjoy your delicious Beer Batter for Fish, Shrimp & Onion Rings dish!

gt:
In the heating pan pour in oil add chicken fry till cook
Add onion and sweet peppers
Add peanuts and add oyster sauce, light soy sauce, sugar and chicken stock powder keep frying to get all the flavours in the chickens
Add green onion and salary stir in for 3 minutes
pred:
1. Heat a wok or large pan over medium heat.
2. Add the oil and let it heat up.
3. Add the onion and stir-fry until it becomes soft and translucent.
4. Add the chicken and stir-fry until it is cooked through and no longer pink.
5. Add the red and yellow sweet peppers and stir-fry for a few minutes until they are slightly softened.
6. Add the green onion and stir-fry for a few more minutes until it becomes slightly wilted.
7. Add the roasted peanuts and stir-fry for a minute or two until they are heated through.
8. Add the oyster sauce, chicken stock powder, sugar, and light soy sauce. Stir to combine.
9. Add the sliced salary and stir-fry until it is cooked through and heated through.
10. Serve the Chicken with peanuts stir fry over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

gt:
Add the spices to a small bowl and mix well with your fingers.
Rub some extra virgin olive oil onto both sides of the steaks, then evenly coat this rub onto both sides, gently rubbing it into the meat.
Let the steak sit at room temperature for 15-20 minutes with this rub on before grilling over direct high heat.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the kosher salt, chili powder, onion powder, garlic granules, paprika, marjoram, cumin, ground black pepper, and cinnamon.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
4. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it becomes fragrant and slightly darkened.
5. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Transfer the mixture to a small bowl and stir in 18 teaspoons of vegetable oil.
7. Store the Lone Star Rub in an airtight container or jar for up to 6 months.

To use the Lone Star Rub, simply sprinkle a small amount onto your desired dish, such as meats, vegetables, or even popcorn, for a delicious, smoky flavor.

gt:
Steam the beans and carrots, covered, until very soft, slightly salted water.
Stir occasionally and make sure there is enough water to keep them from scalding until they are tender-soft.
Drain off any excess water.
Combine all ingredients except oil and combine well in a food processor or mash together by hand.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as per your preference.
(You may add some green chillies or more garam masala if you prefer more heat, or more mango powder if you want it tangy).
Divide into equal portions and shape into 3/4 inch patties, and chill for a few minutes to help them firm up better.
Heat oil, add patties, and brown undisturbed for 1-2 minutes before flipping over.
Cook for 1 minute periods on each side until they are crisp golden brown on the outside.
If desired, garnish with lemon wedges and serve with a green dipping chutney on the side.
(I have made this and included some leftover boiled mung dal in the potato mixture, which works rather well in this - I am sure any lentil would work equally great as well, it is a recommended addition).
pred:
To create delicious Indian-Seasoned Vegetable Patties, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the green beans, carrots, whole wheat bread, and crumbs.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the ginger, mango powder, garam masala, chili powder, cilantro, salt, and vegetable oil.
4. Pour the spice mixture over the vegetable mixture and stir to combine.
5. Shape the mixture into small patties, using your hands or a cookie scoop.
6. Place the patties on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the patties in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
8. Serve the Indian-Seasoned Vegetable Patties warm, as a side dish or as a main course.

Enjoy your delicious Indian-Seasoned Vegetable Patties!

gt:
In a shallow dish, with a fork or potato masher, finely crush the crackers.
Brush each sides of cutlets with 1/4 cup of teriyaki sauce.
Dip each cutlets in the cracker crumbs flipping them to coat well.
In a large skillet, melt butter and oil at medium heat.
Add cutlets and cook 5 to 7 minutes or until not pink inside (flip them one time).
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the vegetable crackers with 1 tablespoon of butter. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chicken cutlets, 14 cup of thick teriyaki sauce, and 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil. Mix well until the chicken is evenly coated.
4. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place the chicken cutlets on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart.
5. Bake the chicken cutlets in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
7. Serve the Crispy Chicken Cutlets with the vegetable crackers on the side. Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

[/INST]

gt:
Place potatoes into 4-quart saucepan; cover with water.
Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cook 10-15 minutes or until potatoes are tender; drain.
Place potatoes into bowl.
Melt butter in same saucepan over medium heat.
Add pecans; cook 3-5 minutes or until golden brown.
Add drained potatoes to pan; mash until desired consistency.
Add all remaining ingredients; mash lightly until well mixed and marshmallows start to melt.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, toss the sweet potato pieces with the Land O Lakes Butter until they are evenly coated.
3. Spread the sweet potato pieces out on a baking sheet, making sure they are not overcrowded.
4. Roast the sweet potato pieces in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.
5. While the sweet potatoes are cooking, prepare the marshmallows by melting them in a microwave-safe bowl or on the stovetop.
6. Once the sweet potatoes are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the chopped pecans, freshly grated lemon zest, salt, and black pepper.
8. Carefully toss the cooled sweet potato pieces with the marshmallow mixture, ensuring that the marshmallows are evenly distributed.
9. Gently toss the marshmallow-covered sweet potato pieces with the pecan mixture.
10. Serve the Lemony Smashed Sweet Potatoes immediately, as they are best when hot and freshly prepared.

[/INST]

gt:
In a skillet, boil the wine and shallot over moderately high heat until reduced to 1/4 cup, 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to moderate.
Gradually add the butter to the skillet and whisk constantly on and off the heat until the sauce is creamy.
Remove from the heat and whisk in the miso and soy sauce; season with salt and pepper.
Light a grill or heat a grill pan.
Brush the cod fillets with oil and season with salt and pepper.
Brush the grill with oil and cook the fish over high heat, turning once, until lightly charred and just cooked, 4 to 5 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of the oil until shimmering.
Add the lettuces and toss over high heat until barely wilted, about 30 seconds.
Transfer the lettuces to plates and top with the fish.
Briefly rewarm the sauce, whisking, over moderate heat.
Spoon some of the sauce over the fish and serve.
Pass the remaining sauce separately.
pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix the minced shallot with a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. In a large bowl, combine the diced cold unsalted butter, white miso, and soy sauce.
4. Season the black cod fillets with salt and pepper.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the seasoned black cod fillets and cook until they are cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Remove the cooked black cod fillets from the skillet and place them on a plate.
7. Place the grill pan over the preheated grill and cook the fish for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
8. While the fish is cooking, place the diced cold unsalted butter, white miso, and soy sauce mixture in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
9. Remove the cooked fish from the grill and place it on a serving plate.
10. Pour the sauce over the fish and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
In a small bowl, microwave candy coating in 30 second intervals, stirring in between intervals until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
Dip each Vanilla Wafer into the melted candy coating and gently shake off excess (I used a large fork for this).
Place on a sheet of wax paper or silpat.
Immediately sprinkle with a few pistachios.
Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Allow to cool and set up for about 10 minutes or place in the refrigerator for a few minutes.
Enjoy!
Miss
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. In a small bowl, mix the white chocolate candy coating or almond bark with a few drops of water until smooth.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the finely chopped pistachios with the vanilla wafer crumbs.
5. Dip each vanilla wafer into the white chocolate mixture, coating it evenly. Then, roll the dipped wafer in the pistachio mixture to coat it.
6. Place the coated vanilla wafers on the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake the wafers in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
8. Remove the wafers from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious White Chocolate Pistachio Vanilla Wafers!

gt:
Place chicken in a medium saucepan; add chicken stock to cover.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium, and cook, uncovered, 15 minutes or until chicken is done.
Remove from liquid.
Let chicken cool to touch.
Chop chicken into bite-size pieces.
Combine chicken, sprouts, water chestnuts,green onions, and garlic.
Combine vinegar, soy sauce, and oil; pour over chicken mixture, tossing gently.
Line each pita half with 1 lettuce leaf; spoon chicken mixture evenly into pita halves.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the rice vinegar, minced garlic, and sesame oil or peanut oil.
3. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper, then brush them with the marinade.
4. Place the chicken breast halves on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
5. While the chicken is cooking, prepare the pita bread by cutting it in half crosswise.
6. In a large bowl, combine the bean sprouts, water chestnut, green onion, and sesame seeds.
7. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce and vinegar.
8. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. Slice the cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces.
10. In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the sliced green onion and cook for a few minutes until softened.
11. Add the bean sprouts, water chestnut, and sesame seeds to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
12. Add the chicken pieces to the skillet and toss everything together.
13. Place the cooked pita bread on a serving platter.
14. Spoon the chicken and vegetable mixture onto the pita bread.
15. Garnish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt: Throw it all in a crock pot and cook on low for 7 - 9 hours!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Place the butternut squash, eggplants, zucchini, and frozen okra in a large bowl.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the tomato sauce, onion, carrot, and vegetable broth.
4. Pour the tomato sauce mixture over the vegetables in the large bowl.
5. Add the garlic, cumin, turmeric, crushed red pepper flakes, cinnamon, and paprika to the bowl.
6. Stir everything together to combine the ingredients.
7. Transfer the mixture to a Crock Pot and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. Serve the Mediterranean Stew hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small bowl, beat egg with milk.
In a shallow plate or bowl, mix bread crumbs with Italian seasonings.
Dip each piece of chicken into the egg/milk mixture, then into the bread crumb mixture to coat thoroughly.
Place coated chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, depending on how thick the chicken breasts are (bake until chicken is done and juices run clear).
In the last 3 to 4 minutes of baking, sprinkle the top of the chicken pieces with cheese.
Remove from oven and serve!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg and milk.
3. In a large bowl, mix together the seasoned dry bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, and salt.
4. Dip the chicken breast halves into the egg mixture, then coat them evenly with the bread crumb mixture.
5. Place the breaded chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a non-stick baking mat.
6. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the bread crumbs are golden brown.
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into portions.
8. Serve the Cheesy Breaded Chicken hot, garnished with additional shredded mozzarella cheese if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
In a bowl, combine almond meal, sugar, and melted coconut oil and mix well.
Put the mixture on the bottom of a 7-inch springform pan.
Store in the freezer until the cheesecake filling is ready.
Preheat the oven to 350F/180C degrees.
In a blender, place 5 strawberries, yogurt, almond milk, sugar and flour and blend well.
Pour in the springform pan.
Bake for about 45 minutes.
The cheesecake is still soft when you take it out of the oven, but it will get firm.
When the cheesecake has cooled down, cover and store in the refrigerator overnight.
Remove the springform pan and transfer the cheesecake to a serving dish.
Garnish with strawberries and powdered sugar.
Infuse love into the cheesecake, slice and serve!
pred:
To prepare a perfect Gluten-Free Vegan Strawberry Cheesecake, follow these key steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the almond meal, coconut sugar, and coconut oil. Mix well until the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of a springform pan, creating a crust.
4. Bake the crust for about 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden.
5. Allow the crust to cool completely.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the Greek-style strawberry coconut yogurt, coconut or almond milk, and coconut sugar or other raw sugar.
7. Stir in the melted coconut oil.
8. Pour the filling over the cooled crust.
9. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the filling is set and the edges are slightly golden.
10. Allow the cheesecake to cool completely in the pan.
11. Once the cheesecake is fully cooled, refrigerate it for at least 4 hours or overnight.
12. To prepare the strawberries, wash and hull them.
13. Cut the strawberries into small pieces.
14. Garnish the cheesecake with the strawberries, and dust it with powdered sugar, if desired.
15. Serve the Gluten-Free Vegan Strawberry Cheesecake immediately.

By following these steps, you will create a delicious and visually appealing Gluten-Free Vegan Strawberry Cheesecake that will be enjoyed by everyone.

gt:
Trim pork tenderloin removing fat and sinew, slice thinly across the grain (1/4" thickness), place in a bowl.
Add marinade ingredients (soy sauce, white wine, sriracha sauce, honey and ginger), mix to distribute sauce evenly and set aside.
Chop veggies.
Heat wok on high heat for a few minutes, add sesame oil, when oil just starts to smoke, add pork slices, turning frequently.
Stir-fry until pork is mostly cooked and opaque, about 5 - 8 minutes.
Remove pork from wok into a clean bowl/plate, set aside.
In the juices left in the wok, stir in chopped garlic, then add broccoli & carrots.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding more sesame oil if desired.
Add baby corn and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Return pork to wok and stir into veggies, add more soy sauce, sriracha, and honey if needed to create a liquid gravy of about 1/2 cup in volume.
Push food to the outer edges so liquid is settled in the bottom of wok.
In a seperate bowl combine cool water & corn starch.
Add mixture to liquid gravy in the wok and stir until thickened.
Mix everything together and voila!
Serve immediately with cooked rice.
(Basmati/wild blend cooked in chicken stock and nutmeg is nice!)
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with the cool water, and set aside.
4. Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
6. Add the pork tenderloin to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the broccoli florets and cook until they are tender but still slightly crisp.
9. Add the baby carrots and baby corn, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until they are tender.
10. Add the cornstarch mixture to the skillet, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
11. Add the pork back to the skillet and toss to combine.
12. Add the honey and sriracha sauce, stirring to coat the pork and vegetables evenly.
13. Add the dry white wine and soy sauce, stirring to combine.
14. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the pork is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
15. Season with ground ginger to taste.
16. Serve the Honey Ginger Sriracha Pork Stir-fry over rice or noodles, garnished with sesame seeds and green onions.

gt:
The directions for this recipe are for using the poinsettia shape disk.
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
Mix butter and sugar.
Mix in remaining ingredients.
This is the critical moment for this cookie; if it feels too tacky add 1/8-1/4 cup of additional flour.
Refrigerate for 10 minutes or so (I usually make a double batch, and refrigerate the first batch while I am mixing the second batch.
).
Fill the press with dough and press onto ungreased cookie sheet.
(I can usually put 24 on a large sheet; they don't spread much).
Sprinkle each cookie with colored sugar.
(My Mom used to place a cinnamon dot into the center of each cookie, but I skip that).
Bake for 7 minutes; remove from pan to cool.
(You may need to adjust this depending on your oven).

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt margarine in a 9 X 13 inch pan.
Remove pan from oven.
Sprinkle crumbs in pan and press down with a fork.
Sprinkle coconut over the crumbs.
Add the nuts and marshmallows.
Drizzle the sweetened condensed milk over all.
Bake for 25-30 minutes.
Cool.
Melt both kinds of chocolate chips in the microwave; spread over your bars; and cool.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the 12 cups of margarine until fluffy.
3. Add the 12 cups of graham cracker crumbs and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the sweetened coconut, nuts, and chopped marshmallows.
5. Add the sweetened coconut mixture to the margarine and graham cracker crumb mixture, and mix until well combined.
6. Spread the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. While the bars are baking, melt the 8 ounces of milk chocolate chips and 8 ounces of semi-sweet chocolate chips in a double boiler or a heat-resistant bowl set over a pot of simmering water.
9. Once the bars are done baking, let them cool for a few minutes before spreading the melted chocolate mixture evenly over the top.
10. Chill the bars in the refrigerator for at least an hour before cutting and serving.

Enjoy your delicious coconut bars!

gt:
Dissolve unflavored gelatin in cold water.
Set in heat proof cup in pan; Simmer until clear.
Let cool.
Cream together shortening, powdered sugar, and vanilla.
add gelatin.
Beat for 10 minutes.
Put a spoonful onto one cookie top with another cookie then press cookies gently together.
pred:

3. Gradually add the powdered sugar to the mixture, stirring continuously until the sugar is fully incorporated.
4. Add the vanilla extract to the mixture and stir to combine.
5. Carefully pour the mixture over the gelatin in the small bowl, stirring gently to ensure that the gelatin is fully coated.
6. Allow the mixture to sit at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes, or until the gelatin has fully melted and the mixture is smooth and creamy.
7. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
8. Line a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
9. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
10. Bake the cake for about 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
11. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan before cutting and serving.

gt:
Mix cream cheese and spreads until well blended.
Stir in onions; cover.
Refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
Serve with the crackers.
pred:
