gt:
Rinse , stem and remove pits from cherries.
I used the cherrie pitter, pictured below
Place cherries in food processor or blender and puree in batches
Strain through a fine mesh strainer in batches, pressing to extract all the juice.
Rinse strainer between batches.
Stir in lemon juice and salt
You should have about 3 cups fresh cherry juice.
Each pound of cherries yields about 1 cup juice.
This juice frezze very well to have on hand all year round for mousses, puddings , cherry curd , frosting and fillings and to drink or add to drinks
pred:
1. Wash the cherries thoroughly and remove any pits.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cherries, lemon juice, and salt.
3. Cover the bowl and let the cherries sit at room temperature for about 2-3 hours.
4. After the time has passed, the cherries will have released their juices and become soft.
5. Using a slotted spoon, carefully transfer the cherries and juice to a blender or food processor.
6. Blend the cherries and juice until smooth and creamy.
7. Pour the cherry juice into a clean glass and enjoy your fresh cherry juice!

This cooking tutorial provides a simple and delicious way to make fresh cherry juice at home. The ingredients are easily accessible, and the process is straightforward, making it a great option for those looking to enjoy the natural flavors of fresh cherries.

gt:
wash the oranges and ream
grate the 2 oranges' barks
flap the eggs and powdered sugar then add the oil
add the orange juice and barks.
preheat the oven 400F
sift the flour and baking powder then add it to the mixture
set the mixture with the same amount to each cupcake cups.
while the muffins are cooking, make the bitter sauce (depending to it's own recipie), then add 200 grams of chocolate to the bitter chocolate sauce
grate the 70 grams of bitter chocolate
when the muffins cook, leave them for chilling.
then remove the cups and apply the bitter chocolate sauce.
add the grated chocolate before serving
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, sunflower oil, baking powder, and orange zest.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, and salt.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined.
5. Fold in the chopped oranges and chocolate sauce.
6. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin, filling each cup about three-quarters full.
7. Bake the muffins for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/INST]

gt:
In a bowl, combine the chicken, cracker crumbs, mayonnaise, onions, lemon juice and pepper.
Shape into six patties.
Heat oil in a large skillet; fry patties over medium heat for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown and heated through.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cooked chicken, crushed saltine crackers, mayonnaise, green onions, lemon juice, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Form the mixture into small patties, about the size of a walnut.
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the patties until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. Transfer the patties to a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
6. Serve the Chicken Patties hot, as a main course or a side dish.

gt:
Roast peppers on stove burners, or under oven broiler until skin turns evenly black.
Immediately place in a plastic bag and let cool.
Prepare the tomatoes by cutting an X on the bottom of each and boil in water for 1 minute, plunge into a cold water bath and let cool.
Cut the eggplant into small strips and saute in oil until eggplant begins to brown.
About 6 to 8 minutes.
Once the eggplant is soft, add garlic.
Rinse the peppers under cold water and remove the burnt skin (just the ash).
Open the peppers and remove seeds.
Cut into small strips and add to eggplant.
Peel cooled tomatoes, chop and add to eggplant mixture.
Add tomato paste, salt, pepper and cayenne.
Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into bite-sized pieces and place them on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly charred.
3. While the eggplant is cooking, prepare the salad by cutting the green and red bell peppers into small strips.
4. In a large bowl, combine the roasted eggplant, bell peppers, tomatoes, and crushed garlic.
5. In a small bowl, mix the tomato paste, olive oil, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
6. Serve the Eggplant Tomato Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Fill a large lobster pot with 1 inch of water.
Stir in the salt, set a rack or large steamer basket in the bottom and bring the water to a boil.
Add the lobsters, cover with a tight-fitting lid and return the water to a boil.
Once boiling, lower the heat to a gentle boil and steam the lobsters until they are bright red, about 10 minutes.
Check doneness by pulling an antenna.
If it comes off without resistance, the lobster is done.
If not, cook for a few more minutes.
Serve with melted butter and, if you choose, corn and potatoes.
Remove the meat from the fifth lobster and refrigerate for use later in lobster risotto (recipe here).
After eating, reserve the lobster shells for stock (recipe here).
Serves 4.
pred:
To create a delicious and visually appealing Steamed Lobsters dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the melted butter, sea salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
3. Rinse the lobsters and pat them dry with paper towels.
4. Place the lobsters in a large pot or a steamer basket, and pour the butter mixture over them.
5. Cover the pot or steamer basket with a lid, and steam the lobsters for 10-12 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the shells are slightly cracked.
6. Remove the lobsters from the pot or steamer basket, and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. While the lobsters are cooling, prepare the corn and baked potatoes.
8. To steam the corn, place it in a steamer basket and steam it for 5-7 minutes, or until it is cooked through and slightly tender.
9. To bake the potatoes, preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C), and then cut the potatoes into evenly sized pieces. Place the potatoes in a baking dish, drizzle them with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.
10. To assemble the dish, place the cooked lobsters on a serving platter, and arrange the steamed corn and baked potatoes around the lobsters.
11. Serve the Steamed Lobsters immediately, and enjoy your delicious and visually appealing meal.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Melt the butter in a large flameproof gratin dish or a large cast-iron pan.
As soon as it begins to froth, add the sausages and onions and saute until golden brown, about 10-15 minutes.
Add the water and wine, then the diced potatoes.
Mix well and season with salt and plenty of pepper.
Transfer dish or pan to the oven and bake until potatoes are tender and fall apart, about 40 minutes.
While cooking, stir occasionally and add more water, if necessary.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Melt the butter in a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium heat.
3. Add the sliced onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the sausages to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides, breaking them up into smaller pieces as they cook.
5. Pour in the water and white wine, stirring to combine.
6. Add the diced potatoes to the pan, making sure they are evenly distributed.
7. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Cover the pan with a lid or aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven.
9. Bake the sausage and potato mixture for about 25-30 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the sausages are cooked through.
10. Remove the pan from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Savoy Sauteed Sausage and Potato dish is a perfect combination of flavors and textures, with the tender sausages, soft onions, and perfectly cooked potatoes. The addition of the wine and herbs in the sausages adds a touch of sophistication to the dish, making it a delightful meal to enjoy.

gt:
Place washed and dried spinach in a large bowl.
Combine sesame oil, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, mustard and sesame seeds.
Pour over spinach.
Toss to coat.
Let set 5 minutes.
Toss again.
Serve.
pred:
1. Wash the baby spinach leaves thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the sesame oil, sugar, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, and Dijon mustard.
3. Add the toasted sesame seeds to the bowl and mix well.
4. Add the baby spinach leaves to the bowl and toss them gently to coat the leaves evenly with the dressing.
5. Serve the Oriental Spinach Salad immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

This Oriental Spinach Salad recipe combines the fresh taste of baby spinach leaves with the rich flavors of sesame oil, sugar, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, and Dijon mustard. The toasted sesame seeds add a nutty, crunchy texture to the salad, enhancing the overall dining experience.

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Blind bake the pie crust, so it is not soggy.
Place the tomatoes in a colander in the sink in 1 layer.
Sprinkle with salt and allow to drain for 10 minutes or longer, if you don't the pie will fall apart.
Layer the tomato slices, basil and onion in pie shell.
Season with salt and pepper.
Combine the grated cheeses and mayonnaise together.
Spread mixture on top of the tomatoes and bake for 30 minutes until lightly browned.
To serve: cut into slices and serve warm.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced tomatoes, chopped green onion, and chopped fresh basil leaves.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
5. Spread the pie crust evenly in the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch deep dish pie pan.
6. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the cheese mixture, and then pour the cheese mixture over the tomato mixture.
7. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot.
8. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Tomato Pie!

gt:
Cut the Chinese cabbage and avocado into bite-sized pieces, then set aside.
Pour on the olive oil over the Chinese cabbage, and mix well.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper to adjust the taste.
Add the avocado, and squeeze on the lemon juice.
Top with shio-konbu at the end, and you're done.
pred:
1. Wash and chop the Chinese cabbage into bite-sized pieces.
2. Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Scoop out the flesh and mash it.
3. Rinse the Shio-kombu under cold water and pat it dry with a paper towel.
4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped Chinese cabbage, mashed avocado, Shio-kombu, salt, and black pepper.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt.
6. Pour the olive oil mixture over the cabbage mixture and toss to combine.
7. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

This Vegetarian Chinese Cabbage Salad with Olive Oil Topped with Shio-Konbu is a delicious and healthy meal option that can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course. The combination of Chinese cabbage, avocado, and Shio-kombu provides a balance of flavors and textures, while the olive oil and lemon juice add a touch of freshness and zest.

gt:
Place spices in pan and warm or roast these.
Add 1 tbs butter at this stage if you want non-diet version.
Add a little water with tomato paste and mix.
Add paneer and mushrooms with rest of water.
Simmer until cooked through.
Stirring occasionally.
Add cream or coconut milk here and simmer.
Stir to ensure no kurdling of cream.
pred:
[INST]
To cook a delicious Mushroom Paneer Curry (Diet Version), follow these steps:
1. Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the cumin seeds and white mustard seeds, and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the garlic cloves and sauté until they turn golden brown.
4. Add the vegetable stock powder, and stir to combine.
5. Add the panir, mushrooms, and coriander paste. Stir to combine.
6. Add the tomato paste, and stir to combine.
7. Add the water, and bring the mixture to a boil.
8. Add the garam masala, cayenne pepper, and stir to combine.
9. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the paneer is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
10. Serve the Mushroom Paneer Curry (Diet Version) hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves.

[/INST]

gt:
Sandwich the sliced cheese in nori seaweed.
The nori should be a little bit bigger.
Cut the nori/cheese sandwich along the dotted lines shown in this picture.
Make incisions on the top and trim off the ends.
Squeeze a portion of rice into a teardrop shape.
Cover the part that will be used for the face in plastic wrap, affix bonito flakes on the top of the teardrop for hair.
There's no need to cover the tip.
Wrap a new sheet of nori around the tip.
Affix the cut off nori edge from Step two to the hat as a brim.
Above the brim, affix the red part of the imitation crab stick.
Attach the parts of the face.
Here she is packed in a bento.
pred:
1. Cook the rice according to the package instructions.
2. Rinse the Nori seaweed and pat it dry.
3. Cut the Imitation crab sticks into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a small bowl, mix the Bonito flakes with a little bit of water to create a pink color.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the Deco-furi with a little bit of water to create a pink color.
6. Prepare the bento box with the cooked rice, Nori seaweed, Imitation crab sticks, and sliced cheese.
7. Add the pink coloring to the rice and Nori seaweed, making sure to cover both evenly.
8. Add the pink coloring to the Imitation crab sticks, making sure to coat them evenly.
9. Place the pink rice and Nori seaweed on the bottom of the bento box.
10. Arrange the pink Imitation crab sticks on top of the rice and seaweed.
11. Add the sliced cheese on top of the crab sticks.
12. Serve the Halloween Witch Girl Character Bento immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Stir confectioners' sugar, peanut butter, and butter together in a bowl using your hands until well mixed.
Shape mixture into 1-inch balls and arrange on a waxed paper-lined baking sheet.
Freeze peanut butter balls while preparing chocolate shell.
Melt chocolate chips and coconut oil together in the top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring frequently and scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Remove double boiler from heat and set aside for 5 minutes.
Remove peanut butter balls from freezer and dip each ball into the melted chocolate until evenly coated.
Place coated peanut butter balls back on the baking sheet.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the peanut butter, butter, and confectioners' sugar until smooth.
3. Add the coconut oil and mix until well combined.
4. Roll the mixture into small balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the balls are set and slightly golden.
6. Allow the balls to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

To make the Chocolate Coconut Shell, melt the semisweet chocolate chips in a heat-resistant bowl set over a pan of simmering water, stirring occasionally.
7. Once melted, remove the bowl from the heat and stir in the coconut oil.
8. Pour the chocolate mixture over the coconut shells and let it set in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
9. Once set, carefully remove the chocolate shells from the bowl and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the chocolate shells are set and slightly golden.
11. Allow the chocolate shells to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Once the balls and shells are completely cooled, you can enjoy your delicious Coconut Chocolate Peanut Butter Balls and Chocolate Coconut Shells!

gt:
Arrange the chips to cover an aluminum foil lined toaster oven pan.
Set aside.
In a fry pan or electric skillet over medium heat, cook the onions in a small amount of the beer on medium for about a minute, stirring constantly and adding more liquid to avoid sticking to the pan.
Add the pinto beans and lightly mash the beans with the onions with a fork until it looks like a cross between refried beans and whole beans.
Add more beer or water and stir as the mixture thickens.
Add the meatless crumbles.
Stir to mix and add enough liquid to keep it from sticking at all.
Sprinkle the spices on to the most liquid areas and stir.
Remove from heat.
Bake the chips in the toaster oven for about 4 minutes on 350 degrees or until they are hot to the touch.
No need to preheat if you use the toaster oven and watch carefully to avoid browning.
Note that chips will get crispier as they cool.
Stir corn into the bean mixture and heat through.
Stir in salsa now if you prefer.
Spoon the mixture over the waiting hot chips.
Top with the tomatoes and sliced romaine lettuce.
Additional toppings can include any or all of these: salsa, grated cheese, diced green pepper, avocado, tofutti sour cream and/or jalapeno peppers.
Grab a fork and a plate if the tortilla pieces were too small to use as a scoop.
Enjoy!
pred:
[INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Spread the tortilla chips on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
3. In a large bowl, combine the onion, beer or water, black beans or pinto beans, veggie crumbles, turmeric, garlic, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
4. Pour the mixture over the tortilla chips, making sure they are evenly coated.
5. Bake the nachos in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the nachos from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Add the diced tomatoes, romaine lettuce, and any remaining onion for garnish.
8. Serve the Veggie Nachos immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Flour and brown Roast on all sides.
Mix Water, Soup Mix and Mushroom soup together.
Add mixture and roast to dutch oven, cover tightly.
Cook at 300deg for 2-2-1/2 hrs or until internal temp reaches 140deg.
I add carrots and celery to cook with roast for added flavor, but I cook vegetables for serving separately so they don't get too mushy.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the French onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, and 12 cups of water. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
3. Add the beef roast to the pot, and cook for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the roast is tender and cooked through.
4. Remove the roast from the pot, and let it rest for a few minutes. Then, shred the beef into bite-sized pieces.
5. Return the beef to the pot, and stir in the root vegetables (such as carrots, potatoes, and onions). Cook for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. Season the pot roast with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Nana's Pot Roast hot, over a bed of mashed potatoes or rice. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Beat shortening in mixer until fluffy.
Add both sugars and beat for several minutes; until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla, water, and egg.
Beat until incorporated.
In a seperate bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and baking soda.
SLOWLY add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and stir on low for several seconds.
Add the chocolate chips.
Using a scooper, place each ball of dough onto a cookiesheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes; or until you stick a toothpick in a cookie and it comes out clean.
pred:
To make delicious Yummy Chocolate Chip Cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the vegetable shortening, white sugar, and brown sugar.
3. Add the vanilla extract and water, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, flour, salt, and baking soda.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
6. Fold in the Ghirardelli milk chocolate chips.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden and the centers are set.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Yummy Chocolate Chip Cookies!

gt:
In a large pan saute onion, carrot and celery in the butter until soft and tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in flour until blended.
Slowly add broth.
Stir in rice, chicken, salt and pepper.
Bring to boil over medium heat.
Cook for a few minutes until it starts to thicken.
Stir in milk and cook for 3-5 minutes.
Garnish with parsley or chives.
pred:
To make Creamy Chicken Wild Rice Soup, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the carrot and celery, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until they are tender.
3. Pour in the chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil.
4. Add the wild rice, and cook until the rice is tender, about 20-25 minutes.
5. Remove the pot from the heat, and let it sit for a few minutes.
6. Add the cooked chicken, salt, pepper, and eavoporated milk (or any milk product) to the pot. Stir to combine.
7. Allow the soup to cool slightly, then blend the mixture until smooth.
8. Return the soup to the pot, and reheat over low heat.
9. Serve the Creamy Chicken Wild Rice Soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh parsley, if desired.

This delicious and comforting soup is perfect for a cozy meal or a hearty lunch. The combination of chicken, wild rice, and creamy sauce creates a rich and satisfying dish that is both filling and flavorful.

gt:
Grease 8-inch square baking pan; set aside.
Combine water, 1/4 cup brown sugar and dates in 1-quart saucepan.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 4-5 minutes or until mixture thickens and comes to a boil.
Cool at least 30 minutes.
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine all crust ingredients in bowl.
Beat at low speed, scraping bowl often, until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Reserve 1 cup.
Press remaining crumbs into prepared pan.
Spoon filling over crust; sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Bake 30-35 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool completely.
Cut into bars.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the water, brown sugar, and chopped dates. Mix well.
3. Add the flour, oats, and softened butter to the bowl. Mix until the dough comes together.
4. Press the dough evenly into the bottom of a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Using a spatula, carefully lift the bars from the dish and transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Cut the bars into desired sizes and serve.

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 450.
Grease an 8-inch cast-iron skillet or baking pan and place in oven to heat.
Beat egg in mixing bowl.
Add remaining ingredients; stir until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the egg, buttermilk, water, vegetable oil, or melted shortening, and cornmeal mix.
3. Gradually add the self-rising flour, stirring until the batter is smooth and well-combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the cornbread for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cornbread to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

By following these key steps, you will be able to prepare a delicious and moist Pea Picker's Cornbread.

gt:
In a small saucepan combine all ingredients.
Cook and stir until bubbly.
Serve with grilled tofu, chicken, beef, or pork, or lightly brush sauce on meat during last 10 minutes of grilling time.
Cover and store in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.
pred:
[/INST]

1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, which include 12 cup hoisin sauce, 14 cup soy sauce, 12 teaspoon sesame oil, 12 teaspoon sugar, 3 garlic cloves, minced, and 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and minced garlic. Whisk the ingredients together until well combined.

3. Add the minced fresh ginger to the mixture and stir to combine.

4. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning as needed. You may need to add more hoisin sauce, soy sauce, or sugar to achieve the desired flavor.

5. Use the sauce immediately or store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

6. To use the sauce, simply pour it over your favorite dish, such as stir-fried noodles, rice, or vegetables. You can also use it as a marinade for meat or tofu.

7. Enjoy your delicious Asian Sauce!

gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F.
In a food processor, combine the arugula, garlic, ginger, curry paste, coconut milk and sugar.
Pulse to combine and continue until smooth.
Transfer to a small saucepan and keep on a light simmer while you sear the shrimp.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high.
Arrange the shrimp in a single layer in the pan and sear for 2 minutes.
Flip and sear 1 more minute.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper and remove shrimp from the pan.
Spoon the arugula coconut pesto sauce over each naan bread.
Top with shrimp and sliced peppers.
Place the pizzas on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, or until the the naan is golden brown and slightly crispy.
Top with fresh cilantro, spritz with fresh lime juice and devour.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger, and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
3. Add the green curry paste, coconut milk, sugar, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Add the shrimp to the skillet, and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the shrimp are cooked through and pink.
5. Remove the skillet from the heat, and stir in the arugula.
6. Place the cooked shrimp mixture on a baking sheet, and spread it evenly.
7. Place the naan on the baking sheet, and top it with the shrimp mixture.
8. Bake the naan in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
9. Remove the baked naan from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Cut the naan into wedges, and serve the Shrimp Naan Pizzas with Thai Coconut Arugula Pesto.

[/INST]

This delicious Shrimp Naan Pizzas with Thai Coconut Arugula Pesto dish is a fusion of flavors and textures, combining the richness of the shrimp, the creaminess of the coconut milk, the spiciness of the green curry paste, and the freshness of the arugula and cilantro. The combination of these elements results in a delightful and satisfying meal that is both visually appealing and flavorful.

gt:
Place pork in a wide nonstick frying pan.
Drain about 1/2 cup liquid from tomatoes into pan.
Bring to a boil over high heat; then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Uncover pan; add onions, celery, oregano, and sage.
Cook over high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and drippings are browned (8 to 10 minutes).
Add bay leaves.
Cut up tomatoes then add tomatoes and their remaining liquid and stir to scrape browned bits free.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 more minutes.
Stir in bell pepper and chilies; cover and continue to cook stirring occasionally until pork is very tender when pierced (about 15 more minutes).
If chili is too thin, uncover and simmer until it's as thick as you like.
Skim and discard fat, if necessary.
To serve, spoon chili over rice and garnish with cilantro sprigs.
pred:
1. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add the pork cubes and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the pork from the pot and set aside.
2. In the same pot, add the onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the celery and cook for another 5 minutes.
3. Add the cooked rice, oregano, sage, bay leaves, and green bell pepper to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the cooked pork back to the pot, along with the tomatoes, anaheim chilies, and poblano peppers. Stir to combine all ingredients.
5. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the Chili Verde over rice, garnished with fresh cilantro stems.

[/INST]

gt:
Combine chicken broth, potatoes, and garlic in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer and cook until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to cool for 5 minutes.
Stir milk into the mixture, place over medium heat, and simmer until warm, about 5 minutes; add soy sauce and black pepper.
Sprinkle Cheddar cheese into the soup in small batches while stirring, allowing each addition to melt into the soup before adding more.
Pour soup into a blender no more than half full.
Cover and hold lid in place; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
Puree in batches until smooth.
Return blended soup to the saucepan; return to a simmer over medium heat.
Slowly stream beer into the soup while gently stirring.
Garnish with paprika to serve.
pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, potatoes, garlic, and soy sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.

2. Add the shredded Cheddar cheese to the pot and stir until melted and smooth.

3. In a small bowl, whisk together the beer and ground black pepper. Pour the beer mixture into the pot, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.

4. Cook the soup over medium heat for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the soup reaches your desired consistency.

5. Season the soup with paprika, or to taste, and serve immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Dip your pounded Pork in the juice of your choice and then into the bread crumbs, pat the crumbs into the meat.
Spray your Non stick Fry pan lightly with oil Brown the pork schnitzels on both sides and remove from the pan.
Spray the pan again lightly with oil Add all the remaining ingredients except cheese& Bread.
Saute until heated through and return Snitzels to the pan, Heat through and serve on toasted bread of your choice or without.
Drizzle cheese on top, garnish with fresh tomatoes and enjoy.
pred:
To cook a Pseudo Italian/German Schnitzel Dinner Sandwich, follow these steps:

1. Prepare the pork: Pound the pork cutlets or steaks very thin using a meat mallet or a rolling pin. Season the pork with salt and pepper.

2. Prepare the breading: In a shallow dish, mix the breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper. In another shallow dish, mix the cooking spray.

3. Coat the pork: Dip the pounded pork in the breading mixture, then coat it evenly with the cooking spray.

4. Heat the fry pan: Heat a fry pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of cooking spray to the pan, and cook the pork until it is golden brown on both sides. This should take about 2-3 minutes per side.

5. Assemble the sandwich: Once the pork is cooked, place it between two slices of bread or bun. Add any desired toppings, such as sun-dried tomatoes, onions, green and red peppers, mushrooms, jalapeno, and garlic.

6. Add condiments: If desired, add a slice of fresh tomato for a touch of freshness, and top with grated parmesan cheese.

7. Serve: Serve the Pseudo Italian/German Schnitzel Dinner Sandwich warm and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
In a pot add broth and broccoli.
Then add salt.
Cook till desired tenderness.
Drain if any liquid is left
In a saucepan add coconut milk.
Heat add butter.
When it starts to bubble add cheese.
Stirring constantly.
Till thickens
Add parmesan chickenballs to broccoli.
Pour sauce over the top serve hope you enjoy!
This would be good with Brussels sprouts instead of broccoli.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the chicken broth over medium heat.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded cheese, salt, and butter.
4. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat.
5. Add the chickenballs to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
6. Remove the chickenballs from the skillet and set aside.
7. Add the broccoli to the skillet and cook until it is tender but still slightly crunchy.
8. Add the coconut milk to the skillet and stir to combine.
9. Add the chickenballs back to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Pour the cheese mixture over the top of the skillet and stir to combine.
11. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Serve the Cheesy creamy broccoli with chickenballs immediately.

[/INST]

gt:
Chop onion and mix in with hamburger meat.
Season hamburger with season salt, garlic salt and pepper.
Brown hamburger.
Drain both cans of tomatoes and add tomatoes in after burger is browned and drained.
Add in pasta sauce and let simmer for a few mins.
Layer bottom of pan with sauce and add noodles.
Layer noodles with sauce
Add ricotta cheese over top of the sauce...
I like to mix my cheese in with the sauce.
Layer again with noodles and sauce
After your lasagna has been layered on top add your mozzarella cheese(both packs) and sprinkle with parmesean cheese.
Preheat oven to 375F and bake for an hour.
Cover with foil.
After hour is up remove foil and let bake another 10-15 mins.
Then eat up!
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the diced onion and cook until softened.
4. Stir in the canned tomatoes, garlic, and basil, and cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, season salt, and pepper.
6. Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Layer the cooked ground beef and onion mixture, noodles, and ricotta cheese mixture on top of the sauce.
8. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese evenly over the top.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting and serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Pre-heat oven to 335
Mix together butter, shortening, eggs, vanilla, sugar and brown sugar in bowl until smooth.
In a separate bowl mix flour, salt, baking powder and soda.
Sift flour mixture into wet mixture until half the bowl is empty.
Now add chocolate chips, then sift the rest of the flour mixture in.
Put in fridge for about ten minutes until able to form solid balls.
Remove from the fridge and make six quarter size balls on cookie sheet.
Put mixture back in fridge while baking.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and eat.
pred:
To make a delightful no foolz chocolate chip cookie dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and shortening until smooth.
3. Add the sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and then add them to the butter mixture. Mix until well combined.
5. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the mixture, and mix until a dough forms.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious no foolz chocolate chip cookies!

gt:
Wash the potatoes
Boil your potatoes skin on dont break skin
When potatoes are done save a quarter cup of potato water you boiled them in.
Drain the rest let potatoes sit and rest 3 minutes to steam themselves with skins on.after you have waited the time, peel the potatoes srcaping with a spoon.
Heat oil in a pan slice the garlic, and fry till brown.
cut potatoes into bite sized pieces.
stir drained spinach into pan of garlic, olive oil.
add rosemary, salt, and potatoes.
Stir just a bit add potato water if needed.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Add parsley
Serve hope you enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the olive oil, salt, and rosemary.
4. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
5. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.
6. While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the spinach. Rinse the spinach and pat it dry.
7. In a small bowl, mix the chopped garlic with the olive oil.
8. Add the spinach to the bowl with the garlic mixture and toss to coat the spinach evenly.
9. Spread the spinach out on a baking sheet or roasting pan.
10. Roast the spinach in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly crispy on the edges.
11. Once the potatoes and spinach are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
12. In a small bowl, mix the grated parmesan cheese with the chopped parsley.
13. Add the cooked potatoes and spinach to a large mixing bowl.
14. Toss the potatoes and spinach with the parmesan and parsley mixture.
15. Serve the Italian potatoes and spinach immediately, or refrigerate and serve later. Enjoy your delicious Italian potatoes with spinach!

gt:
For the dressing:
Drain the cashews.
Put all of the ingredients, except for the olive oil and water, in a blender or food processor, and process until somewhat smooth.
Scrape down the sides of the processor and turn it back on.
Sowly add the water, one tablespoon at a time.
While the processor is still running, add the oil.
Continue processing until the dressing is smooth and pourable.
(You may need to add more water.)
For the salad:
Put all of the salad ingredients in a large bowl except for the pine nuts.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss.
Plate the salad and sprinkle the top of each with pine nuts.
Use organic ingredients whenever possible.
pred:
1. Cook the quinoa according to package instructions, then let it cool.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chopped romaine lettuce, sliced cucumber, sliced red onion, and cooked garbanzo beans.
3. In a small bowl, mix the pine nuts, cashews, and liquid from the olive jar.
4. Add the sliced cherry or plum tomatoes, pitted kalamata olives, and red onion to the large bowl.
5. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil, and water.
6. Add the dressing to the large bowl and toss the ingredients to combine.
7. Serve the Greek inspired quinoa salad immediately, or refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

gt:
Mix first six ingredients in a wide bowl.
Pat chicken with paper towel to remove extra moisture.
Cut chicken breasts into strips (3/4" to 1" thick).
Turn heat on high.
Add oil to a large frying pan.
You will need about 1/2" of oil in the bottom of the pan.
Heat to med-high (not smoking).
While oil is heating up, dip chicken strips into milk.
Let excess drip off.
Roll strips in cornmeal mixture until thoroughly coated.
Fry the chicken strips for approximately 2-3 minutes per side (until coating is golden brown).
Scoop rice onto the centre of each person's plate.
Divide chicken strips evenly among the plates and place on top of rice.
Serve and enjoy!
pred:
[INSTR]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the yellow cornmeal, all-purpose white flour, cayenne, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
3. Add the milk, stirring until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps.
4. Add the chicken breast to the bowl, and toss to coat the chicken evenly with the seasoned mixture.
5. Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat.
6. Carefully place the chicken in the hot oil, and cook until it is golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
7. Remove the chicken from the oil, and place it on a wire rack or a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
8. In a large saucepan, cook the long grain white rice according to the package instructions.
9. Serve the chicken on top of the rice, and enjoy your delicious R U Chicken dish.

[/INSTR]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine the pork with the soya sauce,salt,pepper and sesame oil.
Put about a tsp of filling in the center of each wonton skin and enclose the filling to make a ball shape or a triangle,sealing with a little water.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Put the dumplings,in batches into the water until they rise to the surface.
Remove with a slotted spoon.
Mix hot water with the peanut butter until well combined and then add the soya sauce,rice vinegar,oil,garlic and chilies.
Serve on top of the dumplings.
pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Grind the raw pork through a meat grinder or use a food processor to achieve a fine, even texture.
- Combine the ground pork, soya sauce, salt, pepper, sesame seed oil, and crushed red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
- Rinse the wonton wrappers under cold water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
- In a small bowl, mix the smooth peanut butter, hot water, and soy sauce.
- Set aside the ground pork mixture, the peanut butter sauce, and the wonton wrappers.

2. Prepare the dumplings:
- Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
- On a clean, dry surface, shape the ground pork mixture into small balls using your hands or a cookie scoop.
- Place the shaped dumplings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
- Bake the dumplings in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.

3. Prepare the sauce:
- While the dumplings are baking, carefully heat the peanut butter sauce in a small saucepan over low heat.
- Stir the sauce occasionally to ensure it does not burn or stick to the bottom of the pan.

4. Assemble the dish:
- Once the dumplings are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
- Carefully transfer the dumplings to a serving plate.
- Pour the peanut butter sauce over the dumplings, allowing it to coat the dumplings evenly.
- Serve the Hunan Dumplings with Peanut Butter Sauce immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Hunan Dumplings with Peanut Butter Sauce!

gt:
mix it all up in a bowl and funnel it into some empty seasoning containers.
Then sprinkle it onto just about anything to give your food some extra magic!
POW RIGHT IN THE KISSER!!
!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1/3 cup of salt, 8 tsp of paprika, 4 tsp of black pepper, 2 tsp of onion powder, 2 tsp of cayenne pepper, 1 tsp of coriander, and 1 tsp of turmeric.
3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly to ensure even distribution.
4. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the spices are fragrant and the mixture is dry and crumbly.
6. Remove the mixture from the oven and let it cool completely.
7. Store the Magic Dust in an airtight container for up to 6 months.
8. To use the Magic Dust, simply sprinkle a small amount onto your desired dish, such as a salad, stir-fry, or any other recipe that requires a touch of extra flavor.

This Magic Dust can be used to enhance the taste of various dishes, adding a burst of flavor and aroma. The combination of spices creates a unique and delicious seasoning that can be used in a variety of cuisines.

gt:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Place the oats in the bowl of a stand mixer or into the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and ground pepper and add to the oats.
Add the remaining ingredients except the olive oil and mix at medium speed or pulse together until well blended.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl and the beater and mix again for about 30 seconds.
Add 2 tablespoons of the oil to a 9-inch cast iron skillet and place in the oven for 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven and spread the batter in the pan.
Place in the oven and bake 30 minutes, until the top is nicely browned and a tester comes out clean when inserted in the middle.
Remove from the heat and serve hot, or allow to cool on a rack.
pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the rolled oats, whole wheat pastry flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and herbs.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the chopped herbs, grated onion, and 3 tablespoons of olive oil.
6. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan or a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pan comes out clean.
8. Allow the pan bread to cool for a few minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

Enjoy your delicious Savory Oatmeal Pan Bread!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a saucepan over low heat, combine caramels, butter and milk.
Cook, stirring frequently, until smooth.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt.
Gradually mix in the melted caramel mixture.
Stir in pecans.
Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown.
Allow pie to cool until filling is firm.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pie shells, butter, and sugar. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and salt.
5. Pour the mixture into the pie shells, making sure to evenly distribute the mixture.

12. Serve and enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees .
Brease a large cookie sheet.
Pound chicken breasts between 2 sheets of waxed paper to about 1/4 inch thick.
Dip chicken into salad dressing to coat.
Then dip into crushed chips, making sure chicken is well-coated.
Place on cookie sheet.
Bake 30 minutes.
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a bowl, mix the chicken breast halves with the ranch salad dressing.
3. Spread the crushed nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
4. Place the chicken mixture on top of the tortilla chips, ensuring that the chicken is evenly distributed.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the tortilla chips are crispy.
6. Serve the El Rancho Chicken over a bed of crushed tortilla chips.

gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Line 13x9-inch pan with Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, with ends of foil extending over sides; spray with cooking spray.
Mix flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar and brown sugar in medium bowl until blended; cut in butter with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in oats and nuts.
Reserve 1 cup oat mixture; press remaining onto bottom of prepared pan.
Bake 15 min.
Beat cream cheese, remaining sugar, eggs, pumpkin and spice with mixer until blended; pour over crust.
Sprinkle with reserved oat mixture.
Bake 25 min.
; cool 10 min.
Use foil to transfer dessert from pan to wire rack; cool completely.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, granulated sugar, and brown sugar. Add the cold butter or margarine and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3. Stir in the oats, chopped pecans, and pumpkin pie spice.
4. Press the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. While the bars are baking, prepare the cream cheese filling. In a small mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the pumpkin.
7. Once the bars are done, let them cool for a few minutes. Then, use a spatula to carefully spread the cream cheese filling over the cooled bars.
8. Return the baking dish to the oven and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set and the bars are heated through.
9. Allow the bars to cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares and serving. Enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Put all of the ingredients except for the ice into a blender.
These should total 1 cup of liquid.
Blend these ingredients on low a few times.
Fire up the "ice crush" (or highest speed) on the blender for about 30 seconds.
Pour into a 600ml glass and enjoy!
pred:
To prepare a delicious Perfect Iced Coffee, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 3 teaspoons of sugar, 1 teaspoon of instant coffee, and 18-14 fluid ounce vanilla (splash). Whisk the ingredients together until the sugar is fully dissolved.

2. In a separate bowl, combine the cooking spray (4 sprays) and 13 cups of half-and-half. Whisk the mixture until it is well combined and frothy.

3. Pour the vanilla-sugar mixture into the bowl with the cooking spray and half-and-half mixture. Whisk the ingredients together until they are well combined and frothy.

4. Add the 13 cups of milk to the mixture and whisk until the ingredients are fully combined.

5. Pour the mixture into a large glass or container, and add 600 ml of crushed ice. Stir the mixture until the ice is fully incorporated and the coffee is chilled.

6. Serve the Perfect Iced Coffee immediately, and enjoy the delicious, refreshing beverage.

[/INST]

gt:
Set a pizza stone on the bottom or on the bottom shelf of the oven.
Preheat the oven to 500, allowing at least 30 minutes for the stone to heat.
On a lightly floured work surface, cut the dough into 4 pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 10 minutes.
In a saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the asparagus until tender, about 4 minutes.
Drain and pat dry.
Slice the asparagus 1/4 inch thick on the diagonal and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the shallot and 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
On a lightly floured surface, roll 1 ball of dough into an 8-inch round.
Dust a pizza peel with semolina and set the dough round on it.
Lightly brush the dough with olive oil.
Scatter 1/2 cup of the Fontina cheese and 1/4 cup of the mozzarella on the dough, then top with one-fourth of the asparagus and 1/4 cup of the prosciutto.
Slide the pizzetta onto the hot stone.
Bake for about 6 minutes, or until it is crisp and browned on the bottom and bubbling on top.
Using a large spatula, transfer the pizzetta to a work surface and cut it into quarters.
Sprinkle the pizzetta with the sorrel and lemon juice and serve.
As soon as 1 pizzetta is in the oven, prepare the next.
Slide it into the oven when the first comes out.
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pizza or bread dough, water, and a pinch of salt. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let the dough rise for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
3. In the meantime, prepare the asparagus by trimming the tough ends and discarding them. In a large skillet, cook the asparagus over medium heat until it is tender but still crisp. Season the asparagus with salt and pepper.
4. In a small bowl, mix the extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice, and minced garlic.
5. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Roll the dough out into a 1/2-inch-thick circle.
6. Spread the olive oil mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
7. Layer the asparagus, Fontina cheese, and prosciutto on top of the dough, starting with the asparagus, then the cheese, and finally the prosciutto.
8. Fold the dough over the filling, creating a half-moon shape. Brush the edges with additional olive oil.
9. Transfer the pizzettas to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the pizzettas in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the pizzettas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
12. Sprinkle the pizzettas with semolina or fine cornmeal, and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Asparagus Pizzettas with Fontina and Prosciutto!

gt:
Prepare barbecue grill (medium heat).
Place onions on the grill and cover.
Grill until onions are very tender when pierced with a skewer, about 15 minutes.
Serve with salt.
To pop the onion out of its papery skin, pick it up by the root end and squeeze.
pred:
1. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. In a large bowl, toss the red pearl onions with salt and pepper to season them.
3. Once the grill is hot, place the onions on the grill and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are slightly charred and tender.
4. Remove the onions from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes.
5. In a small bowl, mix together a tablespoon of olive oil, a squeeze of lemon juice, and a pinch of sugar.
6. Add the cooled onions to the bowl with the dressing and toss to coat them evenly.
7. Serve the Grilled Red Pearl Onions as a side dish or a topping for your favorite main course.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large stock pot or Dutch oven on medium heat, start melting the butter.
Add the wine to the butter and let simmer.
Taste the mixture before you add the garlic.
The butter should cut the acidic taste of the tannins in the wine.
If it still has a bitter taste, add a little more butter and keep tasting until you like it.
Add the garlic to the wine by using a garlic press.
You want the garlic to nearly dissolve.
Let this cook for a couple of minutes on a fast simmer.
Add the tomato paste to the wine and garlic and let the liquid cook for a couple of more minutes until it becomes a roux (near the consistency of thin gravy).
The recipe from here goes quickly.
Add the broth, then the water, tortellini, corn, peas and beans.
Keep the soup on medium to medium high heat.
Add all of your spices now and while the soup is working its magic, cut the zucchini into circles, then cut those in half.
After the soup has cooked for about ten to fifteen minutes (before the pasta plumps), add the zucchini.
Just before the pasta is al dente, add the mushrooms.
They only take a couple of minutes to cook.
Garnish with Parmesan and olives.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt the 4 teaspoons of unsalted butter over medium heat.
2. Add the 1/2 cup of Pinot Noir (light and fruity) and cook until the liquid has reduced by half.
3. Add the 3 cloves of garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the 1 teaspoon of tomato paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the 1 package of 32 oz beef broth and the 4 cups of water to the pot.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
7. Add the 1 package of 8 oz tortellini, 7 ounces of corn, 7 ounces of peas, 7 ounces of lima beans, and 1-1/2 cups of small zucchini to the pot.
8. Cook the soup for 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
9. Season the soup with salt, pepper, oregano, rosemary, and bay leaves to taste.
10. Serve the Veggie & Tortellini Soup hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

[/INST]

gt:
Place all but the tomatoes in a food processpor and pulse about 6 x`s to make a spread.
Fill the tomatoes and place on a serving plater.
Serve with crackers or vegie sticks.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

2. Cut the large tomatoes in half and place them cut-side down on a baking sheet. Roast them in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.

3. While the tomatoes are roasting, prepare the stuffing by combining the cooked chicken, mayonnaise, cilantro, and salt and pepper in a large bowl.

4. Once the tomatoes are done roasting, let them cool for a few minutes. Then, carefully scoop out the seeds and pulp from the tomatoes, leaving behind the skin.

5. Stuff the tomatoes with the chicken and chipotle salad mixture, dividing the mixture evenly among the tomatoes.

6. Place the stuffed tomatoes on a baking sheet and bake them in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the filling is hot and the tomatoes are tender.

7. Serve the stuffed tomatoes as a main course or appetizer, garnished with additional cilantro or chopped red pepper, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Tomato Stuffed With Chicken Chipotle Salad!

gt:
Rub the inside of a large wooden bowl with the garlic clove and then either discard it or save it for another use.
Put the mustard in the bowl and whisk in the balsamic vinegar and soy sauce (a French secret!)
vigorously for about 10 seconds to get a creamy consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Drizzle in the olive oil as slowly as possible with 1 hand while whisking as quickly as possible with the other hand to emulsify.
Lay the salad greens on top of the dressing and toss just before serving.
pred:
To make a delicious Cafe Green Salad by Melissa D'arabian, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the garlic clove, Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
3. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, 3 cups of salad greens, and the dressing mixture. Toss the salad gently to coat the greens evenly.
4. Spread the salad greens on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until they are slightly wilted and tender.
5. Remove the salad from the oven and let it cool slightly.
6. Serve the Cafe Green Salad immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

This delicious Cafe Green Salad is a healthy and flavorful dish that can be enjoyed as a main course or a side dish. The combination of garlic, Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, salt, and pepper creates a unique and savory dressing that complements the tender, slightly wilted salad greens. The roasting process adds a smoky, slightly charred flavor to the salad, making it a delightful and satisfying meal.

gt:
Pour 1/4 cup dressing over chicken in shallow dish; turn to evenly coat both sides of each breast.
Refrigerate 30 min.
to marinate.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade.
Cook chicken in large skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium-high heat 4 min.
or until each chicken breast is done and evenly browned, turning after 2 min.
Remove chicken from skillet; cover to keep warm.
Add cracker crumbs and garlic to skillet; cook 5 min.
or until golden brown, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat; stir in parsley.
Place salad greens on platter; top with chicken, tomatoes and crumb mixture.
Drizzle with remaining dressing.
pred:

2. In a small bowl, mix the crushed Ritz crackers with whole wheat, and set aside.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing, minced garlic, and parsley.
4. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then coat them in the dressing mixture.
5. Place the chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Allow the chicken to cool slightly before slicing it into thin strips.
7. In a large bowl, toss the mixed greens with the tomatoes.

9. Add the chicken strips to the salad, and toss to combine.
10. Serve the Chicken & Mixed Greens Salad with Milanese Crumbs immediately.
