gt:
Put oil and butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-low heat.
When butter is melted, add flour and cook, stirring almost constantly, until roux darkens and becomes fragrant, about 15 to 20 minutes; as it cooks, adjust heat as necessary to keep mixture from burning.
Add onion, bell pepper, celery and garlic and raise heat to medium.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently, until vegetables have softened, about 10 more minutes.
Stir in the stock, tomatoes, thyme, oregano, bay leaves and cayenne.
Cover, bring to a boil, then reduce heat so soup bubbles steadily.
Cook for about 20 minutes or until flavors meld.
Add scallops and cook until they are no longer translucent, about 2 minutes.
Remove bay leaves.
Taste, adjust seasoning and serve, garnished with parsley.
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the butter and let it melt.
3. Add the flour and stir until it forms a smooth roux.
4. Cook the roux for a few minutes, stirring constantly, until it reaches a light golden color.
5. Gradually add the vegetable or chicken stock, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
7. Add the chopped tomatoes, thyme, oregano, bay leaves, and cayenne pepper. Stir to combine.
8. Cook for an additional 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
9. Add the scallops and cook for about 5 minutes or until they are cooked through.
10. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the Scallop Gumbo over a bed of rice or noodles.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Start with a cold metal skillet and place bacon in a single layer.
Turn heat to medium and cook until just crispy.
Remove bacon from pan but leave bacon grease in pan!
Dab off any excess grease, and dice bacon into bite-sized pieces.
Cook diced onions in bacon grease.
Place all ingredients (including cooked bacon and onions) into a large bowl.
Stir and place into an oven safe dish.
Cover with tin foil and bake for 45 minutes.
Remove tin foil, stir, and bake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes, or until the beans are hot!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the diced onion until softened.
4. Add the Busch's Original Baked Beans to the skillet and stir to combine.
5. In a small bowl, mix the yellow mustard, ketchup, maple syrup, dark brown sugar, lemon juice, and Spicee Gourmet's St. Louis Rib Rub.
6. Pour the sauce mixture over the beans in the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the cooked bacon to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
9. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Serve the BBQ Baked Beans hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Just a tip: start cooking the rice while you prepare the rest of the jambalaya so it is ready to add in during the last step.
In a 4-6 quart pot, cook sausage and poultry over medium heat until cooked through and juices of the chicken run clear.
Drain the grease (you may only need to do this if you arent using a lean sausage), scrape the meat onto a plate and set aside.
Melt the butter in the same pot over medium heat.
Stir in the flour and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for one minute.
Add the vegetables, basil, the Creole (or Cajun) seasoning, the Rotel tomatoes and the sugar.
Stir well.
Simmer the mixture over low or medium-low heat for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are mostly tender (theyll continue to cook a few minutes longer in the next step).
At this point, add the sausage and chicken back to the pot, and cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chicken broth and simmer 5 minutes longer.
Stir in the hot, steamed rice and simmer until you achieve your desired consistency.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the butter over medium heat.
3. Add the sausage and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
4. Add the chicken and cook until it is no longer pink.
5. Remove the chicken and sausage from the pan, and set aside.
6. In the same pan, add the flour and cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly.
7. Gradually add the chicken broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
8. Add the cooked sausage and chicken back to the pan, and bring the mixture to a boil.
9. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
10. Season the jambalaya with salt, pepper, and any additional seasonings, if desired.
11. Serve the jambalaya over the cooked rice.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Crush ice in a blender.
Add the rest of the ingredients and blend until smooth; about 30-60 seconds.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. Begin by pouring 1 cup of skim milk into a blender or food processor.
2. Add 12 cups of frozen berries, such as blueberries, chopped strawberries, cherries, raspberries (black or red), and mix until smooth.
3. To sweeten the smoothie, add 4 tablespoons of Splenda sugar substitute or 4 tablespoons of sugar, and mix until well combined.
4. Add 4 -5 tablespoons of cocoa powder to the blender or food processor, and mix until smooth.
5. Finally, add 1 cup of ice cubes to the blender or food processor, and blend until smooth and creamy.
6. Optionally, you can add a splash of vanilla extract or a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor.
7. Blend until smooth and creamy, and enjoy your delicious Low Fat Chocolate Berry Smoothie.

This recipe is designed to create a delicious and healthy smoothie that combines the natural sweetness of berries with the rich flavor of chocolate. The use of skim milk and Splenda sugar substitute or sugar ensures that the smoothie is low in fat and calories, making it an ideal choice for those looking to maintain a healthy diet. Additionally, the ice cubes help to create a smooth and creamy texture, while the cocoa powder adds a subtle chocolate flavor that complements the berries.

gt:
In a skillet, brown sausage and drain well.
Add cheddar and Parmesan cheeses, oregano, garlic salt, tomato paste, and tomato sauce and mix well.
Simmer 20 minutes.
Cool.
Open one of the biscuit cans and remove the biscuits.
Separate each biscuit into 4 layers.
Place the layers on a cookie sheet.
Spread 1 teaspoon of sauce mixture on each layer.
Repeat with second can of biscuits.
At this point, you can place the cookie sheets in the freezer until pizzas are frozen.
Store frozen pizzas in a ziploc bag in the freezer until ready to use.
When ready to serve, top pizzas with mozzarella cheese.
Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded pork sausage, shredded sharp cheddar cheese, grated parmesan cheese, oregano, garlic salt, and tomato paste. Mix well.
3. Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch (23cm) springform pan or a deep-dish pizza pan.
4. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden.
5. While the crust is baking, prepare the toppings. In a small bowl, mix the shredded mozzarella cheese with the tomato sauce.
6. Once the crust is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Spread the mozzarella cheese mixture evenly over the crust.
8. Return the crust to the oven and bake for an additional 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Use a spatula to transfer the crust to a serving plate.
11. Cut the crust into 12 equal pieces, and serve each piece with a side of your favorite dipping sauce, such as marinara sauce or ranch dressing.

Enjoy your delicious Two-Bite Pizza!

gt:
Remove turkey from wrapper and set gravy packet in refrigerator for the time being.
Leave netting on turkey breast and keep the turkey in one piece; rub turkey down on both sides with poultry seasoning and set in crock pot.
Add 2 cans of chicken broth to the crock pot, set to low, and cook for 8-10 hours.
At about the 5-6 hour mark, turn the turkey over, and add one more can of broth to the crock pot.
At the end of the cooking time, remove turkey from the pot and place in a shallow baking pan, remove the netting, rub the top with butter, and set under a broiler in the oven to crisp up a bit.
Allow the turkey to sit 15 minutes before cutting.
If you wish, use a portion of the pan juices to pour over some of your dressing/stuffing if you made some to give it extra flavor.
Use the remaining pan juices mixed with the gravy packet in a saucepan on the stove, heated with some cornstarch or flour to make a gravy for the meat.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the turkey breast with poultry seasoning, ensuring it is evenly distributed.
3. Place the turkey breast in a large, oven-safe Crock Pot.
4. Pour the reduced-fat chicken broth over the turkey breast, making sure it is evenly distributed.
5. Add the butter to the Crock Pot, ensuring it is melted and evenly distributed.
6. Cook the turkey breast in the oven for approximately 4-5 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the turkey breast from the Crock Pot and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before slicing it and serving.

This step-by-step guide will ensure that you have a delicious and tender Crock Pot Turkey Breast dish that is both easy to prepare and enjoyable to share with your loved ones.

gt:
In a medium sauce pan, add onion, peppers, garlic, milk, half-and-half, cumin, salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Bring to a boil.
Then add in white cheddar cheese.
Stir until the cheese has completely melted.
I had to add in a bit of flour to help the queso thicken.
Add in flour as needed.
Modified from Blue Mesas Queso Blanco Recipe.
pred:
To cook a delicious Restaurant Style White Queso dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped yellow onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the chopped serrano and poblano peppers to the skillet and cook for another 3-4 minutes, or until they are slightly softened.
4. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
5. Add the 2% milk, half-and-half, cumin, salt, pepper, and garlic salt to the skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens slightly.
6. Gradually add the white cheddar cheese, stirring until melted and smooth.
7. If the mixture is too thick, add a little flour to achieve the desired consistency.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

This delicious Restaurant Style White Queso dish is perfect for sharing with friends and family, and it can be served with tortilla chips or as a topping for various dishes.

gt:
Melt butter over low heat in medium saucepan.
Blend in flour, then add milk, all at once.
Cook, stirring constantly until slightly thickened.
Add shredded cheese, season and continue to cook until cheese melts.
Remove from heat.
Layer cheese sauce and potatoes/onions beginning and ending with cheese sauce.
Bake at 350F for about 1 hour.
pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded cheddar cheese, butter, flour, milk, salt, and pepper. Mix until smooth.
3. Add the thinly sliced potatoes and onions to the bowl, and stir to combine.
4. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown.
6. Serve hot and enjoy!

gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and spray muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Combine dry ingredients (flour, sugar, oat bran, baking soda, allspice, salt, and baking powder) in a medium bowl.
Combine wet ingredients (carrots, egg substitute, applesauce, raisins, and vanilla) in a large bowl.
Combine wet and dry mixtures just until flour is moistened.
Spoon batter into muffin tins, and bake for 30 minutes (or until muffins pass the"toothpick test").
pred:
[/INST]

[INST]
To make the muffins, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, oat bran, baking soda, allspice, and salt (if using). In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg substitute, applesauce, and vanilla. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in the raisins.

Scoop the batter into muffin cups lined with muffin papers or greased with cooking spray. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Carrot Muffins!
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Spread beans out evenly on a non-stick cookie sheet, doesn't have to be a single layer.
Drizzle lightly with extra virgin olive oil.
Sprinkle lightly with salt & pepper (optional).
Spread shredded parmesan evenly over beans.
Bake on center oven rack for 12 minutes.
Beans will be roasted and cheese will be melted, chewy and crunchy where it laid on the pan.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the green beans with the extra virgin olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the green beans out on a baking sheet, making sure they are evenly spaced.
4. Roast the green beans in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy.
5. While the green beans are cooking, prepare the Parmesan cheese by grating it using a cheese grater or a food processor.
6. Once the green beans are cooked, remove them from the oven and transfer them to a serving dish.
7. Sprinkle the grated Parmesan cheese over the top of the green beans, and toss them gently to combine.
8. Serve the Parmesan Roasted Green Beans immediately, as they are best when hot and crispy.

Enjoy your delicious Parmesan Roasted Green Beans dish!

gt:
pre-heat oven to 375 degrees F with 10 inch iron skillet in oven.
Mix first four ingrdients
in a sperate bowl mix next four ingredients
gently combine the two mixtures just until mixed (overmixing causes a tough bread).
remove skillet from oven and melt 2 tablespoons of butter in it.
pour or spoon batter into skillet.
it will be a thick batter.
bake in oven for 25 minutes.
romove and turn onto a plate.
enjoy.
give five star rating on zaar.com.
pred:
1. Preheat your skillet over medium heat.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, melted butter, egg, sugar, and flour until smooth.
3. Add the cornmeal, salt, and baking powder to the bowl and stir until well combined.
4. Pour the batter into the preheated skillet, spreading it evenly to cover the bottom.
5. Cook the cornbread for about 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Remove the cornbread from the skillet and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Cornbread in a Skillet!

gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Brush bread with olive oil and toast until golden brown.
Lay the apple slices in a baking dish.
Cover with cinnamon and sugar and roast at 425 degrees for 15-20 minutes.
Add a slice (or 2!)
of brie to each toast, and top with 2-3 apple slices.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Slice the apples into thin pieces and toss them in a bowl with the cinnamon, sugar, and a drizzle of olive oil.
3. Spread the sliced apples evenly on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and caramelized.
4. While the apples are cooking, prepare the bruschetta by toasting the sliced bread on a baking sheet in the oven. Be careful not to overcook the bread, as it should still be slightly crispy.
5. Once the apples are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the Brie cheese with a fork until it is creamy and smooth.
7. Spread the Brie cheese mixture on the toasted bread slices.
8. Arrange the apple slices on top of the Brie cheese mixture.
9. Serve the Roasted Apple and Brie Bruschetta immediately.

[/INST]

These steps involve preparing the ingredients, cooking the apples, toasting the bread, mixing the Brie cheese, and assembling the bruschetta. The final product is a delicious and visually appealing appetizer that can be enjoyed with friends and family.

gt:
Husk corn, remove silk and wash.
Cut kernels from cob.
Pack loosely into hot jars, leaving 1 inch headspace.
Do not shake or press down.
Add 1/2 teaspoon salt to each pint jar, 1 teaspoon salt to each quart jar, if desired.
Ladle boiling water over corn leaving 1 inch headspace.
Remove air bubbles and apply lids.
Process pints 55 minutes, quarts 1 hour and 25 minutes at 10 pounds pressure in a pressure canner.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Canned Corn, follow these steps:
1. Wash the corn thoroughly, removing any dirt or debris.
2. Remove the corn kernels from the cob using a sharp knife or a corn stripper.
3. In a large pot, combine the corn, water, and 12 teaspoons of pickling salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the corn is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Carefully ladle the corn mixture into clean, hot, sterilized jars, leaving 1/2 inch of headspace.
6. Wipe the rims of the jars clean, then place the lids on the jars, ensuring a good seal.
7. Process the jars in a water bath canner for 10 minutes, or until the lids have popped.
8. Remove the jars from the canner and let them cool completely before storing them in a cool, dark place.

By following these steps, you can create a delicious and homemade Canned Corn that can be enjoyed throughout the year.

gt:
Use either sour milk or add lemon juice to milk to sour it.
Add baking soda to the milk.
Mash bananas.
Cream margarine and sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla.
Blend in banana followed by the sour milk.
Add flour and baking powder.
Can either bake as cupcakes or a larger cake.
Bake at a 350 oven until lightly browned (about 40 minutes).
pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour milk, sugar, mashed banana, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the margarine and mix until smooth.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the baking soda, flour, and baking powder.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
6. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Banana Cake!

gt:
Whisk anchovies, rosemary, olive oil, vinegar, and garlic together in a large bowl; pour into a resealable plastic bag.
Season pork chops with coarse salt and ground black pepper; add to the plastic bag with the marinade, squeeze out as much air from bag as possible, and seal.
Turn bag a few times to assure chops are coated in marinade.
Marinate chops in refrigerator at least 2 hours.
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
Prepare a jelly roll pan with cooking spray.
Remove pork chops from the marinade and shake off excess moisture.
Discard the remaining marinade.
Cook under the broiler until no longer pink in the center, 6 to 7 minutes per side.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the anchovy fillets, finely chopped rosemary, and extra-virgin olive oil. Set aside.
3. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the butter-flavored cooking spray and allow it to melt.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
6. Add the pork chops to the skillet, and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are browned and cooked through.
7. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
8. Spread the anchovy-rosemary mixture evenly over the pork chops.
9. Drizzle the red wine vinegar over the pork chops.
10. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the anchovy-rosemary mixture is bubbly and slightly crispy.
11. Remove the pork chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Anchovies-Rosemary Pork Chops!

gt:
Pre heat oven to 180
Make the pastry and put in the fridge while you make the filling.
I made mine the day before and kept in a plastic bag
Peel and cube the potatoes and steam or boil until soft.
In a bowl add the potatoes, onion, cheese, pepper, garlic and onion powder and mash completely to mix in.
Divide the pastry into 4 and roll out and line each tin saving the extra from each for the top.
Fill the pies just over 3/4 full I filled mine too much lol
Roll out the bit of pastry left and pop on top of the filling pressing into the side pastry
Brush the tops with milk and pop into the oven middle shelf for 20-30 minutes.
Can be frozen and reheated.
I take out freezer night before and put in halogen for 5 minutes...yummy
pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, butter, and a pinch of salt.
3. Using your hands, press the mixture together until it forms a dough.
4. Wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, peel and slice the onion.
6. In a small bowl, mix the grated mozzarella cheese, potatoes, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and a splash of milk.
7. Roll out the chilled dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
8. Transfer the dough to a pie dish or a springform pan.
9. Spread the cheese and potato mixture evenly over the dough.
10. Roll out the remaining dough and use it to create a lid for the pie.
11. Place the lid on top of the pie, pressing the edges to seal.
12. Crimp the edges of the dough to create a decorative border.
13. Brush the top of the pie with milk and sprinkle with a bit of black pepper.
14. Bake the pie in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
15. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/INST]

gt:
Heat the oven to 200 degrees F. Pound the steaks to 1/4-inch thick and season with salt and pepper.
In a shallow baking dish or pie pan, whisk together the flour and 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper.
In another shallow baking dish or pie pan, whisk together the eggs and milk.
Have ready a baking sheet.
One at a time, dip the steaks into the flour mixture, then into the egg mixture, and then back into the flour mixture, coating them evenly on both sides.
Place on the baking sheet in an even layer.
In a large heavy frying pan (ideally cast iron), add the oil and heat over medium-high until very hot.
Fry the steaks until golden brown and cooked through, turning once, about 4 minutes.
While the steaks are fying, clean the baking sheet.
Transfer the steaks to the baking sheet and place in the oven to keep warm while you make the gravy.
Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of the oil from the frying pan.
Warm over medium-low heat.
Add the flour and and whisk to combine.
Let cook, while stirring with a whisk, until the flour mixture begins to brown, about 3 minutes.
Slowly whisk in the warm milk, stirring until smooth.
Increase the heat to medium and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, whisking, until thickened, about 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve the steaks with the gravy.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the beef steaks with salt and pepper, then dredge them in flour to coat evenly.
3. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef steaks and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Remove the beef steaks from the skillet and place them on a plate.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk.
6. Pour the egg and milk mixture over the beef steaks, then cover the plate with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the beef is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
8. Remove the beef steaks from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing them into thin pieces.
9. In a small saucepan, whisk together the milk, flour, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and bubbles.
10. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the butter, then pour the sauce over the beef steaks.
11. Serve the Chicken Fried Steak with Cream Gravy Recipe immediately.

[/INST]

gt: Mix all ingredients together and chill for at least 1 hour.
pred:
1. Wash and peel the carrots thoroughly.
2. Grate the carrots using a grater or a food processor.
3. In a large bowl, combine the grated carrots, lemon juice, olive oil, ground coriander, salt, and maple syrup.
4. Mix the ingredients well to ensure even distribution of the flavors.
5. Add the chopped fresh mint and coriander to the bowl, and mix them in.
6. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. Serve the salad chilled or at room temperature, garnished with additional chopped mint and coriander, if desired.

This delicious Middle Eastern Carrot Salad is a refreshing and healthy side dish that can be enjoyed at various occasions, such as picnics, potlucks, or as a light meal on its own. The combination of grated carrots, lemon juice, olive oil, and spices creates a vibrant and flavorful dish that is both visually appealing and satisfying to eat.

gt:
Pour Coco-cola into large drinking glass, stir in cherry extract.
Place vanilla ice cream in another large glass, add peanuts and cherries.
Pour coke mixture over ice cream mixture.
Serve immediately.
pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Coca-Cola, cherry extract, vanilla ice cream, and dry roasted peanuts.
2. Stir the ingredients until the ice cream is melted and well-incorporated.
3. Add the sliced maraschino cherries to the mixture.
4. Stir the ingredients again to ensure that the cherries are evenly distributed.
5. Serve the Peanutty Coke Cow dish immediately, as the ice cream may start to melt and become a bit runny.

This dish is a delicious and creative twist on a classic Coca-Cola float, incorporating the flavors of cherries and peanuts to create a unique and enjoyable treat.

gt:
In a bowl, combine the egg and one tablespoon lemon juice, mix well and set aside until required.
Next into a bag, add the flour, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes and lemon zest.
Dip the chicken breasts in the egg mixture, then add them to the bag of coating and shake, until well coated.
Melt the butter in a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add the chicken, cooking for 5 minutes on each side or until done.
Remove the chicken from the pan and cover with aluminum foil to keep warm.
If necessary, add the additional tablespoon of butter, then add the garlic, shallot, onions and mushrooms to the pan and cook for 5 minutes on medium to low heat.
Now in a small bowl add the chicken stock, 2 1/2 tablespoons of lemon juice and cream together, stir and add this to the pan.
I had large chicken breasts so I added them back into the pan and brought everything to a gentle boil, cooking until the mixture started to reduce and sauce thickened.
You may cook sauce to your preference.
I served the chicken and lemon mushroom sauce overtop of simple buttered noodles for a quick and easy meal.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken breasts, egg, lemon juice, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the flour, butter, and lemon zest. Add the chicken mixture to the flour mixture, and toss to coat the chicken evenly.
4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken mixture to the skillet, and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and thickened, about 10-12 minutes.
5. If desired, add the optional butter to the skillet to further enhance the sauce.
6. Transfer the cooked chicken to a baking dish, and bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and hot.
7. Serve the Chicken Breasts in Lemon Mushroom Sauce over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious meal!

gt:
1.
To make the crust, blend the flour, butter, and sugar together until crumbly and combined.
Press into a 9x13 pan.
Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.
2.
While crust is cooling, combine the cream cheese with powdered sugar.
Fold in half of the Cool Whip.
Spread this mixture on top of the cooled crust.
3.
Mix the chocolate pudding with milk.
Spread the pudding layer on top of cream cheese layer.
4.
Frost the top with the remaining Cool Whip.
5.
Let set in the fridge.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and butter. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Press the dough into a flat, even disk. Wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
4. After the dough has chilled, roll it out on a floured surface until it reaches your desired thickness.
5. Grease a 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan with cooking spray or butter. Place the rolled-out dough into the prepared pan.
6. Bake the crust in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. While the crust is cooling, prepare the filling. In a large mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Add the powdered sugar, one cup at a time, beating well after each addition.
8. Add the Cool Whip and mix until well combined.
9. Once the crust is cool, pour the filling over the top of the crust.
10. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the filling is set and the edges are golden brown.
11. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Tom Selleck dish!

gt:
Cut the beef into 2-centimeter pieces.
Put in a deep 12-inch nonstick skillet.
Pour 1 cup of warm water and stew over low heat for 1 1/2 hour under cover.
Stir occasionally and add additional water as needed.
Meanwhile, peel the carrots and onion.
Slice the carrots into sticks and the onion into half-rings.
Add to the beef and let stew for 5 minutes more.
Pour in the oil, add salt and spices, mix well.
Rinse the rice in warm water and put it over the vegetables and meat.
Pour in 3 1/2 cups warm water, cover the skillet and let simmer on high heat.
Thirty minutes after the water starts boiling, slightly reduce heat every 5-7 minutes for 20 minutes.
Then continue cooking the plov on very low heat for an additional 10 minutes.
Do not uncover the skillet during the final 30 minutes of cooking.
When the cooking time is done, remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.
Uncover the skillet and mix the rice in with the meat and vegetables.
Serve and enjoy!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the Sunflower Seed Oil over medium heat. Add the beef and cook until browned, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the onion and cook until softened.
4. Add the carrots and cook until they are tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix the spice mix and salt. Add the spice mixture to the skillet and stir to combine.
6. Add the rice to the skillet and stir to combine with the beef and vegetables.
7. Transfer the mixture to a large oven-safe dish.
8. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the beef is tender.
9. Remove the foil and let the dish cool for a few minutes before serving.

This Beef Plov dish is a delicious and hearty meal that combines tender beef, carrots, and onions with a flavorful rice base. The spices and seasonings add depth and complexity to the dish, making it a satisfying and comforting meal.

gt:
1.
Cut bone from pork; reserve bone.
Cut meat across the grain into very thin slices.
Place pork in a medium bowl.
Add chile, garlic, and oil; toss well to coat.
Let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes.2.
Heat a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add pork mixture; saute 3 minutes or until pork is lightly browned, stirring frequently.
Remove pork from pan.
Add reserved bone and kimchi to pan; cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add 3 cups water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes.3.
Cut tofu into 1/2-inch-thick slices; cut slices crosswise into 3/4-inch pieces.4.
Remove bone from soup.
Return pork mixture to soup.
Add tofu to soup; simmer 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with green onions.
pred:
[<INST>]
To prepare the Kimchi Jjigae, start by heating the dark sesame oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the coarsely ground Korean chile and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.

Next, add the chopped kimchi, stirring to combine. Cook for a few minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.

Add the water, tofu, and green onions to the saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the tofu is tender and the flavors have melded together.

Finally, season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the Kimchi Jjigae hot, garnished with a drizzle of sesame oil and a sprinkle of green onions, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Kimchi Jjigae!
</<INST>>

[/INST]

gt:
put half yogurt then granola and peach then yogurt again
top with more peach and almond slice
BELOW,ARE FEW PARFAIT RECIPE,I AM GLAD TO SHARE WITH YOU
pred:
[INST]
1. First, gather all the necessary ingredients, including 1 tbsp granola, 1 tbsp almond slice, 6 slice peach, 1 tbsp dried cranberry, and 1 cup any flavor yogurt.
2. In a blender or food processor, combine the granola, almond slice, and dried cranberry. Blend until the mixture is well combined and the granola is finely ground.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the yogurt and peach slices.
4. To assemble the parfait, start by layering the granola mixture, then the yogurt mixture, and finally the dried cranberry mixture.
5. Repeat this layering process until the parfait is filled to the top.
6. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Peach Parfait!

[/INST]

gt:
EMPTY coating mix into shaker bag.
Add oregano; mix well.
Coat chicken pieces with coating mix as directed on package.
BAKE at 400F (200C) for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese and bake an additional 2 to 3 minutes, just until cheese is melted.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the contents of the Shake'N Bake BBQ Chicken Glaze Coating Mix with 1 tablespoon of water.
3. Season the chicken breasts with the dried oregano leaves and any additional seasoning you prefer.
4. Dip each chicken breast into the glaze mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
5. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the chicken breasts in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are cooked through and the glaze is bubbly and golden brown.
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into bite-sized pieces.
8. In a small saucepan, heat the grated Cracker Barrel Mozzarella Cheese over low heat until it is melted and smooth.
9. Assemble the pizza by spreading the melted cheese over the crust, then topping it with the cooked chicken pieces.
10. Return the pizza to the oven and bake for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and melted, and the crust is golden brown.

Enjoy your homemade Shake'N Bake Pizza Chicken dish!

gt:
Melt butter in a bundt pan.
Add seasonings if you want to.
(I have never added anything!)
Lay the unrolled pkgs of rolls end- to- end in the pan, overlapping where necessary.
Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes.
When really brown, turn onto a serving plate.
Be careful of the excess butter when transferring from the pan.
I slice this like a pound cake-it is good enough to be dessert!
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of Real Salted Butter, seasonings such as garlic or cinnamon-sugar, and a pinch of salt.
3. Spread the butter mixture evenly over the crescent rolls.
4. Place the crescent rolls, buttered side up, on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the crescent rolls in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
6. Remove the crescent rolls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before slicing them into triangles.
7. Serve the Crescent Roll Bread warm, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Place sausage in a large, deep skillet.
Cook over medium heat until evenly brown.
Drain on paper towels, reserving 2 tablespoons fat in skillet.
Stir in flour, salt, and pepper.
Cook, stirring constantly, until flour is brown.
Add chopped green onion, and cook until tender.
Gradually stir in milk, and cook until thickened.
Add more milk if necessary to achieve preferred consistency.
Serve with sausage.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground pork sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
3. Add the flour to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the flour is lightly browned.
4. Gradually pour in the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens.
5. Add the chopped green onions and stir to combine.
6. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the Sawmill Gravy over your choice of cooked meat, such as pork chops, chicken, or fish, or use it as a base for a delicious gravy-covered dish.

Enjoy your delicious Sawmill Gravy dish!

gt:
In a large bowl, combine black beans, salt and pepper.
Mash the beans with a potato masher or pastry blender until it reaches a consistency close to ground beef.
Add in soup mix, cumin, chili powder and cayenne pepper.
Stir to combine.
With slightly damp hands, pat bean mixture into four burgers.
Either pan fry your burgers in a bit of vegetable oil or grill them.
I recommend pan frying unless youre a very gentle griller as these burgers are delicate.
Serve burgers up with cheese, salsa and lettuce.
Enjoy.
pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the black beans, dry onion soup mix, cumin, chili powder, and cayenne pepper. Mix well.
2. Add the minced garlic and mix until combined.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk.
4. Pour the egg and milk mixture over the black bean mixture, and stir to combine.
5. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
8. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan, and cook the patties for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and slightly crispy.
9. Serve the Spicy Black Bean Burgers on buns, and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
To start you will first need to heat the oil in a skillet.About a 1/2 inche in oil.
Now for the platano,first cut the ends of the platanos.
Then cut a slice down the middle of the platano and peel.
Ok then cut the platano in oval slices and fry in oil.cook until golden brown.
about 5 mins or so.drain on paper towels.season with salt.serve.enjoy -- .
pred:
1. Preheat the oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. Peel the green plantains and cut them into thin slices.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the salt and a dash of oil.
4. Dip the plantain slices into the salt mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
5. Carefully place the coated plantain slices into the hot oil in the skillet or frying pan.
6. Fry the plantain slices until they are golden brown and crispy, flipping them occasionally to ensure even cooking.
7. Remove the fried plantain slices from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and drain them on a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil.
8. Serve the Tajadas De Platano Verde hot, as a delicious and healthy snack or appetizer.

gt:
Place large pot on medium-low heat.
Add bacon and gently cook until it hits the crisp stage.
Meanwhile, parboil potato in lightly salted water for about four minutes.
Mix cream and potato soup together in a bowl.
Remove bacon, chop it finely or crumble it and set aside.
Add to the pot of bacon drippings, the butter, carrots, onion, and celery.
Cook stirring frequently until onions are translucent and vegetables are tender.
Add flour and cook for about a minute or until the flour starts to stick to the bottom of the pan.
Add chicken stock, 30 to 50 ml at a time, stirring constantly to make a smooth, creamy soup base.
Add more chicken stock than recommended if you find it a little too thick.
Turn up heat to medium and add the raw seafood.
Bring to a simmer and cook for three to five minutes, or until shrimp are pink and have curled into a tight "c".
When shrimp are pink, add potato soup mixture.
Gently stir.
Thin out soup with cream or milk if you find it too thick.
When it starts to simmer, remove from heat.
Serve with crumbled bacon pieces as a garnish and crusty bread as a side.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot or Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, add the butter and cook until melted.
4. Add the diced carrots, onion, celery, and potato to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the flour to the pot and stir to coat the vegetables evenly. Cook for a few minutes, until the flour is slightly browned.
6. Gradually pour in the chicken stock, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. Add the scallops, shrimp, lobster tails, and meat to the pot. Cook until the seafood is cooked through and the meat is fully cooked.
8. Add the cream and cream of potato soup to the pot. Stir to combine.
9. Simmer the mixture for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the flavors are well-mixed and the soup is heated through.
10. Serve the Award Winning Sea Food Chowder hot, garnished with chopped parsley and a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious Award Winning Sea Food Chowder!

gt:
Rub the steak with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and coat with the thyme.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large cast-iron skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering.
Add the meat and pan-fry over moderately high heat until browned and crusty, about 4 minutes per side for medium rare.
Transfer the steak to a cutting board and let stand for 5 minutes.
Add the shallots to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and browned, about 3 minutes.
Thickly slice the steak across the grain and arrange on plates.
Spoon the sauteed shallots on top of the steak and serve immediately.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, thyme leaves, salt, and pepper.
3. Season the hanger steak with the herb mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the hanger steak and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side to create a nice crust. Remove the steak from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the sliced shallots and cook until they are soft and translucent.
6. Add the hanger steak back to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the steak is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
7. Remove the steak from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
8. Serve the herbed hanger steak with the cooked shallots on the side.

Note: Trim the hanger steak by removing any excess fat and silver skin. This will help the steak cook more evenly and retain its juiciness.

gt:
SOAK.
Grate zucchini in food processor, along with onion and bell peppers.
Mix salt in with vegetables in large plastic bowl.
Let stand overnight.
Next morning, rinse thoroughly in a large strainer and drain well.
MIX.
Place shredded vegetables in large heavy pan and add remaining ingredients.
Mix well and boil for 30 minutes.
Pack and seal in hot sterilized jars.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the zucchini into small, evenly sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the zucchini, onions, red bell peppers, salt, sugar, cornstarch, turmeric, vinegar, dry mustard, coarse black pepper, and celery seed.
4. Mix the ingredients well to ensure they are evenly distributed.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and spread it evenly.
6. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the mixture is slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Using a spatula, carefully transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor.
9. Blend the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency, either smooth or slightly chunky, depending on your preference.
10. Store the relish in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

[/INST]

In summary, the steps involved in cooking Zucchini Relish with these ingredients include preheating the oven, cutting the zucchini into small pieces, mixing the ingredients in a large bowl, transferring the mixture to a baking dish, baking it in the oven, letting it cool, transferring it to a blender or food processor, and storing it in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

gt:
Put the ingredients in large bowl.
Mash, squeeze, knead, etc.
until it is completely blended.
Form into small balls about 1 to 1 1/2 inches in size and place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Butter the bottom of a small glass (or plastic cup) and dip into white sugar, then pound the cookies flat.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 to 12 minutes.
This makes a large batch!
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, margarine, and oatmeal.
3. Add the flour, baking soda, and chocolate chips to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
4. Scoop the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges and slightly soft in the center.
6. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your Aggression Cookies!

gt:
WASH; cut up tomatoes.
Chop onions, celery, parsley, bay leaves.
Add to tomatoes; cook until celery is tender.
Put through sieve.
Rub flour and butter into smooth paste thinned with tomato juice.
Add to boiling soup; stir to prevent scorching.
Add salt, sugar and pepper.
For smoother consistency put through sieve again.
Fill clean jars to within one inch of top of jar.
Put on cap, screwing the band firmly tight.
Process in water bath 15 minutes.
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the 14 quarts of ripe tomatoes, 14 tablespoons of flour, 7 medium onions, 14 tablespoons of butter, 1 stalk of celery, 3 tablespoons of salt, 14 sprigs of parsley, 8 tablespoons of sugar, 3 bay leaves, and 2 teaspoons of pepper.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. Remove the bay leaves and parsley sprigs.
5. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth.
6. Return the soup to the pot and heat it through.
7. Serve the Tomato Soup hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/INST]

gt:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Place cabbage in a steamer over 1 inch of boiling water, and cover.
Cook until tender but still firm, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Heat butter in a deep skillet.
Saute the onion until tender.
Stir in cabbage and noodles.
Season with salt and pepper.
pred:
1. In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the egg noodles and cook according to the package instructions until they are tender but still firm. Drain the noodles and set aside.

2. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until it is soft and translucent.

3. Add the chopped cabbage to the skillet and cook until it is tender but still crisp. Season the cabbage with salt and pepper to taste.

4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked noodles, sautéed cabbage, and melted butter. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.

5. Serve the Holuski immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for a few hours before serving. Enjoy!

gt:
In a small saucepan, mix milk into flour gradually to prevent lumps.
Cook, stirring constantly over low heat until thick.
Cover with waxed paper and cool completely or set in bowl of ice water and stir until cooled.
In mixer bowl, combine shortening and margarine, beat 4 minutes.
Add sugar; beat 4 minutes.
Add cooled paste and vanilla and beat well.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, milk, shortening, and margarine.
3. Add the sugar and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth.
4. If the mixture is too thick, add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the pan.
8. Once cooled, use a spatula to spread the whipped frosting evenly over the cake.
9. Enjoy your delicious Whipped Frosting I-covered cake!

[/INST]

gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Line a shallow baking pan with foil.
2.
Add breadcrumbs, seasoning, and cheese to a ziploc bag.
Close and shake up to mix.
3.
Rinse chicken in water.
Do not pat dry.
Add 1 drumstick at a time to ziploc bag.
Shake to coat.
4.
Bake for approximately 45 minutes or until juices run clear.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chicken drumsticks, breadcrumbs, and Greek seasoning until well coated.
3. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
4. Spread the breaded chicken pieces evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
5. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the breading is golden brown.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Easy Greek Shake 'n Bake Drumsticks!

gt:
Prepare the saffron rice according to the package directions,using the amount of oil/butter and water as indicated on the package (I usually use olive oil).
While the rice is cooking, rinse& drain the black beans in a mesh strainer to remove all the sludgey canning liquid and dump them into a small saucepan.
Pour the entire contents of the diced tomatoes w/chili peppers,liquid and all,into the same pan with the beans and stir to combine.
Cover the saucepan with lid,turn on the heat to low, and let bean mixture heat while the rice cooks, stirring occasionally- it should be ready when the rice is done.
When the rice is fully cooked, pour it into a deep, medium sized casserole dish.
Pour bean mixture into the center of the rice, leaving a border of the yellow rice peeking out arounds the sides.
Place the sour cream in the center of the bean mixture in a dollop as a garnish (you can use more if you like).
Sprinkle shredded Cheddar cheese over the top of the sour cream and over the beans.
Sprinkle with cilantro leaves (optional) if you like and serve immediately.
NOTE: If you don't have access to canned diced tomatoes with chilis, then you can substitute an equal amount of chunky salsa, if you like.
You may wish to provide a bowl of additional sour cream as well as a bowl of more cheese for guests to add extra to each serving, but it isn't necessary.
pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. In a large saucepan, combine the saffron rice mix and water, stirring well. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the drained and rinsed black beans, and cook for an additional 5-6 minutes, or until they are heated through.
3. Add the sour cream, shredded cheddar cheese, and diced tomatoes with mild green chilies to the skillet. Stir to combine, and cook for about 3-4 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, to taste.
5. Serve the Tex-Mex Black Beans & Saffron Rice over the cooked rice, and garnish with chopped cilantro leaves, if desired.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/SYS]

gt:
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in slow cooker.
Combine ginger, garlic, broth, juice from pineapple, vinegar, and sugar; set aside.
Arrange pineapple and waterchestnuts over chicken.
Pour ginger sauce over all.
Cover and cook on high for 1 hour; reduce heat to low and cook an additional 2 to 3 hours or until chicken is tender.
(This can be cooked up to 8 hours).
Add green onions.
Dissolve cornstarch in soy sauce.
Stir into pot.
Cover and cook on high for 10 to 15 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Prep time does not include cooking time (4 to 8 hours).
pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Tofung Woo Chicken, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with a little bit of water to form a smooth slurry.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chicken broth, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and minced garlic. Stir to mix well.
4. Add the chicken to the marinade and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
5. In a small skillet, heat the reserved pineapple juice over medium heat until it comes to a simmer. Add the sliced water chestnuts and cook for about 5 minutes, or until they are tender but still crisp.
6. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
7. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and cook the chicken for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until it is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chicken from the skillet and place it on a plate.
9. Pour the pineapple juice and water chestnut mixture over the chicken and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

gt:
Combine all ingredients and stir with a whisk.
Pour into greased baking dish or muffin tins.
Bake at 350 until bread bounces back slightly when pushed in the center.
About 40 minutes in a 8x8 dish or 20 minutes for muffins.
pred:
To make a delicious Sweet Gluten Free Cornbread Or Muffins dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the gluten-free flour, corn meal, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and vegetable oil.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix, as this can lead to tough muffins.
5. Pour the batter into a greased muffin tin or a well-greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
7. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing them from the pan and transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Sweet Gluten Free Cornbread Or Muffins!

gt:
Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat, erring on the side of heat too low.
Add the garlic and saute for 5 minutes, taking extreme care to keep the garlic from browning, as it will become bitter and ruin your sauce if it does!
(Im just sayin.)
Then, add onion and basil and saute until onion is translucent.
Add tomato puree and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add salt to taste.
Dont be surprised if you need close to a tablespoon of salt.
The level of salt needed will depend on what you use it for, however, so its best to wait to finalize seasonings once you have the entire dish together (example: gnocchi will likely require more salt in the sauce than eggplant parmesan would).
pred:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
4. Add the sliced basil leaves and cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Pour in the canned San Marzano tomatoes, pureed, and stir to combine with the onions and garlic.
6. Add the salt, and stir to combine.
7. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning as needed.
9. Serve the Authentic Italian Tomato Sauce over your favorite pasta or as a base for other dishes.

[/INST]

gt:
In a large skillet coated with cooking spray, saute the onion, mushrooms and carrot until tender.
Remove from heat and cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the vegetables, bread crumbs, salt and pepper.
Crumble turkey over mixture and mix well.
Pat into a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 35 minutes.
Combine syrup and mustard; pour half over the turkey loaf.
Bake 5-10 minutes longer or until a meat thermometer reads 165 and juices run clear.
Serve with remaining syrup mixture.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the chopped onion, mushrooms, carrot, and breadcrumbs.
3. Season the mixture with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
4. Add the ground turkey and maple syrup to the bowl, and mix until well combined.
5. Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it on a baking sheet.
6. Bake the loaf in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the loaf from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your Vermont Turkey Loaf, a delicious and hearty meal that combines the flavors of turkey, mushrooms, and maple syrup, all baked to perfection.

gt:
Heat grill to medium heat.
Mix seasonings; rub onto both sides of ribs.
Place half the ribs in single layer on large sheet of heavy-duty foil.
Bring up sides of foil; double fold top and one end.
Add 1/4 cup water through open end of packet.
Double fold remaining end to seal packet, leaving room for heat to circulate inside.
Repeat to make second packet.
Grill 45 min.
to 1 hour or until ribs are done.
Remove ribs from foil; discard foil.
Return ribs to grill; brush with 1/2 cup barbecue sauce.
Grill 15 min., turning and brushing occasionally with remaining sauce.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the paprika, garlic powder, and ground black pepper.
3. Season the pork baby back ribs with the spice mixture.
4. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned ribs and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Transfer the ribs to a baking dish and pour the water over them.
6. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 1-1/2 to 2 hours, or until the meat is tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
7. Remove the foil and continue to bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce is caramelized and slightly crispy on the edges.
8. Serve the Sweet & Sticky Ribs hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

gt:
Boil water then add noddles in, cooking until desired softness.
In the meantime, pour all the sauce ingredients into a sauce pan, heating at medium heat.
Mix until all ingredients are incorporated before allowing to simmer and thicken, stirring often until at desired thickness and cheese is melted and incorporated.
Add more milk to simmer if you wish a thinner sauce.
Add more cheese to taste if you prefer.
Drain pasta and pour sauce over pasta.
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Begin by cooking the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. In a small saucepan, heat the skim milk over medium heat until it begins to bubble.
3. Add the nonfat sour cream to the saucepan and stir until smooth.
4. Gradually add the whole wheat flour, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the grated low-fat cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
6. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, chicken, and garlic.
7. Pour the creamy white cheese sauce over the pasta mixture and stir to combine.
8. Serve immediately, and enjoy your delicious Light Whole Wheat Pasta With Creamy White Cheese Sauce.

gt:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
May add small amount of onion if desired.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Easy Tartar Sauce dish, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, mix the 14 cup dill pickle relish and 12 cup Miracle Whip.
2. Add the 14 teaspoon lemon juice to the mixture, adjusting the amount to your desired tanginess.
3. Stir in the 12 teaspoon mustard, ensuring that the ingredients are well combined.
4. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning as needed, ensuring that it is balanced and flavorful.
5. Use the prepared sauce to coat the desired food items, such as chicken, fish, or vegetables.

This simple yet flavorful Easy Tartar Sauce can be used to enhance the taste of various dishes, making them more enjoyable and satisfying.

gt:
In a food processor, combine the almonds with 3 tablespoons of the sugar and process to a coarse powder.
Transfer to a bowl and stir in the flour, ginger and a pinch of salt.
In a large bowl, beat the butter with the remaining 3 tablespoons of sugar and the vanilla until well blended.
Add the flour mixture and beat until combined.
Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a 6-inch-long log.
Wrap each log in plastic and chill until firm, at least 3 hours or for up to 3 days.
Preheat the oven to 350 and line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper.
Slice the dough logs 1/4 inch thick and arrange the slices 1 inch apart on the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake the cookies for about 18 minutes, or until golden on the bottoms and edges; shift the pans halfway through baking.
Slide the parchment with the cookies onto wire racks and let the cookies cool completely before serving.
pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the ground ginger, vanilla extract, and almonds to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a dough forms.
6. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
7. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Roll the dough into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
9. Place the balls of dough on the prepared baking sheet.
10. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These Ginger-Almond Cookies are a delicious treat that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of toasted almonds, ginger, and vanilla creates a warm, spicy, and slightly sweet flavor that is perfect for a cozy afternoon or as a holiday gift.

gt:
Combine all ingredients in the jar of a blender and puree until smooth.
Serve.
pred:
1. First, gather all the ingredients, including the strawberries, banana, yogurt, milk, vanilla extract, stevia (optional), and the single-serving packet of stevia (if using).
2. Wash the strawberries and banana thoroughly.
3. Peel the banana and cut it into 1-inch chunks.
4. Wash the strawberries and remove the stems.
5. Place the strawberries and banana chunks in a blender or food processor.
6. Add the yogurt and milk to the blender or food processor.
7. If using stevia, open the single-serving packet and add the desired amount of stevia to the blender or food processor.
8. Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
9. Taste the smoothie and adjust the sweetness, if necessary, by adding more stevia or milk.
10. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy!

[/INST]

gt:
Heat oven to 350.
Coarsly chop 8 squares of chocolate and set aside.
Microwave remaining squares in large microwavable bowl for 1-2 minutes.
Stir until smooth.
Stir in sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla.
Stir in flour and baking powder.
Stir in chopped up chocolate and nuts.
Drop by 1/4 cupfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 12-13 minutes or until puffed and set to touch.
Cool 1 minute.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
pred:
To prepare a delicious Death by Chocolate Cookies dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the bakers semisweet baking chocolate and margarine until smooth.
3. Add the brown sugar and eggs, and mix until well combined.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract and flour, then mix until the dough comes together.
5. If the dough is too dry, you can add a bit more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. Fold in the chopped nuts.
7. Portion the dough into 12 equal-sized balls.
8. Place the balls of dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your Death by Chocolate Cookies, a delicious and indulgent treat!

gt:

Crack in egg.
Cook until bottom is set but top is still gooey.

To create a delicious Gluten-Free Lazy Lasagna, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the minced garlic and diced onion to the skillet, and cook until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the chopped roma tomatoes, marinara seasoning, and a tiny pinch of clove. Cook until the tomatoes are softened and the sauce is heated through.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked ground beef, onion mixture, and pasta sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. In a separate bowl, combine the rice pasta, roasted red pepper, shredded mozzarella cheese, and cheddar blend.
7. Transfer the meat and sauce mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Spread the rice pasta mixture evenly over the top.
8. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the lasagna is hot and bubbly.
9. Remove the foil, and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Let the lasagna rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Gluten-Free Lazy Lasagna!

gt:
preheat wok on high temp with oil.
fry crushed garlic cloves until browned then remove.
add stirfry veg, beansprouts and mushrooms, stir fry for approx 2 mins
add rice noodles and soy sauce then stirfry for another 2 mins
add chicken and lemon juice , give it another toss and your done !

gt:
Make the simple dip by adding the minced or crushed garlic to the yoghurt.
If there is any of the green little heart in the garlic remove this prior to mincing.
You can also puree the garlic into the yoghurt.
Cover and set aside in fridge until needed
Now scrub the unpeeled carrots and grate or rough blend them but don't make them to fine, they should still have substance (you can peel them if you want , I prefer not too for this recipe)
Cut and wash the cress, keep a little aside for garnishing
Mix all the other ingredients, inclusive most of the cress and stir in well.
Do NOT add the garlic dip to this mix.
Heat a little oil or butter , just enough so that the Rosti won't stick to the pan ( spraying oil can be used )
Take a tablespoon of the mix , add to the hot pan, flatten down a bit and cook 2-3 at the time in a pan
When golden brown to crisp remove and keep warm .
When all are cooked serve with the garlic dip and a few sprinkling of the leftover cress.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Peel the carrots and cut them into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the carrots, eggs, flour, cayenne pepper, turmeric, smoked paprika, salt, and any additional desired seasoning. Mix well.
4. Heat a large frying pan or oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add a small amount of oil to the pan and cook the carrot mixture for about 10 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are tender and slightly browned.
5. Transfer the cooked carrot mixture to a large mixing bowl and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the yoghurt, garlic, and mustard cress to the bowl and mix well.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the dip is bubbly and hot.
8. Serve the Sig's Carrot Rosti with Garlic and Cress Dip immediately, as it is best when hot.

[/INST]

The essential ingredients for this recipe include 500 grams of good quality fresh carrots, 1 box of mustard cress, regular size, 3 fresh eggs, 6 to 7 tablespoons of plain flour, 1 pinch of cayenne pepper, 1 pinch of turmeric, 1/2 tsp of smoked paprika, 1 to 2 pinches of salt or salt substitute, 400 grams of natural yoghurt of choice, and 2 to 3 cloves of garlic. These ingredients will help create a delicious and satisfying dish that is both visually appealing and flavorful.

gt:
To prepare your chicken: Peel the garlic and zest the lemon.
Put your crackers into a food processor with the butter, garlic, parsley sprigs, lemon zest and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Whiz until the mixture is very fine, then pour these crumbs on to a plate.
Sprinkle the flour on to a second plate.
Crack the egg into a small bowl and beat with a fork.
Lightly score the underside of the chicken breasts.
Put a square of plastic wrap over each one and bash a few times with the bottom of a pan until the breasts flatten out a bit.
Dip the chicken into the flour until both sides are completely coated, then dip into the egg and finally into the flavored crumbs.
Push the crumbs on to the chicken breasts so they stickyou want the meat to be totally coated.
To cook your chicken: You can either bake or fry the chicken.
If baking, preheat your oven to its highest temperature (475), place your chicken on a sheet pan and cook for 15 minutes.
If frying, put a frying pan on a medium heat, add a few good lugs of olive oil and cook the chicken breasts for 4 to 5 minutes on each side, until cooked through, golden and crisp.
To serve your chicken: Either serve the chicken breasts whole, or cut them into strips and pile them on a plate.
Beautiful and simple served with a lemon wedge for squeezing over, and a tiny sprinkling of salt.
Great with a lovely fresh salad or simply dressed veggies.
pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a small bowl, mix the garlic clove, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.
3. In a large bowl, mix the cream or plain crackers, butter, Italian parsley, sea salt, and black pepper.
4. Season the chicken breast fillets with salt and pepper.
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken fillets and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add them to the bowl with the cream or crackers mixture. Toss to coat the chicken evenly.
8. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the breading is crispy.
9. Serve the Jamie Oliver Crunchy Garlic Chicken Nuggets hot.

[/INST]

heat until slightly thickened (approximately 15 min.
).

Remove from heat.

Then stir peanut butter into milk mixture.
Cool.
Add vanilla and light cream to milk mixture.
Churn-freeze.

gt:
Heat oven to 300 degrees.
In large bowl combine cereal, pretzels, and pecans.
In microwave melt butter and combine with honey.
Pour honey mixture over cereal mixture; stir until well coated.
Spread onto 15x10-inch jelly roll pan and bake for 10 minutes; stir.
Continue baking for 15 minutes or until cereal is glazed and honey mixture is absorbed.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Rice Chex, Corn Chex, small pretzels, and pecan halves.

gt:
Put the onions in the bowl with the fat or butter.
Cover the bowl and microwave for 10 minutes on high.
Take off the cover, and stir the onions--there should be good bit of liquid in the bowl.
Microwave (uncovered) for approximately 10 more minutes, but keep an eye on it.
It should get brown around the edges, so stir it periodically.
Eventually it'll be a brown mass of onions.
If you like them crispy, microwave them a bit longer but, again, keep an eye on them--it's a real short moment between crispy and burnt.
You can do this in a conventional oven too, but it takes longer; say around 20 minutes at 350F with the cover on and another 20 min with the cover off, stirring periodically.
Once again, keep an eye on it.
pred:
To make a delicious Caramelized Onions dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe skillet or pan, melt 12 cups of butter over medium heat.
3. Add 3 sliced onions to the skillet and cook them until they are soft and translucent, stirring occasionally.
4. Once the onions are soft, add a pinch of salt and a pinch of sugar. Stir to combine.
5. Cook the onions for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized and have a rich, sweet flavor.
6. Remove the skillet from the oven and let the onions cool for a few minutes before serving.

This dish is a delicious and simple way to enjoy caramelized onions, and it can be served as a side dish or as a topping for various dishes. The key to achieving the perfect caramelized onions is to cook them slowly and evenly, stirring occasionally to ensure that they do not burn or stick to the pan.

gt:
Heat the oil in a medium sauce pan.
Add the onions and saute until translucent.
Add the chile powder and saute until the onions just start to brown.
Add the Rotel and bring just to a simmer.
Add the beans and water then bring it back to a simmer.
Simmer covered for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Mash the beans with a potato masher.
Adjust the consistency as needed by cooking uncovered or adding water.
Serve topped with a little grated cheddar or Colby-jack cheese and some sour cream (optional, but highly recommended).
Enjoy!
pred:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the New Mexico Chile Powder and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
4. Add the Rotel Tomato & Green Chilies, undrained, and stir to combine.
5. Add the water and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Add the canned beans and stir to combine.
7. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
